review_body: I arrived at Stay Hotel after a pretty stressful experience. The front desk manager, Florencia, honestly turned my whole day around. She was so patient and kind, and it made all the difference. I ended up staying only one night, but it was still a great experience. The hotel is only a block from the beach, and there are plenty of convenience stores and restaurants nearby. The hotel itself had everything I needed, and the lobby downstairs even provided beach chairs and boggie boards you could borrow. There was also a store right next door if you wanted to rent a surfboard. I had an amazing time here, and if I ever return to Waikiki, this is where I'll be returning to stay. Thank you!

if you want to stay in Waikiki and not pay the high prices of the big chains then this is your place.One road behind the main road featuring all the bars, restaurants and shopping that Waikiki has to offer.Car parking is chargeable and limited to get there early. One night we got back and a receptionist was parked in a bay and was reluctant to move. But easily resolved.Room was small but space in Hawaii is a premium. Room was spotlessly clean and with great amenities.

Due to the current world pandemic I contacted the hotel to cancel my booking due to a cancelled flight and my governments travel ban and they were amazing. The communication was prompt and they were understanding. When I eventually get to Hawaii I will be rebooking with them solely for the customer service! Thanks guys!

My wife and I checked into the hotel on Sunday only to find out that I accidentally requested the wrong room type when I made the online reservation. Kitty, at the front desk, was very helpful and accommodating. She was able to rearrange and fix things and got us into the room we needed.

For Spring Break, my friends and I decided to go to Hawaii. We decided to stay at the Stay Hotel. It was one of the best decisions that we made on this girl trip. The hotel was literally near the beach (2 to 3 minutes walking distance). The coffee that is provided from the hotel is delicious and always being served in the morning. The staff members were friendly and kind. Our room was always cleaned when we come back at the end of the day - excellent housekeeping staff! We would like to thank Kitty for always making us feel welcome while we were there. She always has that smile on her face whenever we see her. :) We will definitely stay here again. Highly recommend this hotel!

Located only a block away from the beach, this was a great location to stay at for a great price. The staff were helpful and super friendly. There's also a karaoke bar on the ground floor if you're feeling adventurous.

The Stay Hotel was a very nice place to visit for both me and my family. The room was always clean and tidy. The air conditioning, internet and all other facilities were great. It’s very central in Waikiki and only minutes from the beach. I would also like to give a special thanks to Kitty from the front desk for making our holiday and stay such a great one xx.

Front desk manager Florencio Banse was extremely helpful and showed us the true spirit of aloha. She helped us with parking, directions and checked us in in a very timely manner. Customer service was an A+. I don’t ever write reviews but I felt like this was well deserving. Mahalo Nui

The Stay Hotel is the perfect option for no-frills accommodations for those that are looking for a place to stay while exploring the island outside of the touristy resorts. The staff at The Stay were amazing. While it’s not difficult to find big smiles on this island, Kitty’s courtesy and kindness were exceptional! Even for Hawaiian standards! We really enjoyed our stay in Waikiki at the Stay Hotel!

Our stay was incredible. The room was clean and the staff was the best. Ester was exceptional and went above and beyond. In fact, on our check out date,she held our bags, gave us directions and best advise to get to Alamoana, and set-up a taxi for us so when we returned for our bags, a taxi would be scheduled to pick us up. Thank you for making us feel as though we are at home.

I really enjoyed by time here! The front desk staff was so friendly! Kitty & Leilani were AWESOME at check-in. So friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable about the area. They gave me some great info about local transportation that proved to be very helpful during my stay here! Loved their personalities, too.The hotel is literally a block to the beach & all the action of Waikiki, and it’s right next to an ABC Store, which was great for quick snacks! They give you a complimentary beach towel on a first-come-first-serve basis, too. It can be a little noisy because of its location, but that’s to be expected. They have complimentary ear plugs upon request at the front desk, too. Noise wasn’t a major issue in the end though. Safe & clean, and a great staff. Would totally stay again!

Upon arrival we came to find out our refrigerator and microwave were not working and spoiled or $60 worth of food. When we brought this to the attention of the older lady at the front desk, she was not at all accommodating and did not offer to have someone look at the problem. When checking out from the hotel, I forgot a tote with contents that had a value of over $300, the front desk person, Michelle assured me that she would put the tote with our luggage that we left at the front for the day, when I called the hotel.Upon returning to pick up our luggage before our flight, the older lady was again very rude and unhelpful. She read an email stating that Michelle had the tote placed with our luggage. However, the woman was not able to find it with the luggage or with the cleaning staff.I am appalled at the service provided by this hotel and in particular the horrible service demonstrated by the older lady at the front desk. I will never return to this hotel and I will be sure to let all family and friends to never stay here.This women made several derogatory remarks with respect to homosexuals, considering this hotel has a gay karaoke bar... it is sad and disgusting that she says things like ‘looney tune’ and ‘not the way God intended’ when referring to homosexuals. She has absolutely soured my trip and she should be reprimanded.-James Crandall

The location is amazing, but if you are sensitive to noise please search elsewhere. Around the hotel a TONNNNNN of construction is going on and starts at like 7AM. If I knew there was construction I would have NEVER BOOKED THIS HOTEL. Don’t get me wrong, it’s close to everything but if you want to sacrifice your sleep don’t stay here. I’m in room 408 SUPER SMALL ROOM with two twin beds almost feels like a prison cell. This room has a broken microwave, which I just called the front desk for some help, but she said “why didn’t you tell us the microwave was broken”. I’m like honey, I just tried to use the microwave today”. I’m not going to go around on the 1st day I book a rooM to see if Everything was working up par. She basically yelled at me and said you should have told us when you got the room. Two days in 1st using the microwave.. I told her, “you know what just forget it”. Like it was my fault. It’s all good. Rooms are very small and honesty doesn’t look anything like the advertisements online. If you want a quiet room Please look elsewhere.

Comfortable room and terrific staff. Great location, dining and shopping nearby. Just a block off of Waikiki Beach. Friendly, helpful staff were the best part of this visit - quick to offer suggestions and tips! Beach toys and bodyboards to borrow on the honor system. You are downtown so there is traffic and construction noise. This hotel does not offer the five-star luxury resort experience; however, it is comfortable, safe, and affordable. Special thanks to staff Kit, DoAnne, and Ester!

The hotel was very clean and the customer service was excellent. The Stay is situated in downtown Waikiki so it can be noisy on the weekends and I recommend earplugs.I recommend this hotel. Keep in mind that the additional fees and taxes can be pricey, but the staff notified me of this when I checked in. Underground parking is available. The roll-a-way bed needs an extra mattress for comfort, so be sure to ask for an extra one. The springs are a killer! If you spend most of your time doing fun things and not hanging out in your motel room, this is a great no-frills place to stay.

Small, personal, friendly, clean, affordable! For price, location and friendly staff, this is your place! Shout out to Ms Kitty- knowledgeable, fun and excellent people skills! And Esther - a welcomed face when drinking my AM Coffee! Kris and Deena

Incredible Location! Oustanding staff! Clean! Loved the bar downstairs - all inclusive and Karaoke was funnnn! Staff members Ms. Kitty, Esther, Rufa and Leti, we loved your hospitality, suggestions and knowledge! But, also would like to thank DoAnne for her beautiful smile- daily, Cody, Ariel and Jessica for their conversation and Crysta- just learning and new, but was friendly. Hopefully, we will see you all again! Deena and Kris

Friendly staff with everyone, especially small children. Clean and excellent housekeeping staff. Close to all amenities. We will definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to everyone. Thank you

Overall, I enjoyed this hotel very much. Although the rooms are on the smaller size and twin beds are different from the queen beds in many hotels, as a single person traveling I was comfortable. The AC worked great, there's coffee in room and housekeeping service is good. I particularly liked the washer and dryer for guests as on day 3 I was ready to do laundry. They provide soap pods and dryer sheets at NO COST. This was really one of the highlights as a business traveler. They also have coffee downstairs with cream, flavored creamer and sugars. The only complaint is they use single serve coffee pods and living in Hawaii part time, this is not good for our island! The lounge is nice and peaceful for relaxing. Staff are GREAT! Everyone was smiling and hospitable. Within walking distance to the beach, nearby hotels, restaurants and shopping.

We stayed at Stay Hotel in January following 5 weeks of traveling and lovely hotel visits. This one was appalling. Firstly our room was NOTHING like the photos, toilet was broken and didn’t flush, room stunk, broken door and the smallest window which let in hardly any light. It was just awful. When we asked to change rooms we were told there were no more rooms available. The worst experience I have ever had with accommodation.

We really enjoyed our time at Stay Hotel Waikiki. The price was great! All of the staff were so willing to help us in any way. Yes, it is a budget hotel but in a fantastic location. That being said, there was tremendous value and benefit to staying at a simple and clean hotel and have extra money for sightseeing and shopping. We are going back to Stay Hotel for our next visit to Honolulu!

nice and clean hotel in Waikiki. 3 min to Waikiki beach and neighborhood amusement attractions, restaurants, cafes, shopping centers. helpful staff. they do provide also beach towels and chairs on first come first served basis. overall satisfied

Worst customer service. They said I didn't have a room they had to check booking 6 time the older lady. They never clean the room. They front desk said they called the room never called the room since we were never there until 4 o clock in the afternoon..

The Stay Hotel Waikiki was such a great choice for our trip to hawaii! They are in the heart of Waikiki and literally steps from the beach. Pros: the staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating. I had a request right when we got there and within minutes of calling, someone came up and personally took care of us. Unlike most hotels that charge for bath towels, snorkel masks, and floatation devices, the Stay offers all of that for free... and no time limit. Aside from the towels, it was a first come first serve basis. Although there is construction happening right next to the hotel (out of their control) it was still a pleasant sleep as there was no noise coming into our room; we stayed on the 6th floor. The beds were low and comfortable!!! There are tons of restaurants within minutes from the hotel, there is an ABC store right next to it also. La cuchracha, Mexican restaurant and Shorefyre Restaurant were the closest and are located on Koa Ave and Uluniu Ave. The inside of the our room was nice. There is a microwave and small refrigerator with a tv that had all channels available. There was also a small AC that worked just fine. Just downstairs there was a restaurant and karaoke bar called Wang Chungs. They served good food and inexpensive drinks! Karaoke is $1 per song for those who want to show off their singing skills. Cons: I’m still going to them a 5 star rating because this con is just a personal preference (they met all of my expectations) however, I would have wanted more storage in the bathroom area. We had a lot of personal hygiene stuff that had to be put elsewhere due to lack of space in the bathroom. Overall: EXCELLENT STAY, affordable pricing, and GREAT LOCATION. Thank you to the friendly and amazing staff... special mahalo to Katti!!! Definitely felt the ALOHA in the air!!!!

Honestly it was our first time in Hawaii and I cannot say enough good things about this place. I'm gonna be very candid. It is NOT the Ritz Carlton however, it was a very pleasant stay! It's literally in the middle of Waikiki and right around the corner from everything even the beach! They've got everything you need and like Kitty at the front desk says "You didn't come here to sleep!" and boy she was right. We were hardly in our room! I gotta give a big shout out to Kitty at the front desk she was super accommodating, funny and friendly! If it was not for her we wouldn't have gotten to see half of the sights we saw because we kind of just took the trip and we're just going to play it by ear especially since it was only a 4 day trip. But thanks to her and her introduction of the Waikiki Trolley we actually got to see sights and go around the island. They do have a bar downstairs and I'm super bummed we didn't get to go to their Drag brunch because I heard it's really awesome. But overall if we ever go back to Oahu I'm definitely going to be booking here.

Very average room. I suggest you wear shower shoes to bathe. Windows are very outdated. Power Outlets are inconveniently misplaced, bring extra long cords plus a surge protector if you need to charge up. I must say, the Location is phenomenal though. You get what you pay for, and this hotel came just below the median. 7 minute walk to the beach (treat all my sentences as different reviews)

My stay was great. Very close to the beach and walking distance to everything in Waikiki. Rooms were as advertised. Fun bar on 1st floor. Short block to the beach. I would stay here again with friends or the girlfriend.

My stay at Stay was just what I needed! The room had all I needed to rest, relax and recharge after a few days of camping. 1/2 block off the beach was a huge bonus-made it worth more than the price! Lots of room, clean. Bed was comfy, shower was warm, tv worked great. And front desk was awesome and helpful to get my parking resolved.I booked same day and I was not disappointed. If you don’t need a view or the Ritz Carlton, stay at Stay and spend your money eating, drinking and shopping!

If you're looking for somewhere expensive to rest your head in a great location this it. We spent minimal time in the hotel as we were out doing tourist things but it served it's purpose, only downside it just cost an arm and leg. Staff were very friendly. Room was rundown but didn't bother us. Most tourist tours pick up from behind the Hyatt Waikiki which is on the same street as Stay so that worked out very well.

Prior accommodations had fell thru at the very last minute and being stuck without a place during one of the busiest times of the year— Esther has definitely saved our trip and helped us out with a condo for the four of us. Very friendly and super helpful! Thank you again! You saved us. Mahalo :)

We stayed 11 nights in December. Our room was spacious, clean and tidy with a mini fridge, microwave and cold air conditioning. Cleaning staff did an amazing job everyday. Staff were friendly and helpful, they did laundry for me free of charge. There was free quality coffee every morning. Great location 1 minute walk from Waikiki beach.

Lobby waiting area is uncomfortable, our room is unclean (sticky carpet), low water pressure in bathroom, spring in extra bed is bad, no proper lighting and sheets are old. Totaly our stay was uncofortable considering the price

Very simple hotel, clean room and good service.Nothing fancy but location is great. Rates are overpriced for what it offers but is Hawaii and we went during the holidays. Bed was not very comfortable but overall we had a good time.I rated 4 due to the great proximity to the beach but if you are wanting a fancy hotel this is not the place.

We were on Oahu for two tours so we didn't need a fancy resort, just a place to sleep for three nights. The room was small but very clean so it was suitable for our purposes. Upon arrival we were charged $50 for amenities but I'm not sure there really were any.

the room was clean and everything was as I expected, the team at the front desk were always nice, welcoming, helpful, polite and helpful; great location; - it will be back.free wifi i was there for the Honolulu marathon (DEC 2019) - the atmosphere was great

Location is good, just behind Hyatt Regency and a few min. to Waikiki beach. The curtains in the room could not block out light, so you could not have a nap in daytime. There was no main switch on entry of the room, only a lamp in the room. There was no chair or table to write and eat, could only sit in bed.Staff was friendly and helpful. I should have paid a bit more for better accommodation.

We stayed here for one night to attend a concert. Boy we were surprised to walk into the room and discover how small it was. It was like a college dorm room. However, it was very, very clean!!!! I couldn't have been more impressed. Definitely would stay here again.

Decent hotel, 1 block from main strip and beach. Kitty at the front desk was very helpful and awesome. Will definitely stay again. Everyone is so nice and welcoming. Amenities were great. Let's us know where to go.

Had a great time with my family at the Stay Hotel.Rooms were a little small, however the location of the place in relation to Waikiki beach (3 min walk), and shops made it very convinient. I mean, you can find a better looking hotel somewhere else, but youd have to put in either a lot more $$$ or effort travelling to where the activites are at so Id suggest Stay Hotel. Not to mention the super friendly staff like Meghan, Leilani, Esther, Doanne, Jessica, Amanda, etc. They were super awesome and making sure my family was taken care of, always prompt in responding to our requests, and making sure that we feel welcomed.Super great service.P.s enjoy your trip in the Land Of The Long White Cloud Leilani!! You deserve a good break.

If want to be close to the action in Honolulu and Waikiki Beach this spot is great. I got a great rate and it’s nice simple hotel that won’t cost you and arm and a leg. They are a block from the beach and provide beach towels and floaties for the beach. The service was great too. If you rent a car, make sure you pay for the parking. There is not a lot of street parking.

I checked in and I never wanted to check out. Kitty and her staff are incredibly hospitable. They treated me like family and showed me true aloha during my stay. I am a single woman traveling alone and I felt very safe. The room was very clean, there were beach amenities, a karaoke bar, and it was just a short walk to the beach and shops. I'm so glad I was recommended this hotel and you will be too.

It was our first trip to Hawaii and the location was so convenient, just a minute walk to the beach! The staff was very friendly and helpful, Meghan gave us some great pointers about how best to navigate the Polynesian Cultural Center that worked out well. The room was very clean and nicely updated. There was some construction nearby but I always bring ear plugs when we visit the city so it wasn't an issue. The bed was comfortable and not too firm and the A/C worked great. We are already planning to stay here again!

Firstly, the only reason we ended up at this hotel was because our original booking with the Ala Moana Hotel was cancelled due to the booking company we used ceasing business. We lost our booking (but got our money back thanks to Paypal). So we had to find a hotel quickly for the last two nights of our trip, having just returned from Maui. This one seemed reasonably priced and was in a good location. That is the only positive. This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I nearly cried when I walked in. There were two single beds, not even on proper bed frames but on very low chipboard bases. There was a small box air condition in the corner that was completely ineffective due to the TV unit blocking it. The bathroom smelt of mould and mildew and after using the shower for the first time, it wouldn't stop dripping. We were given a room on the third floor at the front of the building. This meant that at night, the streetlight shone right through the paper thin curtains. The coffee maker was situated on the TV stand, right in front of the TV and the wardrobe door was broken. This was the type of room that made you feel like someone was going to break in at any moment. It just had that vibe to it. (Not that it was a bad neighbourhood or anything.)The bottom line was, I was embarrassed that people would see where I was staying.

The staff were amazing and very nice. The room was a very small room and the window had no screen on them and barely opened. It was a little stuffy cause of the humidity outside and the ac unit didn’t work well in the room but we asked for a fan and it helped out a little bit. There was also no dresser or safe in our room. The place has potential. It was fine for our short visit.

Just stayed here for 5 days. The staff is amazing and super friendly. Have stayed here 2 years in a row and love it. The bar in the hotel Wang Chungs is the best on the strip. Shout out to Kitty our concierge!!!

Just one block from the beach at Waikiki, the Stay Hotel was a great place to spend a few days. Within walking distance of anything you could need it's convenient but beyond that, super friendly. I would like to make special mention of Kitty. At the very end of her long shift, she was bubbly, sweet, funny, and so so friendly. We will never forget her. I'd also like to mention Rowena in housekeeping. The entire staff made our visit superb! I would definitely stay there again.It's an older hotel, overflowing with Aloha!

The staff(Thanks Kitty!!), and location made staying at Stay Hotel FANTASTIC!! Everything was clean and fresh! Having fresh and delicious coffee, early in the morning really starts my day off great!Thank You! Thank You! Thank You!

Great location, close to the beach and shopping galore. The hotel has a European hostel feel to it. Everything you need is here. Free laundry, coffee and beach items are a plus. The rooms are average but clean!! Ear plugs are a must if you’re a light sleeper. They have a bar on the first floor that stays open until 1 am. The front desk staff is very nice.

We had a disgusting experience. Loud construction and trucks outside our window. Guests next door had a party untilafter 2. Rooms not sound proof at all. Room was all white painted brick. One old lamp was the only lighting except in the bath room which was clean. Sheets were clean but with stains. Plug in of refrigerator, microwave and TV looked concerning. Front desk was friendly. Good walking location. I certainly would not recommend this hotel.PS: only place to set was the bed..  next room had a really loud party until about 2 a.m. . Room is barren with white brick walls. Very small with no chairs. One old lamp was only lighting except the bath room light. Pug in for for the refrigerator, microwave and TV gerrymandered into plug. Sheets clean but stained. Bathroom was clean. Good walking location. This place would work for students and other young singles or couples with out children. Staff is friendly. We could never recommend this as a place to stay with all the quality hotels in the area.

Great location, clean with thoughtful extras such as coffee and beach toys available in the foyer.The beach is a two minute walk and the team on the front desk friendly. This is a budget conscious hotel ( great for when the AUD dives) and the building reflects that but they have also made the most of ensuring a fresh modern feel to their rooms and the service was great.There was construction happening next door when I was there but it finished late afternoon each day so don't be put off by that, it did not impact sleep at night. I requested a room in one of the top levels high as given as I was aware of the Kareoke bar down stairs and didn't hear a thing.

We were very comfortable, happy and safe.Do anne and Kitty are pleasant to talk to. Very professional and hepful. All your staff are nice and respectful.I'm very happy to recommend your hotel to our friends and relatives in Canada Thank you and very happy that we met nice people in Hawaii other than our friends.

The staff is what really made this stay wonderful with lovely ladies helping us every which way we needed. The shore is only a block away and there are restaurants and convenience stores all around making this spot wonderful for every day activities.

Location is good and staff are friendly, but for the amount of money they are charging for their rooms, it should be much much nicer. It is very run down, small, dank and has a curtain held up by wire. I would expect that if I paid $80 a night or something. But not for $250 + per night plus a hidden "service fee" of $15 per night. Very disappointing.

Staff were friendly and helpful, rooms are basic but adequate, disappointed with opaque glass obscuring the view, would also recommend double glazing to help with outside noise. Bar on site but no restaurant however handy to plenty of restaurants and bars.

My husband and I were hesitant about staying here but decided to give it a chance. We really enjoyed our stay here. Very affordable, perfect location and the perfect size for the 2 of us. We did have trouble with the WiFi but after informing them, it was fixed. I loved the guest services here. They allowed us to use their beach chairs at no cost and even provided us with beach towels. They even have washers & dryers for free use. The staff was very active and friendly especially Kitty! She is such a sweet and nice lady and definitely made our stay wonderful, we really appreciate her.Thank you Stay Waikiki we will be back!

Friendly, welcoming, and great hospitality! Stayed for seven days and didn't have a single problem! Room was smaller, but cozy and functional. Includes free WiFi, laundry, and coffee, which was highly enjoyable! Overall an lovely and comfortable stay!
user_name:
Real Estate by G
Mesa, Arizona

review_body: Stayed here the last week of September.Room was small A/C did not cool the room enough and it did not cool the bathroom at all which was very hot.Bed was on a low to the ground platform, not comfortable.Parking at the hotel was limited and expensive I believe it was like $42 per day. Hard to find street parking around the area. There's free parking along the canal which is several blocks away and hard to find parking spots. Washer and dryer did not work and we were NOT compensated for having to go and wash somewhere else which was a total of about $15 to wash and dry 3 loads of clothing.Karaoke place inside the hotel on the first floor which can get very loud and annoying if your room it right above itConstruction on the side of the hotel. Construction works start working at around 6am so there is a lot of noise!Overall not the best experience for the price. If you can book anywhere else do so!

Totally enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff was super friendly and my room was exactly as posted. One block away from the beach and the Waikiki flare. I used the beach chair to hang out at the beach and the printer to print my ticket. The morning coffee was appreciated. I’m returning in December .

I did my Homework before choosing the Stay Hotel and when i selected it who would have known that my 8 day stay would end up being one of the finest vacations i have ever had. The hotel was everything i expected. Had a bed, shower, (plumbing worked) great AC and free WIFI. Not to mention it is one block off the main street on the lower side (Zoo) of Waikiki. What made this trip the "Best Ever" was two ladies I had the pleasure of meeting.Leilani and Megan are two remarkable individuals that did everything above and beyond during my stay. What these two ladies bring to the table in customer service skills and wanting to make each and every customers visit a memorable one is head and shoulders above any hotel around. Leilani and Megan....My hat is off to you... hana maikaʻiI look forward to my next visit in a few months!!

The Stay Hotel was the most budget-friendly option I found in Waikiki, and for good reason. The amenities were minimal; the wifi didn't work during our stay at all, the shower pressure was very low and hot water took a long time to come through. We also stayed in room 404, and the exterior light shone in through the windows (which the bed was under) making the room very bright! We had to tape the curtains down to avoid waking up in the middle of the night multiple times due to the light. The staff said it was illegal to remove the bulb, which I understand, but also offered us no other solutions. This really made sleeping difficult, but be mindful it may only be for this room. Otherwise the hotel was fine for a cheap stay in Waikiki. The staff really try their best to make people feel welcome, and can only do so much about the amenities in an older, concrete building. Thanks for accommodating us!

Mmm where to start...I guess hat's off to the photographer who took photos of the rooms because they were so tiny! We had two single beds that were pretty much on top of each other. Oh and to get to the only power point you had to crawl under one of the beds.When we got into our room we discovered that our very noisy aircon didn't actually work, the Wi-Fi was a joke and the fridge couldn't keep anything cold. When we requested a different room they said they couldn't and when they sent maintenance to have a look at everything his reply was "yeah it's a full moon tomorrow night"!!!! We asked for a refund but they said they wouldn't give one and instead just took a measly $17 off one night (we were staying for 4). The receptionist Kitty, was the only saving grace of this terrible hotel. She dragged a fan up stairs to help keep the room "cool"DON'T STAY HERE!

We stayed here four nights on the 7th floor. The rooms were neat, clean, and just what we needed in a simple, no frills place to lay our heads after each day of adventure. There's a microwave and mini fridge. It is super convenient to everything we needed... parking, food, and an ABC store in close walking distance. There's free coffee and free use of the washer and dryer. The staff is excellent; they are friendly and helpful!! I would definitely stay here again.

Amazing hotel, my name is Kathy lam !!! my family & I stay at this hotel,we so happy to stay here , all staffs is wonderful, everyone so nice , so convenient to get to every where, the services is wonderful, room so nice and clean, highly recommended !!!

I stayed here with my Father for ten days. All the staff were friendly and ready to answer any questions we had, about anything. In particular Kitty, Michelle and another young woman who worked at the desk whose name I can't remember! Dad loved the coffee made available. Honestly, never had a problem here and would recommended it to anyone needing a place to stay in Waikiki on their holidays.

I stayed here for 4 nights, 5 days here. The pictures weren't exactly what I expected BUT it was still clean and had all the amenities I expected. The location is excellent and it provides great value. The staff were friendly. If you're looking for basic , no frills, straightforward accomodations then this might be the place for you.

Everything worked well! I booked it to have a peaceful, first time in Hawaii and got exactly what I wanted....a hotel near the beach, coffee at anytime downstairs in the lobby, helpful, pleasant staff and a good price. And the weather was perfect.....walking around, heading to the beach and exploring Honolulu.

The location was great if you want to walk to waikiki beach. They did provide beach towels for you to take to the beach. There were plenty of places to eat near the hotel. It was all just average, nothing exception about it. I would stay again if the price was right.

We had many problems during our stay. The toilet was broken throughout the entire week long stay. The AC would not go below 72 with windows that do not really close keeping it very hot the entire time. The room was nothing like the picture and when I asked the front desk, they told us we were wrong and “ALL” of their rooms correspond with the pictures. The beds are basically on a piece of plywood on the floor. Nothing about this place was clean or nice as it seems in the pictures. The karaoke bar stayed loud constantly while we were there, night and day. Do not let the pictures deceive you. This place is disgusting and I would NOT recommend to anyone.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights and the service couldn’t have been better! We were always greeted with a friendly welcome from Kitty and Jessica at the front desk. This hotel is perfect for couples who are not looking to spend a fortune for a comfortable stay in Waikiki just steps from the beach and surf shops. Would recommend!

My boyfriend and I stayed in a queen sized room for two days. I'm not sure how things were before the renovations, but now this hotel is definitely worthy of getting 5/5. When we came in the air conditioning was 60 degrees but we changed it to 73 and we were happy. The Wi-Fi isn't perfect, but my bf was able to play his xbox and listen to music while on a group call with some spottiness which is pretty good. It wasn't a large luxurious room but had a nice bed and breakfast feel. Would definitely recommend because of how cheap it is in comparison to all the other hotels in Waikiki. Cheap and a bed and breakfast feel. Breakfast isn't included, but you could always to to the ABC store nearby for anything.

This place is very overpriced for what you get. There is no blockout curtain just a sheer curtain meaning it was bright all the time. The air conditioner was very old and the rooms had glass louvers allowing all the heat in. The room was warm constantly even with the air conditioner running 24/7. The bath tap dripped constantly and there is a karaoke bar in the lobby which was at time loud. I would not recommend staying here.

Hubby and I stayed here for a week and were happy with the accommodations. Not a fancy place by any means, but staff are super friendly and helpful and our room was comfortable. You don't come to Hawaii to stay in your room anyway. Very clean, and the coffee is wonderful. Cute bar/restaurant in lobby with karaoke on demand, which is entertaining. Easy walk to everything. Would stay here again.

I would not stay here again, although front desk staff was very kind and called when room was early. Moldy bathroom as shown. Open slat Windows without screens that don’t block heat and see through shade very bright at sunrise. Room was very hot. AC went right out window on 8th floor we also didn’t get a breeze We put up DO NOT DISTURB sigh and housekeeping knocked on our door at 8,8:30 and 9am despite checkout being 11am.

The hotel was centrally located and clean. Staff helpful and friendly. A little noisey and rooms could do with a bit of a refurb but reasonably comfortable. Our air condition unit worked ok but our friends one didnt so their room was pretty hot.

Overall this hotel for a 3 star is worth it for the location. In terms of cleanliness a shout out to Mercy and her team for their friendliness and customer service. The Front desk customer service can improve with a 5 star rating only of they greeted their customers upon entry considering it's a small lobby. That didnt happen 1 out of 10 times and for that reason they were GOOD not excellent Now to my concerns, there are no security deposit box in the room and no cameras on each floor. Added to concern anyone can go up without a security pass as the elevators does not require a pass to go up. I have noticed some shady individuals on my floor. This could be due to the fact outsiders and local people frequent the K Bar in the main lobby. To Stay Management, overall good hotel but something to note from a concerned customer especially for families visiting with small children.

Great location, one block back from beach in Honolulu. No frills, but clean room and cable tv. Small beds, I was ok but my brother who is just over 6 feet tall had his legs overhanging the end of the bed. Great staff, shout out to Kitty!

This is my 3rd visit with Stay Hotel and again it was a wonderful experience. Some minor housekeeping issues that I reported but everything as usual was great. The reception staff and in particular the housekeeping staff are so friendly and approachable and helpful. The free coffee kept me going well..... the location is exceptional, right in the heart of everything, room is a good size for a solo traveller, a chair for the lanai would be great though, so I can sit and watch the world go by. Only drama this trip was the overwhelming construction noise next door where Kings Village was demolished, I couldn't rest in my room during the day so had to go shopping and swimming and eating and drinking!!!! How hard that was. Will stay at Stay for all my trips now, very happy with the whole experience.

Hospitality at Stay Waikiki was fabulous however, the rooms are what provides for a lower rating. We stayed for one week in a king sized room. The room was clean and quaint however, it was so hot each night it made it uncomfortable to sleep. I was given a fan from the front desk but honestly didn’t make much of a difference. The bed and pillows were also not the most comfortable to sleep on. I was also upset we paid a service fee each night for internet, etc... but the interment NEVER ONCE worked in our rooms, only in the lobby area. Room does have various amenities available such as tv, fridge, soaps, and blow dryer. Overall, it was an okay stay but probably would spend more $ on a hotel room somewhere else in the future to be more comfortable and be able to sleep throughout the night.

The staff is awesome. The building is old and the rooms were small but that’s what I expected for the economical pricing. I was very satisfied with my stay at the Stay. Add a chair to room/balcony. The area around the hotel was busy with great food choices, shopping and the beach was very close. The hotel has some beach floats and other items available for use.

Stay Hotel was very comfortable and clean as well as a short walking distance to the Waikiki strip and beach. The Deluxe Room was the perfect amount of space for me and my partner — the room was nice and cool with a great working AC. Front desk staff kind and helpful with any questions we had.

We arrive from Sydney early in the morning and were very tired. The reception staff were extremely helpful and ensured we had a soon available only a fews hours later - we had a rest and got ready for a swim.The Hotel is located a block back from the beach, close to a trolley stop and lots of restaurants.It was very comfortable and we slept well teh short time we were there.The bottomless coffee was also appreciated as was the comfortable lounge area near reception.

The room is too small for 2 people to be comfortable. No room to sit or place luggage. It was HOT. The ac works but is not adequate to cool the room. Put in a larger window unit. The second day we got fresh towels but no face cloths or hand towels. The sliding door on the bathroom broke. I reported it but it was not repaired by the time we checked out. The bath window did not open. It would have helped cool the room but no handle to open it.The coke vending machine was broken. Had to go to the ABC store to get a drink. The staff was awesome. Very helpful. Trying to do the best they could with what they had. Could be a nice place to stay if the owners would invest in a few upgrades and better maintenance. I won’t go back It’s a shame because it could b a nice hide away. Sent from my iPhone

We have at the Stay Hotel on three separate occasions. All three experiences were great. The two person room with twin beds was perfect, same for the larger rooms with a queen bed and fold out couch. The hotel is close to everything and you can walk one block over to the Duke statute. Food and shopping are one block over.  too. The staff has always been nice and accommodating. Our check in/check out went great. The last day of our trip, they locked our luggage in a storage area and we enjoyed the rest of the day. The room was clean and a great place to relax after enjoying the great outdoors on the island. Great value for the money. If you're hypercritical about things like draperies, then stay home. If you want to enjoy all the Oahu has to offer, this is a great budget hotel.

This hotel looked amazing and very worth the money in the pictures. When we first go there, it was definitely not as nice as we thought. There was construction going on around the building. The lobby looked half completed and dirty.Then, as soon as we got there, we found out that they have some hidden extra "amenity fees" that we were not happy about. Fine, I pay the fees.We get up to the room, and find that it is an outdoor hotel, and it smells moldy like a cheap motel. The bathroom looked cheap and so old that it looked dirty.Then, I try to connect to the WiFi, and it doesn't work! I told the receptionist about it, and she apologized, but did nothing. I asked about it the next day and even told her how to fix it. Nothing. I talked to them a few more times, and long story short, we had no WiFi the entire time.While none of these are a huge deal, I would expect much better for the money we paid. For that type of quality, I could have stayed at a cheap motel for half the price. I would avoid this hotel in the future.

This review is based on 2 consecutive years staying at this hotel. In July 2018 my wife and I stayed here and we came in July 2019 with my 6 year old son. First the positives: This hotel is one block from the beach (Kapiolani Beach Park in Waikiki) - you can literally have your feet on the sand in less than 5 minutes. The staff is very friendly and accommodating, during both stays I was always given the utmost attention, towels for the beach are provided on request and there is always someone there to provide these for you, as well as beach gear available to use. Parking is available for a fee that is on par with the rest of the area, but there is limited space and some of the spots are a bit tight but it’s quite convenient. The hotel is also located less than a 2 minute walk from an Alamo rental car. Neutral/possibly negatives depending on your preferences:Currently there is the demo phase of a construction project in what I remember used to be King’s Something center. It can be rather noisy - however this is not any fault of the hotel and their work day ends around 17.00, if you are on vacation in Hawai’i This probably won’t bother you. There is a Karaoke bar on the first floor. There have been times where patrons were outside and gathered on the steps smoking, they never did anything purposely bad or menacing but they were speaking loudly with foul language in front of my 6 year old son on more than one occasion. I want to stress that in my 2 stays here I have never had any issues with intoxicated customers or anything like that. Loud AC. The AC is loud but works well, for me it provides good white noise to put me to sleep, but be aware it might be too loud for some people. Minor Negatives:I hate to say anything negative, but it seems my room this year is in some sort of WiFi dead space. Last year I stayed on the 5th floor and had no problems at all. This year we are on the 4th floor and our WiFi continuously drops the connection or works at extremely slow speeds. I am currently typing this in the lobby and have no issues. If I go outside my room towards the elevator all is well again. In my room it takes nearly 10 minutes to send one photo to my friends and family :/ In conclusion: This place is great. It is in a perfect location and great to use as a crash pad while you do your vacation stuff. The price is great for the location, you could pay upwards to 450 more dollars a night to stay at a larger hotel, but in my opinion if you are coming to Hawaii on vacation and you really just need a room to sleep in, Stay Hotel is perfect, After 2 stays I would definitely recommend it and plan to come here again next year.

We experienced a few days at a high end hotel to start then booked 8 nights here.the appearance of the property is not what the photos show. However price was good for us.the airconditioner was loud enough to block out the street noise at night.very close to shops,eateries and the beach.very friendly obliging staff. Thanks guys.

Do not, repeat... do not stay at this hotel. If you have common sense of decency of what an actual hotel stay/accommodations are!We purchased via Hotels.com, as the pics looked OK, and was close to the beach etc. But if you have any sense of "not wanting to be in tight/close/confined" spaces, again... don't go here!The first room they gave us, I could literally, if I wanted, lay down on the floor, and could touch both sides of the walls, hand to foot. Way to small/claustrophobic for 2 people. THEN, the rooms all have the windows that can open up, with like 6 inch sections of glass. So the room/window is not really 'sealed/air tight'. Which means, as you can imagine.. HOT Air comes in, and COLD air goes out through all the little slits in windows. So yeah, the rooms don't ever cool off. So they put us into a 2nd room. And it was a tad bigger, but that was it. Still AC wouldn't cool off the room. AND, the Bathrooms of the first 2 rooms, were about the size of a closet. No sink space, just horrible.Finally, they moved us to a 3rd room. At least the bathroom was 'normal sized' like other hotels. But you still have the stupid openable windows. Still warm rooms. The ONLY way I could sleep, was because in this 3rd room, the little AC unit in the wall, just so happen to be next to the bed. So at least 1 of us got cool enough to sleep.The worse part is, even after these, and several other issues we had... they WOULD NOT REFUND US ANY OF OUR MONEY. We had paid for 3 days up front. I was ok with taking a 1 day hit ( and at least staying there of course), as I wanted to move to another hotel down the block. But both Hotels.com and the Hotel itself, refused to refund any part of our stay... even after expressing numerous dissatisfactions with our rooms, etc. So basically, we were trapped there!Next time I go to a place like this, I'll just book the 1st night... and if I like it, book the other remaining nites (as there's a pluthera of Hotels in this area)! Uuhhhggg..

We wanted a nice hotel that was walking distance to Waikiki and this was it. Parking was nearby and the view out was amazing. There was construction on the ground so our 8th floor was much quieter. The room was small, but OK. The bathroom was even smaller to fit only one person at a time. The staff was super friendly and helpful in many ways. They even helped us with our luggage.

This ‘hotel’ was the biggest let down. We arrived and was given a TINY room with literally no room for our suitcases, we had to complain and we were given a new room. New room was just as average, but was more spacious. You cannot properly close windows to block out the ridiculous amounts of noise coming from outside which includes partygoers from the hotel, delivery trucks and construction at all hours of the night, not to forget the smell of cigarettes seeping throughly the ‘windows’. Also the air conditioner was extremely loud to the point where you cant even hear the TV. Not to mention the toilet makes a loud beeping/screeching noise which only stops when you get up and flush it! If you want a good nights sleep or a quiet/relaxing night in your room, don’t stay here.

I absolutely love the location of this hotel. One block away from the world famous Waikiki beach, restaurants & bars surrounds this hotel and public transportations are all walking distance. Great staff, clean rooms, comfortable beddings with minimum amenities. Only complaint, this hotel should consider upgrading to double paned windows (less AC use, less energy used). Will definitely come back to Stay Hotel Waikiki

This hotel is no resort, the room was small and it isn't anything fancy. BUT it had everything we needed. A place to sleep, shower, store our belongings and free coffee. Our balcony also gave us a partial ocean view which was so lovely! We had no problems throughout our stay (Except the construction noise next door)

The room was super small with an even smaller bathroom. Everything was clean. I was surprised to see a small fridge and microwave, which is a nice bonus. It has an ironing board and blow dryer. The room was good enough to spend the night to go to the airport. Great location. It is close to the beach and international market.

a complete fraud and ripoff, room was nothing like the pictures. it's a dump. a closet sized room, beds were cots, air conditioner was like a jet engine, bathroom you could barely squeeze into. worst hotel i stayed anywhere in the world.

This place is no frills but it’s clean and quiet. Great staff and free coffee, laundry facilities and a kareoke bar. If you’re a light sleeper, you might request a distance away from it. The hotel is located right where you want to be, Fyre is a good restaurant that’s next to it, ABC store next door as well, most importantly the beach is a two minute walk away. I spent ten days here, had a good experience and will definitely stay at Stay again. For the money, it can’t be beat.

This hotel is in a prime location. There were only 2 things that were off putting. One, there is a light outside of the bathroom window that shines into the room like a spotlight after sundown. Two, the bed was awful. It sunk in in the middle and did not sleep well. The staff is extremely friendly. Buyer beware, you have to pay for parking if you have a vehicle. $45/night for parking. I would stay here again if they had new beds and fixed the light in the window issue.

This title is a more apt name for this hotel as you will not sleep while you're there, at least not on the weekend (so the front desk told us the next morning). This is a quaint local hotel just blocks from the beach. Good location, very friendly staff. HOWEVER, the hotel also has a night club that kept us awake all night long with loud music, noise, laughter etc. Particularly unfortunate for us since we had to rise at 4 a.m. to catch a flight. When I asked the front desk about the noise the lady at the counter apologized and explained that they "try" to keep the clubbers quiet, but can't. We only stayed the one night. Maybe it is quieter on a week night, but I wouldn't bet my sleep on it. I am giving this 2 marks only because of the nice people at the front desk. I really would avoid this place if you want to actually sleep at the hotel.

Location is great, but noise from the night club and patrons kept us up past 3 AM. If I were to stay here again I'd ask for a room far away from the night club. We also had a hard time cooling the room sufficiently, even with unit running at max A/C.

My stay was better than expected.. although the parking is a little to steep, the customer service made up for it plus there’s a karaoke bar and really close to stores and the beach.. so there’s really not much to complain about.

Aloha!Just to thank all support and great reception you guys have!! Special thanks to Katlin who gave us direction for best beaches and support to contact Brazilian consulate!!For sure a place to come back and have fun!!Mahalo!Eduardo Miyagi

For our first visit to Hawaii ever, we chose a place really close to the beach. With the Stay Hotel Waikiki, we got a whole lot more.The public bus from the airport drops off one block behind the Stay. The beach is a little over a block in front of the Stay. And Kalakaua street, which has pretty much everything on it (shopping, food, groceries, drugstores), is between the Stay and the beach.The room was small, but it was absolutely beautiful. We got a balcony and we weren't even expecting one! Toiletries like hand soap, shampoo and body wash are provided. The AC was on when we arrived, which helped us beat the heat.Stop obsessing over perks like free breakfast and enjoy everything else you get for free at the Stay: free coffee in the lobby, free use of their washing machine and dryer with free detergent and dryer sheets, free beach gear (towels, inner tubes, pool noodles, etc.), free newspapers, free computers to use in the lobby and, of course, free WiFi.Hawaii's weather may be quite warm, but the Stay's lobby is wide open, meaning the air flow keeps it from feeling stuffy.Wang Chung's is a cute karaoke bar in the lobby next to the elevator. Gay friendly and great prices on cocktails. One warning, though, their karaoke system might have a version of the song you pick that's been transposed to a different key to make it easier to sing, so be ready to think on your feet.A most wonderful hotel for our first time in Hawaii and one I recommend for your first, second, third time and beyond!

Stayed with the family recently and even though the hotel is old (like most of the places around), it was quite comfortable and very close to the beach. The customer service was excellent and the location was quite close to shopping and the main waikki road.

It was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was outdated but everything worked just fine. The karaoke bar is noisy on the weekends. You can’t beat the location. I would stay there again. Perfect for my budget.

Loved being able to stay here for my niece's graduation. It was close to the beach and had great access to restaurants and shops. Customer service was amazing and all the staff was lovely and I felt well taken care of. I would definitely recommend for anyone looking for a nice low key vacation!

We arrived early before check-in and Margaret was so accommodating and let us keep our luggage there while we did some sight seeing! The room was very clean and quaint. We also had a good check our experience as well. I would definitely recommend this place!!
user_name:
Cbenmarie8
Victoria Capital Regional District, Canada

review_body: Awesome place. Great location and great staff. Yes the area is a little noisy but wasn't a big issue for us. Room had all we needed. Stay hotel is so close to the beach, we got to enjoy regular visits to the beach and everything close by. Staff were always helpful and pleasant.

When I booked this hotel through Qantas thinking it'd be a nice place as pictures. I was horrified, petrified and mortified when I arrived. The room was disgusting with a musky smell to it, the building itself is in absolute horrible condition, nothing is clean. The rooms are a cross between cheap college dorm and prison style. No wifi working in the room. Air con was at head level so while I was laying on the bed it blew cold air straight into my face like Antartica, and the aircon was very loud and noisy all the time. The bed was broken and falling apart. No tea or coffee facilities in room. No toaster, kettle, crockery or cutlery in room. No iron board in room. The bathroom was equally as bad, but not as bad as the balcony. First let me begin by saying that the curtains to the balcony were completely torn up and gross (in need of good clean). They were strung on on some sort of industrial looking metal wire. The balcony door and the jalousie windows cannot shut completely and therefore everything that you hear on the streets can be heard inside my hotel room. When it is bed time, it is like sleeping outside on the streets except that you are on a broken bed. The balcony was another massive disappointment, it is carpeted in astroturf, one part had marks and smell of cigarette butts while the other side had some sort of mould growing in the corner. The view was was 5 star if you live in prison. It was literary looking at other broken down, unoccupied apartment buildings in various state of despair. Not one washing machine was working. The Hotel is literally nothing like the add or pictures shown it to be on the Qantas  website and specially on this website. For this 'hotel' to charge anyone "resort fee" is absolutely ludicrous. It is more like a hostel than a hotel. But one point I’d like to empathize is that the photos are not accurate or current. The quality of this ‘hotel’ is below average and I would not recommend it to anyone.

The people were fantastic, the rooms are clean and great for chilling. There is so much to do you don't need to be in the room but to sleep and get ready to have fun. It is just off the strip so in a minute you can be right in the action.

I would definitely recommend this place. The rooms are small and simple, but very clean. Since we weren't planning on spending a lot of time in the room....your at the beach... it worked great for us. Perfect location! 2 min walk to the beach and tons of shopping and food.

Good location; good prices; basic accommodations for a one-night stay. I'd recommend to someone who won't be in hotel a lot, because it's in walking distance to a lot. Fun bar downstairs on a Saturday night!

Amazing location! It’s less than one block from Waikiki Beach! It’s close to everything and its way better.. The staff were very helpful and friendly specially “Ricky” Free beach towels, free laundry, free coffee and tea. The room was spacious comfortable and clean, definitely go back to this hotel.

The staff was welcoming and very considerate.. they filled all of our accommodations and gave us the best easter. They also put on a easter egg hunt for the kids.. i would definitely book here again for our next trip..

Very convenient location being a block away from Waikiki Beach. The Hyatt Regency is close by which came in extra handy because the tour buses pick you up right across the Stay Hotel Waikiki. Karaoke bar was very cool! All front desk staff was beyond helpful and friendly. Beach items in the front desk available for you to borrow. It’s not a luxurious room with a view but it was very clean. AC, Microwave, blow dryer, iron,and mini fridge are in the room. Bed was comfy and spacious. Walking distance to the zoo. Lobby even has treats for you and a place to refill your water bottles. We were also able to print out our flight tickets in the lobby. Nothing but positive words for this hotel!

The Stay Hotel Waikiki is not a five star hotel but it is a solid place for a solo traveler or a couple. It’s a great place to sleep and store your stuff. It’s not s resort. The staff was extremely friendly and professional. This is an older building that’s well maintained. Complimentary newspaper, WiFi, computer usage in the lobby and free clothing washer and dryer are a nice touch.

I enjoyed my stay at the Stay Hotel Waikiki. Staff was very friendly, and the room exceeded my expectations. Five minute walk to the beach, and tons of restaurants in the area near by. I definitely will be choosing Stay Hotel again as my destination spot when I’m in Hawai’i in the near future.

If you care only about clean sheets, comfortable bed and a good shower and clean rooms this is the hotel at the right price. A block away from Waikiki, east walking distance to the Royal Hawaiian center. Staff are very pleasant.

Easy walk to the beach, stores, restaurants. The hotel also provides flotation devices and beach towels to take on the beach. Staff is extremely friendly too. Stay Hotel has my highest recommendation.

Stayed here for my 33rd birthday with my wife, the stay was amazing thanks to the staff. Front desk was always ready for any request with a smile even while on the phone multi tasking answered all questions promptly. Even the maids we're nice and made sure we had everything and said aloha everday/night. Also saw there maintenance guy he was on point. Room was great if you have trouble keeping your room cool just close the bathroom door trust me it'll get ice cold, and turn the a/c to cool from power saver. Room I thought was in good condition for how many people they have to move through these rooms. I got great sleep, beds could be a tad better but left me rested no issues. Free coffee in lobby is good stuff and they have lots of free beach gear for use during your stay. Close to the beach and everything else. Some decent views from top floor. Great pricing. Abc store next door. Parking was easy and convenient. I see other's complaining about parking but here there's no 20 minute wait to get your car from a nearby parking garage so take that into consideration. Just walk down and out you go simple. Thanks Stay Hotel Waikiki maybe I'll see ya next year. Thanks again to the awesome staff, people don't realize how much crap these people have to put up with on the daily I think everyone should have to work a hotel graveyard shift once in there lives to see. And they still smile and say aloha. Keep up the good work.

I didnt need a big room anyways so for the price, I think the room is perfect. It was clean and we had a pleasant experience with the staff. I arrived about an hour before check-in began, but they were able to allow me to check-in early which was honestly awesome!!

I came across this little gem from tickets @ work. I loved the location, right behind the Hyatt. I loved that it was literally a block from the beach. I did not like that it was situated right next to an apartment complex. But they had coffee in the lobby around the clock. There is a night club on the ground floor. The noise did not reach my room, though. Overall, not bad for a solo trip to just get away. The property seemed a bit dated, like it was an apartment previously.

Well when I reached the hotel I have the expectation of it being Gud and classic but once I checked in and went to my room I see the room is very small just one bed and one table with basic facilities like small fridge,tv,microwave is present but no space as such in the room for the amount u are paying you can get much better deal in some different hotel.I stayed here for 9 days in which I find few things that needs to be improved:-1) Curtains are broken and dirty which got replaced after many request in 5 days.2) Iron box is not working which they got replaced.3) There are very few slots to put in for charging for which u have to struggle.4) bathroom is very small without any tub and the soaps and shampoo not provided daily.5) If u don’t hv money or change the hotel staff is not ready to help with the change they say they don’t hv any money.6) I was there for 9 days but the washing machine doesn’t work even for single day they keep on saying they will get it fixed which they didn’t.7) No shuttle facility to airport they will mention shuttle facility but actually they don’t hv any.Will recommend to stay only if you want to stay for one or two days.

The rooms are very small, staff are friendly but has no extra fasciitis May be you get what you paid for If you want a place only to sleep, this place is okIt’s only advantage is closer to the beach and shopping area and very friendly staff

This hotel has a few downsides. It is a bit outdated, the tv is small, and the bathroom is very small. it’s a very basic hotel. However the staff is very friendly and it is about a half a block away from the beach. They provide complementary beach towels and have a karaoke bar right inside the building. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean.

Wonderful location for Stay Hotel but lacking in so many other areas. The wifi never worked in my room while I was there. Soap dispensers in shower were virtually empty the entire time I was there. To top it off the maid walked into my room at 7AM on my last day while I was still sleeping.

This place is actually quite run down. Only saving grace was the stuff on the front desk which was friendly and the location is fantastic.For the rest the place is not worth half the money they charge. Would not recommend to stay there.

The staff were really lovely, and the room was very nice and clean. It’s in a great location. The only disadvantage was the wifi didn’t work up on floor 6. This review is not long enough to submit without this unnecessary annoying sentence.

This is a very nice, cost effective hotel in the heart of everything. Its environment is clean and fresh. The staff members are friendly,supportive and helpful. I really enjoyed my STAY ...get it ... pun intended.

I stayed in this basic low-rise hotel a couple of summers ago and found it quite suitable for a few nights, clean, comfortable, nice staff. So, with a few days layover in beautiful Honolulu again, with my wife this time, we booked the Stay Hotel Waikiki again. Up front I’ll tell you this is not the swanky multi-storey Hotel in which many visitors to Waikiki are staying. But, it did not cost us anywhere near that of the big brand names in the neighbourhood. It is located only one block away from the beach and nearly centred on the popular strip. So, there are many restaurants, shopping and assorted activities within an easy walk. The zoo is about 10 minutes away, Diamond Head Park is about a 45 minute walk. We arrived on an early flight and the ladies at the front desk checked us into a room right away. The rooms of this 8 floor building are easily accessed by elevator or 2 wide stairways. Our room was plenty big for the two of us, with a comfy bed, clean sheets, a cold fridge and a tv with plenty of channels. The bathroom had a step-in shower stall, no tub. There is a comfy lounge area near reception, with free coffee machines, an ATM and water cooler. The locally popular Wang Chung bar is there too and is a lot of fun. With engaging bar staff, fun and friendly people filling the small space, a dance floor and ’pass the mike’ karaoke this is a fave spot of mine in Waikiki. Cocktails and local beers are well priced and promptly served with a smile. At checkout we needed our luggage kept for a few hours, which the ladies at the front desk happily obliged. When we returned to pick them up, Rence recognized us right away and was already on her way to retrieve them.To sum up, I recommend the Stay for its great value and personable staff for a comfortable stay in Waikiki.

An austere, budget hotel with no amenities to speak of and limited on-site parking. It is a smaller and older hotel, a relic of old Waikiki now surrounded by huge, high-end, modern, brand name hotels. The street noise can be loud as the windows are open to outside. Background noise does not bother me. However, one does not spend much time in the hotel and it is 1 block away from the beach, and surrounded by eateries and the main shopping area. Definitely worth it if you are looking to save your money for the food and shopping.

I booked here without doing my research so I guess I’m to blame. The main reason that it is 2 stars instead of 1 is the location. It’s an amazing location. The room: super disappointing. Got in and there are two twin bed practically on the floor. Such small rooms. It’s a bed and a bathroom. That’s it. No room to do anything at all. Go to bed or bathroom. Old rooms. Wall is concrete. Area surrounding is loud. Next to apartments within touching distance so you can hear all the nonsense. Makes it hard to sleep. My bathroom shower knob fell off as I touched it. Toilet paper is prob the cheapest they can find. Beds are super basic. The hotel charges an amenity fee. One amenity is the WiFi however in my room my laptop could barely get 1 bar of signal and kept dropping it so I just tethered from my phone. The other amenities are pretty stupid honestly. Not worth $15/day. It’s just a hidden fee they use to gain back the discounted room rate. THERE IS NO POOL OR HOT TUB. Most disappointing thing here. I kept getting kicked out of neighboring pools due to me picking the only hotel without one. Overall I’d never stay here again. I thought it was a joke when I went in my room. Location is great but that’s it. So if you’re expecting the worst but a convenient walk, go for it

Well located right next to Waikiki beach. Rooms are dated, but well maintained. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Multiple ABC Stores within walking distance. Be sure to check out the karaoke lounge in the back of the hotel.

Hotel was horrible. There was a musky smell to the room, the television wasnt working. Spoke to Kimberly at the front desk said she would have to have maintenancev look at it the next day but we wouldnt be able to get us before we checked out and the best she could do was refund us $5.00. I thought that was totally ridiculous. The room had drapes stringed together literally by a string. Totally uncomfortable. Do Not Attempt To Stay at Stay Hotel Waikiki

My family decided to stay here based on good reviews and photos .. All false room outdated, showers links .. tv didn’t work. Front desk wasn’t helpful just keep apologize and change a fee for amenities .. stay away from this hotel poor customer service

My husband and I stayed here for 5 days. Location was a block away from the beach—which was great. There was free Keurig coffee in the lobby. The staff was friendly. HOWEVER...the hotel was located right behind the Hyatt hotel—so every morning you can hear the loud trucks beeping and honking making their deliveries. The windows of the rooms were “slatted” windows which did not completely seal the rooms, hence, we heard all the noises coming from the street below. ALSO, the air conditioning was just a small window unit—not enough to cool the room at all. The rooms were very tiny and needed a lot of renovations. The photos on booking sites are very photoshopped and misleading. The only thing that kept us happy was the thought that we are in Hawaii—Let’s make the best of this.

These were the following negatives:The Aircon was at head level while laying on the bed, so it blew straight into your face and as it was hot you needed the Aircon on 24/7, Aircon was also very noisey. We got moved to another room and although the aircon was at the other end to the bed it was still very noisey.No WiFi in rooms.No chairs on balcony.The rooms were old and dated.Bed was falling apart.No coffee/tea facilities in room.No toaster, kettle, crockery or cutlery.Only one curtain was blockout so morning sun beat through.Couldn’t close window louvers up so you could gear noise all night (7th floor).The only positives:Friendly staffGood locationAllowed us early checkin.

Good location but slept poorly because of noise. The air conditioner did not refrigerate, but only the fan worked. Even though we were in Honolulu during wet season it is still humid and the room heats up on just the fan setting.

We had a wonderful stay at the Stay hotel while on our vacation. It was great being able to get into a room with a balcony even after we checked in and stayed a night. I love the free washing on site, I would just recommend having another set of washer and dryer, it was hard to time it with other people with the one set. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

After reading the many reviews online, I had no idea what to expect. First, the location is amazing. Just two blocks from the beach. The bed was very comfortable. So many reviews complained about them being too low. Well, they are platform beds and are expected to be low. This is an older boutique hotel, so don’t expect the Ritz. It was clean, comfortable and located perfectly. I will stay here again for sure.

The room was perfect for my husband and I. Small and dated, but was clean and a good space for us. The hotel is in a great location right next to the beach as well as near good shopping. Parking is $45 a day at the hotel, but we opted out of this and parked at a garage behind the hotel for $30 a day. No pool or hot tub. The hotel provides on site washer and dryer and beach towels and rafts for you to use. We spent a lot of time outside exploring the island instead of hanging out at the hotel. Perfect set up for us

Good - staff were very helpful Location Cons - smoke signals are quicker than the WiFi A/C is noisy TV is on the wrong wall. Think it’s just done so the hotel can change you amenities  Coffee (both in the room and the lobby) is rubbish
user_name:
eddiehig
North West England, United Kingdom

review_body: We booked this through groupon thinking it'd be a cute place as pictured. We were horrified when we arrived and only stayed one night out of a six night reservation. Tried to get a refund from groupon and nothing. The room was absolutely disgusting. The building itself is in absolute horrible condition. Nothing is clean. The rooms are a cross between dorm and prison style. The exposed white brick, coupled with the broken bed and horrible lighting made the interior nearly unlivable. The bathroom was equally as sad but not as bad as the balcony. First, the curtains to the balcony were all completely torn up and ratty. They were strung up on some kind of industrial looking steel wire. The balcony itself was carpeted in astroturf. One side had a giant wad of cigarette butts while the other had some sort of grime and mold growing in the corner. The view was literally staring at other broken down, unoccupied apartment buildings in various states of disrepair. Please, please look through the pictures while will confirm all of this. The "hotel" is literally nothing like the ad or the pictures show it to be.We couldn't stay at the Stay Hotel. After one night we checked out and decided that even without a refund, it was worth $750 each eat the cost and get a room at the nearby Sheraton. It's worth pointing out that this was Christmas in Waikiki. Everything was booked and priced at the highest seasonal rate. The only room we found within $325/night was the Sheraton. It was standard, clean, resort room with functioning air conditioning that didn't leak onto the balcony. Even still, the Stay Hotel for that same amount of time was $450 night and had a parking fee per night of $45 compared to the Sheraton's $35. Things were so awful we just ate the cost and left so we could enjoy the vacation which we'd spent months planning.

Enjoying your time here in the islands can be interesting,but being a local is even better. The experience was very interesting. Came to a meeting and the people and the staff is very accommodating and respectful. Although I am a local, finding that one place to relax and rewind can be hard, the Stay's lobby is a great place to unwind and being able to have it next to a (gay) bar is even better!...Did I mention FREE COFFEE!!!!

The room was the size of a jail cell. The bed was just a mattress on a frame. Glad we only stayed one night. Room had a very musty smell. The only good thing was unlimited Keurig coffee at the front desk.

I was at the hotel with my family for a couple of days for vacation. The location is great it’s just a short walk from the beach. The hotel isn’t extravagant but it has all the necessities including beach towels which is super helpful.A con for us was that there is only one mirror in the room and that too in the bathroom, it’s pretty minor but it was just an inconvenience having to wait for us girls turn by turn to get ready. Do be aware if you’re like me and booked from hotels.com or expedia the hotel charges a $15 fee on top of everything upon checkin which was a turn off since you pay a resort fee when booking anyways. In terms of customer service they aren’t the best at picking the phone it usually was left to the voicemail. However I would like to specifically thank Doanne and Rence for having a big part in making our stay at Stay Hotel so lovely. The two were very sweet and kind and helped us with all our questions and requests. Thank You!

Very average hotel with the marketing strategy of offering a permanent discount which we didn't work out until after booking. Reception were are let down. Parking was very expensive with 3 doors down offering a cheaper option. Won't go back.

We decided on this hotel due to its location, near the famous Waikiki beach, restaurants, activities, bus stops, all the things you need for a holiday. However, we were really disappointed. The staff were helpful, depending who was on the desk. The room was ok for size, but the carpet was grubby & looked very tired, along with the bathroom, where the tap leaked. The shower was hot, a bonus there.However, the mattress was awful, and pillows hard, on top of that the noise outside and around was so loud you would have though it was inside. The walls were thin and windows didn't seal properly and we were on the seventh floor.I am not sure if all hotel's do this, but we asked for a taxi to the hotel, and told a flat rate of $29 dollars, it cost $43, so not sure if the hotel is aware of this but always double check.

The staff were all very nice.They offered to move us to another room, but it was already day 4, so we decided not to move. The other room they showed me had more room and seemed better than the crowded room I had.Room was noisy from the bar downstairs (karaoke gay bar) & from outside noise very early in the morning.Bathroom is very small, no towel hooks, or counter space for anything.Location is perfect for the beach and activities.They did offer beach towels.Wouldn't recommend this hotel & especially not for the price.

The pictures online make the rooms look a lot more spacious than it really is. There was no mirror in our room and the washroom was very cramped. There were no hooks to hang our towels on and the sink was oddly placed underneath a glass ledge, making it hard to brush our teeth without making a mess. There was also no wifi - when asked, we were told the reception was only strong in the lobby of the hotel. I don't think the amenity fees charged per day was appropriate for the amenities that were available. Early mornings were quite noisy, due to the construction outside. On the plus side, the staff were very friendly and did a wonderful job in keeping our room clean. Coffee and little snacks were available in the lobby, and the location of the hotel was excellent. Waikiki Beach was only a few min away and convenience stores and Kings Village (great Farmer's Market) were on the same block.

I stayed at the stay hotel for 2 nights, from 20th-22nd Dec. when I arrived there was a staff’s party, but that’s not the matter they always be there, if you ever need anything. They were very friendly and helpful. The room I got was fine, worth the paid.
