The WiFi connection was having a problem at the time, but it’s ok, and as I need to use a phone call for my tour confirmation, the girl at the front desk was trying her best to help me solve all the struggle! I totally recommended you for this hotel! :)

no chair no table notsafe door lock two beds right nextto eachother looks like a hostel over priced for room wouldnot recommend employees were a plus believe it was a small rental apartment at one time

Enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Room was clean and comforable. It was cleaned each day by staff. Front desk personel and manager were very courteous and eager to share information with us. Location is excellent with a short walk to beach.Price was reasonable. There was lots of city noise but not to overwelming. Earplugs helped. I would stay here again.

Am glad we switched to this hotel. Great location right in Waikiki which is just steps away from the shops and beach. Friendly and helpful staff at the 24-hr reception. Warm and cosy lobby area with coffee and tea available. Clean room perfect for 2 people. I like the old-fashioned louvered glass windows, dont mind the noises. Will stay again if I am in Waikiki again.

While booking our vacation, I made sure to look through reviews/pics before booking. I should’ve known that Stay’s rates were too good to be true. The pictures I saw clearly used some sort of Snapchat filter to make the rooms look nice because they definitely do not look like online! The rooms don’t have real windows, so even though we were on the 5th floor, we heard EVERYTHING outside. And since it’s right behind the huge Hyatt, there’s a lot of trucks/trash trucks that drive by. Don’t plan to sleep past 5am because it is so loud. We had the AC constantly running (bc it’s a small window unit that is terrible) and a white noise app as loud as possible and it was still extremely loud and impossible to sleep - and I have a toddler and am a heavy sleeper used to sleeping distractions! Parking is $45 which is comical for the condition of the place - it is more than the “nice hotels” nearby. We didn’t witness a murder or find rats in our bed, but the place definitely isn’t like the pictures and the noise in the rooms is crazy.

Nice and quaint hotel. Very friendly staff. In the lobby you’ll find cute hanging single chairs, couches and beach rafts. There is also a small business center, ATM and refreshments with a nice water fountain, vending machines (drinks & food) and a coffee area. I didn’t go inside but there was a karaoke bar. The room was basic but all we needed. It’s perfect for 2-3 people or 2 adults and 2 small children. I liked the fridge and microwave which is in the room. There is air conditioning available but even without it wasn’t hot. Only drawback was the noise from the street with people and buses. There is no pool or jacuzzi but you don’t need it because beautiful Waikiki beach is very close. The location is very central and near the shopping and great eateries. Parking is also available. Great affordable place to stay and save money for shopping & excursions.

Ok. It's not a 5 Star Luxury Hotel. However:Location Location Location. One block from Waikiki Beach and Luxury Row without the price. Is it old? Yes! It's original Mid Century Modern. However? They're renovating and even where they haven’t gotten on the upper floors it is very clean. The MOST comfortable bed we have ever slept in. So here's what to expect. No storage. Small bath. Lots of noise because you're right smack in the middle of the city. Easy access to TheBus. One of the best bus transits in the country. In our 10 days here we’ve been all over the island taking TheBus. We're 65 years old. If we can do this, so can you! Most of all? Aloha spirit. Always loving and welcoming. We had a couple of glitches? Courtney took care of them. Amy too. Mahalo Nui Loa! A hiki i ko mākou ho'i'ana. Aloha nui! (Thank you very much. Until we return. With great love).

This hotel is decent. The pro's - Great location, friendly staff, free laundry, includes morning beverages, wifi worked great in our room. Has a fridge and microwave. Its cleanCon's - room is old and really small. Batheroom is tiny. Amenity fee should be included in the price. For how pricy the room is, it doesn't compare to what we have back home for the same price class, but hey this is hawaii so all good.Overal - we enjoyed our stay

It's a convenient place to stay at an affordable price. The free coffee and tea was necessary after a long night on the town. The only thing we wished they had were black out curtains so the beautiful bright sun was not shining in so early in the morning.

Affordable accommodation close to Waikiki Beach. No views but comfortable stay. Hotel provided complimentary coffee, tea, snacks, fruit etc. Also has computer and wifi. This place was value for money if you want some where close to all the action without paying a ridiculous amount.

Words a difficult to discribe. The place is fantastic, the staff delightful. Service is wonderful. And I’m a hotel snob Clean, cool, close to the beach, it doesn’t get any better. The value equation and isstill alive. Stay here!!! X.O. Love,The Marcotte’s

I love Stay Hotel Waikiki. The room was adequate, clean and the bed was comfortable. A/C did it's job and I really appreciated the balcony and fridge. We were only there to sleep at night and change after going out on our daily adventures. The staff was friendly and very helpful and we really appreciated the parking space. Location is perfect, a couple minute walk to the beach and restaurants with an ABC market right next door and another on the opposite corner. I'll definitely stay there whenever I'm in Honolulu again. If you're simply looking for a good base and place to lay your head at night this is honestly the perfect hotel for you .

The bed was extremely uncomfortable. AC needs updated. We hardly slept due to protestors down the street. No need for a resort fee, definitely not a resort. The location was the only good thing here..

Great location and really well priced. If you are not fussed and just looking for a basic affordable place to stay this is the spot! It's close to the beach and has a convenient store 20m from the front door.

Hotwire Hotdeals are always a bit of aCrapshoot, but $48 for parking? Cmon! Room was clean, bed was less comfortable than I’ve experienced in a couple of years. Had microwave, refrigerator, lanai, hair dryer, bar downstairs, nice lobby, and friendly staff. Wouldn’t go again, but only cuz it was an “in a pinch and Hotwire” Choice. If you’re looking for something in the Waikiki mix, it’s great, except for the parking.

I thoroughly enjoyed my time at STAY HOTEL in Waikiki. I chose it on value & ratings. My 1st room had a small problem, the team helped with a new room without questions, all solved quickly & very happily. This is position position position, 1 block behind Waikiki beach where the DUKE statue is. All the day tours leave in the street at the rear of the Hyatt Regency. If you are looking for a reasonable decent stay at an affordable rate in a more basic appearing hotel, STAY HOTEL is for you. The room even had a fridge, a coffee tea maker with iron & board.....what more do you need

Stay hotel is in the perfect spot. It’s minute a way from Queens beach, walking distance to diamond head/ Honolulu zoo. Staff is friendly and always greet you with Aloha smile. Rooms are clean.I have stayed here a few times and each time I have enjoyed my stay. A big mahalo to the staff at the Stay hotel.

I stayed at Stay Waikiki over this past week and thought it was great! The WiFi worked well, it had AC, and the housekeeping did a great job! The rooms were simple but totally sufficient, but hey, it's Hawaii... go to the beach and get out of your room! ;DThe location was just two blocks off the beach and one block off the main drag through Waikiki. Would definitely STAY again!

I’m not the type of person to go on TripAdvisor/yelp and write a review but I feel like I needed to warn others who are traveling from the mainland, so they’re not super disappointed that their vacation is ruined. Hotel is hard to find since the decor trees are covering the sign. Hotel lobby was clean and offered coffee/hot tea. Self-park was $45 + tax/night. (Better off going to a parking garage a block over and walk to hotel) The nightmare begins when you get to the room. Rooms are very small and no mirrors besides the one in the bathroom. The AC unit in the window did not work properly. So we got switched to another room which the AC sucked even more. So both the rooms were super hot and uncomfortable. There was dried up blood on my friend’s bed. WiFi did not work, staff suggested to turn phone back on/off. Still did not work. Annoying leaky faucet in bathroom.So ladies, I highly suggest you pay the extra +$50 and book somewhere else because getting ready and will be a nightmare.Only giving it 2 stars for the super friendly staff and convenient location.

I travel frequently and this was probably the worst hotel that I have stayed in. The Stay Hotel uses jalousie windows which I did not expect. This is terrible because of the noise. The jalousie windows cannot shut completely and therefore everything that you hear on the streets can be heard in my hotel suite. When it's bedtime, it's like sleeping outside on the street. It's nearly impossible to sleep at night.The other annoyance is the LGBTQIA karaoke bar in the lobby. The music coming from the karaoke bar is very loud and the people attending the karaoke bar can be seen hanging out in the lobby of the hotel making a threatening scene. It was very intimidating and I didn't feel safe in the lobby. The suite that I stayed in didn't have a security safe. There was no desk and no office chair. There was no privacy because the window curtains could not slide all the way across and there was always a gap in between the curtains. The bathroom is seriously outdated and needs an upgrade. The towel rack in the bathroom is rusted. Overall, my vacation was ruined because of this hotel. Go look elsewhere because I know that I will never go back to this hotel.

The service was very friendly and the staff was quite knowledgeable of local amenities and restaurants. The location is phenomenal. Offered swimming toys, floating devices and beach towels. All in all very enjoyable.

Location was central, 2 mins walk to Waikiki beach which is definitely a PLUS to this hotel.We stayed for 6 nights and were allocated to 6/F and the last room. Room was clean, but very small. With a small bathroom which could barely fit 2 persons, one double bed, one small fridge, and one chair.Every morning, there is garbage car coming over and we were waken up as early as 7am every day. On top of our bed are the windows with roller blind which could barely cover the sun from outside. So we could not really sleep after sunrise... even the curtain are not well covering our room....

Would not stay here again. Pictures are nothing like it looks in person. Was told we would have a city view, we were on the third floor (of eight) and saw the next door neighbors sketchy apartments. Couldn’t even find the hotel because of how different it looked. Was here for one night and wouldn’t let us cancel the reservation so we were forced to stay or pay another $160 for a different hotel. Do not stay here - not worth it. Wouldn’t even be worth it if it was $40 a night.

It was clean & tidy. Big room. Very helpful friendly staff. It is very close to food outlets & small walk to beach { 1 block} Have already recommended it to others. Would definately  stay there again. We had access to the room earlier than told which helped as we were jet lagged.

Tiny, hole in wall hotel. The sign for the hotel was covered by overgrowth and we had to call for directions. The directions led us to a block past the hotel. It took us an hour to find it when we were on the right block of the city. It is overpriced they charged us an additional 40 some dollars a night to park our rental vehcle! The room has not been updated since the building was erected! The nicest part of the entire room was the bathroom?

I booked a room at Stay Hotel Waikiki *because* it said there was wifi in the rooms. There is not. There is only wifi in the main lobby, which can be quite loud (and fun). When I addressed this, the person at the front desk was unwilling to recognize that this was a problem for me and false advertising and kept suggesting I just use the wifi in the lobby like everyone else. I explained that I needed access to wifi in a quiet place to work and she didn't seem to understand this. So, if you're looking for a fun place, this will do. If you're in town for business, it will not.

Stayed last year was all good , stayed this year was terrible. WiFi now moved from rooms to foyer, In the foyer is a karaoke bar , So now you have loud music no air conditioning and Drunks coming out of the bar sitting next to you discussing their private lives while your trying to check emails and check you bank account, Felt like it should be either a bar or a hotel not both.last booked this 8 months in advance and request by email and phone for the same room, Told this was the best they could do , parking was 22 usd a night now 42usd a night.

The hotel is in a good location but this is about it. The parking is very expensive,45$ a night. I have stayed there last year and the parking was 20$. This was the reason I booked the same hotel. The room which was given to us was very small as well as the bathroom.I know there are bigger rooms so you might ask for one.The room was clean and we slept very well. There is a small fridge in the room. There are resort fees, about 10-15$ a day so take this into consideration when you are booking. Parking 45+ resort fees -5= another extra 60$ /night.

I would say this hotel is more around a 3.5-3.8 stars hotel. The hotel is a minute walk to the beach and is right next to several rental shops for paddle board, surf boards and more. There are toys ready for people to use in the hotel as well. You pay for what you get pretty much at this hotel. However, the WIFI coverage could be better since I couldn't access wifi at all.

My friend had a very spur of the moment stay here for less than 24 hours. The hotel was in a great location and was very close to pretty much everything we wants to do while we were there. The person at the front desk for checkin, Courtney was her name I believe, she was great! So super friendly and answered all of our questions! The room was exactly what we were looking for, straight to the point. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the Stay Hotel for 7 nights. The hotel is in a great location, one street back from the beach and close to shops and restaurants. The rooms and hotel areas are clean. When we first arrived, we were on the third floor. The noise levels seem to be amplified through the corridor between buildings and the room only has shutter windows that don't block out any noise. For three mornings in a row we were woken at 4am with truck reversing sensors, garbage trucks emptying bins and construction noises. One night we even had someone throw bottles at our room windows. We wouldn't recommend the third floor (Unless the hotel gets sealed windows, which I would highly recommend for a more comfortable stay for guests), we did ask for a room change half way through and while it seemed difficult, we ended up on the 6th floor which was a lot better, although the wifi doesn't work the higher you go. Majority of staff members are wonderful, others may need a little more customer experience training. The hotel is reasonably priced, but not the cheapest in the area. Note there is a fee of $15 per day + gst that is payable at the hotel.

It is very good 3 stars hotel. The location was perfect, walking distance to the beach. The place was clean and the service was very good. We left our luggage in the hotel storage for free, twice. We could also leave the passports and valuables in the hotel safe. The rooms are very simple, but have a TV, microwave and a fridge which was very handy. The only thing, the air conditioning system was aged and noisy like a tractor, making it almost impossible to run it at night.

What I loved most about our recent stay here was the beach accessibility. For a budget hotel, the location was really good and convenient to the beach, stores and places to eat. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The room was not of a 5-star luxury hotel, but it was pretty decent. The only issue we had was the parking. We were informed that the parking fee was $47/night. If you are lucky, you can try to find some street parking by Ala Wai Blvd, which is about a 5-10minute walk.

Although not in the first row to the famous Waikiki beach, Stay Hotel is well located right in the middle of the Waikiki area. The hotel is relatively cheap why it also seems to cater to young people who might otherwise consider a hostel. If you are two backpackers travelling together you might as well go here (and also enjoy having fresh sheets and towels!). Rooms are simple and decent. There is a karaoke bar on the lobby level which has a good long and cheap happy hour. If driving a car, I suggest not to use the hotel’s parking offer as it is much cheaper to park by the zoo (usd 1 per hour) and since it is easy to find a spot here. But in general a really good place to stay.

Should have read reviews before we booked this. Is not updated at all like it says, If in fact it Has been I’d hate to have seen it before updated!There’s no where to put anything away. A closet with 3 hangers. So your suitcase has to go on the floor where their are cockroaches crawling. There’s a tiny glass shelf above the sink that is not even installed right , it’s on an angle, so anything sat on it falls right off into the dirty sink.Towels are on a rack above the toilet, continuously falling into the toilet. So gross!They do not clean the room or change the towels. We had to go next door to ABC a buy towels to shower with.They come in and make your bed, with the same dirty sheets. We took a pic of the gross stain on the sheets day 1, day 3 was still there.After 2 days of this, I thought I would check with the front desk if they were supposed to clean the room? I was told yes and sorry they would let the cleaning lady know.Still day 4 the same 2 pieces of candy lay on the fooor in the corner (we put it there to see if they would clean it), sand all over chair still, desk still sticky from making a coffee 3 days prior.Could not make a coffee the next two days as they never replaced our coffee cups. Shower still has the same hair stuck to the wall since check in.And the resort fee?!?! Not sure what that’s all about? It’s not a resort. Far from a resort! What are we paying a resort fee for? Oh....but she did remove the dead cockroach that I asked her to do on our way out this morning.The place just disgusts me!Not sure where they got the 3 stars from?? I’d maybe give them 1!

I couldn't believe it but they charged me $45.00 for Parking over night!!! Also I don't know why there's a Resort Fee when clearly this wasn't a Resort!! I heard about this Hotel from a Coworker for he goes to the Karaoke Bar!

Staff was rude. And did not care. To cancel or reservation was agonizingly painful. They wouldn't cancel it because the reservation was booked through a site. They said all they needed was a cancellation email from the site. Then when the site was contacted, Stay Hotel Wakiki demanded a flight itinerary. For what? They wouldn't disclose. After many phone calls (they continuously hung up) to stay hotel wakiki, We got a refund.

This hotel was a great location and has a mini fridge and microwave but the noise level was way to high. The bar downstairs is incredibly loud and it can be heard very clearly from the rooms. The staff is great. It's also right next door to an apartment building without a/c so on warm nights the doors are open and you never know what you are going to see. If you stay here you might as well shut down the bar because you wont be sleeping. Finally, the wifi is terrible in the rooms. It only connected in one specific spot in the room.

The staff were awesome and very helpful. The location is amazing close to the beach and the prices are good. Spent most of my time out exploring the city felt comfortable enough to leave my stuff at the hotel. The polynesian receptionist working at the front desk was very helpful. Really enjoyed my time in waikiki. If you're like me always out exploring and only need a good place to stay for a good price..this the place for you.

The staff was great but the Hotel is god awful. DO NOT STAY HERE!! Building mangers should be fired. I was working in labs at JABSOM and I think my Hotel room had more DNA then the Lab I was working in. They put me on the top floor with 4x 5g antennas + 3x 4G antennas 8 feet above my head so I was basically staying in a microwave oven and felt like crap every night I stayed there. Super bright and noisy every night with only a POS wall AC unit that you have to huddle 2 feet in front of to have any amount of cool air. Pillows are paper thin and the bed is like a pull out bed in a normal respectable hotel.Internet was garbage couldn't even e-mail a 8MB file attachment to my customerSays comes with a breakfast but there was no breakfast to be seen.They tired to spiff up the bathroom a bit but just trying to polish a turd.

The hotel was very clean, and quiet. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again. Great location, very close to the beach. Lots to do around the area as well, bars and restaurants.

I had a wonderful time at this hotel, I highly recommend it if you're on a budget. The staff are friendly and very helpful, my room was spacious and clean. The location is excellent. I kept my luggage with the for really long time and they never complained.

I want to personally thank the Staff and Receptionist for their outstanding customer service. This has more to do with the building upkeep than customer service. Corporate executives need to be fired. The building is decrepit and dilapidated, cramped, unkempt throughout. Location in relation to the beach is amazing but the entire building needs a complete refurbishment ASAP. The price is not worth it and I want my money back for my time there. I work hard and only expect the best at any establishment. I will never come back to this hotel. Again the Staff was amazing.

In regards to my stay for the 3 days that I was here I had no t.v which I was not notified of that before I came . That was a large inconvenience.the lady at the front desk said they told me about that through email which they didn't because if they had I would of went to another hotel. The only thing that came out of me not having a TV is them waiving my amenities fee which only saved me 50 dollars . Small price giving that I had to be in a silent room all night.You should really consider bringing in better curtains I was waken up my the sun at 4 am in the morning because the curtains dont block out anything and they dont match either it looks like on one side has multiple curtains and the other said has 1 curtain .and the blinds in my room are torn that should really get fixed also makes the room like tacky.In the bathroom there was a huge roach looking type bug that really really scared me I would think the maid should of seen that if she had of done a good cleaning of the room.There is stains on the lamp buy the TV also that's pretty gross.In all on a scale of 1 to 10..10 being the best I would give my room a 4 At least I had clean white sheets and covers.I was in room 810 Thanks for reading

This place is wonderfully close to the beach,stores & restaurants. Staff very friendly & helpful, the room looked nice & the bed was comfortable. However...the rooms have no sound barrier it was like we were sleeping outdoors we could here private conversations from the apartments next door. Parting,Yelling, screaming, & 1 night fighting all night long. And even with earplugs in there was no filter. When we finally thought we would get some sleep the delivery trucks & construction noise started early in the morning. Cable went in & out and wifi was week. Will not stay again.

I stayed one night in Hawaii while on my way to Australia.The staff are so friendly here, I left my luggage with them as I was early for check in. The location is excellent, walking distance to beach, you can view it from certain rooms, there is a shopping centre near by and then a massive strip of shops that was PACKED. All kinds of restaurants nearbyI had a nice room with a soft bed. I’m deducting one point out of the review because the room I was staying in, did not have proper windows that closed which meant the noise from outside kept coming in including other guests and street noise! Very distracting

This is small, quaint hotel. It’s newly remodeled and quite nice, for the price you can’t beat it. I booked a single queen room, which is very small, but enough space for one. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, and they have a selection of beach gear for free. It’s 1 block from Waikiki and surrounded by affordable bars and eateries, all really good and less pricey than the fancier places. I wish my room had more shelving and storage, and better pillows. If you’re looking for the best price in the area and are willing to let go of some amenities, this is the place!

While I can see why the Stay wouldn't be everyone's cup of tea it was just what I needed. Stopped by to check in at 11am and while the rooms were not yet available Jennie was very sweet and accommodating. She understood that I had much to do while there and would be back late and tired. Got back about 10pm hot and exhausted, got my key card and found my room. Jennie made a point to have housekeeping put my a/c on so when I walked in was greeted with a cool blast. Heaven! Room was small but very clean and met all my needs. Clean, comfortable bed, crisp sheets, no yucky looking bedspread. Just to make sure I turned off the light and scanned with my u/v light. Nothing lit up (a very good thing). Slept like a baby that and every night following and every time I passed by the front desk was greeted warmly, lots of Aloha! I read someone was less than thrilled with the tiny 9 stall subterranean parking but after some very long days I was thrilled to see my open stall waiting for me. If you want a clean and comfy crash pad in the heart of Waikiki, stay the Stay!

One of the staff became extremely rude when I was printing out. I won't mention the name. So this is what happened. There were 2 computers for use in the lobby, and a printer in between.I was printing out my plane ticket, it didn't come out from the printer that was beside the computer, so I asked on how or where to print it. Seeing that I looked like a kid (but I'm 27) one of the receptionists screamed at me and said "Go here if you want to print!!!"(she was in front of the computer by the front desk) So I was like, okay maybe this is the way she talks, I let it pass. I went to the front desk, and as I understood her instruction, I'm gonna print it on the computer she was using. As I was about to touch the mouse of the computer, she screamed again and told me, "WHY ARE YOU TOUCHING MY COMPUTER, THIS IS MINE, YOU'RE NOT SUPPOSED TO TOUCH IT". I told her, "WELL YOU COULD SAY IT PROPERLY, YOU SHOULDN'T SCREAM AT ME CAUSE I'M A GUEST!" I got my printout and went to my room. I was crying because she was kind of a racist when she was saying that the reason was LANGUAGE BARRIER. Just because I'm Asian, it doesn't mean I couldn't speak English. It is my first time in the US, but I came from an island with English as first language. She apologized to me when my aunt confronted her for it, but this kind of incident is definitely not acceptable. I hope this won't happen again. Hello, talk about Aloha spirit!It was just one staff that made my first time experience in Hawaii really bad, but the rest of the staff were awesome.

Stay Hotel’s location in Waikiki is excellent. We loved that we were able to walk to the beach, to cafes, shopping centers, food courts etc. We are a family of 4- with 2 teenaged boys- and booked a queen room with a sofa bed. The sofa bed was comfortable enough for our sons. The room has a ref and microwave oven which is convenient for when we prefer to buy and take our meals in the room. We were able to do laundry as hotel guests have access to laundry facilities; got our morning caffeine fix courtesy of the coffee station. Other amenities like beach towels, mats, snorkels and floaters are available for guests, convenient for those with limited luggage space. The reception staff were all professional and excellent; always smiling and accommodating.

We enjoyed 2 nights here. Very helpful desk staff. Room a bit small but clean and well appointed with everything we needed. Previous reviews were mixed so I was pleasantly surprised that this hotel suited us perfectly.

Great location with helpful staff. Rooms, not fancy, but clean.Just one block off the beach with all the shopping in the world in either direction. A bit funkier than the four-star hotels all around. I'd certainly recommend it and wouldn't hesitate to come back again.

➖ Aircon is a bit loud and you can hear some noise outside➕ Amazing location! It’s less than one block from Waikiki Beach! It’s close to everything and its way better.. The staff were very helpful and friendly specially “Ricky” Free beach towels, free laundry, free coffee and tea. The room was spacious comfortable and clean, definitely go back to this hotel.

READ THIS POST!! SCAM!! this hotel is trash! Pictures not accurate. This is a youth hostel at best. Building is old and crumbling inside. Blood stains all over mattress! No curtains means you will be getting up when sun comes up. Shower and sink leaked so loud I had to use ear plugs to sleep. The window air conditioning unit was rusty and rattled like an old car. All rooms look straight into service and delivery area of the nice hotels around it that you should stay at instead. TV mounted behind dresser and facing the curtainless window. Even if the you wanted to stand in the corner of room to see the screen it would be blinded by glare. Door lock broken, had to use luggage to block door to secure room. But my favorite is the fact that you cannot sit on toilet without literally climbing over the sink. I am very skinny, if you are not then you will not be able to use the toilet. The carpets is dirty and full of stains. There is no overhead light so you have to rely only on a desk lamp at night. Room is so small you cannot walk around the bed you must crawl over it to move around the closet sized room. The normal price for single occupancy is $250, I booked last minute on hotels.com for $135 plus $15 per night resort fee... not sure what resort fee is for because there is nothing resort about this roach motel. Yes there are literally roach traps all over the room. I live in hawaii. I have traveled to all seven continents. I am not picky or hard to please but THIS IS A SCAM IN EVERY WAY!!!!

This hotel was worth every buck! Great rooms for a fair price. The beds were great and I slept like a baby. The hotel is 50 meters from the beach and right in the middle of Waikiki. We only needed a bed and a shower, so this was perfect for us. If you need more facilities, this hotel is not right for you. I’d book this one again next time I visit Honolulu.

Thanks Stay Hotel and Staff. Great Aloha Sprit. Our stay was very relaxing. Great prices and so close to the beach, restaurants shopping and much more. If you are after accomodation that’s is not so hard on your budget this is it. Cheers again to the lovely Staff xxx

Everything was better than expected for this budget hotel. Very clean, great and helpful staff, plenty of beach equipment to borrow for free. Sea views from the balcony. Did I mention the proximity to the beach? Right behind the Hyatt without the Hyatt pricetag. Wil definitely return. Thank you.

Just left the hotel and had orders barked at me by the women at the front desk. She never gave me a pen and then rudely confronting me about not signing my check out slip, all the while ignoring myself and other customers.

This Hotel is a fun little place that reminds one of old Hawaii. If you want all the amenities of a high end hotel, this is not for you. Go spend $350 bucks a night at one of the 5 stars if you've got it. The rooms are adequate and clean with enough room to sit sleep and be comfortable. The staff is really nice and checkin is easy and fast. They provide free coffee in the morning and have all the beach toys you could ever want to borrow and take to the beach. How cool is that? Oh buy the way the beach is a block away super easy walk. Great restaurants very close withing walking distance, Loco Moco, Udon, Steak and Seafood all in one of the most fun parts of Waikiki you can be in. Great Place, I would stay again and recommend it to anyone staying a couple days in Honolulu.

The only good thing about this hotel is that it was clean- but rugs smell was unbreathable AC Noisy and no curtains so the light from outside and the noise of the AC on top of your head was a nightmare. bed small and pillow super uncomfortable. bathroom extra small.we paid $150 p night. no parking-we won't come back again-

This hotel is in the perfect location, one street back from Waikiki beach - less than a 2 minute walk. Hotel staff were very welcoming and friendly as well as helpful. As we arrived very early in the morning our room was not ready for check in, however the staff were more than welcome to store our luggage so we could explore Waikiki for the day and were very helpful when we returned numerous times to retrieve things from our luggage. they also offer beach towels for free so you don't have to use your bath towels from the room and have beach toys, floaties, umbrellas etc to borrow. The rooms are spacious and clean, however this is on the budget end as far as Waikiki accommodation goes. The hotel has more of a motel feel with out door corridors to access your room. The furniture was basic and a bit rough but the bed was very comfortable - the most important feature for us. Note there is a karaoke bar downstairs, and as the rooms have louvre windows, it was a bit noisy at night. This room was ok for a one night stay and i would recommend this hotel if you are just looking for a comfortable bed for one night.

The location is super convenient, the staff is super friendly. They also have beach items that you could take on a beach day. ABC stores right around the corner. Room is really roomy. Definitely returning (:

The location is great, one short block away from Waikiki beach where one catches the Pink Trolley to go to the mall.The amenities fee covers use of washing machine and dryer and free coffee machines in lobby (and room). Room was on the small side but then only catered for one, serviced daily, aircon worked well and TV had zillions of channels. Recommended.

A perfect place to stay! The location is so convenient. Anything you need is within a five-minute walk. The hotel staff greets you with a smile and check-in is a breeze. On your way to your room you pass through an open lobby with plenty of seating. Our favorite were the relaxing swing chairs. They have cup holders so if you want to sit with your coffee and read while you wait for everyone to finish getting ready for the day you can. The first thing I noticed walking into the room was the fresh and clean smell. All the linens smelled deliciously of fresh laundry. The bed was very comfortable (I slept so soundly).The pictures on the wall give the room a tropical feel (I forgot to take pictures lol). The shower water pressure was great! We had a room that had a clear view of the ocean looking to the right. We had a larger room this time. I saw other rooms and they still meets my needs of having a clean, safe comfortable room to lay my head after a long day of play. If you are looking for fun you don’t have to go far. Wang Chung’s is right downstairs! Have a Lychee Martini. Yum! Stay Waikiki’s great location allowed us to explore so easily. Ocean, shopping, fancy restaurants and local eateries. On the same block is King’s Village. Go check out the King’s Guard museum. Also look for the Surfboard shaped plaque with local history in front of King’s Village. If you are looking for a great hotel with a chill ambience in a great location you found it! Stay Waikiki Mahalo for a lovely time.

After spending a few nights on the North Shore, we stayed one night in Honolulu before heading to the airport. We were on a tight budget this trip, but needed a hotel room for a night.This hotel was perfect. It was pretty cheap for the location (right in the middle of all the fun), and cozy. The room was smaller then expected, but we spent most of our time outside so it really wasn't a big problem. The room was clean and had a TV, fridge, and microwave. It would have been nice to have a small table in the room besides the two night stands, but again for the short stay it worked. The bar below was a bit noisy at night, but after a few drinks of our own we went right to sleep. There were beach towels available and beach toys offered. It was within walking distance to the beach, shopping and places to eat. Overall I would stay there again.

The staff was extremely nice. Spoke with you every time you walked in the door as if you were a first time customer. The location is perfect for the beach, shopping, and eating locations. This location was also close to Diamond Head as well as the Zoo. Eat was located very close to bus stops as well. I certainly would visit this location again.

Great location, less than a block from the beach. If you have a problem contact Carolyn Ncube who is the General Manager. She is one of the greatest problem solvers I have ever met. Thank you Carolyn for making our stay at your Hotel as close to home as possible.

Perfect location, friendly staff and good wifi in the reception area. However we stayed a few nights after travelling for a week and the noise from the bar on the ground floor was crazy loud, especially on karaoke night. The drunks that sprawled out on to the steps of the hotel and out on the street didn't make me feel safe walking in to the hotel after a wonderful evening in Waikiki. I stayed here four years previously and it was actually a restaurant back then - a bit disappointing to see that this had changed.The room provided everything needed for a rest and to recharge for another busy day in Waikiki and the location is convenient when booking tours as the pick up point was usually at the Hyatt directly across the road.

Staff is very friendly. Room is clean with TV, AC, free WiFi and beach towels. Very short walk up the beach and shopping district. Free Keurig coffee in the lobby :). Would highly recommend and would stay again.

I had the most wonderful service experience from the desk clerk at the Stay Hotel Waikiki. Many, Many thanks to Richard the Reservation Desk Clerk who made my stay, in an otherwise less than wonderful experience in the bug filled room,great and easy to deal with. Richard always had a smile and a pleasant word. What every request I asked of Richard, he was right there to help me. Richard made it very easy for me to experience the shopping,food service, and travel around Waikiki and enjoy my visit to Hawaii. Thank You Richard, you are wonderful.

Very nice I would definitely book here again! Hotel is clean and very welcoming they even have a karaoke bar downstairs. Also the hotel offers a washer and dryer available to use at anytime. Thank you for being great.

It's in a great location couple of blocks from the beach. Restaurants are within walking distance and Beach rental equipment is right next door. Some of the popular tours leave from right across the road. Karaoke bar in the lobby of the hotel! Rooms are nice they have balconies where you can go out and smoke from your room. Staff is also friendly and helpful!

We arrived early and our room would not be ready for a few hours, but our bag were stored we had access to a secure rest room to freshen up and offered coffee or tea. The hotel is located near to the beach, a convenience store a few metres away and bus stops to Downtown Honolulu or Ala Moana Shopping Centre or the other direction East along the coast.The staff were very welcoming and helped us with directions, bus details, sights, etc.There was a lift to our room had the normal facilities and a fridge and a microwave, a balcony. The hotel is not on a main street so we had little traffic noise to bother us. Nearby are main shopping streets with remarkable shopping opportunities and lots going on.We thought that our stay was enjoyable and for the location an excellent budget choice. There is a karaoke bar but it is well insulated so the only time we heard it was when the door opened to let someone in or out.If we visit Waikiki again we would want to Stay here

The room was ok but our bathroom could have been better. The shower was behind the bathroom door so it was difficult to use. On a Friday night it was crazy loud because there’s a bar on the first floor. And one wall is a bank of windows with only a thin curtain so at 530 in the am it’s like you’re on the sun. The location is great for a budget traveler since it’s only a block from the beach! Nice friendly and helpful staff. If not for the shower, the noise and the curtains I’d give it 5 stars.

I have seen reviews complaining about the size of the room, while it is a little on the small side, I dd not fly almost 4,000 miles to spend a lot of time in a hotel room. The room met my needs with a comfy bed, a nice sized bathroom, microwave, fridge, and a tv for settling down at night.I had clean towels every day, towels as I left for the beach and even other beach equipment if I wanted/needed it. I was able to clean my clothes and the hotel provided soap and dryer sheets so that I was not flying home with dirty laundry. There was some noise in the room, but let's be honest it's not a brand new hotel, and there is a hotel being completely renovated the next block up. But I was able to sleep just fine.Location was great for me, one block off the main street from Waikiki and one block off the street for a lot of city buses. It was easy for me to walk to the beach or hop a bus to go anywhere I wanted to in Honolulu of Oahu, I easily took the bus to the Pearl Harbor Memorial, and Hanauma Bay, and Manoa Falls. I would have like to have had the option of a late check out since m flight was leaving later in the day, but I know that is not always possible.

We stayed here for part of our 1st Anniversary Trip to the Hawaiian Islands. We got probably their smallest room. We kept hitting different pieces of furniture because the space between furniture was tiny.Pros: 1. Great Location. 2. 500 ft from public beach. 3. Many restaurants, chain and local, within easy walking distance 4. Friendly staffCons: 1. No car parking space unless you get lucky. You'll have to pay between $24-$30/day at a nearby hotel. 2. If you don't get a room high enough, you'll be staring at other apt. complex front doors/walls. 3. Again, if you're unlucky you'll get the room next to the elevator and the room will be even smaller than other rooms which we got. 4. Wifi was iffy and the TV didn't work but we didn't book this place to stay indoors. I don't recommend staying here if you have little children.

I always enjoy my stay at the Stay Hotel. And that's quite often since my job brings me to Waikiki often. Never a check-in line, have always accommodated my needs. The staff is so friendly and helpful. And most important, I always sleep soundly here which is important to me because I always arrive dog tired.Mahalo GuysDeb

This hotel is close to the beach, tour pick-up areas and food. The rooms are clean and there is WiFi access, cable TV and a daily newspaper at the front desk (I'm bringing some home for my dad to read). There is a bar downstairs (Wang Chung's) with Karaoke at night. There are public computers downstairs and Keurig coffee makers with comfortable seating areas. They also have free laundry and they give you laundry supplies.

Came here this month to celebrate one of the most special ocasiones in my life and I have tons of reasons to be grateful with this hotel. Staff were incredibly diligent, friendly, servicial, effective, customer-oriented. Is not a 5-stars hotel, but the service and attention the employees give, certainly is more than 5 stars. I even felt emotive when I had to say bye to my room because, even thought it was small, it was very clean, smelled good all the time and the view from the balcony was impressive. The location of the hotel is amazing too; 1 minute away from the beach. Thanks ‘Stay Hotel Waikiki’!-Wil

Stayed here for 3 nights. Awesome location, with less than 2 mins walking distance to the beach! How convenient is that. However the wifi was not working at all during my stay and I got to stay at the lobby for the wifi. They switched my room on my last night which I was thankful as I needed the wifi badly to check on my flights and other stuffs. Overall it was a good stay with great location and walking distance to the King’s Village, International Market Place and alot more.

The hotel staff were very friendly upon arrival, and my room was ready early which was a bonus. The rooms themselves are small and the building is older but it is clean and comfortable. However, I was on the top floor and it was quite noisy, I think it was the noise from the air conditioning units on the roof (obviously in the middle of Waikiki you expect traffic and street noise to some extent). The location is great, one block from the beach and easy walk to the shops. Beach towels and some beach equipment (umbrellas, boogie boards etc) are available to borrow too. If you are on a budget I would recommend this hotel as it is good value for money but if you can afford more then look elsewhere.

For about $100 a night in one of the the most in demand locations on earth, I am just not understanding the complaints. It's clean, it's a little basic/bare, the staff is super helpful, and they went out of their way to check us in early. You can hop on one foot to various great restaurants and an excellent and very reasonable Japanese massage place is about 100 steps to the right. A mini-fridge and good cable channels make this a solid value.I'd kill for a little half and half instead of dire coffee mate to go along with the free coffee, but that's a pretty small complaint. As with all budget places the a/c could be a tad stronger, but it's perfectly adaquate. Can't think of another gripe. We're staying right now in room 705 and have no noise complaints at all. Everyone I see staying here at the moment seems very happy to be here.

Clean room even if is quite old and nice free crib for our baby. They gave us clean beach towels, beach umbrela and more amenities for the beach. Good Hawaiian coffee and other teas in the lobby. You can do laundry for free at the hotel too. Staff was very friendly and the hotel is close to Waikiki beach.They need to replace the windows with soundproof glass and they also can replace the doors because it was very noisy especially during the first night when some neighbors were very loud. We will be back after they will replace the windows.

I'm a regular in Hawaii and staying at this hotel made me want to come home for the first time. The hotel staff are lovely and that's the only thing that is lovely about this hotel.When we walked into the lobby we found a karaoke bar which created a nightclub scene, not something we were after for our family holiday. We got up to our room and it was hot and loud. The doors aren't double paned so kiss sleep goodbye if you decide to stay in this hotel. You'll hear people yelling from the street below all night, the once you think you have caught a break the construction workers come out to play at the crack of dawn. May as well of had a jackhammer in our room it was that bad, not great for my baby who didn't sleep at all this trip! On top of that the shredded curtains don't cover the windows so you'll have the sun beaming through as soon as it comes up! My mum stayed down the hall from us and experience the same problems with her room and was living out of her suitcase as the wardrobe door was broken and couldn't open. Hotel is clean - is but so old and in desperate need of a bulldoze and renovation. Will never stay here again, I left Hawaii with a sour taste in my mouth. Considering tourism is the highest income for the economy you would think that you would invest some money into the hotel, it's not exactly a cheap stay. Very disappointed.

Place was clean and staff was helpful. Overall this hotel is just old. If I could do it again I would pay more for a nicer place. Since I was traveling solo I would have liked to have a hotel room with additional locks. My door locked automatically but there was no deadbolt or chain that I could use. I would have felt much safer with more locks. Also the room was so bright due to many windows it was hard to sleep in. If you are a poor college kid stay here....if you can afford more do it!

The hotel is so close to Waikiki beach, shops and restaurants. Kings Village host markets 4 nights of the week and is also just around the corner. Easy access to bus stops. The hotel is older but clean, with helpful staff etc. We were on the 7th floor so had great city views with a balcony on both sides of the room, we could see the beach and fireworks. We would happily stay here again.

This was one of the cheaper hotels on Waikiki, so if you book here don’t expect a lot.There are MANDATORY FEE’s which you have to pay upon arrival. So why not just include this in the price when booking? This is a DAILY Charge, (so if you stay for a week you’ll be charged nearly another $80 USD on top of whatever you paid for your room already) for coffee and towels, whether you want coffee and towels or not. Parking is $30 a night (that’s if they have room for your car, which they didn’t when we stayed there.) so over a week that’s ANOTHER $210 USD. Just keep this in mind.The staff are friendly, it’s a really close walk to Waikiki and shopping. The rooms are pretty basic.

we had to move to a different room the second day. our second room was ok. i wish they had a dresser because it is messy trying to live out of a suitcase.it was quite loud outside at night. this hotel / motel could really use a makeover.the good parts were that it was a close walk to waikiki beach. the staff was friendly. it was across the street from a car rental place, so we rented a car for the day and were able to take it back that night.we were happy to at least have a place to come back to after a fun day at the beach.i would probably stay here again if i could get a lower price.

I booked this hotel for the location between the places I wanted to go and was not disappointed. It was even better than expected. Furnishings are simple to be sure but everything you need short of a kitchen. There was a comfortable stuffed chair, but no table. As soon as I mentioned this on line, I got an email to check at the desk for a table and sure enough I had one delivered to my room the same day. As there is a refrigerator and a microwave in the room this enabled me to eat. They also have daily papers so I could do my crossword puzzles on the table. Maid service very efficient. Coffee in lobby (Koa Kcups) were excellent. Staff was so friendly and knowledgeable.The day I arrived the elevator was not working. They waived the resort fee, moved my room to a lower floor and the girl even carried up my suitcase!! (I am a senior citizen).I think the views from higher rooms are better, but since there was another elevator incident, I was glad I was on a lower floor if I had to walk. One of the girls even helped me weigh my suitcase when I was leaving..

The Stay Waikiki is a clean, moderate priced boutique hotel in an excellent location. We only needed a basic room because we were gone all day exploring, and this fit perfect! There is a convenience store at the end of the block, and a restaurant/bar inside the Stay Hotel. We appreciated the Keurig and the free laundry! Staff are fantastic!!!

I’m sorry but this hotel is very disappointing! Clearly there is a reason why the price is being dropped, word is getting around and everyone is starting to figure out how over priced and expensive this hotel is. Location is great, but if you are looking for location and quality (as this kind of price would suggest). STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!! Not worth the money if you want actually quality in room and hotel. Nothing against the friendly staff but too expensive!!! Bonus: you get woken up in the morning to trash trucks, so hope you don’t like sleeping in on vacations because that won’t happen here!!!Dirty disgusting carpets with stains...no view from room 306 besides a concrete wall...terrible, terrible, terrible.

I love Hawaii and its people! This was my third trip, but a disappointing one, because of my hotel quality. I had reservation via Hotel.com at a 2 star Stay Hotel for $161.52 per night including the resort fee, which was a junkyard, especially for its price, upkeep, and the services they provide: The room fridge, the public ice-maker were out of order, the windows and the door to balcony were impossible to open; the mattress was old and torturous; the cooler was extremely noisy and was next to the bed, blowing the cold air into my face and head, which finally made me sick. When I workup sick in the middle of the night and called the front desk repeatedly, no one was there to answer the phone. Then their only elevator stopped working and they had to wait for the part to be sent from mainland. I finally moved to a wonderful hotel, Pearl Hotel, a 4 stars hotel near International Market place, where the manager, Steve, gave me an upgrade suite that was extraordinary for $117.00 including all fees, taxes and resort fee. It is unbelievable, THANK YOU STEVE?

We have just stayed at the Stay from the 9-16th Feb and overall it was OK. Location to everything was great- however there was a lot of construction work going on and constantly car alarms going off all through the night and early hours of the morning. This wouldn’t have been an issue if there were ACTUALLY PROPER WINDOWS. That’s right- no windows. They are literally just glass slats that you normally can slide up and down to let air in so there is no protection from outside noise whatsoever. The bed was nice and comfy- however the “pillows” I use this term loosely because were like rocks. The room had a microwave which was great and a mini fridge. Bathroom we couldn’t fault except maybe a plug would have been nice so we could have used the bath facility that we pay for in the room rate and resort fee. Parking was a high of $25 a day which hardly makes it worth hiring a car. Maybe a first come first serve basis with free parking considering we paid $100 AUD in resort fees .... feel like I should be entitled to cheaper or free parking... Hotel had free coffee and water which was greatly appreciated and the staff were lovely and kind so I can’t fault them on that. All up- we paid $1300 AUD for 7 nights- my advice get an air BNB or go at a less busier time of year so you’re not paying through your teeth for a room at a decent hotel. **note we aren’t high maintenance. 22 year old and a 26 year old who gladly stay in hostels. In this case a hostel would have been better because at least we know what to expect and it’s half the price.

Location: Great! It’s a short walk from the main part of the strip.Parking: There’s a space or two in front of the hotel just to drop off and pick up. I can’t remember if the hotel itself has parking but there’s a $7 a day/night parking lot just down the road near the corner shopping centre (up the road just before the hotel itself).The Room: We got room 401. In terms of noise, it let almost everything into the room when the slatted windows were open for air. This might be remedied by asking for a room on a higher level.When we first got in (middle of the night), we realised only one (of two) of the lamps worked in the room, so the room itself was really quite dark, we pulled the lamp to the middle of the room.The room itself is spacious but there was nothing more than a bed and tv stand in the room. It could use a seat or two and a table, to eat or watch tv on.The Bathroom: Again only one light, which made the windowless room feel even smaller. But it seemed clean.Service: The front desk team were really quite nice and upbeat. They helped with queries. Only note is that they forgot to call for the airport taxi (flat rate $29) the night before, but they were able to call for a taxi on short demand ($40) (5am).Overall: Ok hotel, I wouldn’t stay here for longer than a few days (my sister and I stayed for 3 nights).

This hotel has a great location steps from the beach and a very friendly staff. Sadly the room itself felt a bit dingy and the bathroom is extremely small. The room and lobby definitely did not meet the expectations I had based on the online photos. My room was on a lower floor and the balcony door would not properly lock when I brought this to the hotels attention all they offered me was a downgraded room as an alternative. I'm pretty sure this place was a dormitory before it was turned into a hotel. This hotel is right behind a major resort and the windows are old and not insulated every morning I was woken up at 5am by loud noises from the street as well as trucks backing up to the loading dock of the resort in front. Very noisy!!! If you're looking to do Hawaii on a budget this hotel is Okay as long as you don't plan on staying in the room long but if you can afford to spend a few extra dollars I would recommend looking elsewhere.

We booked this hotel on shirt notice so we were not sure what to expect as some of the reviews were not good. From the moment we walked in we were happy with our choice. The staff were friendly and though our room was not ready, they kept our bags in a safe place so that we could go to the beach. Once our room was ready we returned to the hotel to find our fourth floor room to be great. We had a queen bed with night stands on both sides. There is no balcony but there were windows that opened by a crank. This let in air but it also let on a lot of noise. Bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. I am not so the noise didn't bother me but it did my husband. The sound of your buses and people yelling occurred all night long. The bathroom only had a small shower but it was adequate. The location of this hotel is perfect... it is directly behind the Hyatt so it is a very quick walk to Waikiki beach. There is also a store next door. We would stay here again but would bring ear plugs... overall it's a great place with the perfect location for the price!

This is one of the worst hotels I have been to....Probably slums look better...The hotel was overbooked we were moved to a condominums.. tired after 11 hrs flight..No elevators... no hot water.. do I have to say more...

We had a great stay at this hotel - the staff was courteous and helpful, and the free morning coffee was definitely a perk. It was truly nice to be so close to Waikiki beach for the price we paid (just a block over). There's a very tall hotel between the beach and hotel though, so just don't expect a beach view. Parking is very very limited - we were able to secure a spot upon check-in with one of their partner locations a block away, and there seemed to be some garages nearby. They have some beach gear that you are able to borrow for the day and bring back (although we didn't end up using any of it). The room itself (Queen) was small and basic but had everything we needed (and it's Hawaii so we weren't going to be in the hotel very much anyway). It would be nice if the fan was a little louder or there were darker curtains - sometimes we could hear people walking by the room outside or the lights were shining in. Overall a nice place for our stay, and a good value for it's location!

Friendly, helpful staff with smiling faces; comfortable basket swing chairs in lobby; coffee available all day; book exchange. Dorm-like room with twin beds; no nightstands or chairs. Good value for location.

A simple value for money hotel. Located in the best part of Waikiki, central to all restaurants, waikiki beach & shopping. Do not expect a 5 star hotel but you dont pay 5 star prices. All the staff are absolutely fantastic. They treat you like family and are helpful in every aspect. The “only” downside is that the street location is where all the buses congregate each morning so if you are a light sleeper you will be woken up. Take that away our stay can not be faulted. Plus the $$$ saved were spent at the Waikele outlets so thank you!

The room had a sink falling off the wall the door to the patio was almost impossible to open, a/c could not cool the room. So we were moved to another room and this room was just as bad, stains on the bathroom wall, stain on the shower curtain, some windows had blinds and not all the blinds work the other windows had drapes (which were actually old bed sheets so thin you could see through them), the window cranks were missing so you could not open or close the windows, no sound proofing so every noise from out side was heard in the room. The only saving grace is that Vanessa tried hard to help and they let us leave after two nights and refunded us the money we had paid through expedia. STAY AWAY from this hotel.

Stay hotel waikiki is a well established,comfortable, little hotel two blocks away from waikiki beach. It is well maintained and very decent for the price you pay. Good enough for couples or singles on a budget.

Stayed here for one night. The hotel itself is OK, I would say it's a step up from a hostel. If one does not like having shared facilities like a hostel but is on a budget, this would be the place for you. The room is a good size, the bed is comfortable, but as some other travelers have noted, there is no headboard. That’s OK, I just used one of the pillows and propped it up. The bathroom is very small but manageable if you are not fussy or only staying for a short time. Funny thing is, when I opened the bathroom door I didn’t see a shower! All I saw was a sink and toilet. Turns out the shower was just behind the door. There are no toiletries only soap and shampoo dispensers, which does not dispense that well. The sink and shower fixtures are old and could be updated but it works, if that’s all you care about. It was rather noisy in the late night with people chatting and hollering (I guess some people don’t need to sleep) in the street and then early morning with the sounds of garbage trucks etc., so bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper. Otherwise, a good place to stay as it is cheaper than most hotels in Honolulu and the best thing about the hotel is it’s very close to the beach, literally just a couple minutes walk. Like most hotels in Waikiki, the hotel charges amenities fee and this place charges ~$10 a night, which is considered cheap. As I only stayed overnight, I did not take advantage of the amenities but it included beach towels, laundry facilities, coffee/water in the lobby, computers in the lobby to use and of course the wi-fi. The hotel also has a karaoke bar if one is so inclined. Looked like a lot of fun! If you are looking for a clean and basic place to stay this is it. If you are looking for a standard hotel look and feel, this is not it. Don’t say I didn’t warn you. ; )

This hotel is a 2 star at best and that's just because of the staff and coffee in the lobby. The room was missing a night stand on the side of the bed and the bed was on a make shift platform. The shower was missing knobs and the drain plug was unusable. Felt dirty!

bed is super comfy and the room has plenty of space. the staff are fantastic - genuinely nice and super helpful. it can be a little noisy at night but i think anywhere nearby would be just as noisy. there is free coffee/tea and wifi/computers which is fantastic for last minute bookings.

Lovely boutique hotel with access to everything - beach, convenient stores, food. Free coffee, laundry, newspaper and WiFi. Car rentals are right around the corner for trips out of Waikiki too. Love the area! And happy staffs.

I have to say in Waikiki you do not get value for money. However, this hotel is very convenient to the beach. You can walk less than 5 minutes go for a swim and walk back. Staff are friendly, beds are comfy. Rooms a really old fashion and ours was super noisy. We had a suite, it was roomy but very expensive.

Good location, friendly staff,tiny bathrooms and sinks,older fixtures,noise pollution but provided earplugs.Had coffee all day long as well as purified water.We were there during the missel scare and they had a safety plan to go underground in their parking lot.

Its a great location in waikikki but a little noisy from the streeet by the trucks and dumster, delivery trucks. The rooms are small and the extra bed are very small,but for 2-3 persons it fit. There are a karokebar in the hotel that plays music late so that can be a disturbance if your rooms next to it. You have to pay the amanity fee when you are checking in at thats not included, but if you are more than 3 it may be worth it, cause you have laundry,coffe,beachtowel.We switch our room and we are pleased of the service we had. The staff are really vey friendly and helpful and we got it all right!

Great location, a block away to the beach and shops.Clean room, though needs updating esp the windows.An extra table to place toiletries in the bathroom will be useful and a full length mirror as well. Will, Evelina, Richard and Sasha are helpful and friendly.I can stay here again.

The greatest plus of this hotel is its friendly staff, making us feel in fact like guests. Located approximately 100m from the beach, where stands Duke's statue, you can ask for as many beach towels as you like when going that way. There are a selection of tea-bags at the desk, and hot water 24 hours and coffee almost as much (except when they take away the pots to clean them late at night.) An added perk are the washing and drying machines for clothes which are free; they even give you the detergent and softening papers. With a serious jet-lag (which I never quite got over) I could always use the machines in the middle of the night while all others slept.While the rooms are clean, the unfortunate downside of the hotel is the noise and minimal furniture. Alongside the tea-bags is a bowl of free earplugs, which says much more than words can tell. There is a constant noise of machinery, probably the air-conditioners all around from the hotel and surrounding buildings, which the jealousy windows let in freely. Being particularly sensitive to noise,I slept with my noise-cancelling earphones. Also, it is located just behind the Hyatt, across from the parking lot. Corner rooms get the noise of the street and the arrival of all the tourist buses which beep, leave their motors on and let out noisy groups. The other downside is the furnishings: there are no drawers in any of the rooms that I saw. Some rooms have nothing more than a closet and a bed, with no chair, table or even a night stand for a cup of tea or for your glasses or morning medecine. On the other hand, there are better appointed rooms with all these pieces of furniture, but still no drawers for underwear.Electronically, the wifi is imperfect and works better in some rooms than others and the same is true for the telephones. One room had a telephone that could not receive calls but could only call out. The answer as to furniture and electronics is that it is an old hotel and they have asked head office to take care of these things, but it was obviously not to be done during our stay.In conclusion, if you are sensitive to noise this hotel is not for you. But if you are on a tight budget (in which case I wonder what you are doing in Honolulu which is generally quite expensive) and have no difficulties with ambient noise, this would be a good choice.

I'll start this review with something positive. This hotel is in a great location. It sits immediately behind the Hyatt which centers on Waikiki Beach in front of the Duke statue. As for the rest of it, I think the proprietor of this hotel is really missing the opportunity to make this a great place. One immediately knows what the standard of a room will be when walking into the lobby. The lobby is typically the most well maintained and updated area of a hotel, so I knew we were in trouble with the room before even setting foot in it. And boy - did their photographer earn his/her money? The pictures on the Internet were very deceiving. The room was very dated and dingy. The bathroom is tiny and just awful for a hotel in this area. The room slept 4 but when the second bed is a fold-out futon, it's really 3. The noise in the morning is unbearable. We experienced a lot of banging and what sounded like trash trucks going to work at around 6am. They have an amenity fee for using their beach towels and a Keurig coffee maker in their lobby. For $25.00, the parking is first come, first serve for only a handful of spaces. To be fair, that's the case in a lot of places, but it certainly doesn't help Stay's cause. In any case, you're likely to be on a waiting list for that parking and as a result, you'll need to park two blocks away in another $25.00/day public lot. But if that public lot is out of spaces too, you're S.O.L. In short, spend the extra money or walk a little further and "STAY" (pun intended) in another hotel till the owners of this place can catch up with other boutique hotels in Waikiki.

good hotel in the center personel cordiallyfree thea or coffe or water in the lobby free wifi littlebit no wery speed the room large whit the lcd screen and frigobar coffe thea and air conditioner.. negetive side is in the room wery wery noise wait the windovs are open glass the restrooms are little but ave dry hairy

This place had an ideal location - close to the beach and great restaurants and shops. I was also able to catch my transportation for excursions right outside the door. It was good for just a place to sleep and not hang out. When I arrived, I cleaned dust off of the ceiling and around the baseboards. The air conditioning was quite loud, but the bed was comfortable.

Spend the extra money and stay elsewhere. Whatever price you pay online, you’ll be charged an extra $10 PER DAY as an “amenity fee”, to include such luxuries as crappy wifi, barely functional cable, and a 24 front desk. Be aware, this is a “motel style” hotel, with doors opening directly outside. Also, don’t plan on getting a lot of sleep. The windows don’t close completely, so you’ll hear all the joyous noises of the street to keep you company all night. And don’t even think about trying to cram more than one person in a room.

Overall the staff were very friendly and the hotel itself was an okay place to stay.However, the windows are absolutely terrible, some were broken and it meant we could hear the busy street outside all night. There is a big bus pickup outside the hotel early in the morning and trucks come down Koa Ave in the evening.If the stays owners are going to invest in anything it should be better windows!

my stay at the hotel was wonderful, everyone working at the hotel are very great and attentive. I would like to congratulate Richard who works at the hotel, he helped me a lot when I needed to edit a video of my work, he was attentive to me that stayed out of his working hours to be able to help me with a video transfer from my cell phone to a computer. Thank you for your help and your attention. 5 thousand stars to you. I'll be back soon!

This review will be quite thorough based on my experiences at this hotel but not too wordy. I stayed here from November 30th to December 7th, 2017. I've lived on the island of Oahu for two years so I'm no stranger to astronomical prices for everythingggggg. Hotels in Hawaii are expensive, and there's now around it. I knew that when I looked for hotels and booked this one. I The listed price is $100 on average. I feel like the prices on Expedia (where I booked this hotel) were slightly misleading. You are charged $11 a day for "amenities", and this price is excluded from room's price. Also, parking is $25+ tax a day. So I was essentially paying about $140 a night for the days I needed parking. Luckily, I only needed the parking garage for 4 days. The hotel is SUPER BASIC. I needed an iron. The hotel does not provide one in the room, and the front desk did not have one either. Toilet paper is one-ply. The beds don't have headboards. The room was extremely small too. I stayed in a room with twin beds, but it was just me so no biggie. The shower is just that, only a shower. No bathtub. The shower is lowkey small. I'm 5'8", 140 pounds, and there was barely any room. One of the beds was placed right in front of the closet so I couldn't open the closet. The staff was super friendly and helpful. There's no valet, no doorman to help load and unload bags, none of that. Like I said, the hotel is super basic. I would stay here again if I were on a budget, but ONLY IF I WERE ON A BUDGET. The A/C is a window A/C as is normal in Hawaii, but it got super cold in my room so no complaints there. My only real complaint was that the sink was so small. MY GOD. It's literally just a sink, not a bathroom counter. When I washed my face in the sink, water would get all on the floor. I bought my own towels, blanket, and pillow so I can't speak on any of that, but the bed was comfy. Oh, also the wifi is free, but it sucks. I got disconnected often while on my laptop, and when I was using my phone, I would just web browse on my carrier's network about half the time. I was on the 6th floor so I wasn't disturbed by the bar downstairs or the street noise. Location is convenient. The beach is literally two blocks over. Wait, I said this wouldn't be too wordy. Oops! Also, I didn't find any roaches in my room. Yay for that. I give it three stars because it's just average. Nothing spectacular at all.

Starting with the prosFriendly staffCoffee in the lobby Good location Refrigerator and microwave in roomNeutral point It’s not spotless clean but it’s not bad. More attention to detail is needed I paid $78 a night and would not pay a cent more. ConsBed was rock hard and are low to the floor. Very small rooms. $10 per day resort fee (this place is not a resort). I assume it’s to cover the cost of the WiFi that does not work in the rooms. That was annoying and frustrating. Late night drunk karaoke an be heard from the bar downstairs (I left the fan on to help drown it out). The ac is above the bed to adjust you had to stand on the bed and stretch. Lighting is horrible. All and all I wouldn’t recommend this place for a long stay. I just wasn’t comfortable the little time that I did spend in my room.

I booked the room for a week. I stayed in the room only at night. The room is clean enough. It has a microwave oven and a fridge so you can pick your own meals from the fridge.The hotel is also very close to the beach, restaurants, and shopping malls.Yet, I believed the room I booked may not be suitable for obese people (and I am slim).One problem is that the Wi-Fi signal is not stable. I cannot find the WiFi station but the signal can be easily blocked by your body or the bed.The staff are nice.

2 night stay. The first room was bad: cramped, broken tiny sink, broken door lock, head of one bed at foot of the other, etc. Was told that other rooms were the same. Wrote complaint on Orbitz, next morning was offered a different room. This room was spacious, what would be expected at a low low end hotel. Resort fee went for beach towels, no other justification. 2 of the 3 desk staff were gracious, truly hospitable. Third was not at all.

I booked a room for myself and my son online, based on the pictures I saw. The room we got was approximately 8 x 8 foot square, smaller than the average college dorm room. Bed was a roll-up mattress laid on OSB board. Shower didn't work. When we asked for a room with either a couch or a chair, as we had a 3rd person with us, they informed us we would have to pay an "upgrade" fee, which would total $44 for 3 nights. They then charged my card an additional $40 per night. Amenities include soap and shampoo dispensers in the shower, similar to what you find in a gas station restroom. What a rip-off! I will give them credit for cleanliness.

We booked the twin room which was very very basic for a 11 night stay. After one night we checked out as it was not what we expected. Do not rely on the photos as shown on the website they look nothing like that at all! Although the twin room is their “basic” rooms we just weren’t happy with it. We came over from Australia and paying close to $2000 (AUS) I️ expected something a bit more decent. Our aircon didn’t work and it was really hot at night. The shower was tiny and had a curtain. I️ can’t complain in relation to the service with staff they were lovely. If you’re on a super cheap budget this would suit as its in a good location. Close to the beach and close to the shops. For all the Aussie travellers I️ would best describe this place similar to a hostel in Sydney’s eastern suburbs.

This was an overnight before en early-AM flight out. Very clean, and for me, very quiet; earplugs available if you face the street. A/C works well. Vending machines in lobby do not operate. Food choices nearby very limited, but room contains a microwave and refrig and a short walk gets you to a grocery store. Fancier eats at Princess Kaiulani hotel nearby or Hyatt Regency across the street. Phone did not work and front desk apparently could not fix. Free self-service laundry, detergent; a challenge to find time when staff are not using the machine, but after hours is easy. Front Desk arranged a $29 flat rate cab to airport, but AM desk folks apparently overruled that plan and called a cab which cost me $52 after tip, and required an ATM stop because driver would not take credit cards. When the pre-arranged cab came, I would have already left.

At first sight the hotel looks good. We got a room which was very noisy. From one side is a karaoke Bar and from the other there is a noisy street . No good for sleep. Also parking is very limited so you got a choice to park in other properties.Coffe and tea for free are great.

Don’t rely on the photos shown on the web site.I have just checked out after a 3 day stay. We have travelled throughout Asia, Europe and the US and this is the smallest room we have ever stayed in. Our room, and I stress our room (I have learnt that there are several different sizes available) contained twin beds, a cabinet which housed a TV, Microwave and Fridge. There was no room for a table and chairs. So no place to put your bags etc. The aircon was a small in-wall unit that was so noisy you couldn’t hear the TV while it was running. The room was clean and tidy.The bathroom was also extremely small with the shower having a curtain instead of a door.The staff were absolutely beautiful and were at all times pleasant and courteous.
