The location is very central with most places only a short walk away.My advice to anyone intending to stay at The Stay check out the room before accepting and unless they are offering a decent discount don’t accept room 509.

We recently stayed at Stay Hotel, and loved it! A perfect hotel for the budget conscious travellers. It’s in a great location in Waikiki, minutes from the beach and main streets. Easy to walk around, and find transport to other areas. The hotel/ room was spotless at all times. The best part of the hotel: the service and friendliness of the staff. They were always polite and helpful, and made the hotel feel like a home! The room was somewhat noisy in the morning with street noise - however this is Waikiki, and to be expected. You could get earplugs at the front desk if needed. This hotel is perfect for the budget conscious travellers who prefer to spend their time, and money, outside of their hotel room. Definitely will be booking here again if we are on Honolulu!

Hotel is only 2 minutes walk from the beach and is very close to food and shopping. Hotel staff is very friendly and is very keen to help you. They helped us arrange the transportation. Hotel is very clean and very reasonably priced for the budget traveler.

We needed a couple of nights on very short notice and our regular hotel was fullWe booked this through an online “pay and then find out” service We were intrigued as they were touted as a “boutique hotel”The pictures looked promising and the location seemed rightUntil we got there and found the hotel sandwiched between three very sketchy old apartment complexesFirst the good: the place was cleaner than most; linens, bedding, etc were spotless The staff was quite friendly with an “aloha” to everyone whenever you came or wentNow the bad: the residents of the aforementioned apartments were quite noisy into the small hours of the nightOur room was tiny to the point of claustrophobic, although they do have some larger rooms (and some smaller rooms, a scary proposition)Our room had a bed that was a well worn mattress on a piece of unpainted particle board which sat on an 8” high platform. Without a box spring the top of the mattress was about 16” off the floor My wife has a hip replacement and was barely able to get in and out of bed even with my helpAnd other than the toilet, the bed was the only place to sit in the room; no chair whatsoever, not even a folding oneNo dresser or side tableThe bathroom was reasonably clean but the bath gel and shampoo dispensers were empty and there was only a hand soap dispenser A call to housekeeping brought nothing but two small bars of soapThe tub was an ancient cast iron model and was DANGER slickAlthough the price seemed reasonable, when we checked in we were told the parking was full because they have three times as many rooms as parking spaces so we had to pay $30 a night to park in a public lot a half mile awayWe later found out even if you get a space in their parking it’s an extra $25 a nightWe were also hit with a $10 a night “resort fee”. Now this is a cinderblock tower with no grounds, no pool, no sauna, no spa, no amenities We were told the resort fee covered the front desk being open 24 hours, as well as the “business center” which was two computers in the lobby, the free Keurig coffee, and finally use of the pile of beach toys and beach stuff piled in a corner of the lobbyBy the time all the fees and parking and taxes etc were added on we increased the total cost by over 50%We didn’t book this place for the price; it was all we could find in the area with less than 12 hours notice; but still, you expect a certain return on your investment If you are young, a bit bohemian, and can’t afford the surrounding Marriotts and Westin’s etc this might be your cup of teaOtherwise I would keep looking

Great location a block back from main part of Waikiki Beach. Good size rooms , clean and serviced everyday. Friendly helpful staff. Only problem we had as we stayed twice here on our holiday was the room phones did not work only to front desk.

The staff was great. They were all very helpful & pleasant. 1 block from the beach. Wonderful room service. We would definitely stay there again. Thank you all for being a part of our vacation. mahaloStay hotel staff..

I stayed here recently during an overnight layover in Honolulu, wanting an economical hotel near Waikiki Beach. You really get what you pay for with this place. The rooms are not the most welcoming; there are cinder-block walls and the carpet and bathrooms are dank. The toilet paper holder fell out of the wall too. Also, be aware that the rooms face an outside hallway so it gets noisy at night with tourists returning from bars. The staff are super friendly though and there are complimentary laundry machines and detergent - so this would make a great hotel for backpackers. All in all, it's tough to complain too much because it's a budget option and the location really is terrific.

very disappointed stay hotel !!!!!Not managed staffs. Lost !! Lost!! Brand new jacket in the room. my wife hang her jacket in the closet that is almost brand new only wore coming day to Waikiki that was rainy day home area. I bought it for her special day at lululemon and she like it so hang it in closet making good. Next day we got rushed check the room out due to pick my family up at the airport. Then we got switch the other apartment for big family. A few days later, my wife realized left her jacket in the closet at the Stay hotel then she went to Stay hotel right away asked to the staffs said NO, we have no any jacket lost and found. My wife 100% surely left the jacket in the closet but they said no found. Only they say call you when they got it never call so far.

If your looking to save,this is a great place,the room's were kept clean,staff at the front desk helped us with anything we needed,with info and phoning to help us confirm our tours pickups and airport pick ups as well,within walking distance to the beach just around the corner.There is a ATM near the lift's.Free tea and coffee in the foyer also in the room.Loved all the ABC Stores on every corner they had everything we needed as well,I will worn you, get the 70+ Sunscreen or the 100 Sunscreen from there it saved us from getting burned because the 50+ wasn't quiet strong enough in Waikiki.Farmers markets three nights a week just down the road,it is budget style but if you want to keep your money to look around and go on tours this is the place. Waikiki didn't seam to sleep it's very busy day and night, full of things to see and do. Just down the end of the street is the "Aloha Trikki Tours, they are a must,had the best time,thank you Jason and Ken,these Trikki's are motorised and are a blast,Ken gave us a safety lesson before we took off by the time the tour was finished I wanted to go again,a real "Adrenalin Rush", they can move.

We stayed here for a week and decided to stay here as the last time I visited, I stayed in a similar accommodation round the corner. Loved staying here and would definitely stay here again.The rooms aren't anything fancy, if your looking for luxury then best to head elsewhere but it suited us. They don't have a kitchenette but we did get a microwave, fridge and coffee compliments in our room. The rooms are good sized rooms and can fit 4 adults and kids comfortably.The greatest advantages staying here is location. It's in the heart of Waikiki. From the beach to the shopping to restaurants, it is only a walk away from the hotel. It is also right next to one of the main pickup points for tours and adventures which is the Hyatt (right in front of stay waikiki).We were also blessed to have wonderful customer service from the ladies at the desk. It's a 24/7 desk and they are wonderful and helpful. I think the only disadvantage is if you arrive early (we flew in at 6.30am) you will need to wait till check in time which is 4pm...so best to have something planned in case you arrive early and your room isn't ready. We had to wait till about 3pm for our room to be ready so best to have something planned like shopping or lunch etc... to burn time. However they can look after your bags whilst you do that.Overall I would recomend you stay here as it's cheap and location makes it better than Some fancy hotels. Service is great and can't emphasize enough how important location is. Enjoy!

We recently spent 1 week in Waikiki to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We were greeted by smiling counter staff when we first entered the premises. We had a bit of an issue with our booking due to a third party booking it under the incorrect name. The counter staff quickly assisted to have this issue fixed and allowed us to check into our room on the second level.The weather was quite hot & humid during our time & we were grateful for the air conditioning in our room. Other room ammenities included a TV, couch, mini fridge & microwave and free wi-fi.We only felt a bit let down there was no cutlery (forks, knives, spoons) for the leftover food we would bring back from our dinners.We appreciated the free coffee and complimentary use of washing machine & dryer and also the daily room service.Wang Chung’s bar on the ground floor would always be pumping, we had dinner there one night and found the food and staff really great (the karaoke not so much lol).Location wise - Waikiki beach is just a street away which we found very handy for our booked expeditions with pick ups and drop off and the shopping.In final we would definitely return and stay at Stay Hotel and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for affordable accomodation and is not intending on spending their time in the room bar for sleep.

We arrived on Oct 26th here till November 2nd. Staff made our arrival very easy, the room is beyond what we expected the staff more than we anticipated. Very friendly, professional and courteous, LGBT Friendly with an LGBT friendly club in the lobby which really surprised us. Walking distance to beach and i do mean VERY short walking distance, parking is limited but available. We HIGHLY RECOMMEND. They even called up once we were checked in to make sure room was acceptable and to see if there was anything else they could do for us. Most of the time we have to call when checked in not here they were very professional.

I definitely have mixed feelings about this resort. Mostly it was a great place to stay.Some of the things i liked about it are:Great location: You can pretty much walk 15 minutes in any direction and end up somewhere great. The view: We were on the 8th floor so we had a great view of the mountains on one side and the beach on the other. The balcony. that was my hangout when we were not on the beach or exploringThe maids did amazing workThe little outdoor chill area in the lobby was heaven The hand sanatizer next to the elevator on each floor is inspired.What I did not like about it.I didn't know until our second last day about half of the services offered by the hotel. I only found out because I overheard the receptionist telling another new guest. Why weren't we given the walk through? Was there even a pool? we were never told. <-- This was the biggest disappointment for meThe wifi only really works in the lobby. good luck getting it to work on the 8th floor.I hate hidden fees like service fees and resort fees. Just tell me how much the total is. Anything else is misleading.Myself and several other guests had to continuously complain for several days about the coffee pods not working before anything was done about itAll in all a good place to stay aside from those pet peeves

The Hotel was in a good location and I found it quite, clean and pleasant , I consider it more than basic as it has a nice reception but small as is the pool. However, its not designed as a resort or large hotel and does not pretend to be one. The hotel is opposite the Hilton resort and close to the Ala Mona shopping centre which is almost walk-able as is the centre of Waikiki beach depending on your age/fitness. There are bus stops right out side the door. Bottom line if you want a clean hotel is a good location without all the frills then this is a great place to stay.

If you just need a place to crash, this is the place for you. Very old building even though they just renovated it, our room was clean and comfortable. Nice bed and TV. Bathroom was rather small and our shower head didn't work well. Our AC did not work, the temperature would not get cooler than 75 degrees. It seems more like an apartment building rather than a hotel. Got a nice karaoke bar downstairs. The building is next to a couple ghetto apartment buildings. There is NO parking, although you could pay for reserved parking that is about a block away behind their building. Seems sketchy back there. It is outdoor parking and someone kicked a dent into our rental. There was a footprint left.

We stayed here for one night. Very close to the beach & stores. Luzie at the reception was very helpful & gave us a lot of information on the various buses & sights. The rooms were neat & clean - no complains for 1 night. The local bus is not far & you can take it. You can take the airport shuttle for drop & pickup.

My husband and I booked a room for our honeymoon at the stay hotel waikiki. Now the plus side is that it is located near everything! It's only 2 blocks away from the beach, 5-10min walk from some good restaurants, they provide beach towels and boogie boards, there's a little bar on the first floor (non-jugdemental bar) and the staff is very friendly. Some of the bad things about it is the room is very small, but if you're going to Hawaii it shouldn't be spent in your room, the noise is crazy in the morning and somethi as at night. The Windows are not noise cancelling, we were at the 8th floor and the honking and people sounded like they were right outside our windows, I guess if you look at the Brightside you can use it as an alarm clock to get up and start your say, but don't think you will be sleeping in at all. There isn't really a view the building across the street blocks all or most of the view there's like only a small piece of ocean you can see through one window. Overall descent not the best but okay if you don't want to spend your whole time inside your room.

The room was small and air con was not great.Room had bar fridge which was great. Staff were friendly and helpful...always smiling and welcoming.Great location to everything.If you want low cost accomodation this is great.

This hotel was close to the Main Street where all the shops are, not to far away from the beach. However walking to the located at night time I didn’t feel safe or really in the hotel itself. The room was smallish good for a solo trip, but wouldn’t want to be here alone

We rented 3 rooms. 2 were fine but the 3rd was not! The one that was not fine was a room with 2 single beds. It was so small I couldn't believe it! There was almost no room around the 2 beds! When 2 people share such a room, it gets too crowded. And the bathroom was also smaller than in the other rooms we had. To make matters worse, the internet was not working most of the time in this room!The other rooms (the ones with a queen bed and a sofa bed) were a fine size. They just missed a dresser.The windows are not really noise cancelling so expect to hear the street's usual noise.We really liked the close proximity to the beach (towels provided by the hotel), the shops and the restaurants!

Stayed one night between week long accommodation on other islands. Great location (one short street back from Waikiki beach) and spotlessly clean. Service is friendly and accommodating. Bed is a very comfy, queen size, although the room is very small there's enough room for a couple of open cases - wasn't quite what we anticipated from the pictures but the service and comfort made up for it. Coffee brew machine in room, microwave and fridge is good. Bathroom is spotless and I was happy with the soap dispensers and towels. Coffee and tea downstairs in reception is nice Kona coffee, a nice surprise.Parking just off site for $25 per day. Reception couches are nice to lounge on.They offer beach towels and beach equipment (boogie boards and mats) to borrow for free. One recommendation? Ask for a higher floor as possible, busy street noise up to 2nd floor on outside rooms is very very disruptive at sleep time if this is important to you. If not. Ask for complimentary ear plugs. Although the comfy bed and great location makes up for it.

Absolutely great stay. Best value hotel. Arrived well before check in time and the lovely lady on reception who looked after everything. Room was quite basic but functional. Had everything we needed. Cannot praise the staff highly enough. Fabulous. If (and I hope we will) be in Hawaii again, would stay there.

Stayed here for 5 nights in September, basic hotel but fantastic location right across the street from Waikiki Beach. Hotel was spotless we had a room on the 6th floor. Linen changed when we wanted and a fridge in the room with good air con. Would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here for 3 nights & we were very happy with the service provided. The staff were so friendly and helpful. The room was a little tired but spotlessly clean. A great location for all amenities. We fell in love with the Kings Village at the end of the street.
user_name:
Jo S
Burton upon Trent, United Kingdom

review_body: Ok so first off I just want to say that if you book this hotel online your hotel room will NOT look like the photos that Stay Hotel has posted. Of course the photos they post will look super fancy. But overall this hotel was good! I was worried about it because some of the photos that previous guests has uploaded look pretty dingy. The room was a decent size with a queen sized bed, it was also very clean. It had a microwave and a fridge. The only thing I didn't like was that there wasn't a full size mirror but oh well that was only a minor inconvenience. Another thing I didn't really like was that they had dispensers for the soap, shampoo, and conditioner, however I called the front desk and they hooked us up with the mini bottles so yay that made me happy. Overall this hotel was very good! Thanks for the stay, Stay hotel. Oh and there's a karaoke bar right by the lobby :P OH and it's right in the middle of Waikiki which is PERFECT. Ok that's all

The hotel was very clean. They do not offer very many hotel sized lotions/shampoo/body wash so it is wise to bring your own if you need lots. There is a karaoke bar (Wang Chungs) located in the hotel on the first floor that is very fun and filled with people singing every night.

We had a great time at Stay Hotel. The room was exceptionally clean and it's in a great location, we walked everywhere from here. Above all the staff, Luzie in particular went out of their way to make sure we were happy. All the extra little things made our stay wonderful.

We usually stay in a red roof Inn style hotel. This place is vastly superior to that chain. We stayed for 12 nights and slept well every night. Our room was on the 8th floor and was quiet with no street noise despite its location about 3 minutes walk from the main road through Waikiki and the beach. The room we had was a queen bed room non smoking. It had a nice little balcony which we didn't really use as it didn't have a beach view. The bed was comfy and the bathroom clean and bright. The only possible improvement would be the air con. It was pretty noisy and didn't really cool the entire room down but it's location near the bed made sleeping cool. The price was very good but remember to factor in the resort and parking fee which are clearly stated and similar to surrounding hotels. The staff were always friendly and helpful we would stay here again.

loved it. great location. great staff. room was massive and would definitely stay again. rooms were clean and 1 min walk to beach. karoke bar at your door step which was pumping. fan-bloody-tastic.........................

Upon our arrival we were welcomed warmly by Luzie, who also called us shortly after arriving in our room to make sure everything was in order. Our room was a decent size with air-conditioning. The aircon unit was a little noisy but I appreciated the fact that it drowned out the street noise below. The facilities were clean and comfortable and we really were only there to sleep. We spent a lot of time wandering around Waikiki checking out the sites and swimming at the beach. The price was really reasonable for the accommodation we received. We will definitely stay there again if we go back to Waikiki. Thank you!

Stayed here for 9 nights. It was affordable, the room clean and the staff extremely friendly. If you want a place to sleep and clean up after a day exploring the island, this hotel is perfect. They provide beach towels at the front desk and have a small selection of beach items in the lobby. The ladies who worked the desk were very friendly and helpful. House keeping was consistent and courteous. The location was close to major streets and attractions. They have limited parking and charge $25 a night to park which was consistent with all parking in area. The location is near street parking though so it was a quick stroll to the hotel. I would stay here again in a second.

Stayed for two periods covering 7 nights around our cruise of the islands. Tidy, clean comfortable rooms, but a 'negative' was the aircons which were quite noisy. Room initially provided on second stay was quite small and TV on side wall which was awkwardly placed for comfortable viewing. It also did not have small desk/table nor any chair such as in the room of our first stay. Being that I needed such to do work on I spoke with the office staff and they helpfully arranged for us to go into a better room. Room wifi was pretty good but found using my computer in the foyer for some inexplicable reason, was poor/non-existent. Mentioned this to staff. Foyer computer and printer were great at all times. The other thing of note was that on the booking agency website we used for booking the hotel, daily breakfasts were stated as being provided. This was not the case. On looking through some of the reviews before writing this one, I see that others have raised this as well. Your website just checked still states that these are available. Could I suggest that this info be deleted as soon as possible from your website and those of booking agencies such as Expedia, Wotif, etc so as to remove negative perceptions/expectations of future clients. Mahlo

Location of this hotel is great, is aged and room we had was large. Everything works and the people who work there are friendly and extremely helpful. Short walk to beaches, bars and food places. Is priced well for this area. Big shout out to the staff who were very accommodating with us booking in early.

Where do I start. The location is great, really convenient for being central to Waikiki, but that's really where it stopped. We checked in and after filling in numerous pieces of paper were told that they only had 2 cribs instead of the 3 we spoke about on the phone the day before. They then told us we hadn't actually paid and took our card details again (we have since confirmed that we were charged when the original booking was done online and then again at the counter.). On top of that the prices quoted online did not include tax or an 'amenities fee' which we were advised is compulsory. So the price kept jumping up and up. This has been resolved quickly and courteously via email by their staff. This made us happy. The rooms were of an ok size but the bathrooms were smaller than a normal public toilet cubicle, no good if you are trying to shower children (which we were). The rooms were lit up like Christmas trees at night due to outside lighting and curtains off the wall. I woke up, saw it was light and assumed it was morning, checked my clock and it was 12.45am. We turned our air on off to try and cut the constant sound but it made no difference as the loud units from ever other room continued to drone. Being charged for parking the next morning without being advised of the twenty five dollar fee was another little surprise for when we checked out. This didn't appear to be a cheap room for the one night, they are clearly relying on the convenience factor. All in all, pretty underwhelming, the location is probably enough to get us back but we would look at other first.

It has everything you could ask for in Waikiki, even beach equipment. Rooms are clean and comfortable and the best is the people who work there. EVERYBODY smiles and helps you whenever you need. It was great!!! 100% recommentable.

This hotel is definitely not your Marriott or Hilton but it's clean and budget friendly. Staff is very helpful. I actually had a situation where I left luggage in Honolulu and had already flown to the big Island ! They assisted me with getting my luggage to me. It's an easy walk to Waikiki beach and surrounded by stores and restaurants. Me and my husband enjoyed our stay.

This wasn't a bad place, but I don't see how it is 3 stars. There isn't a pool or breakfast or a bar or anything (unless you count Wang Chung's which is attached) and the rooms are very basic. They are clean and have plenty of outlets and a good AC and a hot shower and that's all we needed, really. But I would have expected more from a '3 star hotel.' I loved the swings in the lobby and the staff were super nice!

We were staying back in Waikiki after being elsewhere on the island for one night before flying home early the next morning. The recent reviews were really worrying, however for general Waikiki prices it was very central, clean and reasonably quiet (5th floor) and exactly what we needed just for the night at an ok price. The rooms look NOTHING like the pictures on the website and were of motel not hotel standard but as I said it was clean and had what we needed. Wifi worked well, they had beach towels you could have for the day and other beach mats etc (first in first served). I wouldnt stay here for my whole holiday, unless you only intend to be in the room to sleep, but wouldn't hesitate in staying again for a short time.

Don't expect any frills with Stay Hotel. You get a room, shower, bed and a shower. The location is very good to walk to the beach. It was reasonably clean, but needs repair (leaky faucets and showers). The staff was very friendly and helpful. It'll do if you can't afford better.

I would first start off by saying the location is very convenient at stay Waikiki. The equipment they offer the guests are to use at the beach are faulty. The chairs are broken down so bad that I cut myself very bad on my leg. It caused me such a great deal of pain when I landed I went to my doctor to check it out. The staff did nothing to accommodate my pain nor did it seem like they care! There are no disclosures stating to use the equipment at your own risk, they encourage you to use it! The manager has yet to reach out to discuss the incident as well! There are also roaches in the rooms making you have to shake out your clothing daily so you don't take the with you. The rooms also don't have the greatest air conditioners, you need a shower and a 15 minute time out to cool off. They don't een have headboards in their rooms. The hotel needs a serious face lift. They are falsely advertising free breakfast with your stay, they only offer free coffee! I had a great time in Hawaii. However, I think I could have choose a better hotel. Like the Hyatt or the Outrigger, these are Phenomenal choices! The Hyatt is rated the best hotel in Fortune Magazine and it's also located close to the beach
user_name:
Tasha B
New York City, New York

review_body: Overall a nice hotel and great location. Both the rooms we stayed in were very clean and friendly staff. Great if your on a budget and not planning on staying in the room often. Downsides are both rooms we stayed in were very small, tv is located on the side wall from where the bed is and not at the end so its a bit awkward trying to watch tv comfortably, only lighting in the rooms was a bedside lamp, lack of powerpoints, and one of the rooms we stayed in the only window was above the bed which went out onto the hallway/walkway so was noisy when people walked past and couldnt have the window open without anyone seeing in. Aircon was a little noisy in both rooms but worked well to cool the room down. Wifi was not free, when we arrived and checked in we were told its an extra $10 a day to access wifi, beach towels and equipment.A suggestion would be to update the photos on your webpage and booking.com as what we saw was not anywhere near what we got.

I don't know where to start. As soon as we arrived there were people arguing with the receptionists asking for their money back and refusing to stay a day longer, we chose to ignore it and thought the guests were being dramatic but we were wrong. We had initially had booked to stay in this "hotel" for 1 week. I would say it's closer to a motel but we will let that slide as well. our first night at the hotel we were woken up in the middle of the night to our toilet exploding. Just what you need on a vacation right?The water from the toilet had flooded our entire room and had reached the beds we were sleeping on and destroyed all of our luggages. This occurred at roughly around 3 a.m. So I went downstairs to reception and told them about the situation. They were reluctant to come up and resolve the issue and told us they'll just give us a room upgrade. They did not care that our luggages were drenched in dirty sewerage water and were not fussed about the situation in the slightest bit. We were too exhausted to argue at this point therefore we accepted to move rooms and deal with the situation in the morning. This so called upgrade was from a room with a king bed and sofa (for 3 people) to a room with 2 single beds that were no bigger than the massage beds you see at a massage parlour. We had no choice but to have 2 people "sleep" or should I say lay there awkwardly on one single and The other sleep alone. Come morning time (7-8am) we headed down to reception to them trying to gain some sort of money from us as they blamed us for the toilet explosion and used the excuse of there being "too much sand in the toilet" and therefore it "being clogged" it was our first night there and we had only used to the toilet once, and hadn't even gone to the beach that day in order for sand to get into the toilet. After telling them this, they refused to listen and told us to leave the premises asap or the police would be contacted. We were all clearly very shocked and surprised so we asked them to give us our money back so we could leave. They refused to do this as well and just kept insisting that we leave or else they will call the police for harassment (because we wanted our money back) and trespassing (because we no longer wanted to stay in their "hotel"). MIKE was the name of the man at reception whom made our experience a living hell. He was the one who threatened us by attempting to call the police. He also refused to let us contact his manager as he was scared he would "lose his job" for contacting her (Erika) on July 4th as she was busy celebrating, which made it clear that the employees and management of stay hotel obviously value their own fun and leisure rather than helping and caring for the people staying at their hotel. Mike was sitting back in his chair relaxed the entire time whilst us (3 ladies) were on the verge of breaking down. He did not offer to help nor did he try to work out a solution. All he did was tell us to leave or the police will be on their way to escort us out. needless to say, we had no place to stay for an entire week because of STAY HOTEL WAIKIKI and their irresponsibility, drainage issues, lack of care and empathy and unprofessionalism & prioritising a day off rather than providing shelter for people who have paid for it.

This hotel is in a great location. Near shops, restaurants and beach. We were able to get the washing done also here and the staff are very helpful. There was a great local night market right near it where I managed to buy some gluten free slices also.

Nice e hotel, clean comfy rooms. No free breakfast but free coffee.Excellent location for beach and Diamond Head Crater.Only issue was at check in, the lady was really rude. Asked for my credit card (we'd already paid for the room) and I asked what was this for - she's said she didn't know but had to take it anyway. About 5 mins later she told it was for state taxes - very unnecessary. All other staff were friendly and helpful.WiFi didn't work in our rooms so had to go to the lobby.

A really convenient location both for local sight seeing by public transportation and for joining the day tour. The rooms are clean and tidy. We all satisfied about our stay, except sometimes the wifi signal is not good enough.

this place was just what we needed after our week long cruise around the other islands of hawaii , i think we were on the 6th floor of an 8 floor hotel so abit closer to the ground and noise but cosy enough,comes with all you need like bed,fridge coffee maker etc and very close to the beach and lots of places to eat,one thing that bugged me was the 4p.m. check in time!has balconies to take in views of surrounding hotels/apartments.very warm rooms as noisy with a/c on as a/c units are in room.

We got a nice large room that was clean and tidy. The staff give excellent customer service and were really helpful.They provide beach towels as well which saves using your own. And its only a 5 minute walk from the beach.

The room we stayed in wasn't very big but it was very clean especially the bathroom. Window airconditioning worked great just would suggest that it be moved from side of bed. Only other suggestions , add a small stand on side of bed and inform hotel guests about very limited parking/cost. My stay was nice . Staff were friendly,helpful . Overall I'd stay there again.

Small hotel very close to beach only about 2 minute walk.Room aircon was ok but a little noisy, fridge in room good to place drinks in.Helpful staff at the desk all happy to help when needed.Didn't give 5 stars due to the compulsory resort fee, it's almost racketeering what they do. I spent 3 nights at hotel and went to beach once but still get charged a daily fee?

We stayed at the Stay Hotel Waikiki in mid-May. It was only a week stay. For all the events we had to go to, it was centralized and the price is right since we didn't stay in the hotel much. We were always on the go. There are always pros and cons, the only reason why I gave them a rating of three was because my daughters room was not able to connect with their WiFi, she had brought her laptop to do homework, and also the parking garage was at a different hotel, it was two blocks down and around the corner. We had feed the meter everyday and that was costly. For the staff themselves at the hotel, they were all friendly. I would stay here again.

The moment we stepped into this establishment we got the hostel vibe. We verified with the front desk staff and they confirmed with us this is a 3-star establishment. We chose to believe and checked into our room. When we entered the room, I went straight for the light switch next to the door hoping to turn on some lights but nope, nevermind, the switch is NOT connected to any lighting in the room. In fact, the only lighting equipment in the room is a night lamp by the bed that has its own switch on the stand.With the lights on we had a good look of our 3-star hotel room. "ARE YOU KIDDING ME?" is the only thing in our head - picture motel rooms you see in some 50s American movies and that's what you get - windows open to the hall way right above your bed, air-conditioning unit right above your head, tiny bathroom (again, with window opening to the hall way) and some tv cabinet from the 50s.We would not be so furious IF we were not told that this is a 3-star hotel. The fact that this is a hostel/ 2-star motel pretending to be a 3-star hotel is what frustrated us. We feel cheated and lied to.We asked for refund (since we booked through priceline express deal) as soon as we checked in so we could book another hotel, but were told a decision couldn't be made until the next day since the manager was not on duty. Not wanting to spend extra money that we shouldn't have to, we stayed the night, despite the bright light from the corridor shining right above our head and nice noisy air conditioner above the bed.As of today, a week after we checked out, we are still waiting for an explanation from either the hotel or priceline regarding the 3-star rating policy. We feel really bad for whoever getting this hotel through the express deal hoping for a 3-star nice hotel. It is NOT what you're going to get.P.S.: Both my fiance and I travel a lot (200+ days a year) /work in the hospitality industry, so we have a reasonable understanding/expectation of star-rating.

This room was excellent. Spacious clean and comfortable Half block to start of Honolulu marathon free coffee in lobby and area to hang in hammock style chairs w a large screen tv Beach is half block away with plenty of places to eat and shop within walking distance

We stayed at Stay Hotel Waikiki in mid-June. It was the first stop on a two-week, three-island vacation for our family (mom and dad in late 40's and two sons, 17 and 19). Stay Hotel is located one block away from Waikiki Beach. The hotel is not glamorous, but was perfect for our active family. We had enough room for everyone. The beds were comfortable. The rooms were nicely appointed. And the location was fantastic. We walked to Waikiki Beach in about 30 seconds. We felt safe. We trolley-ed to Diamondhead Crater and Hamauna Bay. The Pearl Harbor tour bus picked us up right outside the front door. There were many, many shops, restaurants, and other stores within a very short and enjoyable walk. One of our favorite things was the little farmers market that sets up 3 nights per week just down the street on Koa Ave. The food was great! Overall, this hotel was great. If you are expecting Ritz Carlton, then pay the money and go stay at the Ritz Carlton. If you want a reasonably priced hotel with a great location, then consider Stay Hotel. I wish I was there right now!

Good ratio quality / price.No swimming room.Wi-Fi and A/C OK.Coffee and newspaper each morning !Noisy because works on the contiguous hotel.We stayed 6 nights and all was OK.IMPORTANT : Parking free near the river or the zoo. (Hotel = 25$/day)

I don't know why others find this hotel a problem.We stayed here for two weeks and to be honest it was by far the best place we have stayed in honolulu, this was our third visit o hawaii and we now will always book this hotel first.Big thank you to all the staff who made our stay wonderful. If you get a chance and he is not busy talk to Jimmy he is a wonderful man with a lot of local knowledge.

Booked on Wotif and turned out nothing like the photos.There was no wi fi for the whole week , the aircon was not working, there was so much light coming through the windows,spoke to the staff they did nothing about it, yes its close to beach but you should also update your photos because nothing was like the photos. Even the white lounge you have in the photos is not correct. The place is really run down and looks more like a backpackers place. I don't recommend this at all i was really dissappointed

Great location, close to waikiki beach, bars restaurants and shops. Also on the same street and bus pick up point for most tours. No bar noise but traffic noise from this room. Wifi was terrible, continuously cutting out or no connection. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Room was very noisy and dirty .. Spent 5 painful nights here lots of road noise there is a multi level car park behind and a hotel next door that is also noisy. Motor bike rentals are nearby and they comeback late. Old style A/C that you need to have on all night is VERY LOUD .. We were informed when we checked in that there would be noise from construction next door and it started at 7am everyday. The 2 staff members that checked us in had no idea of local attractions or how to get there. We asked them if there was a Hop On Hop Off bus and they said go to ABC and buy a $45 4 day pass. We did but it is only for local buses, thanks for that. Eventually we found an Expedia desk across the road at The Grand Hyatt who were very helpful and got us to all the attractions we wanted to see .. Location is the only good thing about this place as all tour buses pick up from the rear of the Hyatt Regency which is across the road. It is also a short walk to beaches and shops/restuarants

Within walking distance from beach, shops, everything. Quarter of the price of Hyatt across the street! Free laundry, beach towels, wifi! Can hear traffic, but not here much! Verandah, air con. Bed comfy, bath clean. Staff lovely. Nothing is a problem.

Full size kitchen, very close to kiddy beach, friendly staff all around. Premium coffee and tea at front desk, free luggage storage, laundry if needed and other amenities.No pool, but beach is the reason we came to Waikiki. Would stay again.

This room is by far the worst one u can hear the traffic all day buses passing by delivery truck passing by horns tooting I won't stay here again that's for sure there was also no parking we had to walk two blocks just to park our car and walk to the hotel

We stayed two nights at the "hotel" and found it to be a step about a motel. The street noise was ridiculous, evident by the fact they offer ear plugs at the front desk. I'm not sure if we over paid but I could have booked a much nicer mainstream hotel for $20 more a night. It's my fault for being cheap and deceived by the photos. Don't choose this place by the pictures trust me.I reserved two double beds and got a sofa and a double, wow. The bathroom had toilet seats that don't fit the toilet and the bathroom fixtures were from the 70's or 80's. Oh I almost forgot the tiny window are conditioning unit designed for a small room. It was totally inadequate for our size room that was nearly open air due to the impossibility to completely shut the glass "blinds". There are no see through windows they are all smoked because I'm sure they don't want you to see the run down building next door.One thing this place has going for it is the staff. They are friendly and helpful. Ps. Forget about the wifi, it's weak and not usable.
user_name:
Tri H
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: If you search for a luxury place it is not for you. But if you wish to find a good but low-cost and comfortable place for your vacation in the centre of tourist Honolulu it is precisely what you need. Everything is near this place. Beaches, shops, restaurants, shopping mall, Macy's, local market are in 2-7 minutes on foot from the hotel.

Stayed from April26-May 2nd with 3 middle age ladies . Closed to Waikiki beach , restaurants , Kings Village where they have Farmers market every other day and you can buy local food and fruits . They have a mini fridge and microwave which is convenient after buying so much local food from the market outside and directly across from Hyatt Regency which is the pick up place for most Day trips and activities for the Island. There's a Karaoke bar at the lobby mostly visited by younger crowds but was never loud or crazy . The staff are so friendly , accommodating and just have great customer service . Try going to Musubi Cafe about 2 blocks away heading to Kuhio Avenue. They have the best Musubi sushi and ready to eat Japanese dishes for an affordable price . And don't forget to pick up your Spam while there! Valued price for the Hotel , have to give it a 4* for the accommodation and definitely a 5 star for the Staff and Associates of StayHotel .

I know price is a huge factor, but I'd recommend dishing out the extra dough and upgrading from this hotel. It will effect your whole Waikiki experience. Slat windows don't drown out the "Rocky Horror Picture Show" scene from the neighbors and negate the effect of the loud AC. Internet was spotty day and night. Vending machines are "out of order" as are W/D for renters. Decent location within Waikiki is really the main advantage. All front desk staff were extremely friently and helpful. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone unless you're taking the same drugs as the neighbors.

I recently travelled here with three friends, we booked two rooms. Rooms were average to small in size but plenty big enough for what we needed. We knew the room had two single beds and that disnt bother us and actually we found the beds to be sooo comfy so we got a good nights sleep. The hotel itself is one street back from the beach- cant fault the location. We have travelled 4 times previously and stayed at the 5 star hotels on the beach which is the same price for one night as it was for seven here. The staff were so friendly and we loved that they had lilos,sunshades and chairs we could use at the beach. I dont think this hotel would be ideal for families however perfect for friends and couples travelling together. Money well spent.

Booked on Booking.com, saw the fresh, nice photos, renovated, beautiful. Checked in and it looked NOTHING like the photos.I checked Booking.com and the photos were not there anymore, they were replaced with photos of what the actual room looked like.Room was old.Bathroom was disgusting.So, we decided to check out and cancel the remaining nights, luckily the person at the front desk was very nice and did that right away for us. Ended up staying at Pacific Beach.

The hotel was in the perfect location to get to the beach and shops. Staff were friendly and everything was clean. The room was extremely small and got a bit uncomfortable for an 8 night stay. Also had a hole in the door.

My friends and I were initially happy with the service and facilities. However, to our dismay, we were woken up at around 6:00 am to the (yes literally) deafening sound of jackhammering and construction directly outside of the room. The jackhammering continued for around 3 hours until sometime after 9 am when it calmed.  I understand that the construction next door was no fault of the hotel's. However, the room was completely and utterly unusable (even to sit in it was so loud and unceasing) for those hours.  We are all college students and have been working for a long time to afford and put together this vacation. In fact, we would have been fine with the construction if we had been warned about it in on the hotels website; once again I understand the construction is not the hotel's fault but it IS their responsibility to tell their guests so we can make an informed decision.  Unfortunately, when I talked to the staff (who were very understanding and professional) all they could offer was our 10 dollar resort fee back (which covers the use of pool floaties and coffee...) The manager, Carolyn Pinho, messaged me later thanking me for the stay and asking for any feedback. However, when I wrote her a professional and calm letter informing her of our experience, she never responded. This we believe is unacceptable for the experience we received. Although we would have been very satisfied with the stay otherwise, this experience was extremely unpleasant hence the poor review. The price is tempting, but you are in Hawaii! If you want to really enjoy your vacation, I truly believe it's worth the extra few dollars to stay at a decent hotel and be able to truly enjoy and relax in Hawaii!

My girlfriend and I stayed at the stay hotel for a few days while visiting Oahu. The location is perfect as it is walking distance to everything. The room was clean for the most part although the room itself was kind of low budget. The rooms could def use some upgrades. We arrived super early and we're not able to check in right away but the staff was super friendly and happy to hold our bags for us so we could go walk around while we waited for our room to be ready. The hotel has a little bar downstairs with karaoke every night. The front desk also offers beach supplies to use on a first come basis such as masks and snorkels, rafts, beach mats etc. which is a huge plus.

I stayed there from 4/5-14/5/2017 (Rm 608)I had such a good time at this place stay there for 9 nights. Very handy to everything. My room was nice and clean. It was perfect for me as I was out for most of the day, and travelled by myself. Staff were so friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again in the future and will also recommend it to friends and families. To some of the staff I got to meet, Mike, Cody, Tiani, Maria, Lynne, and Cleaning Ladies, thank you so much for making my visit to your beautiful island so enjoyable and the best holiday I have ever had.RegardsAiga Iosefa(aka Saiaiga Mataafa)

This was a nice little hotel,looked to be recently renovated.the rooms were clean and had comfortable bed,small fridge with clean bathrooms.The staff was very helpful and welcoming.Anything you want is within walking distance and the beach is seconds away.

Rooms were nice but no desk. I had to call the HPD at about 3am for all the noise out front. Guest sitting on the hotel steps chatting and laughing. No one at the front desk during the night. It's way over priced.

I was a little nervous about staying at this motel because of some of the negative reviews. I figured, my wife and I would hardly be in the room so for the price we couldn't go wrong. This place was much better than expected. The room was small but clean, our toilette mad a odd humming noise the first night and it was a challenge to sleep, but we told the staff about it the next day and it was fixed by the time we got back to our room. The staff recommended some great places to eat, and to visit, and made sure we were comfortable in our stay, It was a little loud outside in the mornings, but that's to be expected in a large city. We even had a partial ocean view. If you're not expecting a resort type of motel, want a good price, with friendly staff, i'd highly recommend this place.

This hotel is touted as a boutique hotel. It was at best, just 'okay.' Location-wise, it's excellent; it's just a block away from the beach and so many restaurants are accessible from the hotel as well. The staff was accommodating and friendly. The rooms are plain. The bathroom in our room at least, needs updating. It also was not clean; there was hair on the tub, and a yellow powdery residue on it too. There's a convenience fee of $10, which covers coffee/tea, local newspaper, wifi). I would not stay here again and neither would I recommend it.

How to rate this hotel really depends on what you're looking for. The staff was great. The room was clean and everything worked. Very convenient location.On the other hand, the room was small and the street noise is atrocious. Due to the window design, it's hard to imagine ever being able to have a quiet night here. The room is very basic. For instance, there was no headboard and we were only allocated one washcloth. The first impression of the club downstairs was a little intimidating.Bottom line is if you're looking for a good deal near the beach this may be the place for you. Just don't set your expectations too high.

The room is clean and tidy, staff are friendly and very helpful. It is close to the beach and any tours that you want to book you can do across the road and you are picked up from there as well. Close to restaurants, bars and shopping as well. The only down side is the noise from the traffic in the morning but you get use to it.

thankyou Mike and all the staff at Stay Hotel! Mike you went out of your way to help us with a tour that we were trying to book. Love this place so close to the beach and all the shops. very clean and perfect coffee everyday. We will be back to stay at Stay. We had the best 7 nights to celebrate our 25 year anniversary! thankyou again from Mark & Priscilla x

Location of this hotel is excellent and tis one of the plus points. Complementary tea coffee is another plus. Staff - front desk are really very helpful - the third plus. Room is very basic and small but considering price aspect at the premium location it should be ok. Room and bath was clean. Wi-Fi at room is really weak (I was at 3rd floor) - I consider it to be a negative point. However, at lobby guest can access free computer.

I have no idea why people are leaving such negative reviews. We stayed for a week and couldn't have been happier with our room. This hotel is so inexpensive for its location! You are in the centre of everything and 1 block from the beach!There was a fridge and microwave in our room which we had no idea about until we walked in, so it was a nice surprise and allowed us to save some money as we went and bought some lunch meat and bread at Walmart. The 2 major bus lines are right outside your door on the streets in front and behind the hotel.We had a car for 2 days and were only able to park at the hotel for 1 of the days but that was no problem because only a 5 minute walk down the road the Banyan Hotel offered parking for $5 less than our hotel.Our only issues with this place is the windows don't block the noise from the street and the doors need a soft-close feature because people slam them and it gets annoying at 2am. Loved the free coffee feature in the lobby, but adding some fruit, granola bars and muffins would be amazing as breakfast can be quite expensive in Waikiki.They supply floaties for the ocean on a first come first serve basis so you do not have to buy one.We would definitely stay here again!People need to stop their belly aching. If you want a discounted hotel then you need to realize it doesn't come with the frills of an expensive one.P.s. Mike at the front desk is a great guy and an asset to your establishment! He was always so pleasant and helpful.Karen & Kyle

Stayed at Stay hotel for 2 nights, team could not have been more helpful, nothing was too much trouble to them, happy and cheerful all the time. Helped out with lending us an adapter when realised had wrong type with us, easy walk to beach and restaurants, buses, and shops. Very clean bathroom a little small but ok. Would stay here again.

What was advertised was not what we got. Pictures did not represent the rooms shown. Very small room. Toilet and wifi did not work. One channel on the television. The only upside was that it was clean and had complementary coffee in the morning.

Maria P and Tiani are sweetest pie and so helpful! Always smiling and willing to go the extra mile!! Thank you ladies for making my stay so comfortable and always giving me great advice about the island.Whitney and Tanya are the night crew and where helpful as well!! Whitney always has a smile on her face even at 4 am in the morning and made me a cup of coffeee! I was not expecting that! You have a wonderful staff of young ladies that always want to go the extra mile and as a manager myself I know how valuebale that is! So great job!!!Overall review of the hotel. Saed made it amazing! Very close to the beach! Rooms r a bit tiny and beds were morning the best however I was fine with it because I don't come to Hawaii to stay in ur hotel room. You do not get a view from any rooms but just go outside and u willl!!

I stayed for a week with a friend and we were pleased with this hotel. It was clean, rooms were of a good standard and staff friendly. Biggest issue was the noise! We were on the 5th floor and our room was at the very end. This meant we had an extra window on the side which in fact wasn't even a window it was some kind of plastic blind type 'window' which let in every bit of noise. We were woken up every day to the bin men outside on the street clearing the bins. 4am on our first morning we were woken up and then again at 5am and 6am so we never slept well. This would put me off staying again to be honest. But I would like to think we were just unlucky being in an end room with the extra plastic window.Bathroom needs updating too.Overall the hotel itself and the room is decent. Staff were great and free beach towels each day were helpful. The beach is literally a 30 seconds walk turn left and then right and it's right there which was perfect. Location perfect. Wifi worked well for us too.

The staff is very friendly and very helpful. I stayed on the 3rd floor and I recommend to the hotel to adjust the doors because they slam loudly. It gets very annoying. There will be some costs but its just something customers deserve. The free coffee down stairs is a good thing. I had encounters with other cleaning people and they were professional. The place is a little dated but no concerns vs cost. The inclusion of a microwave and refrigerator was great. The Wifi was free and parking is available a block away in a garage. The television selection was good also. Many enjoyed drinks and food in the lobby area as there is a place available. There is a $11 per night resort fee but that's par for Hawaii and cheap.

We had decided to do Hawaii for our 60th Birthday and as the pound had took a hit booked and pre paid for a mid range hotel. The Stay Hotel Waikiki. First impressions were good but the rooms were not as the photo had depicted but as we weren't paying a high price it was ok. Tea and Coffee were on tap 24hr staff were helpful and friendly. The trouble starts at night when we were tired and needed sleep it was near impossible. The street noise is heavy and the hotel offers no protection from it as far as I could see all the rooms had louvred windows which may as well have not been there. Work starts at 3 in the morning around the hotel so IF you manage to sleep you are up again. It cost so much to get to this beautiful island and it is a shame the lack of sleep spoiled the holidayI would in hind sight consider spending more to get a double glazed room

The Stay Hotel was a great place to stay. Not a fancy place but a perfect place. Wonderfully located and the people (Tiani and Maria) and all the others, working there are just awesome. Definitely will stay again. A real home away from home.Thank you all for your help and great service.

Small hotel Very close to beach, shopping and nightlife in Waikiki. Friendly staff and good sized clean room with fridge , coffee machine and microwave. No need for adapters as usb charging ports are within the dresser.

Stay Waikiki is perfect for those of us travelers that don't plan to lounge in our rooms all day. And why would you do that, we are in Honolulu. Firstly the staff were fantastic, helpful and friendly. The lobby has free coffee (good coffee too) and there were also water toys to take to the beach, boogie boards etc... free of charge. Also free of charge - beach towels. Yes the rooms are small but they were clean and comfortable. The location is what is amazeballs, 1 block from the beach in the middle of everything. I would stay again if I was just staying for a few days. if you want to lay in your luxury room and lanai and laze by your hotel pool then don't choose Stay - if you want amazing value for money and you are going to be out and about and use your room to sleep and shower then Stay is for you.

Firstly I want to say that the staff were great, very friendly & helpful. The location is good, if you want to be close to Waikiki Beach.Thats where the positives stop. Its more like a motel not a hotel charging 4 star rates. The rooms are small & horrible. The windows are slats, so its sounds like your sleeping in a tent. If that isn't bad enough, there is a light outside the window thats on all night. I've never seen windows in a hotel like that in my life.Another first time for me was being charged $21 per night for the wifi & cable tv, when I checked in.If you want to watch some local tv like the news, forget it. They have Direct Tv that only shows certain channels, mostly tele marketing channels.The choice is yours, I stay in hotels for a living, the heading is my opinion.

The title is the only positive thing I can say about this property. The picture on the site are not pictures of this property. The bathroom fixtures were broken and you could hear every noise outside and was awaken continually through the night. The lobby had what looked like a large shower curtain that stretched across or you would be looking at the apartment stairs next door (no wall). The Wifi was basically non existent as you could not stay on it for any length of time

We were concerned reading some of the poor reviews before leaving but were extremely relieved on arrival. The staff were pleasant. The free coffees in reception were great. The rooms were clean and of a decent size. We heard nothing of the street noise that other guests had complained about. We were on level 4 so this may have helped.The wifi in the rooms was a little spotty but that's only a minor complaint.We booked the 2 bedroom suite which was perfect for two friends traveling together. The location was the highlight. Only one street back from Waikiki Beach just behind the Hyatt. Everything was accessible and any tours we booked if not a direct pick up had their pick up point at the Hyatt. We were puzzled by some other guest's negative reviews and could only put it down to their high expectations. For what we paid the hotel by far exceeded our expectations. Loved our stay and would book again if returning to Waikiki.

The Staff is great, very polite and are there to help you in any way they can. My wife and I were on the eight floor and we enjoyed the room, the view, and the swiftness of the elevator. The morning coffee was also good. The price for the room is good, I see a lot of people complaining about the $25.00 a day fee for parking a car. Well first of all Waikiki has a big parking problem and for me if you do not want to pay the fee then don't rent a car. We rented a car and enjoyed driving the island, it's was worth the fee. The only reason why I rated the hotel a 4 instead of a five was the WI-FI, it would recycle once in the morning and once in the afternoon and I would be without WI-FI for as much as two hours after each recycle. They need to get after the contractor responsible for the WI-FI and solve this problem. The hotel is one minute from the beach and there is an ABC store (convenience store) one or two doors down.

Staff are very kindness. Room is very clean. location is perfect for The Waikiki beach. In the first floor has a vending machine. A convenience store is very near from hotel. Room-cleaner is very good at the everyday. I confidently recommend you.とても良いホテルでした。部屋も清潔でスタッフの対応も親切でした。場所もワイキキビーチまで歩いて直ぐの所にあります。次回も利用したいです。

I'm giving this 3 stars instead of 2 because I have become a hotel snob. I'm just going to list the pros and cons and you can make your own decision on whether or not this is a place you'd like to stay. Pros: cheap, for Honolulu standards. $124 on Orbitz, room only. Very small but nice lobby with pod chairs outside to sit in and relax. Free coffee in the morning. Comfortable beds, new bed linen, and soft towels. Rooms very very clean. Free wifi. In a pretty good location for food, beach and shopping. Staff very accommodating and polite. Cons: night club on the lobby floor can be loud if you are staying right above it. We had to move rooms. $10/night "resort fee". I'd hardly call this place a resort. They should up the price a few dollars instead. I was shocked at this fee. It may be on their website but I didn't see it and no reviews I read said anything about it. Supposedly its for beach towels, etc. whatever the etc is. They have a parking lot if you have a car. The fee is $25/night. Again big hotels charge for this kind of perk but really for this place? To top it off we got to the hotel late (after 10pm) and the lot was full we had to park down the street and pay $30/night. Staff said this is where they always recommend their overflow cars to park. It was within walking distance. Just around the corner. Like I said we had to change rooms. Our 6th floor room was more spacious than our 2nd floor room, but it is small. VERY SMALL. I was prepared for that. But what I was not prepared for is the fact that there was no place to put your clothes. You will basically have to live out of your suitcase. Ok for one night. Not so great for more than that. Beds were comfy, but only mattress no box spring so it's low to the floor. The room was freshly painted and as updated as it could get for being as old as it was. No place in bathroom for toiletries and the only mirror was the one above the sink in the bathroom. We had a room with an east facing window, this made the room uncomfortably hot in the morning when I was trying to get ready for the day. The curtains are not black out or even close so if the light bothers you, you'll be up early. The window unit, which they have in all rooms had trouble cooling the room. It wasn't awful but I had to sleep with no covers. Overall, you get what you pay for. Would I stay again? Probably not. Would I recommend it, that depends on whether you would choose price over space and comfort. Let me be clear about two things: this place was very, very clean and the staff excellent. Just not my cup of tea.

We spent 5 nights here. The Location was ideal but the room tired. The windows were louvred and the noise levels at night and early morning were shocking. The bathroom was old and the taps leaked. The pillows were very hard but the staff were good.

Great location. Close to lots of shopping, hotels, restaurants, bars and only 1 block from the beach. Good central location. Really helpful and friendly staff. Clean rooms. Fair price for what you get. Nothing fancy but it's good if you're on a budget but still want quality. Would stay again.

Let's get 1 thing straight! If you want 5 star...goto a 5 star hotel!!!.. sux to be you paying HUNDREDS more per night for what?... in Hawaii most travelers are out all day there is so much to do and eat!... this hotel 100m from Waikiki Beach behind the Hyatt.There are regular accomm specials at the stay for as little as $165AU a night! the 3 times i have been here the rooms are clean the aircon is thankfully noisy and drowns out street noise because morning at Waikiki starts early and the noise is the same as when i stayed at the Hyatt my 1st time! Staff are super friendly i recommend booking a day before you arrive so you can go straight to your room as check in is in the arvo and aussie flights get in in the morn..and the wait is murder! but for the price of a night..meh! Rooms cleaned every day i gave up my 4/5 star life because of this hotel as i only want a good bed to sleep in after a day of wearing my feet off! end of the day you get what you pay for... in this hubub of Waikiki a good bed and clean room is all i want and with what i saved instead of going to the other hotels pays for exploring on the other isles!

We stayed here overnight, to catch a morning plane. The top floor room, was tiny, with a small queen bed pushed against 1wall and a 12 to 18 inch space to get out the other side. Window air conditioning unit is 18 inches from the head of the bed. No chair. The building air unit rumbled and vibrated all night. Noise from the bar and street below stopped by 2am. Pleasant reception staff.

Stayed 2 weeks in February 2017. Our room was clean c/w queen bed, mini fridge, microwave, single cup coffee maker c/w free coffee each day, iron, ironing board, blow dryer. Tub/shower combo c/w shampoo and body wash supplied. Room is desperately in need of a dresser to store clothes. Basically lived out of suitcases. Had a balcony but no chairs. Beach was only 1 block away. Front desk provided beach towels as well as beach toys, umbrellas. Wifi was hit and miss - either worked great or not at all. Staff was super friendly and helpful.

I really don't understand the negative reviews about this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised with our experience! Check-in was quick and easy, and our room was spacious and clean. My only issue was the the air conditioner was right next to the bed, so the person sleeping on that side got blasted with cold air. But I just flipped around and slept the other way, no big deal! We had drinks and dinner at Wang Chung's, which was AMAZING. Definitely seems to be a big attraction for the gay community (mostly men), which was great because those are our people. We weren't at the hotel long enough to enjoy the other benefits (like free beach gear!), which was a bummer. I would stay here again without hesitation. You can tell the staff really cares, and the manager is clearly trying to make the needed improvements. She responds to every review! If you are looking for a reasonably priced and clean place to stay in Waikiki then run, don't walk to Stay Hotel!

We stayed here for 2 nights in Waikiki. It is more like a slightly higher standard of a hostel. The whole property has a hostel vibe. The rooms are very basic and the furniture is a little out of date. However it is in a good location just one block back from the beach. The staff didn't really know what they were doing and not overly helpful with any questions or concerns.Parking is $20 per night.

Our room was small. Very small. But it was clean and so close to the beach! The stops for tours are nearby as well (if they don't come directly to the hotel). Staff were friendly and helpful. Wifi was free but constantly cut out in our room - made it tricky to book things online. We did have a microwave and mini fridge, which was great! It would have been nice to have a chair or two in the room or at least on the balcony. The only place to sit was the bed. The room really didn't look anything like the photos... but if your looking for a simple place to stay that's clean with a great location, this is it!

If you are looking for hostel style accommodation then stay here. If you are after somewhere to actually get some sleep and spend a little time in the room chilling out then this is not the place. It was noisy and old. Just a query - why is the towel rack above the toilet when there is plenty of other space to mount it on the wall? Seems unhygienic! Our room keys expired the day before we checked out (not a big deal but painful), wifi doesn't work in the room - thankfully I got a t-mobile sim so my partner could use it for hotspot. The curtain on the window wouldn't actually stop the light coming in, and as we were facing another building, their light was streaming in the window with curtains shut. Hotel is in a good location but I think next time I would book a little further away for a nicer place. It wasn't cheap either.

I booked for 6 nights at this hotel due to its close proximity to the beach and its reasonable nightly rates. As I checked in, I was given the password for the internet access. When I opened the door, the room has 2 beds, no desk, no chair, no luggage rack and a tiny closet maybe 5 hangers for your clothes, I travel and do some online work during my downtime but to my surprise, no internet access in my room and was informed by front desk that it can't be accessed in the room but ONLY in the lobby due to system upgrade. Due to my work that deals with confidential info, doing it in the lobby is a big NO NO. I wish they could have told me when I checked in that the internet was not accessible in the room. Bathroom space is OK but watch out for the towel rack right above the toilet. I bumped my head on it a few times. I spoke to the front desk manager the following morning regarding my situation but prior to that, I already shopped around which hotel to move to. She understood my situation and they only charged for one night stay with no resort fee(obviously) added to it. Luckily, I scored an awesome 5 night deal from one of my favorite hotels in Waikiki for just $15 more per night with awesome amenities.Should I stay at this hotel again?YES, with these following conditions: If internet is accessible in the room If I decide not to do my work in the room due to no chair and desk (Surprisingly, first Waikiki hotel I booked with no desk and chair). If I don't need a luggage rack. If I don't mind staying in a room that reminds me of a dorm If the nightly rate is less than $135.This review is based solely on ROOM 602.

Stayed here for 10 days. The staff were very welcoming and informative. However, for the entire duration of our stay, only the wifi in the lobby worked. This was very inconvenient for us as we had to come downstairs in order to use wifi. After a few days, we gave up and bought an extra sim card with data roaming from T-mobile which cost $30. The service and internet fee from the hotel is more than $10 a day in which internet use is meant to be included. Housekeeping was lovely but the rooms were small. There is a fridge and microwave in the room and we also had a balcony. AC was very loud so we had it off for most of the time. However our room was facing the street on 7th foor and it was SO loud in the middle of the night. The windows were actually glass slits which cannot be fully closed so the sound of the cars below comes directly into the room. Also the garbage trucks come to collect at 5am every morning (I would know since we got woken up by them every day). There is free coffee in the lobby throughout the day and you can get beach towels and beach mats from reception too. Despite the hotel buildings' problems, it was in a great location being one street away from the beach and just behind the Park Hyatt. It is also across the road from where most shuttle pick customers up from Waikiki, if you were to book tours or transportation to other areas of the island. Despite the great location and staff, I would most likely not stay here again if I wanted one night of uninterrupted sleep and wifi.

I read some of the reviews of this hotel after I made the reservation. So I was a little concerned since I read some bad reviews. But was, pleasantly surprised. The staff was wonderful, it was clean, close to the beach, stores and restaurants. It does have slat windows which is wonderful for letting in the fresh air, but it also let's in noise. So the early morning garbage truck at 6 a.m. isn't pleasant if you're a light sleeper. I never used the WiFi and was told upfront it was iffy. But overall, I'd stay here again.

1. Reception staff very courteous and helpful.2. Near to areas I was interested in.3. Easy access to restaurants and eateries.4. No phone in room.5. Handicap parking limited.6. Laundry area interferes with foot traffice.

The staff at Stay Waikiki were very nice and service-minded. They gave us good tips regarding shopping and also helped us getting our luggage from the airport. Our room was neat and the beds comfortable. A big plus for its very central location.

Our stay was horrible. The Wifi simply didn't work and when we called the front desk about it they said just wait a while and if we didn't connect then they could refund our amenities. We called again the next morning when it still didn't work and they gave us a password to a different network that also didn't work. When we brought the refund up during checkout they said they had no record of us calling despite acknowledging that there wifi doesn't work... the beds are very firm and customer service terrible. Also if you liked the hand-chairs in the pictures be prepared to be disappointed. Our unit had none. Nothing about the room looks like the pictures, except that the walls were white (kind of). They claim that they are redoing their website for new pictures, and note - they are not for the better. Also, they claim they are planning on renovating the bathrooms. Please note - it is such a small space - they can't possibly make it all that much better. The whole room feels like a mix between a dirty pool change room and a one star hostel.The rooms are significantly smaller than they look, the bathroom isn't big enough to function (the toilet is under the towel rack, the door can barely clear the sink and you can only get in the shower if the bathroom door is completely closed. The bed is terribly uncomfortable. Feels like a futon mattress on a wood plank.The website says you may have a balcony on your room by request. We requested and their response was "no" with no other information or explanation.Also, there is no soundproofing and previously unbeknownst to us, there is a karaoke bar downstairs that is loud and goes late and garbage pick up starts at 6:30am. Not to mention the night noise... ugh.

Room clean and airy. Stayed one night and it was absolutely fine.Staff very friendly and helpful. Asked for an early check in and got in to room 3 hrs early. Thank you!Shops and restaurants all around great location

Stayed here with my wife for 4 nights to start off our week long honeymoon in Honolulu. We were given a room on the 4th floor which didn't have a balcony. Not a huge issue since we didn't really spend a lot of time in the room. Overall the room was OK. It was older and could use a renovation, but everything worked and it met our needs. Microwave and fridge in the room + free coffee in the lobby was a nice touch. A/c is a bit loud but kept the room at a comfortable temperatureThe best part is the location. It is right in the heart of Waikiki so you won't have to go far at all to enjoy yourself. The kings market next door is nice for some fresh, inexpensive food (try the Spanish patella!)Overall I would recommend this hotel based on value for the price. Don't be discouraged when you walk in and expect something a bit more updated... we did but ended up satisfied pretty quick.

Room was clean, very basic, pictures are deceiving. The biggest issue is how loud it was. Street noise was horrible and began at 5 am. Wouldn't stay here again. The staff at desk, however were great, the stars are for them. I only stayed 1 night so I made it work.

When I travel to Hawaii, I never like to spend much on the hotel because I'm literally never there except for sleeping. This hotel has a great front desk staff and a lost of options like mats, chairs and umbrellas you can check out and bring to the beach with you. The rooms are basic...nothing fancy. But the beds/pillows are comfy and the AC works. You're one block from the beach and the famous Duke statue. And the price is phenomenal. If you are looking for a solid option with a great price, then this is the hotel for you. If you need extra amenities...then you might want to look elsewhere. For me, this was the perfect place. AND, the Wang Chung bar is an amazing place to hang out...one of the gems of Waikiki.

We have stayed at Stay Hotel in Waikiki beach for 6 nights . The hotel has a good location, 2 steps from the beach and from the strip on Waikiki beach. A lot of stores near the hotel, very good coffee available 24 hours in the lobby, beach towel, other accessories for the beach. Some problems with the internet but great staff members who resolve the problem right away. A big plus for the staff members.They have a parking with about 14-15 places (indoor) for 25$ a night.We have booked another room for our friends visiting for one night: they had a lot of problems with the noise.. it was on the 2nd floor near the main street and the trucks and the garbage collectors start early in the morning. They didn't sleep starting 3-4 AM.

Perfectly located right by Waikiki beach . Rooms were clean, beds comfortable and staff helpful and efficient .We were a Family of six, and with the money we paid were happy with the hotel.
