What we saved by staying here instead of the more expensive hotels we were able to do lots of activities , swimming (cage) with the sharks ,scuba diving, snorkeling, surfing lessons, trip around island. Rooms needed Chester draws to put clothes in and internet was slow in rooms with laptop but good with phones and computers in lobby were faster.

1. Front desk staff weren't friendly or helpful. One staff member could not read the local bus timetable or even point us in the direction of the closest supermarket. 2. The rooms are nothing like the photos at all. 3. There were no windows, only shutters which meant that the room was constantly noisy and it was impossible to sleep (we were woken up at least 5 times each night). 4. No furniture to put any of our things. We were left to put everything on the floor with only one bed side table that you couldn't even reach from the bed. 5. Bathroom was dirty and small. 6. Wifi was slow and constantly cut out Our 1 star is given for the location, which was close to the beach and all of the attractions.

The hotel room is not like the pic. Needs updating and minor repairs. Staff was nice. Rm 808 has very loud. Sounds penetrated the wall. Not sure what is was and we were not near an elevator. The room was clean even though it lack in appearances. The shower head needed cleaning from hard water. Our flight got in late and we were leaving out early the next day, otherwise this would not have made the cut. Definitely a 2 star. WIFI was awful and down most of our stay.

To those of you who have submitted bad reviews, I regret not reading them sooner. I experienced all 5 of the major complaints from previous reviewers. First, you will not be acquiring that room you think you paid for when you book the hotel, the reality does not imitate the pictures on the website. When I asked the staff, they explained that they haven't had an opportunity to photograph their existing rooms to upload on the website, and yet they had time to do so for their renovated rooms. I didn't get the opportunity to photograph my first room, so I'm using another TripAdvisor's photo (@tamarab890). You can see below, the first picture is the room I thought I booked, the second is the room we were booked in for, and the third is the room we actually stayed in after some concerns we shared with the staff. Secondly, I noticed a day in that our bedsheets weren't being changed, so I enquired at the front desk as to whether we do receive that service and they confirmed that it should be changed each time housekeeping visits. Unfortunately, they forgot a second time to change the sheets, as I used lipstick to leave faint marks in order to determine their cleanliness, but they were still there. We began leaving notes with our tips asking for the bed sheets to be changed, and that's just poor form. The wifi isn't temperamental, it doesn't work 85% of the time and that's the same with the television, it's easier to purchase an AT&T SIM card if you're not a local American for $45 for unlimited data and just stream. Lastly, the noise, our balcony doors were solid, it was the blind-like windows above our bed that allowed the noise in and it wasn't from the karaoke bar downstairs, it was the trucks delivering stock to the hotels behind us every hour of the night. You would have had the same experience sleeping on the street, or better yet, booking a nicer hotel at the last minute before your trip that would still be cheaper and much more pleasant than staying at this hotel. It's disappointing because most of the staff are very accommodating and friendly, and that's the only highlight of this hotel, so essentially you'd just be paying for good customer service (My 1 star is for the staff). Also, the hotel manager that comments on everyone's bad reviews doesn't have the power to improve your awful experience unless they were to refund everyone who has booked this hotel at the beginning of their stay and suggest they find another place. For those of you looking to book this hotel because it seems the most economical at the time, you've been warned.

Room decent size bed comfortable had a balcony with a small ocean view... but the toilet broke and was originally told I would have to come all the way down from the top floor to use the reception bathroom whenever I felt the need!! Wasn't offered another room until I suggested they move me!! Sliding door come off the track when I opened it and I couldn't get WiFi in my room had to sit in reception area which was noisy with no privacy...won't be recommending this hotel....

This hotel provides all you need as a base from which to discover Waikiki.The rooms are clean, nothing fancy and great if all you are really after is to head out and explore the area as it is in an absolutely fantastic location.Bathroom was also clean - very standard but decent enough. Overall it was an okay stay but good for what we needed for a stop-over on our way back from the Big Island.

I loved our stay at the Hotel. When I initially booked with priceline they gave me a different address to check in however the hotel registration is on 2424 Koa Ave. I thought for the price we paid it exceeded my expectation. Clean, neat, great location, good amenities and prompt service.

I really wanted to like this hotel, as I enjoy staying in boutique hotels. Unfortunately, it proved disappointing. One of the walls of my room consisted entirely of glass shutters that could not be fully closed. Consequently, you could hear every bit of noise on the street throughout the night. Bear in mind this hotel is located on a busy street in central Waikiki, so it was very noisy. In addition to traffic, I heard a noisy fight between several Australian tourists around 2am. There is a karaoke bar downstairs, so I suspect the hotel attracts a lot of noisy revelers.The bathroom had similar shutters, albeit smaller, which meant that people on the upper floors of the neighboring building could see in. The shower was difficult to get in and out of.The room had no table or desk - there was nowhere to put belongings. The room consisted of two twin beds, which were genuinely twin beds, effectively the smallest beds I've seen in any hotel.The Wifi was woefully slow, which was irksome given the $10 'amenity fee' for things such as Wifi. (Folks should note that the nearby Vive Hotel, where I stayed earlier in my visit, is excellent and has no 'amenity fee.')On a positive note, the front desk were friendly and the room basically seemed clean, if spartan.

Don't be fooled by the pictures. The lobby and rooms look nothing like what is posted on their internet site - false advertising as far as I'm concerned. My sister, who was staying a a hotel a couple of blocks away made the comment that her parking garage looked better than our room.

Just want to give a shout out to Lauren and G who were at the desk when we checked out. We had a terrible experience with the shuttle we booked with Go Hawaii shuttle service and they chased them up for us continuously. The shuttle never showed and they promptly called a taxi who drove us at a flat rate. Thanks you guys for providing service over and above what was expected.The hotel was fine, clean and basic and right in the centre of Honolulu. Great for the price you pay.

Stay Hotel Waikiki is located right at the central Waikiki beach just 1 minute walk or a few steps away from the beach. The location, the staff, comfort, cleanliness of the room and sheets are the best! From the balcony of any room you can see the Pacific Ocean on the west and the mountain on the east from your hotel room balcony. It is amazing!The staff are the nicest and good hearted especially Cody at the Front Desk fully accommodated our special requests and even hosted his personal delicious pumpkin pie. Thank you very much Cody! The hotel rooms are modern style with clean cool decorations and very clean as spotless with plenty of great smelling shampoo and body wash as well as tissues so on. We stayed in the hotel for 8 nights in Dec 2016 including Christmas and checked in and out for two to one nights due to our plan change in Hawaii. Thus we've been to 5 different rooms of the Stay Hotel Waikiki in one trip. The rooms with queen size beds are spacious with bathtubs, desk, desk chair, chairs and a table for food on the balcony as well as sofa chair in the room in addition to the beds with good mattresses in addition to TV, coffeemaker, air conditioner and so on. Rooms with twin single beds are smaller size comparing to the room with queen bed and with shower, however much cheaper than rooms with the queen beds as total around 30$ cheaper per night including tax and fees. Stay Hotel Waikiki has purified cold and hot water dispenser and good quality coffee free of charge in the lobby 24 hours. The hotel is 3-5 minutes walking distance from public bus station #20, 42 that goes to and from the Honolulu airport. The stop names is Food Pantry and Hyatt Regency Waikiki. Stay Hotel is next to Hyatt Hotel on Koa Avenue. Public buses that cost 2.50$ only allow carry on baggages but not luggages. However Fly Shuttle from Honolulu airport to Waikiki Hotel doors including Stay Hotel Waikiki are 10$ per person for the people with luggages.The hotel is surrounded by lots of good eating places as the best and the fast food and stores selling both food and Hawaiian best products. Nearby the hotel, there is a food market on odd numbered days and Saturday beginning from 4PM.Comparing to other hotels in Waikiki, Stay Hotel Waikiki is in the best location, the best service, and the best staff with good hearts and comparatively cheaper considering all the pros.
user_name:
GalindivS
New York City, New York

review_body: Aloha greetings right from the start. The hotel underwent renovation and is a contemporary small hotel with comfortable rooms. Great service, front desk agents very kind and accommodating. Parking is limited and safe. Maria P. checked me in with a smile and explained the hotel facilities. Upon check out I spoke to Erika J. which was also very knowledgeable and once again gave great customer service. The location is also great, close to everything in Waikiki. Steps from the beach. I highly recommend this place.

The rooms are exceptionally-clean & the staff is very friendly! The location is excellent & you can walk anywhere quickly on Waikiki. Underground parking is limited - but the rates are very competitive. The wireless was not a reliable as we would have liked, but it did work.

Hotel room was very clean and comfortable, staff were very helpful and friendly and nothing was a problem or too much trouble. An ideal location for proximity to the beach, shops and transport. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend for the price.

Enjoy the room it is small but it's very clean the staff is fantastic rates are great would recommend to any of my clients especially when I know they're going on a bunch of excursions. Stay Waikiki is awesome.

The hotel people made an effort to get us into our room early, which was very nice and appreciated . ( 8 1/2 hr flight from Sydney ) The staff is very friendly and accommodating. Like their coffee in the lobby...always fresh! Mahalo!!!

Online profiles for this property show it as modern and fresh, this is not the reality of my experience. I selected a queen room with sofa, not the cheapest option. Upon arrival I was 'upgraded' to a condo. I thought wow can't complain! Then was lead out the back of the property, across the road, a few doors down and up two flights of stairs. At the top of the stairs the very helpful staff member opened the door and tried his best sell on a very old room. I look around, thought this is not what I was expecting but I'll give it a go. After a humid evening I thought I would have a shower and refresh before bed. The shower was very old and I was not prepared to use it without thongs on my feet. So I got ready and turned on the water. It came out of the bottom tap and was almost brown to begin with and I could not switch to the shower head. I called the front desk (from my mobile phone as there is no phone in the room) And the lady said she would send a maintenance man. I quickly got dressed and the man arrived within minutes, he was not able to get the shower to work either. I called the front desk again, there were no empty rooms to relocate me to so I had to stay. The girl was able to find me a room that was an early checkout and allowed me to use the shower in there. NOT IDEAL. Said I will need to come and see the manager in the morning for alternative arrangements. So I went to the desk at 9am as advised but no manager on duty today. The front desk attendants were very polite and as accommodating as can be but after two phone calls to the manager were still not approved to give me a refund so I could check into a new hotel. As I was not prepared to leave without a refund I had no choice but to accept another room. The other room was better than the first, it is part of the main 'hotel' although external facing so quite noisy. The location is central and the desk seems to be manned at all hours and staff I have dealt with are nice, aside from this I don't see any points to recommend.

Great location less then 5 minutes walk from the beach. Clean room, very friendly staff happy to assist with anything including ringing and booking tours for us. There is also a cool karaoke bar downstairs next to the lobby which is also awesome, there were some quality singers in there! For the price we paid the hotel exceeded my expectations!

This place is OK - it's cheap, clean and positioned well but there are far better options around for the price. I only stayed one night and it was fine, did the job.One entire wall in the room I was in was simply glass shutters, which meant all the street noise came in and made it harder to get a good night's rest, something to be mindful of if you're staying for a few days. Also the curtains are white and let a heap of light in so again, sleep quality isn't great.Wifi is paaaaaainfully slow.The front desk staff aren't the best overall, again, just kind of average. You know the kind where you stand there for a bit before they acknowledge you, then talk to their colleagues instead of helping you out. Not the worst, not the best, just average.On the plus side, the hotel is in a great spot, is clean and has a reasonably modern interior. Having stayed at a few places in Honolulu now, I just think there are better places to spend your hard earned money - places that are a bit more special and will make you feel more welcome/comfortable, for pretty much a similar price. It's not a terrible hotel at all, it's just not great.

Knowing the hotel has a low standard, it really was a great place to stay at. Clean, with helpful staff, fridge and microwave at the room allowing you to bring water, breakfast and all you need, good beds, beach towels, pretty much everything you need for a good staying!

I stayed there for my bday, was there for a week. The gay staff kept asking to hook up with me(I'm openly gay but wouldn't hook up with hotel staff). I left my leather bracelet when I checked out. I called from the airport asking that my friends will pick and bring it back from me. No one contact me as I was in states for 3 more weeks. Hotel itself is very close to Waikiki beach.

Mark and Crystal are awesome! The hotel is a block from the beach. The room was clean, housekeeping kept up with towels... Coffee is provided in the lobby.... Everything was great.... Would definitely return in the future!

was an okay hotel we booked last minute after our friends had left and we had a few days to ourselves its a great location but nothing like the pictures online, the room was very small and horrible views from both front balcony and little balcony of the room.staff were great we dealt with a girl by the name of crystal she was nothing short of amazing helping us with what to do and were to go.one of the guys on the desk helped us with organising transport back to the airport he told us we could pay i think it was around $US10 pp for a shuttle or US$29 flat rate for a taxi we chose the taxi as we had to be up super early the last thing we wanted was to stop and this hotel and that hotel while the shuttle was picking up more guests we got to the airport and we were charged $US45 for the ride to the airport we stated to the cab driver that the guy from the hotel told us it was a flat rate of US$29 and he told us that it was untrue and we had to pay the US$45

We were in Waikiki recently and weren't willing to spend a ridiculous amount of money on hotels- as we knew we wouldn't be spending too much time in the room. We ended up at Stay hotel and it really had everything we needed. A great location, always smiling staff, helpful amenities downstairs -tea, coffee, computers and a printer. We were a little worried at first because we didn't realise there was a bar downstairs and thought this might result in lots of noise- but the doors of the bar seem to be totally sound proof! The wifi in the rooms was really patchy, but it didn't take much effort to use the wifi in the lobby which always had a good connection. Small but clean rooms. Definitely nothing fancy but just what we wanted.

I really wanted to love this hotel. When you walk in the main floor is setup with several leather like couches, hammock chairs, LCD TV, 2 computers and printer, tea and coffee available all day with a modern look. Friendly faces at the counter doing their best. My low score reflects the several attempts I made to resolve issues on our week stay where the staff and management failed.(1) The staff seem ill prepared to answer questions about the area. It is my expectation that the hotel should have some ideas about the restaurants and attractions in their area. Many AIRBNB hosts have lists of places and instructions to get there. In our case we asked about a place 2 blocks and 7 minutes away (Marukame Udon restauarant) highly rated on Yelp. The two people could not figure out how to get there even thought they knew it was always busy. Ended up finding our way there.(2) When we used the shower for the first time we noticed the shower head was not fully turning on (RM 407 I believe). Hot water was going to the head and very little cold water. A third of the water flowed through the tap. We reported this 3 times to the front desk. The third time i went up to the room with maintenance person and demonstrated the issue. I was nicely told that they could not do anything about this. It was known by maintenance that the fixture were old. There was no concern that someone could get scalded from hot water.(3) Room cleaning service was poor. The sink and bathrub were never cleaned the week I was there. I ended up cleaning it myself as their were bits of paint flaking off and the sink was not draining correctly. As far as I could tell towels were changed, garbage were emptied and beds made. No change when i left sign out to clean.Finally I did ask twice to talk to a manager about my experience (first attempt 3 days before i left). No one contacted me. Our last day I got an e-mail asking for feedback. As a result I posted this review. I am disappointed that staff did not block this room so it could be repaired and provided another.My advice when booking here is that you fully inspect the room. I've never had to be this detailed before as I expect some common sense by the hotel. But in this case they are just filling rooms. Also keep in mind that you are behind the Hyatt and you will here all kinds of noise starting from 3-4 am.

Great location and staff for our trip to Honolulu. Wanted to save money on the accomodation and was not let down. The staff were on hand to help when required and the cleaning staff were amazing. The only thing I can think of is more lights in the room near the bed.

The Stay Waikiki is a great hotel to stay at in Waikiki Beach . It is one block from the beach but that is a very short block. The accommodations are quite nice and the staff is so friendly and willing to answer any question or give advice of where and what you need to see or do. I would recommed this to anyone you will not be disappointed.

We stayed in a 2 bed room and it was very nice. Try to ask for a room on The 5th floor up(definitely recommended), because they are the only rooms that have balconies and we had a view of Waikiki beach from our side. It is literally a 45 second walk to Waikiki beach and the Duke K Statue. It was very comfortable if you don't mind a smaller room. They held on to our luggage, while we had to take a tour. Only recommendation is to try and stock the bathrooms with more soap. But otherwise a great great stay!! Very impressed for the price we paid. Side note; there is an additional $10 amenities fee charged per day.

Love this hotel! The staff were more than helpful and extremely friendly. We had the room that sleeps 4, and it was great for us. Just one block away from the beach and within 3 to 4 blocks you had everything you could ask for: International Marketplace was a favorite of ours. Easy access for taxis and shuttles. Very clean rooms. My only advice would be to get the larger room and try to get on floors 6-8 so you have a view. In the lobby was free internet access and printer, and free water toys (boogie boards, flippers, goggles), also use of washer and dryer was free. Needless to say we will book here next time in Hawaii.

I was looking for an affordable location because I knew I would not be spending much time in the room. This was a great choice for me. The location was wonderful. The staff at the hotel were all very informative and helpful with tips on things to do and transportation question. They will hold your luggage if your room is not available and they have complimentary tea, coffee, water, newspapers, and a lounge that is located in the lobby. As a solo traveler I felt completely comfortable and safe venturing outside the area of this hotel. One block from the beach and the "Duke" statue which is a pickup point for some of the tours I had scheduled. Farmers market and great restaurants and shopping are located close by. WIFI is available, 24 hour computer access in the lobby. Beach equipment is first come first served. I think the names are Alex and Nick who helped with check-in and questions in reference to my stay.There were two wonderful women that assisted with my inquiries patiently, please forgive me, but I thought I had wrote their names down as well. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it if you are in need of a great location and a comfortable place to sleep, shower and hit the road to enjoy Honolulu. Mahalo!

When arriving, struggled with parking. Had to park in the next street because they have very limited parking. Besides that, front desk was very nice and helpful and the location is great. Few minutes from beach and nearby to several restaurants. Room is average but didn't spend much time in the room anyway. Would definitely stay again.

We stayed three nights, we were 'upgraded' to a condo in the next street....room very basic, bed comfortable, but air conditioner about 500mm from head of bed, had to swelter through the night as it was just so noisy you couldn't sleep. Car rental parking lot next door to our room which was very noisy.Reception staff very nice and friendly, weren't impressed about the fee for wifi etc. on checkout. The position of the hotel is a winner, very close to beach, shopping and restaurants etc.

This little gem on Koa Avenue, one block back from the beachfront, is truly the place to stay in Waikiki. The super courteous staff, the clean & quiet rooms plus the very easy access to all the islands' tours gives you everything you need to enjoy your holiday in Hawaii. And if you're inclined, there's a Karaoke bar in the foyer at the back ;)You pay enough for food & drinks on the main strip of Waikiki (Kalakaua Ave), this place will help you minimise your costs.

Stay Hotel Waikiki was exactly what I wanted for my trip. As a solo traveler without a car, Stay was perfect. Literally 30 seconds from the beach, walking distance to every part of Waikiki and beyond, a block from The Bus, and is a safe, clean hotel. The folks at the front were amazing - super friendly and welcoming, and they offered great recommendations for restaurants, things to do, and places to see.About the room: the room was not large, but it was clean and airy and streamlined. My room also had a balcony, which was a huge bonus. The air conditioning worked really well (it was a typical window unit, so if you're not used to that, it may be louder than you expect, but certainly not LOUD). The water pressure in the shower was awesome, and the showerhead was super tall. Free coffee / tea in the hotel and room, free and fast WiFi as well (fast enough for video streaming, no problem).About the hotel: there is a karaoke bar in the ground floor, but I never heard it from my room and really only could hear the patrons when I was in the lobby AND the door to the bar opened (so, really unnoticeable). There's one elevator which was super fast - I was worried at first it would be slow to get up and down from the 6th floor, but I rarely waited longer than maybe 30 seconds.Most importantly - the Hyatt Regency is across the street. That's a huge hotel, with a steep cost per night, and if I were to leave my room at the same time as someone staying there, I would beat them to the beach. Other bonuses: free beach gear for borrow, including beach towels, floaties, snorkel gear, boogie boards... and right next door to two great surf / SUP rental stores. Kai Coffee, located in the Hyatt Regency, is great for strong coffee if you're needing something fancy. Plenty of restaurants with anything you could want (and any price range) within a 5 min walk, Foodland is around the corner, Farmer's Market in King's Market on Saturdays, a block away from the mall. The one bummer was the soap / shampoo offered - only in wall dispensers, would have preferred to have more personal items, but I have sensitive skin and brought my own anyway!The value of Stay Hotel Waikiki is unbeatable. You can't beat the location, the people are amazing, and their hospitality provided a fantastic stay. Thank you, Stay team!!

The room was poor not what was shown in pictures on the internet listing, the staff admitted the hotel was under renovation and we booked because of the pictures we saw on their internet site, but gave us an old room and the air/con was an in the window at head height next to your pillow about 600mm away. The manager said they would give us 1 night off our bill, but refused to do so when check out. very dissappointed

I stayed after a wedding but the location was good & that's about it. The room was very old & the aircon was so loud I had to use ear plugs to be able to sleep. It was nothing like what I've seen on the photos on their website. I got the feeling that it was near new but it was far from it. The staff on the other hand were very friendly & always going out of their way to help you. Thank goodness for the front desk staff. You all did an amazing job.

Very small and not so clean bathrooms...the bedroom is spacious. The biggest advantage is the proximity to the waikiki beach. We had to park elsewhere since the hotel's parking space is very small. There is a karaoke place that we could not visit in the hotel.

One block away from the beach, one block away from the bus system, and any food you would want is a short walk away. Room was clean, bed was comfortable. Beach towels on demand (and even beach toys if available) coffee and newspaper in the morning readily available. When my shuttle left without us for the airport, front desk immediately called taxi for us. Price was great for the location! Do not hesitate to book!

My husband and I arrived later than we had expected and were greeted by a super friendly young lady. She walked us through all the great little amenities like kona coffee in the lobby or the local teas, free beach gear like bamboo mats, floats, and even some snorkel gear. I mentioned working at a coffee shop back home and she recommend a great place called Vintage Island Coffee (something like that, I was in a Hawaiian daze!) which turned out to be delicious. The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. It felt clean and well taken care of. Loved having a mini fridge and microwave available. Cant wait to go back and stay here again.

First impressions walking in was this is a cool little boutique hotel. Staff were friendly and the location is perfect. They were the only positives. The extra hotel fee you pay on checking in for towels and wifi neither of which I used left a bad taste with me from the start. This should be optional. The rest of the hotel is one step up from a hostel. The room was as basic as basic can be. The bed felt like a pull out camper bed. It was noisy from adjacent apartments and traffic. Overall it did me for one night but I would not choose to stay there again.

Perfect location for the right price! my girlfriend and I had read the reviews on here and were hesitant and a little worried over nothing! We stayed on the 7th floor not one issue, house keeping was done everyday and the staff downstairs are very easy going, helpful, bright happy people! they were so helpful with any enquiry i had about the room or even directions and best places to go definitely will be booking again!With wang chungs downstairs, one street away from waikiki beach and 10 steps away from the abc store why would you not book this hotel for the perfect price?!and finally if you ever get to meet lilly she is just amazing will do everything in her power to help you get comfortable and make it work your way, she has a great knowledge of hawaii and things that you dont normally see come up as touristy things, she is even good for a chat!Hope to be back there soon!

first of all: the resort fee is total BS!!!!!! They provide you beach towels and coffee -wow! not amazing.... The room was REALLY tiny. There was a super loud fan noise, which to me was ok, but my boyfriend hated it. The AC could barely keep up with the heat.But, the location is really great. The room was really clean. The staff was friendly. So, even though I had to pay the extra resort BS fee and $25 a day for parking, it was ok. Don't think I'd stay there again tho.

Nothing special- rooms were not cleaned. Found condom from previous guest. Tape wouldn't stop leaking. Wifi very poor signal. Rooms very small.However, Lilly was very helpful and tried her best to make our stay as pleasent as possible.

Great place!!! Got off cruise ship, and they stored luggage till room was available, they even called me when it was ready early. Got checked in, and got 10 days of laundry done in their free washers (even provided soap). Walking distance to beach, food and shopping. There was a nice farmers market on the corner 3 nights a week. Only thing that was hard was the noise, but that was nice having tour pickup across from hotel and didn't take long to get used to it. Will stay again!!!

The staff are very friendly and looked after all of our requests, it's clean and they give out beach towels whenever you want to go swimming - we swam every day as it's super close to the beach. The only criticisms would be that the air conditioner smelt a little musty and was a little loud (if you can sleep over white noise like I can you'll be fine). I think it might have leaked but we were busy exploring Honolulu and shopping so we didn't spend that much time in it! All in all a great place

A very friendly,inexpensive place to stay. Good location, neat and clean.i would suggest new pillows and curtains though, as the outside lights kept the room lit all night.pillows were very flat! Love that they had beach gear available for free. Loved that they organised the airport shuttle which arrived on time for $14.

My fiancee and i stayed at this hotel for our recent trip to Honolulu. We really enjoyed this hotel. It is super close to the beach and restaurants, all of the staff were very friendly and helpful also. The room was clean and modern and our wifi worked every time we used it. Street noise was a bit full on, but i expect that from most hotels in that area due to it being so busy, nothing a set of ear plugs didnt fix. Dont really have anything to fault about this hotel as i said it was clean and comfortable. Would recommend to anyone wanting to stay at a nice hotel without the price tag. Stayed September 2016.

If you want to sleep,this is not the place for you. Windows are old fashioned glass and don't shut all the way. All noise from hotel across the street loading dock is all I heard. Called downstairs asking about the Windows they said that is due to the type of whindow and nothing can be done so if you want to sleep DONT COUNT ON IT

This was a super-friendly place to stay. They loan you mats for the beach, towels, and even toys for the kids. Funky karaoke bar on the premises. Two Kuerig coffee makers in the lobby with seemingly unlimited coffee. And breakfast bars and fruit available in the morning.It's a quick 1-2 block walk to Waikiki beach. We loved everything about it.

Hi. First impressions were fine due to the check-in girl Lilly. She was great. We booked a room with two "twin" beds and upon entry were a little disappointed to find two "single" beds and only enough room to store our bags. I called reception and mentioned that the room description was a little deceiving regarding the size of beds and after a little discussion the duty manager kindle moved us to a room with a queen size bed. Thanks Calvin. The pictures on the website don not accurately reflect the hotel. If I was paying full price for this room i would be less than excited. The room was quite noisy from road noise as only had louvre windows. Location is great.

My friend and I have just returned home after an amazing week in Honolulu. I guess we chose the stay hotel based on its affordability. It is advertised as a budget hotel! Initially, when we arrived in 806 we were thinking 'where is our hand chair' ! To be fair, it was a basic room (not boutique?) but was absolutely spotless and we had house keeping daily! Renovations are happening I imagine 1 floor at a time. Our little dated room grew on us very quickly! The air con is a bit of a pain in the derrière - right next to the bed in line with where you sleep!! So air con was a day time luxury only. We had absolutely no access to wifi in our room which seemingly is a working progress in the hotel. The front desk were a nice bunch. Specifically, I would like to mention Lilly. She was extremely approachable and really excellent at her job. She clearly cared about the people in the hotel and was focussed on ensuring folks had a great stay. ? Management - maybe a promotion or raise !? If not recognizing her work would be great !!!!! Overall, you pay for what you get. If you want four or five stars don't chose this hotel. If you want friendly faces, a great location, basic but clean come here. Also, our resort bill was wavered as a result of the no wifi - this really removed any bitter taste in our mouths re. Wifi ! So thank you ! I hope the problem is sorted for future guests soon ! I know we were on holiday but like wifi for working out bus routes and happy hours !!! Many Regards,Kirsty Murray (Canada *formally Scotland)
user_name:
Kirsty M
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Hello All,I just wanted to share our time here at Stay Hotel Waikiki. First off it wasn't what we expected and things didn't go so well. The wifi didn't properly and I was forced to purchase additional data from my service provider as I went over my data plan. I called the front desk on several occasions one clerk Cody told me we would get credited for the days the Wifi wasn't working in the room. The staff had me reset my phone and only in the lobby did the wifi worked. My room was 805 and it's an inconvenience to go downstairs every time to use Internet. Next the wall AC unit is inches from the bed and when we have gone to sleep my wife wakes up the next morning with chills, fever, and diarrhea. I myself by the third day started getting diarrhea from the close proximity of the AC. I had to visit the local ABC store for Advil and an anti-diarrhea medicine. There is little range of motion to the air vents and any way you turn it you will still be directly hit by the air regardless if it's hot or cold. I am certain I have never stayed in a room where the AC unit is that close to your face.Also the TV channels are viewed with a snowy or bad signal look to them so we couldn't enjoy that. Also the wall outlet to the right of the bed doesn't work.Tripadvisor advertises that this hotel had free breakfast and several posted pictures show a continental breakfast. Upon arrival and when asking a staff member her response was dismissive and she stated no that there was no such breakfast. Part of the reason I chose this hotel was expecting that amenity and I wasn't afforded.A vacation that took months and several thousand dollars to make a reality are a bittersweet memory for us which we will not soon forget.

this is the first hotel that doesn't care if the telephone is working, if the sofa bed is left in the middle of the room, undone,with the head of the second person literally hanging .And above all no safe box in the room! ONLY ....IN THE RECEPTION!!!The most of the glass shutters don't work, the a\c is noisy and the only thing they good fix was to set the sofa bed.

Don't do it, especially if you're traveling alone or just females!!! After my friend left, I had one night alone and based on misleading pictures I figured the Stay Hotel would work for me. And the price was right.... Like $99, but I should have known better!!!It's super small, and all doors face outside so anyone can see you come and go and I didn't feel safe. It's not your normal hotel where each floor has an indoor hallway for rooms, so I felt insecure. The lobby is small and sterile, with some little ghetto bar. Once I entered the room, it was all white and concrete so felt like I was in a hospital or jail cell. It was clean, so I'll give them that. But small, impersonal and like a college dorm. The location is good since it's just one block from the beach, but you can do better for sure and have a better experience.If you're some young dudes wanting a cheap place/hostel to stay while you surf, then fine. But within an hour, and after a FaceTime to my husband I decided to walk out!! I know I wouldn't have slept well or enjoyed my last night.They wouldn't refund my money, and there's also a resort fee... For what?? God only knows!!! I walked down the street to the Pacific Beach Hotel and got a room for just $60 more that FAR surpassed the Stay room and had a door you entered from an interior hallway, so I was happy. This hotel was on the beach, safe, clean and just what I needed for my last night!I would never go here with kids or for a romantic time. Just don't go!

We stayed for 9 nights at the Stay hotel. The beach and the main street is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Same for the city bus that can get you almost anywhere on the island. You have stores, restaurants and tour accomodation from a walking distance as well. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The only downsize of our stay is the Wifi in the room (didn't work most of the time) and the lack of beach equipment (beach mat).

Room - If you are looking for accommodation with a view, this is not the place. This would be ideal if your planning to enjoy 'Waikiki' out and about. Room has fridge, microwave, TV (simple things one needs).  Staff - 24 hours service desk. Most of the staff won't 'knowledge' you. Staff at the time NOT helpful when my partner wanted them to transfer an important phone call to our room. Made her wait downstairs but ended up transferring the call anyway to the room, lucky I was there to answer. Not all staff were bad, one lady (didn't get her name) pregnant at the time and feminine male probably the only friendly staff. Most of them will only speak or look at you if you say something to them.Car park - US/$25 a day. No street parks. Not sure how safe the car park is? Roller door is mostly up and signs inform customers the hotel is not responsible for any damage or stolen goods. Didn't observe any cameras?. Karaoke Bar - down stairs (you can't hear it from your room - a plus). Per song cost US/$1. They don't take coins (lol). Didn't try the food. 2 minutes walk to restaurants etc. I also notice they have a small food market in front of Burger King every Wednesday's from 3pm until 8pm. (Around the corner from Stay Hotel). Overall - I enjoyed my stay, rooms were always clean. Warm showers everyday, wifi (not really good, but connected when we could lol). Clean beach towels always available. I would probably book and stay here again. I found Stay Hotel very convenient and close to everything!

My stay was very good. The front desk was incredibly helpful and friendly. One of the staff was training and still did a good and efficient job. The more senior staff was fantastic and knowledgable. They made a map for me to find local bars and restaurants even though it was a late hour. I appreciated their help and they made the visit. Room was quiet and clean, nothing fancy but a great spot for the price.

I stayed for 2 nights on a weekend in July after I sent my relatives back home first. Staff is very friendly, pleasant, and helpful. They answered all the questions I had and booked a shuttle to the airport. The hotel should not be called a "boutique" hotel. It is an extension of a hostel. It is sufficient for one person spending a couple of nights. The room I stayed was not a renovated room, the look far from the images posted on their website. Outside noise on Friday night was unbearable. The location was great, enjoyable to walk around and do shopping.

Vacation was planned for Big Island, but added a few days on the trip to revisit Oahu. We wanted to be in walking distance of Waikiki. A quick search on Trip Advisor and other sites came up with Stay Hotel which had great pictures on their website. For the time of year we were traveling it had lower rates than the bigger places. It appeared to be something like an A-Loft from the pictures. They must have had a fantastic photographer. In the first place signage is so small and hidden by trees you can't find the place. It appeared to be an small, old, apartment building which had been converted into a hotel. The only thing this facility had going for it was its location and it was fairly clean. There was no moldy caulk in the bathrooms, apparently all had been freshly painted, and it was kept clean. However, it was very Spartan. We had a 2 BR suite, which was really nothing but two connected bedrooms. The A/C was cheap window units which did not do a good job of cooling the place off and they were very noisy. The mattress on the cheap platform bed was just a few inches of foam and the support was not good. Linens were clean and apparently new. Flatscreen TV's in each room but poor selection of channels. Parking was supposed to be under the building, but they only had 6 spots and we had to park at another of their properties 2 blocks away. It was endurable as we weren't around during the day and it was essentially just a place to sleep. It was relatively quiet although cramped between two similar buildings that were apparently rental apartments. The facility was too expensive for what you get. As every hotel was essentially booked in the area, even the old Outrigger properties, we were left little choice to get the location. It was a block from Waikiki and you could walk to everything.

The rooms look nothing like those advertised and are very old and run-down. Our room had a very strong scent of something rotting, which was very unpleasant. You are also slugged an amenities fee even though the cleaners basically do nothing. The location is good and the staff are (generally) friendly.

Will start of with the good things, staff are great and the desk is 24/7, there is also free wifi in the lobby. Location is excellent as very close to the Beach and shops. The rooms are very small but clean and had the facilities we wanted, fridge, microwave and coffee. They are advertised with free wifi but the wifi did not work in the room, however we did get refunded the amenities bill. Until the wifi is fixed I think this hotel should be advertised with lobby wifi only. We were on floor 8 with good views I would not recommend being any lower than floor 6.

We stayed here for one night in a queen room. It's in a great location and very reasonably priced, even the daily charge was great at around USD10. Friendly, efficient check-in. Clean, tidy and spacious room with balcony and almost sea view. Only downside was the aircon unit as it was situated on the wall right next to the bed and you unfortunately couldn't direct it away. Wifi was consistently good. The bar downstairs 'Wang Chungs' was great too, good people, good food and varying degrees of karaoke. All in all, I'd happily stay here again.

Booked with Expedia for 6 nights, got a great deal. The location is superb, only one block back from the beach, directly behind the Hyatt. Rooms were small, clean and comfortable. We were on Level 6 and could see the ocean from our balcony.The air-con is loud and you can hear street noise, but we still managed to sleep well every night. For the price and the location, it was great value and I'd book again.

Booked from Australia, stayed 2 nights. Room was great, balcony could just see the ocean , nice. Cool, clean, comfortable bed. Service desk staff very helpful and friendly. Close to beach, shops and restaurants. The ONLY downside for us was the check-in time. Our flight arrived in the early morning and we were at the hotel by 8.30am. Check-in 4pm meant a very long wait after a long flight. The hotel managed to get us in to the room at 2pm, we were just about sleep in the lobby. Perhaps an option to pay something extra for the half day would be good :)

Location is awesome, just 1 block back from Waikiki beach. Eateries, bars and clubs all within a few minutes walk Very basic rooms but if you're in Hawaii you should only be in your room to sleep or shower before setting out to explore. There is the greatest karaoke bar downstairs that goes off everynight. Wang chungs rocks and the bar staff are awesome at what they do. Unfortunately I didn't try the food but I can recommend the cocktails.The hotel staff are super friendly and accommodating, from the front desk to the room service. Nothing was too hard for them.I would definitely stay here again. Stay Hotel Waikiki you're awesome

My wife and I stayed here recently for 6 nights and were quite happy with the room. After reading many reviews (both good and bad) we were not quite sure what to expect as my wife was worried about tne cleanliness of the bathroom, but we weren’t disappointed when we arrived. Front desk staff was very friendly and really helpful, and the location was perfect! Only a 2 minute walk to Waikiki and the main shopping area/restaurants. Many tours also pick up passengers from the Grand Hyatt bus stop which was directly across the road from this hotel, so that was handy as well. Then on Waikiki Beach itself you had a variety of Tram Tours that would take you everywhere from Diamond Head to Pearl Harbour.Yes there was some noise - the room is not soundproof and The air conditioning wasn't the quietest, and the room was quite simple as your not paying a King’s ransom it done the job. The room was clean and had the amenities we needed (we were able to use the safe at reception to put our passports in) and for the price I found it to be a great deal.If you were looking to stay at one of the more expensive resorts and are looking at a hotel with all the bells & whistles then it's probably not for you (depending on your expectations). If you are after a clean basic room with a great price and great location, and the amenities you would expect at this price ie beach towels, wifi and beach gear). but it was a good price in a great location, then I would definitely recommend! We will happily stay again when we can get back there.

The customer service folks were really great, and they made the crappy hotel a little better. The location is great, but the hotel is old and the pix online do not accurately depict the hotel. They had beach stuff available for everyone to use.

My son I stayed five days here and it got the job done as far as being close to the Waikiki beach and Diamond Head crater. Our balcony was also cool because of the view of the Diamond Head.It was small but had everything we needed,also all our tours were picked up in front of our hotel.The ABC store was very close and had cheap water and some pastries for breakfast. I would stay again, but my Wife,I'm not so sure.The front desk was so helpful and very nice to us.We used the washer and dryer and their beach body board as well as towels for the beach.Surf boards ,body boards,as well as snorkeling equipment were next door and easy to get.Thanks for making my son's graduation gift from me a memory we will never forget

Great location just a block from Waikiki beach. Only stayed 1 night while waiting to get into our timeshare. Our room and bathroom were small but clean and well-furnished with refer, microwave & coffee pot. Seems like a great spot for younger travelers although anyone should be comfortable. Beware that you should make plans ahead of time if you need a parking space as there were none available when we were there. My only complaint would be that, when researching a reservation, the room price seemed to vary from day to day. At one point the room was priced at $114 while another time it was almost $300 for the same night. Be sure to grab your reservation as far in advance as you can. Speedi Shuttle from the airport will drop you at the door and pick you up for $30 per person round trip. It's a bargain.

My partner and I stayed here recently and were quite happy with the room. After reading many reviews (both good and bad) we were not quite sure what to expect, but were not disappointed when we arrived. Front desk staff were very friendly and really helpful, and the location was perfect! Only a 2 minute walk to Waikiki and the main shopping area/restaurants. Many tours also pick up passengers from the Grand Hyatt bus stop which was directly across the road from this hotel, so that was handy as well.My only gripes were the noise - the room is not soundproof and as someone has previously mentioned there is a rubbish truck every morning that is bound to wake you up (and I am a heavy sleeeper!). The room was clean and had the amenities we needed (except for a safe!) and for the price I found it to be a great deal.If you were looking to stay at one of the more expensive resorts and are looking at this hotel because of availability, it's probably not for you (depending on your expectations). If you are after a clean basic room with a great price and great location, then I would definitely recommend!

My grandson and I used Expedia to book this room. My grandson is in a wheelchair...and I had phoned ahead to check on the room size.. I was assured it was big enough and they would make any changes if it wasn't ....so...when we arrived and checked in...(all rooms were full) I was irked to find the doorway to the bathroom (which was 4 ft x 3 ft) was so narrow that my grandsons wheel chair could not go thru the door.(could not get the bathroom photo to load!)..... fortunately he was able to transfer from out side the door to the toilet..(because it was such a small room). I do have to say that the room was sparkling clean...I don't think I have ever been in such a clean room! There were only two outlets...and in this day and age...with all the tech stuff needing recharged and also we both have cpap machines..I was worried that I was setting up a fire hazard with my multiple outlet extension cord! !!! The reception desk personal were out standing ...very helpful , cheerful and friendly..... We were staying one night because of a cruise leaving the next day. Lets see what have I forgotten...the shower was behind the bathroom door...so no shower for my grandson...but It was fabulous for me...great water pressure! We were 3 city blocks from the beach... Coffee and Tea 24/7 No breakfast included.... the wheelchair ramp to enter the building was very steep...but manageable... elevator worked great! oh...and the night noise was frustrating, someone was practicing on their ukulele ... and they definitely needed more practice! Since we were exhausted....we did sleep pretty well....It was exceptionally hot and the air conditioner did its best to keep up...the windows had bi-fold slats that let any cooling that was in the room escape! It wasn't horrible ...AND it wasn't 500$ per night... just depends what you want to pay!

The Stay Hotel was exactly what it promised, and what we were looking for. Simple, clean rooms located just two blocks back from the beach, with friendly staff and the amenities you would expect at this price(beach towels, wifi and beach gear). The air conditioning wasn't the quietest, and the room was quite simple but it was a good price in a great location. Would happily stay again.

Do not go here, it's nothing like the photos online. It's terrible, worse than any hostel I've stayed at and charges more than other decent hotels around the place. We ended up moving hotels and staying somewhere much nicer for less money. Total scam.

My girlfriend and I stayed here on the last leg of our Hawaii holiday and it was a very disappointing way to finish the holiday!On arrival you get charged with the amenity fee which we knew about but the internet which is included always drops out which is quite frustrating when you are looking for a laundromat close by on the Internet when the one washing machine and dryer are always being used (this is also an inclusion in the amenity fee) the beach equipment is things that customers have donated, the breakfast is very basic but good for grabbing and going in the morning. Parking is an additional $25 per night if available, which we thought was rather expensive following the other hotels we had stayed in.We eventually got the door to the room open after a hip and shoulder (which was a continuous way the door had to be opened) and walked in and there was sand all over the floor, one of the louvre Windows didn't work and when you opened them you looked straight onto the back packers next door and we did get a fair bit of noise from there, they don't block out anything. At 5:30am every morning the rubbish truck comes so be sure you will be woken. My girlfriend dropped something on the floor and when she picked it up it game with a long strand of black hair (and before you ask she is blonde).The room is not a bad size however the bathroom is small with no bench space and there are no bedside tables. The A/C that is in the room is not big enough and when you leave it on all night you may as well go out partying because you won't sleep with its loudness!To top it off 2 of the nights we went and stayed on the North Shore, that you to the girls at the front for refunding the parking for these two nights. When we returned our bedroom door was ajar (who knows how long for) and it was not secure! We may not have been staying there these 2 nights but we payed for the room and I would expect security! Luckily my girlfriend took our valuables with us. This was reported to reception and who knows what happened with that.I hope the manager doesn't give his stock standard reply of we are currently undergoing renovations at the moment because with all of the above mentioned issues they have nothing to do with the renovating of the building and the room security is a more important issue!!!

I do not have high standards for hotel rooms and this is the worse experience I have ever had. The room was so small, we could barely get the suitcase in. We had to climb to get in the bed as it was against both walls. The air conditioner was blowing right into your face or your back. It sounded like a train running all night as we were on the top floor. The bathroom was very small with a small shower, if you are over 5'10" good luck, I am only 5" 2". They charged the resort fee for my 6 hour stay and the internet never worked. The pictures were not the same room we had.

My partner and i booked to stay here for 7 nights in June 2016. We mainly booked for the location, and that is all this hotel has got going for it.When we arrived and managed to open the door to our room (it required a hard 'hip and shoulder' maneuver) we walked in, took off our shoes and were met with what i assume to be half of waikiki beach. The sand that was covering the floor did not get cleaned for our entire stay. We had to use our bath towels as floor mats before getting into bed.The small air conditioning unit stuck in the louvered window was not adequate size for the room. This resulted in us having to leave the very loud a/c on 24/7. The positive of this was that it slightly drowned out the noises of the garbage trucks that must have their morning meeting outside the building everyday at 5.50am.On the first morning, i dropped something on the floor and when i picked it up it was accompanied by a long black hair (I'm a blonde!)There is no bench space in the bathroom and no bedside tables.They sting you $25 a night for self-parking (if it's available).The washing machine and dryer that is included in the amenities fee is always being used (even at 5am). We ended up using a laundromat nearby.We ended up leaving for 2 nights and staying at another hotel. When we arrived back our door was unlocked and ajar!The girls at the front counter were lovely and they did refund us the 2 nights of parking when we stayed elsewhere (but we still paid for our unlocked room)The hotel is apparently undergoing renovations at the moment, which seems to be the managements standard response to negative tripadvisor reviews.I'd highly recommend staying at another hotel!

Big room, everything worked, good wifi, 1 block from beach! Roomy bathroom, friendly staff! Would highly recommend to anyone wanting a reasonable priced accommodation! Walking distance to everything in Waikiki

Two blocks from the beach. The hotel looks humble from the outside, but for the low price it didn't matter for me. Room was large and clean, although they should have hired an architect when they built the place ... the bedroom was over sized relative to the bathroom; the bathroom was so small that when I open the door, it almost hits the sink. That's just my room, maybe others are different?

My flight was delayed due to weather and I called the hotel to let them know I was getting into Hawaii the next day, they wouldn't refund me the night I was missing. I travel lots for work and when flights are delayed most hotels are really good and don't charge you. When I got to the hotel there was a 25 dollar parking fee which was not noted anywhere when I booked. They charge you a 10 fee for having a small amount of beach items. The room looked nothing like it did on the pictures, it was small, and old looking. The bed covers had stains on them, same with the bath curtain. When I asked to stay an extra two hours because I was getting hair and make up done, they wanted to charge me an extra fee. This hotel is overpriced for what you get, they fee you for everything they can, the customer service is bad, the whole experience was bad. I was glad I was there only one night instead of the two.I would not recommend this hotel at all.

The room was tiny, it looked much better in the picture. Generally it was a clean room, with a small bath room. Internet didn't work until 8pm, and they didn't have any breakfest packs for us left on our departure. The staff were friendly though. I wouldn't stay again, could get a better room with the money spent.

Not at all what it looks like in the photos!! Yes, it is going through refurbishment but it's not acceptable to show photos of something that does not exist. Rooms are large but bed is very uncomfortable. We asked for extra pillows and apparently they didn't have any. We asked for beach towels and they had none left.. but 'don't worry, you can just walk through the lobby wet'. No lights in the room ceiling except in the door way.. light out side the bathroom was extremely bright (had to put up our towels to block it out at night time). We couldn't change the air con temperature and it was so loud! Make sure you ask for your amenity fee to be waived because the 'complimentary' in room wifi doesn't work (still waiting for that reimbusment a week later). Very seedy karaoke bar in the lobby attracted some interesting characters that lingered on the lobby steps every afternoon and into the evening. The only good thing about our stay here was that it encouraged us to do more sight seeing far far away and only return for sleep. We had ocean views from our deck but the railings are so high that you can't enjoy the view from the plastic deck furniture. Don't stay here. Spend your money else where and get a much more pleasant experience.

We stayed at this hotel with my husband recently.I must say that it is such a fantastic hotel. Excellent location, very friendly and helpful staff. Very clean rooms. And most important great value. Best choice if you don't want to spend a lot on accommodation.

Best value for location and wonderful staff. Tania was especially good to us and made our stay even better. The hotel is not fancy or renewed, so if you are looking for luxury, you are in the wrong place, it is clean with great water pressure and we had a nice view of the beach from our balcony and thats what we appreciated. The beach is a 4 minute walk away. The buses are nearby and so convenient to go into honolulu or other attractions. The wifi was not really working in the room, but was consistent in the lobby where there is always Keurig coffee available and we were in Hawaii so who cares about wifi, go to the beach!!!!

We have stayed here several times in many different rooms. The hotel is being renovated; the rooms are clean,and airy, but in both our last two rooms there was effectively no ceiling light. The louvre windows let in the light and air, which is mostly great. The extras such as a light breakfast and beach gear at no charge make this hotel a great find.

Stayed here 4 nights.Pros: location location! 3 mins from Waikiki Beach and within walking distance of all the main areas. Rooms are reasonable enough, bathroom a bit old. A very cold!Amenities "fee" covers wifi, beach equipment and breakfast.Cons: TV reception was fuzzy.Biggest gripe was the wifi. It connects intermittently (I found the best times to be 7am and around 5pm) but completely useless in the evening. Had them come up once to the room to "reset the router" which only temporarily addressed the issue.From other reviews clearly this is an issue which continues to be a problem.

Technically this is a budget hotel- there are plenty but this is a stand out as they are upgrading so much better than many very tired properties I viewed.Rooms have everything you need, they are clean & relatively upgraded.The hotel offers many extras at no extra charge- beach towels, snorkelling gear, boxed continental breakfast packs (pastries & fruit), tea, coffee & water, guest washer & dryer.I would definitely stay again & recommend to anyone who is more budget conscious yet wants to be in a great location.

Looks like the motel from scarface, chainsaw scene. Loud rumbling from top floor, ac stinks like mold, spotty wifi. Good location though. I swear this used to be a low income housing complex. Cheapest place near the beach. If you want to impress a significant other, don't come here.

One block from the beach and the friendliest little hotel imagineable! The staff are great and will even lead you to local cheap eats. There is fridg,microwave and coffee pot in room and free use of the washer and dryer. They have free beach towels and beach equipment for your use including chairs, mats, and floats. And a pick up and go breakfast and free coffee in the lobby all the time. Did I mention a lending library. Fun fun place.

Fantastic location- walking distance to everything you need including the beach. Warm and friendly staff who go out of their way to accommodate your special requests and give local insider tips on where to eat, what to see, etc. Clean/quiet room and lovely lanai too. We really enjoyed singing a tune with a cocktail at Wang Chungs and hanging out on the swing chairs in the lobby. Overall, fantastic experience we highly recommend to other visitors who are on a budget, but still want to have a positive hotel experience in Waikiki!

Great location. Terrible TV and Internet. I was unable to connect to the Internet multiple times. The TV was fuzzy and there are only s few channels that worked. Rooms are very small and frames of metal...so don't bump them or it will hurt. The hotel does have a pile of swim gear including snorkeling gear to borrow for free on s first come first serve basis. Parking is $25!!!

"The people make the place," and this hotel has the best people I've seen in all my trips to Honolulu (so many now, I've stopped counting). Best free morning coffee I've ever had! The accommodations are modest, but clean and well kept up. If you're looking for "grand" surroundings, go ask Mr. & Mrs. Thurston Howell III, but if you want a quick walk to Waikiki beach and real smiles at the desk when you return, you'll love this place. The free laundry service has one washer and dryer, so go early, but the staff and the customers all have a mellow yet diligent devotion to this little jewel of a hotel. I will certainly look here again when I book my next trip. Nearby bus lines, some affordable and delicious restaurants, and a Food Pantry supermarket in walking distance,too! 場所より人々はだいじですね。何回もホノルルに行ったことありますが　このホテルは、一番優しかった。ただの朝のコーヒーは、美味しくて、部屋は、安くて地味だ。すうっごいな部屋　欲しければ、お金持ちの友達に相談してね。でも、ワイキキにはやく歩いてく、もどると　暖ったかい笑いを　みたければ、Stay Hotel Waikiki 大好きに　なります。　ただのランドリーは、一向の洗濯機とドライヤーだけですので、朝早い行ったほうがいい。スタフも客さんもメロな真面目な感じです。バス、レストラン、スーパー　全部近くて安いの見つけれるんです。また行くとき　私は、絶対　この国際的なホテルを　調べます！

Lilly at the Front Desk was Gracious to allow us to store our bags before checkin time 4:00 PM.Clean Room White/Blue Decor.Good Amenities, Water, Tea & Newspapers at the Front Desk.Short walk to Kings Court & Ala Wai Blvd.Convenient Location for Public Transportation.Booked on Hotels.com. Great Price.Thank You,
user_name:
kathyfong633
New York City, New York

review_body: We came across this hotel a number of times on our research for hotels in Honolulu. I didn't wanna book it because of the mainly negative reviews on several websites. At the end we decided for this hotel because of the great price and it was simply to be as we have looked at it so many times. The location is perfect, just around the corner from Waikiki Beach, close to shops and restaurants. Our room was very spacious, I didn't expect it to be that big. We had a balcony and en suite bathroom. It was very clean and tidy. All necessary amenities provided such as shampoo and also coffee and tea making facilities. We also decided for the amenity option, which includes a little continental breakfast, beach towels, beach gear such as lilos, wifi and newspaper. We purchased this package for about $10.00 a day for the two of us. And it was just perfect. It was nice to get towels for the beach, the little breakfast in the morning was packed into a box, so we took it with us and had a little picnic on our way. We had a fantastic stay, it was the perfect start to our Hawaii holiday. I am pretty certain I will return to Waikiki Beach one day, and this hotel is where I am going to stay for sure.

My best friend & I visited Oahu for 8 days & stayed at the 'Stay Hotel' for our whole trip. The location of the hotel is perfect, just a few minute walk from the beach & very close to the major shopping area & lots of places to eat. The hotel staff are so friendly & helpful, everyone who worked there that we interacted with was so kind & genuine. The hotel was very affordable & had good reviews which is why we chose to stay there. If you're looking for an affordable hotel at a great location this is the place for you, however if you prefer newly renovated fancy hotels this is definitely not the place for you. The hotel is quite old, the lobby is newly renovated but the rooms are very outdated, we didn't mind because it was clean & the beds were comfortable. All though the bathroom was extremely small, you can't wash your face in the sink without getting water all over the floor, there is also only one mirror in the room, which is fine for most people, but if you're two girls traveling together it makes getting ready in a timely fashion quite difficult. The shower is really small and old. The rooms have air conditioning all though it's not very strong, when you first walk in from outside it feels cold but within minutes of being in your room you're very hot again. If you have a car rental it costs $25/day to have your car parked in the hotel underground parking, that may be standard price for most hotels in the area, however I found that to be ridiculous, I'd think hotel parking would be $10 per day at the very most, but unfortunately we had no other options and had to pay $25/day for parking on top of the daily room fee ($10/day) which they charge you at the end of your stay at check out. I still rated the hotel 4/5 stars because the location is great & the staff are so so nice.

You get what you pay for. 1 1/2 blocks from the beach and transportation. Right across the street from "tour bus alley" behind the Hyatt.Pros: Can't beat the price. Staff was friendly. Room was clean. Grab and go boxes for breakfast. Great place if you need a place to change and sleep. Checked bag service will hold your bag when you get to hotel before check in, or when your airport departure is after checkout. 3 ABC stores within 2 blocks.Cons: Louvered windows let in ALL outside noise. Keep the bathroom door closed to keep the sleeping area cooler. No blackout curtains.We enjoyed our stay - it was what we were looking for - a home base to store our stuff and to sleep at night. It was noisy - as if there were no windows.

Stay Waikiki doesn't try to be anything it isn't. Was clean, comfortable, close to the beach, and most importantly for us, cheap. Just stayed one night before we moved islands. The best part was a maintenance guy they've got. I saw this dude maybe three times and every time he was so friendly and keen to have a chat. That guy needs a raise. I would happily be a repeat customer just to see this guy again.

The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was fantastic. We especially enjoyed grabbing a towel and mat from the front desk and walking to the beach just a block and a half from the hotel. Our room was quite small and tired, but it was a great price for the location. The small parking lot was full both days we were there; parking close by was a must and this was $25 for 24 hours. (My husband stayed here while traveling alone and just took a shuttle to/from the airport and didn't worry about parking.) There are plenty of shops and places to eat just minutes away. After spending a day at the beach, we could walk to the room, clean up, and be at a restaurant within the hour.

The photos depicted on here are not what you see in person. Hotel needs a big refurbishment! Room was dirty and very noisy, so don't expect to get a good nights sleep.The hidden amenities fee which you don't find out until you check in is a joke! Also, wifi is Finnish, keeps dropping in and out which was quite frustrating!We only had 1 night here as we were leaving the next day so was mainly needing a bed to sleep!Far nice places to stay in Waikiki rather than here!

The photos on the website make it look refurbished and modern. It's old, very old and rather dirty. It's not a nice place to stay. There is also an additional $10 amenities fee that isn't mentioned until you get there - which is not acceptable. And it's non optional. They have paid parking bit it was full.It's close to the beach and it's not expensive for Waikiki, anywhere else and it would be extortion. That's what it had going for it.

This place was wonderful. The two girls that I dealt with at the front desk, named Lilly and Erika were an absolute delight. Very professional and lovely personalities. They really know how to deal with the public. This hotel is very nice and clean and is only one block from the beach. Great location.

We had 7 nights at Stay Waikiki great location handy to Waikiki beach ,restaurants and shopping. Friendly staff pick up and go breakfast box, coffeemaker and beach towels was a good idea.Room was clean and tidy towels changed everyday hotel isn't 5 star but is comfortable a little bit noisy at night but quite ok.We will stay there again when we return. Thank you to all the staff we had a fantastic time.

After a long flight was looking forward to arriving at Stay Hotel. The staff were so friendly and helpful upon arrival. There is a $10 resort fee which covered the beach equipment, wifi, and free grab and go breakfast and paper. I found this to be quite reasonable. The room didnt look as shown in the pictures on the website but was perfect for a place to stay. Was only a 2 minute walk to Waikiki Beach and all the shopping and restaurants which was fantastic as it was my first time in Hawaii. I would recommend Stay Hotel and look forward to my next stay there.

A decent hotel for the price and location. Make sure you note that there is a $10/day "resort fee" which I was told covered the complimentary breakfast (muffin, apple, granola bar) and coffee/tea, wi-fi, newspaper, and beach towels and equipment. The wi-fi can be sketchy at times. The room is pretty clean and convenient. Rooms include a fridge and microwave.

Although I got a different room from the advertised picture and there was a loud buzzing noise coming from an unknown source, it was the perfect place to stay for one nights sleep. In the middle of it all and for a good price. The staff were very helpful, no complaints there at all. I even got a view of Waiki Beach!

The hotel was extremely clean. There is a Karaoke bar on the main floor of the hotel and the patrons are very well contained to the bar. They offer a "grab and go" breakfast daily of pastries and fresh fruits. The front desk staff is very accommodating and helpful. We will stay here again as it is 1 block from the beach at the Duke end. There are many excellent restaurants within walking distance.

I was dubious about staying here, but decided to give it a go based on price. It was $500 cheaper than my original choice for the duration of my stay and that was a huge factor. Looking at Expedia and booking.com as well as TripAdvisor, there are a whole lot of different rooms and it would appear that the reviews indicate the differing levels of quality.I had a queen bed room on the 5th floor that faced the front of the building (no view to speak of) but that's ok. It had a/c and was quite roomy. The bathroom was tiny but clean and functional. The bed was quite comfortable and there was plenty of room for me to spread out and re-pack in preparation for my flight home.The wifi was good. I didn't try the breakfast so can't comment on that. The room was very clean and the staff were fantastic. The tv reception was awful but the fridge was great.Here's the thing I agree on with other reviews - it is LOUD. They are going through a refit and that's great, but until it happens expect noise. Trucks, buses, works. I travel with ear plugs and was prepared for noise, but this can be unworkable for some people. The louvres let in every bit of noise and the glass door doesn't do much to block it either. That being said, you're in the middle of Waikiki. I was only there to sleep.

The room pictures presented are non exhistant. We checked into a room we referred to as a "closet",it had slats for windows to allow every noise in and a light outside that shone so brightly you literally didn't need to use inside lighting. The next morning we complained about the accomodations the clerk was apologetic as she stated it's not the first time she's heard this... She immediately found us a better room (though still not as represented) but tolerable and credited back the amenities charged. Great location and staff but the property is a mess.

My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in April 2016 for two nights. We simply wanted a low cost (but safe) place to stay close to Waikiki Beach before heading off to spend the majority of our vacation on the North Shore, and the Stay Hotel was an ideal spot! The best part about this hotel was the location! It is literally a 2 minute walk to the beach and it has many restaurants and convenience stores just meters away from the front door. There is a Burger King, Subway, Korean BBQ spot (Me's BBQ), surf shop, and many other options on the same block as the hotel. On Sunday, there is a small local market (set up on the corner by Burger King), which has fresh fruit and tasty meal options!There is a bus stop just around the corner that can take you to the airport (about 45 mins), Diamond Head (about 15 mins), and many other places. Hotel staff are super friendly and accommodating, and they will provide guidance for bus routes. Stay Hotel also provides beach toys, umbrellas and mats, which we really enjoyed during our stay!The room was small, but comfortable and clean. There was a TV, fridge, coffee maker, hairdryer, and some toiletries provided. We also requested a room with a balcony (no extra cost) and that was a nice place to enjoy your morning coffee (provided free in the hotel lobby, along with a breakfast of pastries, muffins and fruit)!Overall, this hotel is certainly not glamorous, but it is the perfect spot for a young couple looking to travel to beautiful Hawaii on a budget. The staff are great, the location is ideal, and there's tons of stuff within walking distance, so you definitely don't need a car in Waikiki! Although, I certainly highly recommend spending at least half of your trip to Oahu NOT in Waikiki, and renting a car for travelling the rest of the island. There is so much to see (Kualoa Ranch, the North Shore, the much less crowded beaches of north and east coasts) - so enjoy it!

A great place to stay, close to the beach and other amenities. The room was clean and fresh and staff that are friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to budget conscience travellers and would definitely stay there again.

First of all, the location is 5 minutes from Waikiki Beach, which is great. The staff were also super friendly every time I talked to them. However the hotel itself is not great. There is a karaoke bar in the first floor of the hotel that's open till 2 am, so it's super noisy if you're trying to sleep on the 2nd or 3rd floors. The wifi cuts in and out, or sometimes won't connect at all. We stayed in 3 separate rooms, and there was something weird in each. In the first the sink was comedically small. In the second the windows wouldn't open and the faucet leaked. In the third, the door to the bathroom blocked the shower.
