We were four people on holiday, and whilst the hotel is obviously not 5 star we did not pay 5 star prices. The Hotel is clean, comfortable, and extremely well situated. The staff were very helpful, and arranged whatever we requested. We had no complaints whatsoever

The Stay Hotel is a great basic level hotel, close to the beach and is clean and has fantastic staff. Having read many of the reviews I appreciate that this hotel does not claim to be 5* and we also chose not to raise of the concerns with management during our stay. There are many positives to this hotel so my average review is purely to highlight the more basic level of accommodation and facilities.I cannot stress how fantastic the staff were. On arrival they were incredibly helpful and remained throughout. However, I think a 4pm check in is quite late. This was also not advised on our confirmation. I also don't agree with the compulsory charge for extras. I would suggest just putting the price up to cover these "facilities" rather than making a big deal over no real benefits. We didn't use the computer / printer in Reception, or read a newspaper. You can't list the newspaper as "free" and then charge for it.... The room was very basic and not in line with the photos we saw online. I presume that we had one of the rooms yet to be upgraded as both rooms either side were in the progress of being upgraded. I know this as the people working on the room were singing and shouting at 7am. Perhaps they thought they were in the karaoke bar which is part of the hotel on the ground floor...Don't let the karaoke bar put you off. The noise didn't disturb us (we were on the 7th floor) and the staff the in bar are also great fun. It's a cool little bar and we had some good nights in there. Our room wasn't small but it was very noisy due to the slated glass windows. The aircon unit was next to the bed and at the same height so it was impossible to have this on during the night unless you wanted a frozen face. It was also very noisy. Overall the room was just very very basic. The curtains on a bit of string and there are plastic/cardboard cups and no other utensils so almost pointless having a microwave oven. We were only there to sleep though but unfortunately it wasn't even the best night sleep mainly due to the noise and the heat. I suppose you get what you pay for and unfortunately in Hawaii the prices are already high everywhere else so this place was value for money.As I said at the beginning, I didn't raise these concerns so I'm sure the staff would have been very helpful to do what they can but in all honesty, I almost wish I didn't need to raise any of these issues as no matter how basic, they still shouldn't be issues in the first place.

The Stay does not claim to be a 5 star resort and it isn't. But it is in a great location and all the staff were helpfull and friendly. They provide a grab and go box for breakfast which while not enough for a grown man was better than nothing. Great hotel clean,safe and value for money.

My Man and I arrived there around 3;00 p.m. so we were looking forward to getting our room and freshening up and going out to enjoy the rest of the afternoon. That was not the case. Instead the woman tells us they don't have a room available at their hotel because it's over booked! But they are going to give us a bigger room at their other hotel. Which she said was just across the street. When the young man carried our luggage through the back, past the laundry down some stairs and across the back lane where he pointed to an iron gate and told us, its over there and didn't seem like he was going to walk any further with the heavy luggage. Well, then things went sideways after that! My Man said "Stop that's it were going back!" So we crossed the lane again and went up some stairs past two women doing the laundry and back to the reception. We were not impressed to say the least This was not acceptable and we were ready to leave.Then the young man who had carried the luggage got on the computer and found us a room on the 3rd floor of their hotel. Imagine that! So with hesitation we decided to take a look at it since we only needed the room for one night. So we decided to stay. The next day, at check out they told us there was a mandatory fee for the hospitality services, breakfast, coffee, internet and floats for the beach that we didn't use.I looked at the girl, which was the same girl from the day before and said You can wave the fee because there was no hospitality and no service. So she said she would have to ask her manager and would be right back. When she came back 2 minutes later, she said her manager was in a meeting but she had the authority to wave the fee. Oh really? That was so nice of her. While waiting in the reception area for our ride, the manger of the hotel came out to apologize and explain to us that the room in the back alley was really an upgrade if we had taken a look. She was very nice. but a little too late. I don't feel this hotel is even worth 100 dollars. However the location is close to the beach which is wonderful.

Pros:- Right downtown in good location for walking around Waikiki- Has parking (see Cons about this too)- Friendly staff that was very accommodating and always had smiles on their faces- Clean rooms (though VERY small. See Cons)- Free beach towels for the day- Air-conditioned room via window unit- Small balcony- Great showerhead- Free WiFiCons:- About 10 parking spaces under the hotel in garage for small vehicles at a steep price of $25 a day.- I can't speak for what other rooms looked like, but ours (room #804) was 8'x9'-- EXTREMELY small. Only one person could stand in the bathroom at a time and if you sit down on the toilet, your face was pretty much over the sink. I don't think I have ever seen a room and bathroom this small in my life. None of the pictures online showed this small of a room.- Bring your earplugs, as you can pretty much hear everything going on downtown since the bathrooms have slatted windows that don't really seal out any noise and carry into your room.Overall, this hotel reminded me of a small hostel and is only a place to lay your head at night. We spent most of the time at beaches and purposely "Stay"ed away from the hotel because our room was sooo tiny. The saving grace for Stay Hotel was the staff. They were very friendly and kind. The hotel was also clean, as was our tiny room each night we returned, so no complaints there.

I used my left over Asia miles to book this place. Truly I had no great expectations about this hotel. However I was pleasantly surprised. It is in a very central location near Waikiki. The staff are very friendly and it was nice to be able to upgrade the room. Our first room was on the 8th floor and just above our closet was the roof fan. The sound was like a constant 100 car freight train rumbling over the roof. Be aware of the 8th floor.Also the location was close to the pickup area for local tours. See my review of 5 star Hoku tour and Polynesian Cultural center as I will be reviewing them as well.

Very nice and close to beach. Decent price. Nothing fancy but that is to be expected for the price. You have to walk (1) block for food and shops but that is no issue to me. You will be at beach in 3 blocks. Nice lobby and decent wifi. Have a daily resort fee but acceptable due to wifi.

We stayed here for a few nights on our travels. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The location is good, ABC store on the corner and the beach is just around the corner. Also plenty of places to eat around and the shops including Apple, Macy's, footlocker etc are only 5 mins away by foot.There was free coffee downstairs which you could help yourself to any time of day as well as having coffee making facilities in you're room. I thought the hotel was a little overpriced, however this seems to be in keeping with the area.

We stayed for 2 nights for girls trip. Great location being only 1 street away. Breakfast available but is part of the compulsory additional fees that you may when you get there. Was approximately $10/day. Room was clean and staff friendly We requested early check in on booking as flight arrived at 0630. Check in usually 4pm. Only on arrival did staff tell us that check in would be at 1600 and this couldn't change. Thought they could have at least let us know in advance when this was requested. Very unhelpful in regards to getting into our room even a hour earlier.

This was my first visit to Hawaii. I was just looking for something for a night, nothing fancy. The place was great value and an amazing location, you can't ask for better at that price! The place was clean, bed was comfy and they had a TV and microwave, which is handy. If you have the right expectations you will find it has everything you need.

I requested an upper floor because I had read the reviews about street noise. I stayed in room 403, which has been newly renovated and was quite spacious with an ample closet, fold out couch, queen comfy bed, fridge/micro, desk, comfy chair. There are some truck backup beeping noises in the mornings but I travel with earplugs and the whir of the AC unit made it tolerable. Great free beach towels, beach chairs and water flotation devices. Free coffee all the time in the lobby. Best of all were the amazing staff, who were genuinely so friendly and helpful. I usually stay at a Hyatt or Marriott for work travel but I am so glad I opted for this smaller, more real hotel. My room was super-clean and well cared for. I was a little concerned that it would be a noisy party scene but nights were quiet and peaceful. There was a great vibe with the other guests, and everyone seemed so happy to have found this place. Everything was in great working order. I paid about $100 per night--excellent value and a really warm and friendly place. True aloha spirit here--don't miss out!

This place is a dump. I wouldn't pay more than $30 for this place. Even if it's in Waikiki area. At first glance you'd actually think your taxi made a mistake and dropped you off in a hoStel, read that again. It is not a hotel but a HOOSSSTEL. I almost died when they charged me for a "resort" fee! The only thing that's resort like the picture on travel book! The lobby is the only thing id consider updated. The rooms will remind you of your dorm room back in college and they happily charge $85! Goodluck trying to sleep the noise on the road is audible, its also atop a gay bar so if you're into that maybe its for you. I have reported them to Trip Advisor for deceptive practices by posting a misleading pictures. The pictures of the rooms and building in their website are so different than the original. I actually took a photo of their room.

We rented two rooms , both were great . The staff was friendly and provided prompt service. The laundry services are free just bring your own soap, small go pack breakfast is offered along with coffee . The hotel sits two short streets over from the beach. Shopping is all around you from every side . Your right in the middle of everything , highly recommend .

We experience numerous issues during our 2 night stay.The largest issue was that the toilet was broken - I believe the chain broke off from the ball in the tank. Not only could we not use the toilet but it ran all night in addition to the shower which was also leaking - it was difficult to get a good night's sleep due to the noise.Lastly, we couldn't adjust the air conditioner - which was blasting at 61 degrees. We tried changing the temperature as well as the speed and though the lights changed on the display, nothing would change. We were only able to turn the unit off.We approached the front desk about fixing the toilet in the morning but it seemed that they couldn't get maintenance out in time so we just used the toilet in the main lobby. The desk manager, Stacy Murata, was very nice but ultimately wasn't able to help us and told us to contact the general manager, Carolyn Pinho. I wrote her a lengthy email detailing the many problem we had in our hotel a week ago and I never heard back from her. This hotel is a trashy motel masquerading as a boutique hotel. Don't be fooled by the management photos - I didn't want to touch anything in the room. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that it is close to the beach.

When we arrived we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom 2 bath suite! This was great because there were 5 of us sharing 1 room. The room was very spacious and clean. The windows all opened to create a nice breeze when we left our front door open, which we did often. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, we pre shipped to big boxes for a convention we were attending, and they held them for us without any problems.On our trips to the beach we were able to borrow beach towels and swimming equipment, floaty tubes beach chairs ect.While waiting for our party to get together we often hung out in the lobby on the swinging chairs, which were super comfy and fun!Love those chairs!Also in the lobby was a karaoke bar Wang Chungs , some of our party always made that their last stop for drinks right before bed.Also cant beat the location, right next to an ABC store and a 1 minute walk from Waikiki Beach. Very important for me, since I cant miss a sunset.They have grab and go breakfast consisting of pastries and fruit. If you need a more eggy breakfast head over to Shorefrye across the street, or grab a spam masubi a block away at the masubi cafe. Book your parking early with them for a convenient underground spot, tight fit if you have a larger vehicle , which we did, but we managed to snag the wall spots each day. If not there are plenty of parking structures with walking distance.Would definitely book again, felt like our own apartment building by the time we left.Thank you Stay Waikiki ='.'=

This hotel looks good from the street, but is completely different behind the facade. The location is fantastic for the price but the rooms are grubby, tiny and in desperate need of renovation. I doubt any money has been spent on the rooms since construction ( which I estimate to be around 1960). The air conditioning did nothing for the room, if you want to feel cool, it's necessary to sit directly in front of the unit. Out-dated louvre windows(!), floor tiles that are so stained, they need to be ripped up. Very little room between the bed and the bathroom (I'm thin and had to walk sideways!)ONE bedside table (no room for another!) lumpy, springy bed in dire need of replacement and the same can be said for the hideous basin and tapware! This hotel is very busy and clearly management do not care about re-investing profits to improve the place. When we got out of the elevator (which was incredibly fast!) I thought I was in a third-world hotel. You have to spend money to make money. Our room wasn't ready, so we were upgraded, which was nice, but I'd hate to see what our pre-upgrade room would've looked like! We stayed two nights and couldn't wait to move onto greener pastures and are so glad we did!Pros: Customer service at reception was unbeatable, those girls are really good at their jobs!Wifi in roomsFast elevatorsLocation. Right behind one of the five star hotels. Cons: Over-priced, poorly-appointed, never-renovated hotel.

We spent three nights at this hotel and found it more than adequate for a vacation where we wanted to save money on the accommodation so that we could spend on other things!Right in the heart of Waikiki, the main shops and beautiful Waikiki beach just around the corner. Pick up for tours and Luaus just outside the door - what could be more convenient. We found that the staff at the Stay Hotel were lovely people: genuine, friendly, knowledgeable and willing to go the extra mile for any problem that we had. The room was comfortable with a unique mod style of stark white walls with a feature perspex orange and blue hibiscus bedhead. Not quite as spectacular looking as their photos on the internet but nearly! The rooms were cleaned and beds made every day. Our Boutique Queen was quite spacious and there was frosted glass over one entire wall letting in plenty of light whilst shielding out an unattractive view of the apartments next door. The bathroom was a bit below par: cramped and tired looking decor-wise. We were on the 3rd floor near the front of the hotel and pleased that we could not hear the Karaoke Bar that operates on the 1st floor although there was a constant hum of generators/air conditioning type sounds and service vehicles collecting glass recycling. I bought some ear plugs (just in case this might prevent me sleeping) and slept soundly each night.My tip for lovers of coffee and hanging out in tropical ambiance: Right across the road you can hang out in the Atrium at the base of the Hyatt where there is a water feature, tropical plants, shops, and the best coffee shop in Waikiki, also a night Farmers market on Tuesdays and Thursdays!
user_name:
Rosalind M
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: the location was perfect! close to the beach and shopping and all amenities. The room was just perfect - always clean and comfortable beds. There was a fridge and microwave as well. I loved that there was coffee and breakfast treats too. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone! The staff are so friendly and they make you feel welcome.

Hotel is well located, with close proximity to the beach as well as being located close to shopping and dining options. Found staff to be extremely friendly and helpful, with assisting with arranging early morning transport and wake up call.

All the staff, without exception were very friendly and helpful. The room was kept beautifully clean throughout. Lovely balcony with views of beach. All facilities excellent. Very pleased with grab and go breakfast and free loan of beach equipment. Would DEFINATELY recommend and will come again

Great location staff very helpful with buses and taxis would stay here again plus plenty of food and clothes shop by as well as so close to the beach plus free coffee and snacks for breakfast and the price was great as well rooms where very clean too

We enjoyed our 3-day "Stay" at this hotel. The Stay hotel is just around the corner from high-end hotels that you pay 3 times as much for. The desk staff is very friendly and the rooms are very clean.

Windows do not fully close therefore, it is very noisy and get woken up by sirens, beeping horns and people talking on their phones outside the room. The curtains don't serve it's purpose and lots of light shines through making it difficult to sleep in. There is no main ceiling light - need to use a standing lamp. Other than the mentioned, the location and amenities ie: snack box, wifi, beach gear, washing machine are a plus. If you're a light sleeper, do not stay here. If you're looking for convenience, it is ideal.

A party of 5 and the first stop on our epic 4 week USA TRIP ! Fantastic location, closed to shops, beach, malls, and attractions. More of a hostel than hotel but this didn't bother us. Breakfast was just what we needed before we heading out to look and experience the great state that Hawaii is !! I am of a view that a hotel is just a place to rest your head, and why would you spend all your time in a hotel when u are in Honolulu !

We stayed at the Stay Hotel on the first week of March 2016, the room looked nothing like the picture but it was nice and clean the shower were Hot and Great. But the bed frame left a small hole in my leg. Hoping they willupgraded the beds before I return. The employees were awesome and very attentive. Love the distance from from the hotel to the beach.

The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The room was secure, super clean, and was well stocked. I would definitely stay here again. It beats all the other experiences I've had in Waikiki. We also found it pretty quiet at night compared to other places we have stayed in the area.

Recently stayed here for 5 nights. You can't beat the perfect location (close to beach & lots of food options just steps away from hotel). The staff was very nice and accommodating. The breakfast treats you get in the morning were perfect for taking to the beach. The wifi did go in and out but wasn't a big deal--you're in Hawaii you should be disconnected from that stuff anyway. Loved our stay, would stay here again!!

Thanks all for previous reviews. This was exactly as we expected. Unmatchable location for the price. Literally behind some of the top hotels in Waikiki and only a portion of the price. The rooms are clean and basic. We had a room at the end of the building and it was a little noisy (traffic and pedestrian noise). WIFI was unreliable in the room but the Hotel gave us a discount as a result. Breakfast snack and 24/7 coffee was a great idea. Hotel staff very helpful.

Stay hotel is a comfortable, smaller hotel in the heart of Waikiki. My wife and I stayed 10 days here and were most impressed by the location, friendly staff eager to go above and beyond to assist in finding attractions and providing directions, and the spacious rooms. From the balcony, you can see the Pacific Ocean.

This was a great little room for the price. The room was clean, modern and compact. The staff were nice and accommodating. The hotel was within walking distance to the beach and fine shopping such as fendi, channel, Louis Vuitton and many other stores. There were many restaurants to chose from. I would definitely stay here the next time I was at Waikiki beach.

The perfect hotel for travellers like me with a limited budget who still want to make the most of their vacation. I travelled to Hawaii because I'm the biggest fan of the TV show "Hawaii Five-0" and wanted to visit the home of my favorite show and cast - but didn't have a lot of money to spend. I booked the hotel through expedia.de and got the 'Deal of the Day' with a great price :)You should not expect a luxury resort or very large rooms but the Stay Hotel definitely offers best value for reasonable prices. The room was clean, had a balcony, large TV, coffee-machine, microwave and refrigerator etc. and, thus, met all my needs perfectly. In the hotel lobby, there were couches and a large TV screen, two computers (that I used regularly), a snack and beverage vending machine, book-shelf and an ATM - which also worked for ec/Maestro cards).There was even a small breakfast snack pack included (1 small muffin, 1 small bagel, 1 orange or apple) and coffee which you could pick up in the lobby each morning.What stood out the most was the super-friendly staff (front-desk and housekeeping) and the perfect location in the heart of Waikiki. There were shops and restaurants all around (incl. fast-food places, ABC stores for groceries etc. and the King's village with a small farmers market three nights per week from 4-9 p.m.). The bus and trolley stops were all within walking distance (1-3 minutes) and, of course, the beach was also just a 1-minute walk away and offered best views of the sunset every night.If I make it back to Hawai'i (which I hope) from Germany some day, I will definitely stay at the Stay Hotel again.

We booked for a 5 night stay and a follow up stay after returning from another island for a further three nights. We booked here as we wanted a two bedroom apartment that was in a good location. Stay came up and when compared to the other options with vacancy at the time we needed, the rates were much better than the rest.We turned up and it looked a little dated but the reception area seemed revamped and tidy. We were placed in a room on the first floor - it had a bedroom to the right and then the main living area had a couch & the second bed. The room was unfortunately warm due to a) the glass venetian style windows and b) the location of the air conditioner (just off the floor in the corner). There was an ABC store on the next corner and it was just one block to waikiki beach. All seemed well.The first night is when it all unfolded. Turns out the room was directly above Wang Chungs and there was no sound proofing whatsoever. It was loud. Not just loud, but the floor vibrated from the bass. It got worse as the night went on and all the drunken karaoke singers began shouting into the microphone. To make things worse, the first bedroom was right on the main thoroughfare to all the rooms and had the same glass venetian windows. The noise from the traffic was compounded by the lights in the hall & from the building next door which was very close, making it almost impossible to sleep. The room remained lit up the entire evening.We raised the issue the next morning and we were brushed off saying they had no control over Wang Chung. When asked to be moved, even into two separate single rooms, we were declined and told it wouldn't happen. The "best" they could do was waive the amenity fee for one day and if we wanted to complain again, they could "ask" WC to turn their music down. Even ear plugs didn't make a big difference.We only got sleep two nights of the stay - they were the two nights we ended up inebriated enough that falling asleep was inevitable. We cancelled our second stay and I would strongly recommend that you consider very carefully whether light & sound until ~2am is something you can withstand (night after night) before booking your stay here.

The location was amazing! Just a block from the beach, walking distance to everything, it was awesome! The hotel itself was cute and modern, the room was quite small but clean and all we needed as we were really only there to sleep. The staff was super friendly and went above and beyond if we needed anything. The only thing was it didnt have a pool… but then again the beach is a block away!Definitely recommend it!!

I stayed in a "boutique" room, and I won't lie, it was tiny. It lacked a desk or even chairs (except for a fairly cheap set on the balcony) and the bathroom was one of the smallest I've ever used--but it DID have a very nice shower. Despite this, I ended up really enjoying my stay. Why? It is ONE BLOCK from the beach. Nestled in the middle of a number of larger (and more expensive) hotels, Stay Hotel Waikiki put me right in the middle of Waikiki beach on a budget. And the 24 hour service at the desk down front had answers for all sorts of questions--they helped me figure what bus to take (I had no car) to get to all sorts of destinations, ideas on how to spend my day, and even held my key so that I could go for a swim one morning (I was traveling by myself). The Karaoke bar on the ground floor, Wang Chung's, is a fun way to spend the evening on a weekend, too. The room seemed a little less clean than I would have expected, but I found I was tracking lots of sand in. Despite this, the maid service was very diligent and I found the room well kept whenever I returned in the afternoon. While it may feel a bit rough for a full family or someone on a business trip, for young adults who will spend little time in their rooms, it's very good! (Please note: I got an Expedia deal on the room that ended up costing me about $110 a day; paying more for what I had would have felt like less of a deal.)

Very friendly hotel with the entire staff and great location. Room size was ok, but I suppose the one with balcony would be even better. The only thing they should really improve is cleanliness - would recommend daily floor and bathroom cleaning.

We came to Hawaii for a family wedding and stayed 4 nights in the Stay Hotel. We had a small twin room and although it was very small, it was adequate for our needs, clean and very affordable. We had a balcony with 2 plastic chairs and small table. There wasn't enough room on the floor for both our suitcases, however, the beds were high off the floor, which allowed us to put our bags under the bed. There was a complimentary breakfast pack of 2 pieces of fruit and a muffin, available at reception each morning. There was a guest laundry and free wifi. The staff were really friendly and helpful. I'd stay again, but in a bigger room.
user_name:
deroman50
Orange, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Amazing staff very friendly! Very nice hotel with access to everything in walking distance!!! Can't beat the price!! I would definitely stay here again!!!! The pictures are the views from our room!!! Fresh farmers market everyday that opens at 4pm right down the street from hotel. Access to all the shops and restaurants literally within walking distanced of everything. Stay hotel Waikiki was the best place for my first time staying in Hawaii!!!! Go check them out for sure!!!!

Came to Hawaii for a family funeral. Booked a package deal with airfare and car and really enjoyed the 4 nights stay. Hotel provides everything you need plus a basic breakfast every morning, staffs are friendly and helpful. Hotel is just 5 minutes to the beach, Diamond Head monument is just 10 minutes away. We came from Colorado and the time is 3 hour ahead so the first night we had problem sleeping due to the loud noise from the street but after that we kind get use to it. If you just want a place to stay in Waikiki and don't want to spend too much money, this place is for you. We will come back to this hotel next time.

We booked a one night stay at this hotel before we flew home after a two week stay in Hawaii. We had already stayed in Waikiki at another hotel, so had a comparison. Price wise this was about the same as the other hotel, but the room was smaller, décor more tired and location was noisy due to building work next door. The location is central, staff are friendly and there are towels/beach equipment you can borrow, which are all pluses. However, I don't think I would have wanted to spend anymore than a couple of nights at this hotel and found similar priced accommodation in the area offered better value.

+++Booked as part of package with airfare and had zero problems or confusion. Stayed 7 nights and shared with adult daughter first then sister, we all loved the desk staff and housekeeping teams' attentiveness. Tub/shower was excellent. Tile floors in room rather than nasty hotel carpet. Great guest washer & dryer provided included in amenities charge, not coin op. ---Weak WiFi. Security lights shine into room at night. Noise from trash collection before dawn.

Nice place if you're on a budget. Only two blocks from the water and has nice modern rooms. Each room only has a window ac unit, but that's enough to make it comfortable. They also let you use whatever beach gear they have so you might not have to purchase a boogie board.

Stayed here for a few nights and we really enjoyed convenient location a block off of the beach. The hotel is also small which we saw as a plus as it wasn't overly busy in the lobby. The front desk staff was very helpful with questions and had contacts with cabs that promptly arrived to take us to area destinations. The room was very clean and the layout was different than standard hotel design which was refreshing. The hotel didn't offer anything special that wowed us comfort/amenity wise, but we felt it wasn't necessary since we spent a lot of time outside of the room. Don't expect any kind of view and in our opinion don't waste the extra money elsewhere for a view because it's better to be out enjoying the islands anyway. Would absolutely stay here again.

The name of the hotel might be called "stay" however that's one thing you do not want to do . I pre booked and paid online for one nights accommodation due to an oversight on my behalf with another hotel , leaving me without accommodation for that night . On arrival to STAY HOTEL WAIKIKI , I was asked for my credit card details , I was curious as to why and was informed that there was a 50 USD fee as a security bond (not completely unusual however the surprise was a little annoying ) a 11USD utility fee to cover beach towels and pool equipment .... Please note there is no pool on this site so I'm a little confused why this fee was a compulsory fee at all, given coffee and tea facilities are normally provided in the overall cost of paying for accommodation at any other hotel, motel or resort . And the third fee was 25USD for parking for the day . Now after they deducted the additional funds of nearly 90 USD i was provided with my room key and was utterly shocked in the state of the room , I wasn't expecting anything fancy and I've never felt compelled to write a review before but here I am .... Mold on the blinds and curtains , unknown hair on linen and the coffee machine was already clogged with an old coffee bag witch just showed the level of cleanliness of the room , overall I stayed the night feeling dirty and ripped off .. Not the best way to spend day one of your Hawaiian stay . Avoid staying at "stay" ! Unfortunately the photos I've included don't do it justice ... The only light apart from a light in the bathroom is two lamps .. No ceiling light unfortunately (probably to hide the poor effort of cleaning )

Staff are the best, Staci was terrific from the time I made the reservation til I checked out! The other staff members are the best, Tanya on nights and everyone else I met there. Location, a block to the beach and 2 short blocks to the bus. Most of the tour busses pick right across the street. They have beach supplies to use like chairs, floats, etc. My room was small but had a tiny balcony, fridge, microwave, coffee pot, tv, and shower. I prefer a bathtub but it was fine. If you are looking for a luxury room or ocean view you would probably be happy somewhere else. If you want a good clean room with the best staff and wonderful location, give it a try! I would be to return!

A cursory glance at the reviews for Stay Waikiki will yield something similar to the title line of this review, and it's absolutely true. The location of Stay is fantastic, and so is the service, but other things could do with some improvements.As I mentioned, the location of this place is terrific. Merely steps from the beach, and major bus lines are located just moments away. The staff is super friendly and helpful. However, keep your expectations for everything else in check. When you arrive at Honolulu International, what is your first impression? Mine was, "wow, this is an old airport". I'd have to say that goes for a lot of the hotels on Waikiki as well, as it seems a lot were built probably 40 years ago or so. Stay Waikiki suffers from the same problems, it is an old building. So if you are looking for something newer, you will likely have to look elsewhere.We were on the 8th floor during our stay (which is the top floor). Our room pleasantly looked nothing like the pictures, so it did not have the tiling you see in some of the photos, but some sort of snap together flooring that resembled carpets. Not exactly sure what the proper terminology is for it, but it is better than tile.Our bed was soft and welcoming after a day of travel, but too soft towards the middle. It could definitely use some extra support. We did not have a headboard. The room also lacks a full mirror which my wife found frustrating.The washroom is where the building shows it's age. However, old doesn't mean bad, just worn. It seemed clean enough, so no complaints about it from us.We did have an incident with a small lizard (it certainly wasn't a bug) climbing around our ceiling, but it was easy enough to harmlessly guide outside. One of the perks, I suppose of a tropical environment.I will say you can expect to be woken up in the early hours of the morning when the garbage truck makes it's rounds. The windows are slatted (I don't know the term for this style of window) so it's not exactly noise proof. I'd imagine staying on anything lower than the 6th floor would make for a much nosier stay. Bring earplugs for sure. There is also a Karaokee bar which can cause some noise at night, but was not discernible to our ears on the 8th floor.We were charged an amenity fee for the breakfast/wifi which was separate from the hotel fees. I forget the amount but I believe it is $10 a day. Breakfast consisted of a muffin, a mini bread and a piece of fruit. Coffee is also available. Parking clocks in at $25 a night in the convenient underground parking, but I think there are only 16 stalls. If it is full, you may need to park elsewhere.Our room had a mini fridge and a microwave as well. It would be extra nice if the hotel provided slippers for the guests for each room though (especially considering the number of Asian tourists that visit).Overall it was a positive visit and the location cannot be beat. Beach towels and flotation devices are also complementary. Anything you are lacking can also be picked up at the ABC store a couple doors down. Also, a big thank you to the helpful staff who helped make our stay pleasant.Mahalo!

Look the summary is trying to find something in the heart of Waikiki at this location (which is by far the best area) is next near impossible....As you would guess however you get what you pay for. This is not a lux resort so if thats what your looking for whip out your wallet and head down the street. Its a place to sleep and leave to get to the activities on the main drag and of course the beach...With that being said though if you are SENSITIVE TO NOISE PLEASE READ: request a room that is on the 6th floor or higher. Or else you will have one hell of a time falling and keeping asleep. Tour buses frequent this street due to its location and the jealousy windows which provide little noise reduction on top of that you will hear very often slamming of doors on and around the 3rd floor. How do I know? the first night we were on the 3rd floor and it was honestly unreal I had never experienced anything like it. We powered through but requested a different room in the morning. Jayar and Jovie from the front desk were really good to us and deserve a big shout out. We were moved to a 6th floor suite and it was significantly better....summary: you get what you pay for; however, sometimes you can bend the rules in your favour.

The staff at this hotel were so friendlier and nice that they immediately made me feel at home! This added to the nice rooms really made my stay here seem quite wonderful! They even gave us a free upgrade to a better room because all their suites were not booked the night we flew in. I would stay here again!
user_location: One Hundred Mile House, British Columbia, Canada
user_name:
Jordan L
One Hundred Mile House, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: Rooms are dingy breakfast consists of granola bars and fruit which isn't included in your bill. I will not be going back. I heard several complaints while I was there about TV remotes missing, wifi not working

Shocking to say the least. Old, Dirty, two army cots, not one chair or table, no where to hang your wet bath towels or wet bathing suits. Yellow goop running down the inside of the main door. Very noisy with traffic and staff yelling to one another in the outside hallways. Close to the ocean is the only positive here, however in a little seedy area! The price should have been half!

Of course...nice location...but...on booking server is nice picture with spaceful room with two big beds...we had a small room, which looked like a prison cell. Internet didn´t work neither in room, nor in lobby...and blight on the ceiling in bathroom...staff was very surprised, when we told them this fact...

The location is great, only a short walk from the beach. The staff made the stay pleasant. It must be said, that the hotel is in need of renovation.There is no pool available, but Waikiki beach is close.Furthermore, the breakfast is a put-off. Stay with the coffee. The noise from the street is a problem as there are no proper windows that can be shut.The staff saves the impression
user_name:
traveller-honolulu
New York City, New York

review_body: the only good thing about this hotel stay was the customer service. They where very polite. However we requested several things like better house keeping, which only came once out whole 8 days, a remote to the tv which wasn't there, and for our trash to be taken out more than once our whole stay. None of our requests where met. The breakfast was cheap, and the "luxury condos" we stayed in where not so luxury. You get what you pay for I guess! If it looks to good to be true chances are it is. They forget to mention the condos are on the corner block between a rental car dealership and a garbage company. So expect it to stink 24/7 and to be woken up 7am sharp every day to car alarms being tested and dumpsters being banged around by trucks. The windows in Hawaii to the condos are only shutters so you hear EVERYTHING going on. Would not recommend staying here unless it's in the actual hotel. Even then don't expect much... Will not ever stay at this place again.

You can't beat the value of this hotel in relation to it's location. We were a short 3 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. The hotel staff was amazing!! They were so friendly, always a greeting when you walked in the door. The room was always clean and fresh. On the down side, the noise from the tour busses that gathered on the street in the mornings was loud. Our room was on the 4th floor so there was no view, except of the apartments next door. The water pressure from the shower was weak at best, which made it difficult to shower. Also the hot water would fade in and out, so there was a drizzle of cold water every few minutes. The Wifi didn't work most of the time, and the TV channel selection didn't include any national news channels (which was probably good). Other than those few things the hotel was not bad and like I said the staff was friendly and helpful, Great ALOHA spirit! Anyway, you're in Hawaii so why stay in the hotel room? Go to the beach! The hotel staff did explain that they were going through renovations. I hope the next time we stay there these issues are taken care of. That would make this hotel an excellent value.

Stayed here with my partner for 10 nights. The room was nice and bright and colourful and comfortable enough for our stay. It did get ridiculously hot in the room and the air conditioner was quite small and needed to be on ALL DAY to keep the room comfortable enough to stay in.Unfortunately for us, the windows of the room were a shutter style and therefore didn't close properly. They let a lot of noise in from the back street and the windows let in a lot of light. I'd probably recommend to request a room at the front of the property as the noise on the backstreet can get quite loud... Please note... Whilst the location is pretty awesome and the beach is a stone's throw away... the streets heading away from the beach can be quite rough at night... Just be on your guard. There are a few ladies of the night floating around as well.There is a fun Karaoke bar downstairs and the hotel provides breakfast... Health freaks won't be happy as it is mainly cake style pastries and toast with jellies (very sugary jam-like spreads) Didn't rate the breakfast highly, but it was free and was OK for a few days. You'll probably want to have something different after a few days so I recommend... If you're on a budget, head to the ABC store up the street (there is one on every corner) and buy yourself a yoghurt and museli bowl for a few dollars and a juice... or if you can splurge, go to one of the many cafes and restaurants in the area. They also sell granola bars, sandwiches, salads and everything else you need (including alcohol and munchies)There is free wifi at the hotel which is great for uploading your favourite holiday snaps and there is an internet cafe for printing and surfing the web.Downsides of this hotel were: Cleaning of the rooms wasn't consistent. You generally should leave a few bucks tip on the bed for the cleaners... but every day they were pretty inconsistent... A few times they left the floor sandy or didn't make the bed or replace toiletries... but I guess this happens from time to time. There is no pool, but you don't really need one with the beach across the street.All in all, it was pretty comfortable and I would probably stay here again. The feel was more like a upmarket backpackers with private rooms. Majority of guests were young adults 20-30's and party goers. Probably wouldn't recommend for older couples as the creature comforts are minimal... But if you're after a comfortable room to share with your partner, close to the beach and walking distance to everything fun... whilst not spending a fortune... this place is for you!

I stayed at the Stay hotel for the first time in 2012. At first, I wasn't very happy with my room. It was dark with one tiny window and I wasn't crazy about the cell block walls. The front desk staff at the time were very easy going with accommodating me with a nicer room on an upper floor (6th thru 8th floors have lanai balconies). The room was very clean, bed was comfy, lanai was perfect, and the AC made the cutely decorated room feel nice and cool. After having such a nice experience, I decided to spend my birthday this past Feb 2016 again at the Stay, with my boyfriend. Tanya was extremely helpful over the phone with helping me reserve the same room, 4 years later! Kudos to her :)The hotel is located one short block from the beach and an ABC store is conveniently located right on the corner. The hotel has parking, gives beach towels, and provides little pastries for breakfast. The wifi was a little spotty in the room, but after notifying the front desk, they were able to fix it and had no issues after that.Even though we spent most of our time on the beach, we always came back to our room cleaned and towels replaced. The mini fridge was a big plus and I loved that it was always quiet at night.Big, big, THANK YOU to Jayar for allowing us to check out one hour after normal check out time on our last day. We really appreciate you holding our luggage after check out and especially for keeping our lei's in your refrigerator! You're the best!I definitely recommend staying at this boutique hotel! I would love to relocate to Hawaii and hopefully one day work at this hotel!
user_name:
EandJLove
New York City, New York

review_body: the hotel is sufficient for what you need - comfy bed, spacious and your own bathroom. because honolulu is so stunning i was hardly in my room.the staff were so friendly and the location was brilliant - so close to the beach and to bus routes and activity pick up locations.i would definitely stay here again

Was not worth the money spent! Beds were on some kind of ply wood with sharp corners hurt leg on it. Room was clean thats about it. Charged me extra for internetEven if i didn't use it!!! Also believe its right next door to a college dorm / hostel of some sort. Over all I could have stayed in a much nicer hotel for the same $$$. very over priced!!

Great location about 30 seconds away from the beach. The room was great and had a great ac system. I would absolutely recommend this hotel. Everyone that works here is super nice and they make you feel like they have known you for a while.

The staff are probably the very best in the hospitality industry. This is belated, but a while back, at the break of dawn (Honolulu time), I got a call from back East from my employer explaining that he needed a complex packet of files not only emailed to him, but assembled carefully as well-- and IMMEDIATELY!Tanya was manning the desk and she went the extra mile to help me get my documents in order for preparation and sending off.Her tech savvy helped out a lot, too.My strongest thanks and recommendation for Stay Waikiki, and Tanya.
user_name:
Kash K
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: A great little hotel in a very convenient location. This hotel has some very nice people working for them & they all treated me very well (as I have had a stroke) & helped me with my bags etc. There are things that the locals can tell you were a big hotel might not be as happy as these people to tell you where (as a local) you should go. There a are few down points, like the early morning builders all over the area, loud garbage trucks that make a lot of noise but, if you can get over that, it is really a good place to stay.

This hotel is in a great location of Waikiki, you're less than a 5 minute walk to the beach and near most of the shops restaurants. Most hotels in Waikiki are dated and this is no exception, it does look like some areas have been refurbished. I was tossing up between average and very good but the loud noises that woke us up at 7am both mornings and the bright lights from the hotel next door do make it hard to get a good nights sleep. Also even by pre paying for the hotel, was still stung with a $20 amenities fee. On the positive side, it isn't that expensive for the area, the room sizes aren't bad and there is coffee provided in the lobby. Also did like how there was a microwave in the room. The breakfast is simple but enough to start your day and not feel hungry. The staff at the front desk are super friendly as well. Overall it wasn't a bad stay, just some things they could work on such as getting the curtains to block out the light from next door.

My first review wasn't published, probably too many complaints, so short and sweet - stay well clear of it, it is a dump. Internet/fax didn't work, grab and go breakfast included, overpriced, noisy, drab furnishings, out of the 1950's.

Going to make this simple and a quick read. We have traveled here before and I decided to get a little lower end hotel. Here is what it's like.Sleeping- the noise starts at 530am and doesn't stop till 230am. You can hear everything going on. Trash trucks busses from the neighboring hotel. If your a light sleeper or wanna sleep in this will not work. Also the bar downstairs plays music till230am and it's loud. This could be that we were on the 2nd floor right above the bar practically. The bed is super stiff because it is low to the ground set directly on plywood.Parking- the $25 daily fee is crazy!!! If your lucky you can park in a few spots on he same street. If not, do like we did and park by the park by the beach. It's about a 5 min walk and it's free. There are plenty of little spots to park around the hotel. If you want the added security then pay. There are some shady people going in and out at times I think due to the rate but if you use the room to sleep and shower it will work. It truly is a awesome location. We would stay again but if your used to the Hilton this is not your cup of tea! Lol

The Photo's from the website show these cool modern rooms, that is not the case, maybe there is one room like that one in the photo but it was not mine. The hotel is sandwiched between two low end apartment buildings and is across from the service entrance of another big hotel. Noisy all night long, micro sized bathroom, The WiFi was a joke, rarely worked. $25.00 a day to park at the hotel, the parking area would be tight for a Smart Car.

I chose this hotel for the price as against location. However, I do not recommend this hotel to anyone for the following reasons: 1. The room is really small like a prison cell and sometimes it was even hard to turn around.2. The washroom is small and you may bump something each time you use it.3. The so called breakfast is disgusting: everyday is the same. On my last day I chose to eat outside.4. The front desk service is not efficient. Only one oriental guy did things fast.

Stayed a few nights while in Waikiki and was pleased with the location and staff friendliness. Small room but perfect for a single. Provided beach towels, mats and other floaties only one block from the beach.

Before i book this hotel i took a look on the pic from the website. Was fine and the price was good also. They provide some tea and coffee and some sea toys and stuff for visiter in this hotel which is nice. However. we went there it was in the midnight and when we first came in reception was also fine. Im just looking to my room. When i first sow it really it was a chock for me! Wasn't expected to be like this. Forgot the pic online nothing similar at all :(. It's too small and the bathroom is horror extra on that they don't have a small bed for kids so you have to book a bed in the same price for adult or you bring you the ready bed for your child.! Also the room is too small cant stand it, i love doing some exercise in my room, i went for more than a week and i couldn't do any! Also just be careful for your children, my little bumped her head in the sink, she also full down cuz the sink was leaking Also the room in the day is so bright the curtain is not good at all there is too mush space between each one. I found difficulties when i want to take a nap also my daughter cuz she used to sleep in a dark place. Alright, leave all this alone and take this one. Looking for wifi?? Forgot it.. Didn't see such a bad internet survive in the world like this hotel. Sorry but never work in the room & when we want to use it we have to go down in reception just to open any app, texting, or free internet calls! Sorry but i would rather pay more for better hotel than staying in this one..

I recently stayed here with a friend - both of us who have recently traveled around Europe, staying at hostels. We both concluded that this was more like a nice hostel rather than a 3 star hotel. I've been to some nice hostels with private rooms, and this seemed pretty much on par. Just to clarify, I don't think that being like a hostel is a bad thing so long as you market it as such!The WiFi was free but it did not work most of the time (we had to constantly change between 2 passwords as well) the 'breakfast' was a basic package of the following - a piece of fruit, a muffin, some sort of pastry and a muesli bar - similar to what you might find at a hostel!To the credit of this establishment, the location was fantastic - super close to the beach, shops, Cheesecake Factory (yum). The staff were also incredibly accomodating. I'd rate most of the staff 5/5 but I can't up my rating based solely on that, unfortunately.I think that perhaps people would be more receptive to this place if their expectations matched what was actually provided. That being said, there are many other options but I would strongly consider staying again. Thanks, everyone!

We only stayed here for 1 night but the rooms were very clean, the price was great and the staff were always very friendly and more than helpful. Would definitely recommend staying here. Great location, short walk to shops, restaurants and the beach.

Cute hotel and all that we needed. Great simple room with balcony, and very friendly front desk staff. The amazing location right in downtown Waikiki only a block from the beach was the best and most convenient part, everything is in walking distance. Great for people who plan to spend their day out and need a nice and comfortable place to sleep.

The hotel is very well situated, in the middle of Waikiki (near restaurants, shops, beaches). However some rooms don't have actual closed windows, which means all the noise from the streets gets into your room. Late at night you'll hear people walking down the streets or cars honking, and early in the morning you get woken up by trucks unloading things at the Sheraton or Hyatt. The wi-fi is also difficult to use, it's quite choppy and you'll spend more time trying to connect to it and actually being connected. The room was clean, bed could've been more comfortable. Otherwise the staff in the lobby was very nice.

The photos were very deceiving and we regretted booking here immediately upon arrival. Unfortunately, the place was a bit of a dump. The hotel had no bellhop or even a luggage cart. For us, Honolulu was a transit stop during our international flight from Canada to Australia and we were travelling with an elderly, disabled person. The receptionist was kind enough to assist us with our luggage, but the hotel was in a shocking state of disrepair. The floors of the room were dirty and the closet had no door (covered by hanging fabric). The room contained two single beds at right angles and was extremely tiny. The air conditioner was a window unit that was very loud throughout the night. The wifi signal was poor from our room. We were forced to pay an amenities fee of $10 per person that we had no idea about, which was to cover the cost of "breakfast" consisting of an apple and some muffins in a takeaway container. Other than the location, there was really nothing to recommend this place, which reminded me of a hostel. I would never stay here again. There are far superior hotels in the city.

I stayed at the Stay Hotel December 30 through January 6. The hotel room was neat, clean and real noisy. The room was very small. There was no dresser. I paid $215 a night during high season. But despite all this I enjoyed my time there. Why? Because the workers at the front desk are wonderful people. They never failed to greet me. They always wanted to know about my day. Would I stay at the Stay again? Probably and only because of the front desk workers.

From what I can gather, every hotel on Waikiki Beach is outdated and overpriced with tiny rooms. This is no exception. That said, we enjoyed our stay. The amenities were good: bagged breakfast snacks in the morning, beach accessories to borrow, convenience stores nearby, and walking distance to the beach. I would stay here again.

The place was just fine. It was about what we expected for the rate. We appreciated the kitchen and full size refrigerator. The worst thing about this place is out of the control of the property owner/s. The daily garbage trucks were banging around for a half hour in the early morning hours (7:30am-8am). We were hoping it was just once a week, but it was every morning for 30+ minutes. Since we are night owls, we won't stay there again for that reason.

This hotel is two blocks from Waikiki beach, restaurants and shopping. We used it to spend our last day on Waikiki Beach before flying home. The rooms are clean and spacious. The staff is awesome, helpful in every way, even printed our boarding passes!

Everything is relative, but when considering accommodations to offset the costs of everything on Kalakaua Avenue (including ABC Markets), Stay Hotel Waikiki offers the right stuff at a fair price. True, some updates could be done in the bathrooms for standard maintenance; room safes might also be a nice, inexpensive touch, but the average traveler with a budget in mind may care more for quality customer service than the aforementioned updates. Stay Hotel Waikiki delivers just that... The staff is courteous at all hours, from desk clerks to those in maid service. Not once did our needs/requests result in anything appearing an inconvenience for them. From a room upgrade (scheduled last minute) to free luggage storage and changing room accommodations after check out, we were treated with warmth and courtesy. The staff was also very knowledgeable, not only of the basics, but of alternative options for daily activities if plans fell through. We thoroughly appreciated their efforts. Looking forward to our next trip!

The only thing that's modern is the lobby. Wifi didnt work properly in the room. Had to go down the lobby to use Internet to search for a different hotel to stay at. Did not want to stay one night there! Phone didn't even work in the room too. Rooms felt like a motel style. Not completely clean. Bathrooms outdated. Not worth the price. Only things that were good was the location and staff were friendly.

It was ok - lobby was nice and the staff very friendly. Location is fantastic, quick 5 minute walk to the beach. Some beach stuff you can borrow all included in the daily fee. I wasn't impressed with the room for the price. The windows were grates that looked out on to the walkway up to the room. My first thought walking in was that I was walking into a dorm room. Where the TV was positioned made it quite difficult to watch as it was on the side of the bed. The bathroom was actually nicer than expected with a wooden tile floor, though one light was blinking (which I told them about on the way out so should be fixed for the next guest!). Overall not a bad place to stay, the windows let in a little more noise than I liked and the AC unit was pretty noisy, but I don't think it's worth the money. I guess most of all you're paying for the location.

Everything is relative, but when considering accommodations to offset the costs of everything on Kalakaua Avenue (including ABC Markets), Stay Hotel Waikiki offers the right stuff at a fair price. True, some updates could be done in the bathrooms for standard maintenance; room safes might also be a nice, inexpensive touch, but the average traveler with a budget in mind may care more for quality customer service than the aforementioned updates. Stay Hotel Waikiki delivers just that... The staff is courteous at all hours, from desk clerks to those in maid service. Not once did our needs/requests result in anything appearing an inconvenience for them. From a room upgrade (scheduled last minute) to free luggage storage and changing room accommodations after check out, we were treated with warmth and courtesy. The staff was also very knowledgeable, not only of the basics, but of alternative options for daily activities if plans fell through. We thoroughly appreciated their efforts. Looking forward to our next trip!

My husband and I stayed here 2 nights before heading out on a cruise last month. Our room was plenty big, very clean and the bed was very comfortable. We arrived on a Thursday afternoon, went to a luau that evening, and spent all day Friday on a tour. So Saturday morning before we checked out was the only time we were there when we weren't sleeping. We were on the fifth floor and I did hear the noise around 4:00 am or so. One really good feature for us is that although it is too small to be listed for a pick-up spot for the tours we booked online, we just walked out the front door and crossed the street to the bus stop where we had arranged to be picked up. We had a balcony and if you looked just right, you could see a sliver of the ocean.

Don't expect much. Very clean but a basic cinder block room. Three adults in the room with a double bed and futon. Tiny bathroom. Very friendly staff, they provided pastries and fruit for breakfast, free coffee and beach towels. Best part - only one block to the beautiful Waikiki beach. We rented an umbrella and 3 chairs on the beach for $50 for the entire day. Also a block from the main street so we could walk to all sorts of restaurants and shopping.

This hotel is the perfect choice if you are visiting Waikiki on a budget and don't need a pool. Three stars is because rooms are small and the windows are "thin" so you can definitely hear street noise as other reviewers have mentioned. Bedding was comfortable and shades were dark enough to sleep. Our room was very clean and well maintained - no funny smells and we even had a very partial ocean view from the balcony. Staff is extremely friendly and $10/day service fee for unlimited coffee, Wi-Fi, and beach towels is really the best you are going to get in the area.

My husband and I stayed here for one night before moving to our rental house. This hotel had a great location and the staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel rooms are tiny with concrete walls, hotel had karioke and you could hear it clearly when lying in bed on the 4th floor. There was an amenities charge for WiFi and complementary snacks, however the WiFi was down so thankfully the girl removed the charge. All in all if you go in with low expectations for a night or 2 for location and "cheaper" hotel this would be fine.... Any more than that and I would look at other options.

This place is on a small street where numerous large Tour busses pick up tourists all day. My window view was of an old 2 story building that had welfare people living in it that leave their laundry outside to dry and super loud cursing shouting back and forth. Now for the room itself. There are no pane windows, just levered glass shingles so you can hear everything outside. The air condition didn't work. The internet does not work in the rooms, only in the lobby. The shower in the bathroom was discusting. It looked like a gym shower. The toilet was backed up. And the free breakfast is a small orange and a small muffin. This is not breakfast. When I complained about all this, they only gave me $10 off. I was at the Doubletree and was less for a lot nicer room and location. This room was not worth $209.00.

Room was pretty small, and would need some renovation and redecoration. Location is great, 5 minutes walk to Waikiki beach, and several shopping plaza. Breakfast includes a fruit, a pastry and a muffin most of the time (Cereal bars also available). Free coffee (available all the time) Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Check in is very late... There's a daily fee for amenities (WiFi, beach equipment, breakfast, etc.) Expect to pay a little bit more than what you already had.

I needed a room for just one night for two large guys with comfortable queen beds. I was on my way home after being in Hawaii on the north shore for two weeks and had to catch a flight in the morning. So decided to book on hotels.com When we got to the hotel and were checking into are room the room only had two single beds. I was disappointed because I made sure to ask the person who I was booking my room with on hotels.com that we needed two queens because I'm 6'2 and just had back surgery and my friend is 6'2 also. We went down to the front desk to explain this is not what we booked online and that this wasn't going to work. The girl at the front desk couldn't have been nicer. She went ahead and upgraded are room to a two bedroom suite with two bath rooms and two queen beds. I was very happy and the location of this hotel couldn't be better. One block from Waikiki beach behind the Hyatt. Walk to everything. Highly recommend if want clean and modern hotel with best location in Waikiki.

Room was dirty. Moldy bathroom. Elevator was broken. Had to take our bags up 3 flights of stairs. Only comp was $10 off. Parking was additional $25 and it was a loading dock and had to leave by a certain time. We would have been better off sleeping in our car at the airport parking.

Stayed at the stay hotel in waikiki the week before christmas. It is an ok hotel, staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is great. Rooms are on the small side and the bathrooms need some updating. There is an additional charge upon arrival of $10/day for breakfast ( apple with muffin and a croissant) this charge also includes the use of their beach mats... this is a charge that is not and should be included within the price or at least mentioned on their website... free keurig coffee all day long. Wifi is ok...gets a little slow in the evenings.

Booked online and blind, apart from seeing the photos, we found the hotel was in need of quite a bit of upgrading. We got a room upgrade, to a queen size, which made a big difference, as the room was large, although the bathroom was a bit tight. The room needed more drawers, in fact any drawers, and some extra hangers but as it was so large, we could leave our cases out and not fall over them! The room was kept spotlessly clean and all of the staff were helpful and friendly in the extreme. Breakfast was basic, a couple of muesli bars and a bit of fruit but when going out on early morning excursions, enough for the start of the day. Coffee/tea are available all day and there are beach towels and beach gear in the lounge area for everyone's use. The location is superb, one street back from Waikiki beach, near all of the shops and bars. For the price we paid, we cannot fault the hotel and although not one of the 'better' hotels, it was pretty good. We would return, but only if we got a similar room to the one we had. We went on 3 trips, Pearl Harbour( a MUST!!) a round the island all day trip and a visit to the outlet mall. There are MANY more to choose from. A visit to 'Dukes' is to be recommended, especially to see the sunset. Shopping was something else, varied and reasonably priced.

Located just a block from the Waikiki beach. Staff was very friendly. Of course parking was not free at the hotel like every other place in Waikiki, but the staff told me about the all the places I could look for free parking if I wanted. Beach equipment are available to borrow. Rooms are in decent shape given the pricing levels.

The only good thing we can say is that the hotel is on walking distance of main street, beach and shopping area. For the rest the pictures online gives a much better impression than the one when you enter the room! Room was small, smelled like wet dog, old fashioned and in urgent need of renovation (our bathroom was leaking water towards our neighbours), ac unit was making a hell of a noise, curtains didn't slide on the rail, floor was covered with paint, fossets where full of calcic, ...At night there was a lot of noise on the streets, mainly of all the laundry trucks that are making the backing-up beeping sound to get in the garage of the Laundry Factory across the street all night long!When you checked in we had to pay $10/day for the wife that never worked properly! The website says that there is parking available for $25/night but in reality they only have 12 parking spots so they let us park in a structure 2 blocks away. Fact is that the 4 star hotel 'Moana Surfrider' is only charging $12/night VALET so we parked over there.We checked out earlier because we didn't sleep because of the noise and they refused to give us any compensation for the cancelled nights.What was planned as a stay in Paradise turned into a nightmare in Paradise.No value for the money you pay!

Very good and clean basic accomodation right on the beach. Comfortable bed. Kitchen is really helpfull to keep your vacation on budget. If you are looking for luxury, this place is not for you. The area around is very busy and as a result noisy. But we didn't use air conditioner, but kept open windows and balcony door. It is also three stores hotel without an elevator. We were perfectly OK with it, but people with limited physical abilities should be aware of it. WE had two issues with the room furniture: 1. there weren't any chairs or stools; 2. would be nice to have a broom and dustpan, to clean the sand brought from the beach as often as we want. Overall we were happy with accomodation and with the price we paid.

We thought the room was going to be bigger. BUT We spent most of our time at the beach and not in the room so it was just fine for our STAY. we receive a free upgrade to queen size room, Cool and refreshing! The beach was within walking distance (about a block) and shopping was close, all within walking distance. We enjoyed our time there and would do it again! overall it was a good stay with affordable price, good customer service.

Stayed for one night on a layover to Australia and was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Rooms are basic but all you need as you'll most likely be out exploring the island. Room, shower and bathroom were clean and the bed very comfy providing a great nights sleep. Staff were very friendly, recommending several great locations for dinner upon my arrival and breakfast the next morning.

Great location, friendly and helpful staff, room was quiet and super clean. Included all of the basic conveniences and a breakfast snack, consisting of two energy bars and an apple. Great to take along on a hike or excursion.

My family had spent 4 nights here and honestly I was a slightly skeptical about this hotel prior to our arrival. However, it was the cheapest hotel I could find around the area so I thought it would still be okay even if it's not as great as we thought. Guess what? It turned out great!Our experience went from 3 out of 10 to 9 out of 10 because of the friendly staff there who really tried to accommodate to our needs and made sure our stay was as pleasant as possible. Initially, I booked two separate rooms for 4 of us, and the rooms were located on the 6th floor. The surprise? Elevator was out of order and has not been working for a week. My mom, who is in her 60's, almost had a heart attack before she reached 4th floor and that's when we decided this is not going to work. Long story short, the staff was kindly enough to find us two vacant condos (across the street) on 1st and 2nd floor AND let us stay there at no extra cost. This was the nicest thing they've done for my mom and I really appreciate their hospitality and thoughtfulness. Especially after the fact that there were two gentlemen carrying all our luggage all around the hotel. The location was great! We were close to everything. Beach, farmer's market, Waikiki trolley stops, shopping centers, food, bus stops...etc.The only down side was the noise. The windows don't close and I guess Hawaiians start their days around 4 or 5 am. You can hear the trucks going through, trash bins being dumped, and etc etc. If you are a light sleeper, I strongly recommend ear plugs.Overall speaking, we had a very pleasant stay and we would definitely come back again the next time we travel to Waikiki.

I recently spent 9 nights here and I had a sensational time! Renovations were going on at the time and the elevator was not working, but were told about this straight up and they waived the amenities fee which was a great touch. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfy and the WiFi worked great the entire time. The location was absolutely spot on, you could not ask for more. A stones throws away form Waikiki Beach, restaurants and shops.Beach towels were provided, beach equipment on hand to borrow if it was available and to top it off, a breakfast snack bag to grab on our way out in the morning. The staff were all fantastic. Always welcoming with a bright Aloha, answered and helped with any questions I had. The hotel Bar, Wang Chung's was one of our favourite places. Karaoke was great fun to wind down the day. Overall I was so so happy with our stay as a first time visitor to Hawaii, and I will be back to spend my holiday again with Stay Hotel Waikiki. Mahalo

My partner and I, chose to stay at Stay Hotel for 2 weeks, while we were in Waikiki. The hotel is not a 5 star hotel, however, it is inexpensive and suits those who will only use the hotel for a good nights rest. The bathroom is small and compact but you get what you pay for. The wifi is not great, it cuts out, but who stays in the hotel when you can go down to the beach everyday.The staff were all friendly and greets you when you walk in and out of the building. They also told us upfront that the elevator is being renovated. I highly recommend Stay Hotel to anyone who is looking for accommodation that is within walking distance to Waikiki and looking to save some money for shopping.

I travel often to Waikiki but this was my first time at Stay Hotel. Be prepared for loud noises throughout the night! I'm usually a deep sleeper that can fall asleep regardless of the background noise but was unable to fall asleep at this hotel. It's almost like road noises and people talking are amplified making it seem as though you are sleeping outside. Beds are slightly less comfortable than an air mattress. The room stays lit up at night due to street lights even with the makeshift curtains closed. No elevator at this hotel if that's important to you. No onsite parking available. My wife and I found a parking garage a couple blocks away for $40 and since we pack light and enjoy exercise, this was not to big of an issue although onsite parking is a nice feature to have. There is a nightclub onsite with karaoke playing late into the night. Nice option if you are down to party but not if you're into getting some restful sleep. The proximity to the beach, nightlife, restaurants, and shopping was about the same distance we had to walk to the parking garage. Only a couple blocks away, so pretty close. The staff was very friendly which was my favorite part of my visit to this establishment. Overall this hotel reminded me of a hostel stay in a 3rd world country. It was just nice enough to make us feel grateful that we had a roof over our heads to keep us dry while anxious to leave first thing in the morning. Hopefully this review was helpful in deciding if this place is a good fit for you! Mahalo, Erick

Convenient hotel close to everything in Waikiki. Basic but clean. Friendly and helpful staff. Less than 2 minutes walk to iconic surfing beach. One block back from main drag so not too noisy on a normal night - we stayed over Halloween which was very noisy till 2 am but also an amazing spectacle!

Last month I had stayed at a boutique hotel across the street that is run from this hotel's front desk. Tried to stay there again but they were sold out for the night I wanted. Nonetheless, I stayed here. The building only has one elevator which was out because it was going through a major overhaul, but the staff explained this upfront. They were very friendly and carried my bags up the stairs, so it really wasn't that inconvenient. On the higher floors they were doing a remodel of some of the rooms but the workers were very courteous. This hotel is 1 block off of Waikiki Beach, super convenient to everything and the price was a great value.

I & my partner recently stayed at Stay Hotel Waikiki, a very short walk to the Waikiki Beach & the main shopping strip bustling with bars & restaurants. It's perfect if you're someone who uses the hotel to sleep & shower whilst spending majority of the time out exploring. The beds are comfortable & rooms are of decent size, bathroom was a bit too cramped but again we were not expecting it too be lavish or anything! They also have a Karaoke room downstairs so if you are a bit of a singer give it a go! The staff was understanding of the fact it'll get noisy in the evenings so she already gave us a room on the other side of the block which we really appreciated! All the staff at reception were friendly & welcoming at all times.

My Wife and I decided to do a "staycation" for almost 2 weeks at the hotel. We were amazed on how close we were to the beach and the fact that they provide EVERY guest with beach towels AND beach equipment was amazing!! You may have to pay the $10 a day amenity fee but if you look at what it includes you definitely get your monies worth! The fee includes Wifi, beach gear, newspaper, computers, a nice light snack bag for the morning so you can grab and go to whatever adventures you have planned and one thing I didnt know was that you can make local calls and not get charged for it!! Thats a first and Ive stayed at plenty hotels that charge for local calls. Im not sure if I left anything out thats included in the fee but that already is worth $10 a day.

Don't get fooled by the photos. It's not what it looks like. The building seems pretty old. The rooms size is ok, and it's clean but you still can see that it's just old and very used. The Wifi signal is very low, dont expect that much. The prize, in my opinion is pretty high for what you get and there's an additional 10$ fee every day, what I don't understand is for. I was in another hotel for 2 weeks before and it was newer, cleaner, cheaper and no fee at all. The staff was friendly but I don't recommend this hotel and I only stayed for 1 day, before leaving back home so I'm fine with it.
