I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel! The lobby was very trendy and clean and had these neat hanging egg chairs for you to relax in! My friends and I really thought those were cool! Wang Chung's was right off of the lobby which was so awesome since I LOVE to karaoke--and guess what?! Once I heard that this place was the number one place in Waikiki to karaoke, I was sold and just had to go check it out! Soooo cool that its right in the lobby! The front desk ladies were very accommodating and polite, I just wish I could remember the name of the lady who checked me in, so I could give her a shout out! I was very impressed with how she handled my check in as it was smooth and quick. She was sweet and I felt as though she genuinely valued me as a guest at the hotel. The hotel room itself was simple, clean, and modern. But, it had all of the main things I needed, like a hair dryer, mini-fridge, microwave-- so I was one happy camper! Plus the bed was super comfy--I slept better than I do at home.For the price, you honestly can't beat the location! Its one block away from the beach and all of the shopping and restaurants you could want. I didn't really spend much time in my room, but why would I? I was in Hawaii! As a first time visitor to the islands, the staff were warm and welcoming and really added to my experience. Don't forget to ask them about their favorite local attractions they'll be more than happy to give you some tips!
user_name:
Ava L
New York City, New York

review_body: The Stay Hotel is an economical hotel located just a short walk to the beach. It is within walking distance from many other attractions and shopping.The hotel itself could use some updates. The hotel is in the process of updating the furniture and rooms. Also the elevator is in need of some TLC. The door will eat you if you are not careful.The high point of the hotel is the staff. They will do anything they can to make your stay more enjoyable. This goes especially for Tonya, the overnight clerk She was very friendly and helpful. She provided helpful insight to the local culture and I found her a delightful resource.

My husband and I checked into Stay Hotel Waikiki for our honeymoon. We stayed in Hawaii for 2 weeks. This hotel had the most amazing location. We could walk to the beach and/or shopping in less than 2 minutes. Has tons of amazing restaurants that are walking distance too! The hotel was clean, the beds were comfortable and the staff was so helpful with directions and recommendations. We would definitely stay here again when we return to Hawaii next year!

Good location to the beach, just one block behind waikiki. Unfortunately the bed was really small and the room was not very big. Staff was friendly and the room clean.I was surprised how good breakfast and the selection there was.

We stayed for a week and for the price it was nice. WiFi wasn't working for most of the time. There was a lot of light in the room because the windows didn't have blackouts and we could ear a lot of noise from the street. On the positive side, the staff was very friendly and helpful and the location was EXCELLENT!

We used this hotel on a stopover for one night and it was very suitable for this purpose. It is in an excellent location and the staff were friendly and very helpful. Our room was freshly painted and the bed was comfortable and the furniture adequate if basic. Breakfast seemed ok but we chose to have a hot meal elsewhere. There were towels and mats provided for the beach and free wifi. For the price this hotel is fine but clearly if you want resort facilities then you need to look elsewhere. It depends upon what you want for your money.
user_name:
Peter B
New York City, New York

review_body: During my recent stay at Stay Waikiki, i found my room at an extremely fair price, and my room was even ready a full 3 hours before my scheduled check in time. What comoelled me to write this review was the extraordinary efforts of the overnight desk clerk, Ms. Tanya Cullen, who continually went above and beyond what i consider to be the normal duties of a hotel employee, and she seemed quite pleased when she was able to assist. I certainly hope that she will get recognized by her peers and her superiors for making my stay at Stay Waikiki a very pleasant experience.Eric Smith

Very small hotel, and small room, not as seen on pictures, runs out of parking spaces quickly, $10 hotel fee. Not warm Breakfast, just some muffins and protein bars, very little choices. Overall, if you can add 30 dollar to your budget, go somewhere else.Pros: friendly staff, provides towel for the beach, free coffee in the lobby.Cons: very slow internet, small room, double bed room has very small bed, small bathroom, everything old, a little further from the beach.

Although the location is idea, for the price I paid, I could've stayed in a far more superior hotel for the same price! Don't allow the pictures fool you, everything needs to be updated. The Windows as well as its fixtures were broken and need of dire repair. Not conducive in keeping the street noise out nor the cold air in. We had to keep the curtains closed to not allow the a/c to escape, but the street noise was just unbearable.

Extremly well located, 2 mins from the main beach of Waikiki. the hotel is old but modern furnished. the parking is 25 dollars a night if they have any, the rooms are more ore less clean, had a visitor one day (cockroach) but Waikiki is full of them. No big complains but neither big pros for the hotel, it was ok, a bit too expensive, just for the location.

Stayed here one night before boarding a plane back to the mainland the next morning. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and polite. I was told that this place used to be student housing before being converted into a hotel. It basically reminded me of a dorm room. Twin beds, curtain over the closet door, small bathroom, furniture looks like everything was bought at Ikea. The room was clean, but rundown. Cracked walls and plaster were falling off in several areas of the room, which is why I'm not rating it higher. Regardless, it was one of the cheaper hotels for the area (only charged a $10 resort fee that included WiFi) considering the location. Plus, they offer free breakfast in the morning. Served its purpose, but I wouldn't stay here more then a day or two at most.

This hotel has an awesome location!! You are a block away from the beach and all the great stores and restauraunts. In the lobby there is a bar/karaoke always look for Rex! Thanks to him we had a great time! He is an awesome bar tender! Staff is also friendly Carmen is a great front desk/informational guide! Thanks to her we saw everything we wanted to see on the island in 4 days! We would def recommend and come back!

We stayed here for one night before hopping over to Maui. The hotel is nothing amazing, although I did like the attention to detail in the reception (fruit flavoured chilled water, swinging egg chairs). Our room was quite spacious, however the air con was really noisy and we had to turn it off to sleep. Which meant a restless sleep because it was so hot. The staff were friendly and helpful. The bathroom was teeny and the door awkwardly opened inward, not leaving much space to get around. Best selling point is the location - only one street away from Waikiki beach strip. If you consider staying here for any reason, it would be this.

This is the best location in Waikiki to experience all that is Waikiki! Call it a surf hotel, if you will, someplace you can stay and relax in. But honestly, you will be spending all of your vacation time learning how to surf at the beach which is only steps away! Think simplicity. Think hospitality, local style. Think sandy toes and surf hair. Laid back. Think Stay Hotel! Don't expect bellhops carrying your luggage up to your room, turned down beds, or even mints on pillows. You won't get that here. What's better is expecting a little bit of ALOHA everyday from the friendly staff and front desk who will always put a smile on your face and lead you in the right direction to waste no time or money on your already expensive vacation to Hawaii! Your trip to Hawaii is better spent on every single activity that you can cram into your vacation rather than "fluff." If you want fluff, go to those other brand name hotels that will probably cost you a fortune. If you want the real deal Hawaii experience, stay at Stay! They will take care of you, and then some!

Don't get impressed by these great pictures. The hotel looks nothing like these pictures. The room is tiny and dirty. The hotel has a lounge on first floor in which is very noisy. There are dumpsters right behind the hotel and the waste collection starts around 4am and you can hear the noise if it's like inside your own room. The room shades do not block sun light. Just terrible! Would not recommend at all.

The pictures online look great but when u get to the hotel its a bit disappointing. U have no view, windows don't open, the tub u cant use , u can only shower, the bathrooms don't have a fan so everyone in the room can smell anything that happens in the bathroom. But other than that, the staff is friendly , u get a breakfast , u can use beach tubes and all that as long as u bring them back, and my most favorite is that even though u have no view whatsoever , it's a two minute walk to the beach. It turns out convenient. If ur not a picky person and don't care much where u stay then this is just fine :-)

Good hotel, value for money. Fantastic location only a block back from Waikiki beach! Good if you just want a room to sleep and shower in, especially since you will spend the day at the beach. The breakfast included isn't anything to fancy just toast, cereal and juice.

the location is perfect. The property is older with a face lift. Granted its is still an old building! However staff and owners try hard to make it extra special to free continental breakfast, internet (WIFI), to fresh beach towels with an added bonus of free use of beach float toys and chairs! Felt very safe. The shower had great water pressure with plenty of HOT water. I thought the price was too high for what it was.(I paid $145.00 a nite) Should be right at $95.00 a night and no more. Location again was great! I would call hotel to see if you can get lower rates than using search engine hotel sites. Staff were great. Check out is at 11:00 ouch. One block from Waikiki Beach! 2 thumbs up!

The staff is unfriendly, the girls at the reception do not smile, nor say hello or goodbye, very rude. The shower was broken (there was an annoying leak) and the air conditioning was noisy. The bed was too soft and distroyed my back, the room was not very clean. I read some other reviews where the staff says this hotel is for young travellers, however, in my opinion, young travellers doesn't mean poor service or unclean rooms. The breakfast is basic but ok, however there is not enough space to have breakfast (only a couple of small tables and chairs). I would not come back to this hotel nor recommend to other guests.

Location was the best 2 minutes to beach, stores and restaurants. Nice and helpful staff. Rooms real tiny and bathrooms need renovation but has the basics. Room 808 has a side view of the ocean from the balcony. Adequate for the Money.

I want to thank the staff at the Stay Hotel for being very friendly and helpful. I want to especially thank Staci at the front desk for taking great care of us as we checked in. Thank you again! I would recommend this hotel to anyone! Great location and great service!Tim

i have nothing bad to say about this hotel. The front desk was absolutely wonderful and helpful. the beds were comfortable and literally 2 minutes from the beach. top it off the AC worked great! only down side is it doesn't by any means look like the pictures. its kind of run down definitely needs some renovations done. the bathrooms are small. but for the price and how close it is to the beach. it allowed us to save on our hotel and splurge everywhere else. who needs something luxury to sleep in when honolulu speaks for itself. the front desk girls are incredible I would 100% stay here again without second question.

My dad stayed at the Stay Hotel for 4 nights when he was helping me move to Hawaii. I stayed here for one night. The overall experience was average. I don't think you could find anything for much cheaper in the heart of Waikiki for this price. It was near lots of high end shopping, places to eat, and only a block or so away from Waikiki beach. If you are looking for a posh, or luxurious hotel stay during your time in Hawaii, this is certainly not the place. However if you are young, not planning on spending much time in your hotel, and aren't expecting top notch amenities, this is the place to be. I would definitely stay at Stay if I were visiting the area with other young folk like myself.

If you only need a one or two night stay, then this hotel is tolerable. More than that and forget it. Our room was reeeeaaallly small. One old Ikea dresser that was falling apart and veneer was peeling off, no closet or anything--just an alcove with a curtain that had a wooden rod to hang clothes. Paint everywhere was peeling. Bathroom so small it had a micro-sink that you would hit to try to get into the shower. Small room air conditioner near the floor that did nothing to cool the room in 90-degree weather. About the only thing good I can say is that the shower had great water pressure. They tried a bit with the interesting "art" as a headboard but this hotel clearly needs some serious work. Front desk staff were very nice and they had fruit-infused water in the lobby. Online photos make hotel look much nicer than it is.

I booked this hotel on Orbitz and was totally satisfied! Orbitz, not Expedia. Do NOT book through Expedia!!!!! Do not book ANYTHING through Expedia. They will... I repeat ... absolutely WILL rip you off! Stay Hotel Waikiki had amazing customer service at the front desk! They were very attentive and friendly. Shout out to Courtney, I believe that was her name. They provide an umbrella if you need it, extra towels for days, and the location is amazing.The breakfast in the morning is a deal! Other hotels will overcharge you and NOT provide a breakfast in the morning. Lots of options and refreshers. The hotel also has a hip bar downstairs. Was not able to get a drink yet was able to check it out.Overall if you are planning to stay for a few nights to a whole week I would pick this place out of the hundreds of hotels in the area. What more could you ask for? Great prices, amazing location and helpful service? I give this place an A+!

Needed a room for one night in Waikiki. Stay was clean and affordable, and it had AC! It is minutes from the beach and near all the restaurants and shopping you could ask for. The staff was friendly and helpful. Recommended.

This place has just what you need when you are going to Hawaii to run around in the sun and surf. A bed. It's a good budget hotel, the receptionist are friendly and the complementary breakfast was just what you needed to get out of the door. The room was tiny but had all that we needed. A bed which was comfy, a tv. For budget stays this is great.

Look it's no super glamour and a lot of the furniture was cheap but the bed was comfy the room was clean, it had a balcony, staff were welcoming and always happy to help.Breakfast was simple with 2-3 things but for me it was perfect - Piece of fruit, a danish, muffin and coffee - My ideal.They give you towels for the beach and it's walking distance to everywhere. Be aware the street it's on is narrow and very busy - If you have children I would watch out for this.

While traversing the beaches of Oahu, Stay Waikiki became my home base this summer. Very modest accommodations considering the price, but at the same time you're literally half a block from Waikiki beach and a plethora of great restaurants. Breakfast being included in the morning is always a plus! The cherry on top of this sundae is definitely the staff. They have a bright and cheery way about them in everything they do and are always willing to help and guide you through their piece of the island. The aloha spirit is alive and well in Stay Waikiki.

Stayed here for 7 nights after having to change from a different hotel. Found it pleasant, clean and in a great location. Possibly over priced but we put it down to staying in the Waikiki area - was one of the only hotels in our budget. Staff are friendly and helpful with tourist info (buses etc). Wifi was fantastic and didn't drop out! Bed was pretty comfy - slept like a baby the entire time! Would definitely stay again!

I fell for this place because I wanted two rooms to accommodate my Husband and I, and our married Son and his Wife. The reviews sounded good. What we got was a nicely painted very old and stark room. The windows wouldn't open and the air conditioner wasn't big enough to cool the room. On the other hand, the bed was comfortable, the people were nice and my Son said that the breakfast was good. WARNING. NOT WORTH THE MONEY.

Our room looked nothing like the websites photos. Pretty run down and very basic room. For a decent price is not bad though. Bed was comfy and cleaners did a good job. Amazing location. No view from the balcony, had to ask for a fridge.

We had a great visit to the Stay Hotel. The rooms were simple, yet clean and comfortable. Only a small amount of night time noise, however the cool aircon made for a comfy night sleep so the noise meant little.The staff were very kind, crackin' the odd joke or two with us and helped us with every request.The outside sitting area in the lobby was great when we were waiting for our transport. With comfortable chair, a refreshing ocean breeze and warm sun. It was a nice change from the hustle of the main street.A huge bonus is that the hotel is located no more than a 3 minute walk to the main beach in Waikiki. you can't ask for much more than that!If your looking for 1-2 nights in Waikiki and don't want to bust the bank, I definitely recommend letting the staff at Stay Hotel look after you!

If you get a room on the 8th floor ask to change immediately as it is right below the air con units. While it is in a good location that comes at the price of late night and early morning noise. The other thing not made clear is there is a night club in the hotel lobby - not that we experienced it but guesssing the rooms above it may suffer a little bit from the noise too. When we got into our room the blinds were very dirty and linens had a lot of marks. If possible l would suggest avoiding.

Stay Hotel is a great spot in Waikiki-- it doesn't break the bank, and it keeps you close to the beach. For my sister and I traveling around Hawaii, we wanted to spend our funds on experiences and activities, not the pricey lodging of other high rise hotels in Waikiki. Stay Hotel was perfect for our needs. Tanya Cullen behind the front desk was super knowledgable and helpful, as well as engaging and friendly-- ask for her if you want excellent service!
user_name:
Arielle S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: If you are in Waikiki for a night or 2 this hotel is in a great location. One block, 4 min walk from the beach. The hotel is very modest .... bed and bathroom, but you will not be spending much time in your room at Waikiki. The front line staff are super friendly and very helpful. They got us checked in early, stored our luggage on check out, provided beach toys and gave us great tips on cabs, busses, eats, etc. The breakfast is simple (pasteries, bread, yougurt, fruit, coffee) but adequate. There are many hotels at twice the price if you want, but I would recommend this property for its staff and location.

If you love buses pulling up all night next to your window, then this place is for you! I have stayed in places 5 times as nice for half the price - rooms are dirty and small, the kareoke bar downstairs makes the lobby and street a hangout for people all hours of the morning so if you like sleeping, give it a miss. I would have been happy paying $70 US for this hotel, nothing more. I would say the only good thing was it is walking distance to Waikiki - but its not. If you can, stay away from Waikiki (go to Waimanalo beach) or go to the Big Island and Maui instead, less touristy and much less expensive.

I stayed at this hotel for two nights and enjoyed my time there. The room is not as good as one can expect but I believe it worth what I paid for. I love the amenities the hotel can offer: free wifi, free breakfast and friendly staffs. The best thing of this hotel is the location. It is in the center of Wakiki beach and close to everything. Many trolley stops are one block from this hotel and you get to go anywhere outside Wakiki beach. For example, the downtown Honolulu and diamond head. Overall, I would like to recommend this hotel for travelers who is on limited budget and do not have a car.

Only stayed one night as this hotel is nothing like the photos. Room was dirty and didn't even want to shower there it was so gross. Even the lobby photos are inaccurate. For $200US a night I would expect more. Went down the road to the Pacific Beach hotel. Got a descent rate on Expedia, much nicer.

The pictures you see on the website are very deceiving. The rooms are dark with not much lighting options and very out dated. The floors did not have a rug, it made the room look empty with not so attractive tile. The bathroom was small with very old fixtures. No individual bath amenities with no storage space. There is no parking so you have to pay over $20 for over night parking in a small parking structure down the street and you have to pay a daily fee for something, not sure what it was since there is no parking, fitness facility or swimming pool. The daily breakfast that was included was more like a continental breakfast with not much selection. I really don't like writing negative reviews but feel I was mislead to think I was staying in a clean, modern boutique hotel. Very disappointed!

Stated here mid June. Was disappointed at first because it looked nothing like the website but ended up being happy.it is very basic and a bit dated but clean and provides everything you need and is FANTASTIC LOCATION. views of waikiki beach from balcony .great continental breakfast and helpful reception staff

We stayed 3 nights. The cost was affordable, and the breakfast was satisfactory. If you are wanting to stay near Waikiki Beach, this is a good place to be. The only frustration is the parking. Most likely, you will have to park a couple blocks away at a public parking garage connected to another hotel ($25 a day). If I return to Oahu and want to stay near Waikiki, I'd stay here again. In hindsight, I would have explored accommodations outside of Waikiki as it is not my style - congestion and higher prices. We spent all of our 3 days driving to other locations on Oahu, exploring beautiful locations, going to uncrowded beaches, eating at food trucks, and hiking great trails. Overall, the Stay is a good place to stay!

The hotel is pretty small and must be either a former apartment complex or dorm. The rooms are a bit cozy (small), but the price was affordable. The room had a modern tropical decor. It was in a convenient location (blocks from the beach, beach equipment rentals, eateries,shops). The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. They had beach towels to use and lots of beach equipment (blow up floaties, snorkel gear, beach chairs, etc...)One thing to note - the elevator closes very fast and is unsafe. We developed a system - our son entered first and held the button that holds the door open until we were all safely inside. Don't put your arm in the door to hold it open, it will continue to close on your arm!

very clean, staff very friendly and helpfull, rooms very good, bed was comfy, big TV and fridge and air conditioning, Id stay there again for sure, great hotel,ask for room 601 it has water views, the staff will give you tips on what are the best places to visit and tours to go on, try out the bar its great with good friendly staff.

the staff of this hotel is just like your family back home... they are easy to get along with and will move mountains to ensure that you have a great stay and enjoy your vacation to the fullest... there are no perfect vacations but if your hotel staff is very helpful it kinda eases everything ... kudos to maryanne and the rest of the group.... till our next visit

They have a great staff. Staff who works here are so lovely. They great you on such early morning serve with breakfast. The only problem was the elevator. Its not safe. It close too fast and even tough you put your hand in between it won't open unless some holds the open button. But over all I was satisfied with our stay. Even tough there's no available flat iron because all of them were used. When you said you need it by certain time they bring a new set of flat iron. Filipino staffs is so dependable. you could ask anything. Thank you so much. You'll appreciate your stay here if your looking for affordable yet relaxing after a long day outside.

We took a 7 day cruise touring the 4 largest Hawaiian Islands. Since our cruise was starting in Oahu, we arrived as day early just in case our flight was delayed. The hotel we chose was the Stay Waikiki, located one block from the beach. It was very close to a lot of unique shopping including 5 ABC stores (Hawaii's version of a catch all souvenir store with liquor). There were some great restaurants close by including aCheeseburger in Paradise (Great food, I reviewed earlier). The public beach across from the shopping boasted tropical foliage, clear blue water and lots of surfers. A huge banyan tree housed numerous pigeons. The sunset was spectacular. The hotel was moderately priced for the realestate. The bed a queen size featured one of the most comfortable mattresses I've ever slept on. The hotel furnished us with a superb continental breakfast with multiple choices. The room was smaller like NY hotel rooms but very comfortable. It featured a flat screen TV. We were very happy with the accommodations. We were close enough to walk to the Zoo along the beach front. Enjoy!

We stayed here at the end of May then again at the beginning of June and it was the best place to stay. The staff were really friendly and helpful and the rooms were modern, clean and spacious. Our only issue was that the wifi didn't work properly in our rooms on our first stay but they were able to waive a small fee from our bill which we we appreciated. They also offer a free pasty breakfast too which is perfect.Location is just great. Right in the middle of everything and just so central to all activities. A really nice place to stay I would recommend to all travellers.

Pros:Friendly and informative staffFree breakfast (pastries, yoghurt, fruit, cereal, coffee mostly)Comfortable bedsVery close to the beach and other attractions around WaikikiCons:Fairly loud throughout the day/night (traffic, garbage trucks, people talking etc)Wifi wasn't the fastestOverall the hotel was nothing special but there is nothing wrong with it. A nice, basic hotel right in the heart of Waikiki

I was very worried about staying at this hotel after reading the reviews. I was pleasantly surprised. It is a little out dated and the rooms could use a good renovation. Other than that are stay here was perfect./ The staff is very nice. beds comfortable. It is a bit noisey, but what do you expect in the middle of Waikiki . It is close to beach, and the main strip,. I would stay here again.

A short 2 minute walk will see you with sand between your toes on Waikiki beach. The hotel is average, rooms were clean. The front desk staff were very friendly and checked within 4 hrs of arrival if everything was ok with the room. There was some noise but I slept through it. Room 510 could do with some blocking curtains over the bed as the light from the next building beams in during the night. We were extremely grateful that our room was available for checkin when we arrived early morning from our Australian flight..We would recommend this hotel to those who are budget conscious and don't have standards above their price range :)

Rooms are nothing like the website. Old, dark and no windows (I dont count windows that are locked shut with a view of a wall ) Breakfast included but very ordinary, and it seemed that staff got the best food and we got what was left.We also were charged $153 to our credit card after we left, despite pre-paying and settling the bill as we checked out. Our bank has sorted that one out in our favour as the hotel were ripping us off!

Noisy with glass louvred windows but not bad. They provided breakfast every morning and coffee which was a nice touch. The wifi worked well too. Excellent locAtion not far from the beach. Down the corner is an awesome diner with great food and as always there is an abc shop close by.

If you want to be close to Waikiki beach this is a great hotel to stay. The hotel is located pretty much in center Waikiki. Close to beach, shops, restaurants etc and I guess the hotel does fair price considering the area. The room is ok however we missed a place to sit outside, so if you'd like that remember to ask before checking in.The hotel does not have any areas, where you could sit except for the lobby.The wifi was very much on and off- and we hardly had any in our room, but I believe it depends on which room??The breakfast was not special, but you could grab a bite...So staying central this could be a good choice..

Although the rooms leave much to be desired, they are basic and functional. The best part of this hotel are the ladies at the front desk. They are incredibly warm, friendly and really feel like family. It's a funky little hotel but more suited to people without kids. Thank you to that amazing staff here!!!

Stay Hotel isn't luxurious and far from a resort however it's exactly what's needed for a person to rest their head and unwind before the next island adventure. Clean, friendly and super hospitable. 1 block from the beach, ABC store a hop skip and a jump away, The Bus stops within 3 min walk. Close enough to the main drag (high end shopping centers, international market, fine dinning) but far away from the hustle and bustle. Who can beat a $10/day resort fee when the others charge $30-$60/day. Okay there is no pool  but really? why chill in a pool when you can take a dip in that gorgeous turquoise ocean?!I didn't see a single bug anywhere while I stayed. Trust me I checked. Even if I had, who am I kidding it's a tropical island .I give Stay Hotel 5 stars because their customer service was outstanding. They made me feel special and welcomed me with such warm vibe. Checking in was fast. Gio at the front desk called me within few mins to see if I was comfortable in my room. No place has ever done that. He knew it was my birthday and any time he seen me he asked how my day was going and If i was enjoying my birthday/stay.Staci at the front desk was also wonderful. She helped me print things needed for my tour and another time for airport documents.She to remembered where I was going or what I was doing and asked about my enjoyment whenever she seen me passing by.They treated me kind, made me feel special and didn't see me as another face in the crowd. I would mos def stay again.*view from room 707

Location is very good, very close to the beach and they provide you beach towels and other beach stuff. Don´t expect confort or luxury, the rooms are very simple, with very bad light conditions at night and some noise. The staying may include a simple breakfast but you barely will have a place to sit while eating because they serve at the reception floor. Wi-fi connection is poor. Staff is very nice and firendly.

Disappointing place. Reminded me of cheap backpacking hotels in Thailand -though admittedly without lizzards on the walls and bugs in the bathroom. But still, not worth the price. Not a boutique hotel in any way. It's all a bit shabby and feels cheap. Stayed two nights in different rooms. Tiny bathrooms with below average showers. Cold tile floors, cable clutter. Rooms are spacious though and have plenty of sockets. WiFi is free yet slow. The free DIY laundry facility is the only positive feature to mention. All in all: meh.

Don't expect luxury, but if you want somewhere clean with basic amenities, this is the place for you! One block back from the beach, easy walking distance from Waikiki and all it has to offer. Parking was costly at $30 a day-to-day but that's to be expected in this area. Would highly recommend if you're in Oahu to explore. If you're here to be pampered in a hotel, it's not the place for you.

The hotel is 1block from the beach, that was awesome, the staff is very friendly made the stay worth it. Great Mexican across the street from CVS, and the people that work there was also very friendly... Great Margarita's!!!!

I would describe this hotel hostel-esque, except with private bathroom/shower in the room. The absolutely hands-down best thing about this hotel is that it is right in Waikiki, literally a block away from the Waikiki beach & Kalakaua Ave that has all the shops, restaurants, & the huge shopping plazas, all while being less than a third of the price of the giant Hyatt across the street from it. I had realistic expectations when booking this hotel that with the rate we were at & considering its location in Hawaii (which is expensive as it is), so I was not expecting a huge lofty, luxurious room, nor did the photos reflect that the rooms had much space.. so, it definitely met my expectations. You have to keep in mind that the photos by management are going to be the most flattering photos of the place, so of course it's not perfect, but it is renovated & trendy. Our room was on the top floor, with a small view of the ocean. I think the higher up you go, the less of a problem the noise is. Currently, the windows in the rooms are not solid panes of glass, they're slats that allow a lot of noise (& heat) in, but I've seen that management will be replacing those & I think that'll be a major improvement soon! honestly though, we kept the air unit running & kept the blinds & slats closed and our room was just fine. Bearing in mind that this is a city, the noise truly wasn't that bad. my husband and I both got good nights sleep for the week that we were there. my husband was obsessed with the local pastries offered for breakfast & we even checked out the karaoke bar in the lobby, which was a lot of fun! also, it's important for me to acknowledge how awesome their staff is. they are all so friendly & accommodating. Housekeeping staff is also very friendly and my room was always cleaned. management did a great job in staffing! bottom line, we saved a lot of money by staying here & had a pleasant time! we will be staying here again whenever we visit this side of Oahu again!

Stayed here for a week in April. The pictures are a bit deceiving as the hotel is a little run down. The positives include the great location, the friendly staff and the comfy beds. There were a few negatives. The room we were in was a good size, but it was in need of a decent clean and some renovations. Our room had Paint peeling off the walls and tiles that always looked dirty. The main issue was the amount of noise from the street. At times it was impossible to sleep due to the noise of buses and people outside. Overall, our stay was pleasant and comfortable for the price we paid, however I don't think I would recommend the hotel to friends or family.

We booked a 2 twin bed room for a week. We knew about the $25 a day parking fee but they had no place for us to park. The room was super small there was about 18 in. Between the beds that are agenst the walls. No night stands just a square shelf on the wall that had the phone on it. Bathroom has NO counter at all just the smallest sink I have ever seen and a 4in. Glass shelf above it. No lights by the beds or even close just a bulb by the door to the bathroom. The photos that are on line for this hotel do NOT actually show what the room looks like. It is so bad that after 1 night we are going to a different hotel and just "eating" the cost of what we spent here because Travelocity will not give us a refund or even change hotels for us. The lady at the front counter was nice she did what she could. But wow this was BAD!

We stayed in a Deluxe queen room with sofa bed and it was fine the room was clean and comfortable. It is noisy if you want quiet and sleep ins this isn't the place for you. If you want to be right in the heart of waikiki though this is great value for money. I wasn't expecting much but we were preasently surprised

We had spent nearly a week in Kapolei and had a couple of days before our flight home. We chose this place because it was cheap, available, and proximal to the main strip and the beach. The hotel is 60's styled with outdoor corridors and tiny but sufficient rooms (and bathrooms). When you're on the beach, you don't need much else. Breakfast was fine. Some beach accessories were available in the lobby. But most importantly, the hotel was well situated and made Waikiki easily accessible without any form of transportation.The Ritz certainly this isn't. But if you go in with the right expectations, this hotel is a perfectly fine beach crashpad.
user_name:
DaynaThomas
New York City, New York

review_body: The people at reception are super helpful, and the location is great however the place is pretty noisy. I think just because the building is older that it hasn't got double glazed windows etc which makes it really noisy from traffic and surrounding buildings (garbage trucks etc). The rooms are pretty basic but clean and nicely renovated. It's good for the location and the price, just take ear plugs.

The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Definitely recommend this hotel. Location is great. Room was quiet and clean. Enjoyed our stay and the experience of having the beach and shopping nearby.

I stayed at the Stay Hotel Waikiki, Honolulu for four nights. It was nice, quiet and one block away from the beach. It is well located with good shopping and restaurants nearby. The staff are very friendly and helpful. They do a nice breakfast in house. All rooms have a good view and are airy. There are surf board hire places all but next door. I recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking to stay in Waikiki for a reasonable rate.
user_name:
Beverley H H
Rotorua, New Zealand

review_body: Great location, full breakfast, clean and affordable. It is next to the Waikiki beach, where you can go walking. However is very noisy, but it is not their faultless. A good place to stay in Honolulu.

Great convenient location, near every where. Breakfast complete with fruits, cereals, juice, coffee, tea, milk and pastries. Clean and well lighted room. Friendly and accomodating staff. Value for money hotel.

Don’t be fool by the pictures on the hotel’s website. The hotel building is very old, it resembles of a motel or an old apartment complex with the doors and non-seal window opened to the outside door therefore you can hear all kind of noise from the street. I don’t mind if it’s an old building but the noises were killing us, especially when you need a good night sleep after a long day outside. If this hotel would like to stay in business, I think the management team should try to have enclosed/sealed window/door installed in each room to eliminate as much noise as possible. The parking garage space was too small. One time I could not even get into a parking slot since there's not enough space for me to move around. Also, there's no remote control or keypad to open the garage door. I just have to wait till the staff to open it for me and several times I had to tell my kids to walk into the lobby to tell the staff to open the door for me. The only good things about this hotel are the friendly staffs and its location since it's very closed to the waikiki beach.

staff is always nice breakfast is always ready by 7am and beds were always clean and comfy. not a high priced brand but for great service and clean rooms i will give you all a high 5! thank you for a great stay

We spent 2 nights at Stay in Waikiki, and while the room was perhaps a little banged up, it was clean and had nice natural light coming in. The actual lighting inside the room wasn't the greatest, rather dim and no bedside lamps.The front desk staff were friendly and helpful... we wanted to check in quite early and were given the option to upgrade our room to something bigger and get early check in, this incurred a fee of around $20/night, but as we got the original room at a good price, this was acceptable for us. It's also important to mention the "amenity fee", this is a $10/person fee that is, if I remember correctly, mandatory, and includes such amenities as wifi, continental breakfast, etc. Would be nice if this wasn't sprung upon you at check in, but as it was only 2 of us, we weren't terribly bothered, it would be nice if they just increased prices slightly perhaps and included it, instead of a separate charge. Also important to know that in rooms that are on the outside of the building, ie with outside facing windows, it can get very noisy, especially early on. This is partially due to the fact that the windows are what I would call "shutter style" (not sure if thats the actual name or not), therefore they shut, but are like shutters in that there are gaps between all the panes. Only small gaps mind you, but this doesn't help the noise situation. We were severely jet-lagged though, so waking up early was okay as it helped with resetting our clocks a bit. But this is a noisy hotel, windows aside, as it is located right near the main Waikiki area/beach and with garbage trucks and construction going on, it's not the quietest place. Overall, this was a great short term stay, great staff, convenient location, clean rooms, etc. Long term it wouldn't be my first choice, simply because of noise, which is ultimately beyond their control (short of sound-proofing their windows). Continental breakfast was as expected, the croissants and roll things were quite nice.

Stayed here three nights. Staff was very friendly and helpful (especially the girl at the desk in the evening during our stay- wish I got her name- she went out of her way for us). Room was basic but clean. Price was reasonable considering the location and the daily continental breakfast and free wifi. Has a bar/restaurant with karaoke which we didn't try but seemed to be active every night. The street noice was a little loud in the morning by no fault of there own. We were getting up early anyway. All in all a great stay and fit our needs. We would and probably will stay here again. Thanks

The rooms are basic, but are clean and close to the beach and shops. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Good for a quick stay in the heart of the city. We felt safe walking around at night near the hotel.The parking was full at the hotel so we parked a few blocks away in a lot.

not what I expected - no lamps by the bed...too dark in here...just arrived yesterday and have 4 more nights to go...shall we move out ? the front desk was very nice at check -in ...as I arrived in the evening, could not unpack well as there's hardly any lighting...the light by the TV looks more like a Christmas ornament.

Really nice, clean and comfortable hotel (IKEA decorated), in a perfect location for Waikiki beach and shopping and buses to other places. The balcony was nice too. Staff really friendly and helpful. Only negative was slow wifi, sometimes not working at all.

I stayed there 10-12 Jan 2015 and found it very pleasant, hospitable, homey. I don't like cold, international chain hotels so Stay Motel worked well. They have computers, a bar, and are only a few steps from restaurants. The motel is a little bohemian, a youth hostel feel except you get your own room and shower. My only complaint is my room did not have a desk and the hard plastic chairs are cute, but not comfortable to sit on. However, I shall return... to Stay Hotel ! Paula, Washington DC
user_name:
Paula D
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: It was not what I expected; pictures were kind of deceiving. front desk staff was courteous though. Parking was kind of far away. Windows did not shut all the was so air could not be felt and the door to our room would not shut well. Told front desk and maintenance was suppose to fix it while we were out. When we returned the door was still the same.

We stayed in room 605. It suited our needs and we were very pleased. Next time I am going to spend more time in the exciting lounge. The karaoke sounded fantastic. The WIFI was fast and included in the $10 daily surcharge.

We chose Stay Hotel because it was cheap and in a good location - it's literally a street behind the main strip and the beach. The room was fairly clean however upon arrival my bed sheets were dirty. There was also no fridge and the sink in the bathroom was so small that whenever we used it water went everywhere. Also, we would be woken up early every morning to the sounds of construction and trucks moving as right across the road work would start early. Most of the staff at the front desk were extremely helpful and friendly and always helped us to organise shuttle buses to the outlets and taxi services when needed. Overall, we got what we payed for. It was perfect for accommodating 2 girls on a holiday and was also within our budget.

If you're looking for luxury, head elsewhere. But if you're cool with having a comfy place to crash, shower, and change, this is your spot. The location can't be beat as it's two blocks from the beach and everything else you'd want, and ultimately that's what you're paying for. This hotel is basically an upgrade from a hostel. I was traveling by myself, and the room was small but met all my needs. I was staying on the 6th floor (room 604) and noise was not an issue for me. There is a karaoke bar on the first floor, so it could be noisy if you were staying on a lower level. On my last day, the front desk was kind enough to hold my luggage as it was an 11am checkout and my flight wasn't until 11pm!Downsides: I did find two roaches on the floor during my stay. There was "pest control" cleaning on my third day, and I didn't see any roaches until afterward; unsure if that had anything to do with it. I'm not horrified by bugs, but if you are, it's something to consider.

PROS:Clean. Especially when considering the age of the building.Front desk. Pleasant and engaging staff.Location. Two blocks from the beach, shopping, and dining options.CONS: Noise. The windows in many rooms are like glass blinds, a style that is common in Hawaii. They provide little noise insulation, so we were awoken by our boisterous neighbors and loud crashing noises in the adjacent alley throughout the night.Amenities fee. We were surprised to have to pay an additional $10 fee when checking in. This was not mentioned when we booked and paid for the room by credit card online (via hotels[dot]com).Parking garage. It's small and was completely full when we arrived. Had to park at a different hotel about three blocks away ($25).Disrepair. The floor lamp and some of the turn-key devices on the blind-style windows were either broken or not working properly.Fridge. There isn't one.OVERALL:Clean, sparse room in a decent location that would likely be attractive to small groups of friends looking for shopping, beach time, and partying (perhaps in the karaoke bar on the first floor).Due to a last-minute schedule change, we had to book an extra night in Waikiki and thought we were getting a deal when Stay Hotel was advertised as 50% off the regular rate. However, we did not feel that it was a good value for a married 30-something couple in town trying to mix a bit of relaxation in with their business obligations.

from the time you arrive to you leave,you are made to feel welcome, checkin a breeze,one street away from the beach,food,walking distance to just about everything, we had a 2 bedroom suite, very clean,beds so comforatble,2 bathrooms.. Breakfast was included which is a bonus. Would recommend The Stay Hotel if you are after a great location, close to everything,if you are spending to much time in your room,you aren't enjoying Hawaii. Staff are a great asset to this hotel

I moved to Stay after booking elsewhere and being so uncomfortable that I had to find something else. Luckily Stay was right next door and within my budget. The staff was wonderful in accommodating me and attempting to get me in slightly earlier than the 4pm check-in (as I had a call in meeting at 2pm). The rooms are small, but clean, and are in the style of most older buildings that you find in Honolulu (brick with tile flooring). The location can't be beat -- steps from the shops and the beach.

When we arrived we backed up the block trying to back up form the locked parking garage, to park on the street to check in. The counter was busy, but the gentleman was friendly. I was charged an additional $100 deposit, which I was not aware of, and parking (expected if it were better organized) The room was gross, the closet was filthy, the baseboards, behind the toilet, the air conditioner area was covered in dust. When we got out of the shower our feet were dirty from the floors not being mopped properly. The shower tub was cleaned, but not the tile walls, had dried bugers, and something else. The TV remote was broken, and not replaced when asked, the AC did not properly cool the room, the curtains did not shade the room, so in the early morning the room was bright and hot. Our neighborhood were a group of party boys, that were loud all night. I run a cleaning and maintenance business on the Big Island and know things could be done much better without total renovation and a bucket of bleach. The location was amazing, thankfully we were out most of the days. Make the rooms actually look like their online photos

The sunburn has gone and the reality has set back in ... I'm not in Hawaii anymore (someone book me on the next plane!!!)When adventuring you always want a good base to just chill from before you go out adventuring and when you drag yourself back in from them. Stay Waikiki was the perfect place for me! Stone's throw away from the beach and a walk away from like five million ABC stores (need those snacks).Wanted to say a massive thank you to Tanya and Staci who were working away at the reception. Wonderful, friendly and duh, local... told me all the good places to go explore! Really excellent service that I got, which was awesome when you're by yourself and in a new country. Can not say enough good things about them :)Cheap and cheerful room to relax in .. or go outside on the balcony and read. Air conditioner was epic. Like I said, you want a nice place to sleep in and refresh yourself in...but admit it...you're in Hawaii not just to stay in the hotel. So tuck into the breakfast in the morning (nice bonus that I didn't know about) and grab a beach towel from reception (mats are provided in the room) and enjoy Oahu.I would definitely book here again when I'm next in Oahu.

I stayed one night at the hotel between flights and found it to be a simple, clean and comfortable choice. My only slight complaint was the lack of a suitcase rack, or two, so my suitcases weren't on the floor - having fold-out racks makes accessing suitcases and backpacks much easier (also, although there was a chest of drawers in the room, there was only a single wardrobe which may be a bit small for a couple - a double could have been provided as there is enough room). Other than that, particularly given it was under half the price of the other choices around it and very near Waikiki Beach, I can't fault it. Upon arrival, I found the staff to be polite and helpful, the bed was comfortable (but may be low for anyone with poor knees - it is not an ensemble bed), the bathroom functional and clean and tidy and the free Wi-Fi worked well for the short time I used it. I definitely would consider staying again particularly given the price. I gave it four stars as it is great value-for-money.

This hotel was perfect for our one night stay in Waikiki. It's in a great location and the staff were all very accommodating. The hotel is a little outdated but it didn't hamper our stay in the slightest. The karaoke bar downstairs has great food and a great atmosphere. We'd definitely stay here again.

Such great location, close to everything around Waikiki and public transport. Only thing I would suggest is to NOT get a twin bedroom- you will be very disappointed the rooms are extremely small and somewhat dirty. But the one queen bed is lovely.Giovanni is a wonderful young man who helped with every request, and provided 100% fantastic services! It was a pleasure having him at the desk as he was so helpful. Overall great place to stay with great service and very accommodating.

This is nice hotel. Close to all the shops and beaches. Has underground parking but you must pay extra. Nice continental breakfast. All in all a nice hotel but biggest issue was outside noise. Rooms have on one wall of just glass shutters so you hear everything. However management said they will be boarding them up soon. But this place was cheaper than most hotels so if your more on costs. This is not a bad place. Just bring ear plugs for when you sleep

It's hard to find affordable accommodations in Waikiki, so this wasn't a surprise, but the facility felt like a cheap apartment. If you intend to spend most of your time on tours and out-and-about, this is a reasonable location and less expensive than the big hotels in the area. You get what you pay for (well, not quite, but compared to the rest of Waikiki...): the room is a little dirty, you will be watched by the people in the neighboring buildings will watch you any time your curtains aren't closed, the facilities feel like they need maintenance.Not a horrible place to stay so long as you know what you are getting into... and compared to the rest of Waikiki, the price is comparable to similar places.

The price of accommodation at this hotel, made us question it a bit, due to the superb location. This is a hidden gem of a budget hotel. Waikiki Beach, great restaurants, shopping, local buses and night markets all within 1 to 2 blocks.Clean rooms, comfortable beds and helpful, friendly staff. Our resort fee ($10/day) covered a generous continental breakfast for 2 which was still plentiful and fresh if you came down late, free use of laundry facilities, beach chairs, beach towels, etc.Only complaint is that it can become noisy at night so bring earplugs if that would bother you. You can buy a lot of earplugs to save hundreds of dollars a night.

What a bad decision was to "stay" at Stay. I honestly don't know where to start so I will bullet some stuff and let you figure out the rest if you dare stay here for some reason:The Good (there's always something):*Location*Free WiFi*Water Pressure*The Shampoo and Lotion*Bed linens and towels were clean*All lightbulbs worked*The staff is borderline pleasant but does nothing to acknowledge you or inquire on how your room or stay is, not even at checkout but that's probably because they are afraid of the answer so why bother.*The price even though still deceiving! I can't imagine trying to write a review if I had payed full price.The Bad:*If you look at their website, imagery is not reflective of the facilities...those pictures are like a science fiction movie so do not expect your room to look as nice.*Although the linens and towels were clean, the rest of the room didn't feel properly clean. Dirty windows, rusted drapes, there was hair in the bathroom wall and old dirt above the bathroom tile.*Furniture in disrepair*Paper thin pillows*Waking up to the sound of the trash trucks in the morning and the beeping of deliveries to nearby businesses as early as 530am due to lack of proper windows.Appreciated even though not used:*Continental breakfast (people seemed to enjoy but then again most would go for the free stuff and appear to be happy with it just because is free)There is a karaoke establishment in the lobby that didn't bother me, however if there is going to be such establishment in the lobby management should look at ways to monitor the elevator which anyone can get to at anytime, no questions asked.I guess I appreciate receiving an email from the General Manager overnight on departure date asking for feedback. However and especially given the condition of this hotel, I would suggest you are more visible in your operation, introduce yourself to people, see what your staff is doing or not doing. Maybe instead of sitting at the desk all day doing nothing they can help you compose an inspection sheet that addresses your most common and fixable complaints that don't require "renovating". Why leave it up to your paying guests to tell you at the end of their stay what they thought and then apologize saying the hotel will be refurbished and that you wish we told you while we were there to see what you could do? Perhaps you need to start walking the rooms and corridors of your hotel and addressing the simple things that can truly make a difference. See that the rooms are properly cleaned, that maintenance is looking at shower heads that fall when you turn on the water to prevent this to happen to a guest like it happened to me. This questions may remain unanswered, and constructive suggestions and feedback ignored but in the end I've done my part, paid for my stay and given you the feedback you requested.To the readers of this review and potential guests: Stay "elsewhere" Waikiki.

Two night stay. Hotel was clean in all the areas we went to. The simple style was fine and the excellent shower water pressure with plenty of hot water was appreciated. The lobby staff was pleasant. A small breakfast and newspaper were daily perks. If you want a clean, but sparse furnished room and want to walk to everything then this is your hotel. It does get noisy outside but with ear plugs, no problem. I had read the comments on this hotel before I got there and found most complainers were probably not American (not use to our normal expectations) and expected a five star hotel. Nice hotel. My only suggestion is to stay two nights or less.

I was happy with my room at the Stay Hotel. It is conveniently located in the middle of "everything" in Waikiki and very near the beach. The staff were helpful and the room was clean. The rooms are small and simple. I was in Honolulu with work and events in mind, so my main requirement was a safe, affordable place to sleep in the general area of where I needed to be. I was comfortable and satisfied.

Booked a room because of my disability. As i have a mobility scooter we were given a corner room"211" it was so hard to manouver my scooter through the door. I felt like going to another hotel because this isn't a hotel that is suitable for people in wheelchairs or on scooters but because it was late at night and it was just for a stopover on our way home, we stayed.

Staff friendly, room perfect for short term or overnight in transit, not a flash hotel but comfortable and well located in Waikiki. Complementary continental breakfast unexpected. Noise didn't bother me and lift was not a problem for me. I would stay again. Basic facilities but no complaints..

I found the website for this hotel to be very deceiving, as the photos made it look much nicer than it is. Upon arrival we could see it basically looks just like the lobby for a hostel, even with the entrance to a karaoke bar not far from front desk. We made our way to our room and realized it only got worse, the elevator tried to hurt us a few times (gives you 4 seconds to get in then shuts), the light outside of the elevator door on the second floor was burnt out making it dark and sketchy since the halls are outside. Our room which was on the front side of the second floor was ok when we first arrived, but after spending some time in there we realized some things: I didn't have a light next to my single bed, but there was a plug there labelled 'floor lamp', the TV remote did not work, the blinds were filthy, so I opened them to see the dirty shutters, and bad view, the shower is basically a coffin, I am claustrophobic so I could not spend long in it, and the worst part, which was there were no real windows just shutters, nothing to shut to drown out the street noise, so we tried to do this with the A/C.. Neither my mom or I slept much the one night we were able to stay (out of our 6 reserved nights). I was woken up for good at about 4am when the deliveries and dumpster emptying started. I know we were on the front street but it felt like it was all happening in our room. We also heard the doors in the other rooms slamming all night, as well as the bar crowd coming and going. My mom did not sleep at all as she jumped at every noise, and thought about how she didn't feel safe staying there after I left a few days later. at 4:30am we started reading the reviews, which we really should have done when booking, and saw that we were not alone. We then started looking for deals on hotels.com for other hotels and found really nice ones for $120/night, where we were paying $200/night to stay at Stay, so we decided to move hotels and cancel our remaining days there since even if the issues were rectified, and we moved to a higher floor, we still didn't want to stay due to the lack of value, and not feeling comfortable there.I know we booked it a long time ago when peak rates were listed, and we managed to luck out with a last minute deal ($140/night at Aqua Skyline with 2 very comfortable and clean queen sized beds, doors and windows that shut, a pool and an amazing view), but I don't think $200/night is acceptable for a room of that quality, with 2 single beds in it, at any time of year. The front desk lady was really nice and helped us check-out smoothly. We did not mention why we were leaving as we didn't want any offers to move rooms, we just wanted to leave. I would say the only thing going for this hotel is the location, and I would recommend it for backpackers, or young people who plan to just pass out there after a night of partying, rather than to get a good night's sleep. I see the manager plans to upgrade the windows, which would help a lot, but in the mean time I would definitely not recommend it for older people or families with young kids.

1) Noisy - the windows here are the kind you find in warehouses. This means ZERO noise protection, which makes you feel like you're sleeping in the street. Partygoers and loud drunks until late at night (weekends - 4am), especially since the first floor has a karaoke bar. And construction noises from 8am (building a new hotel next to it).2) Old - The rooms themselves are old and poorly renovated. Especially the bathroom. Also the fact that I didn't have a chair or a proper desk in my room was very annoying.3) Extremely Greedy Pricing - I know that it's high season (end of year), but paying ~$450/night was simply an act of greed. This is the kind of room I would feel bad paying $90/night for (unfortunately, I didn't have much choice - it was either staying in this hotel or sleeping in street, which noise-wise, didn't feel much different).

This hotel is very basic - no gym, no kettle in the room, no safe deposit box. It is very central to Waikiki beach and easy to get anywhere in town. Continental breakfast (I wouldn't really call it breakfast - orange slices, apples, bread, yoghurt, cereals and horrible pastries) included, unlike many better hotels. It's like a motel with entry to rooms from outside passage (very wet in the rain). But who cares - you have a place to sleep and in Honolulu you will probably be outside all day anyway! All the big hotels are in walking distance so you can have a nice culpa at the Hyatt opposite, for example.

I came with my daughter for a week and we had a lovely stay at this place, it was unusual since we had the bunkbed room, but I enjoyed every minute of it. Very close to beach, about a minute walk and to local restaurants just down the road. We stayed here end of Mai 2014. If you want more luxury then you prob. better of across the street at the big resort, but I would come back here today.
user_name:
Ute M
Los Lunas, New Mexico

review_body: My partner and I along with my parents booked two twin rooms for two nights. They were great, comfortable bunk beds, clean showers, tv in both rooms. Breakfast was basic but its free so no ccomplaining from us. I work in hotels so I am fairly fussy but if you need a place to stay, one block from the beach, on a mediun budget - this is the place for you. All staff were friendly and helped us with everything over our stay. Highly recommended.

the place was ok shouldn't expect anymore for the $130 in such a prime location. but at least a parking space for the car, very limted spots so if you have a car make sure you book a space when you book your room $25 per night. As for the room very very small! the only way in to the queen bed was to crawl on from the end of the bed as there is next to no room on the sides of the bed, which was ok for us but if you have a bad back or something maybe ask about the access. and a little trouble with powerpoints to which made it a little tricky to charge our stuff. how ever the sheets were clean the staff were friendly and happy to help where they could and the breaky was good..

The staff were great, our bathroom sink wasn't draining and they got it fixed quickly. The beds were comfortable and linen/towels nice and clean. A hair dryer provided was also a handy touch to the room. However, the room itself was tired and needed a full on clean. Also disappointing was the lack of sound proofing to the room, with glass slat windows the street noise and in our case early morning construction noise came straight into the room. Thankfully for our travels accommodation is simply somewhere to sleep and shower, if you're looking for more look elsewhere.

As the title says this place is a bit tired albeit with a comfortable bed. In the rooms they have clearly taken a few short cuts and the decor has seen it's used by date. It feels a bit like a student flat where everything is either old or secondhand so all mismatched. Service on arrival was good. Couple of things that would have helped. I'm 6 months pregnant so someone to help me with my bag would have been good. There doesn't appear to be a lift from the carpark to reception. A slightly earlier check in time. 4pm is quite late in the day if you have spent 24 hours traveling. Last thing to point out while the hotel is well located, one street back from Waikiki beach and amenities it is very noisy. The street constantly had deliveries trucks and so forth until the wee hours of the morning. I got a good price when booking online but I definitely wouldn't want to pay more than 100USD.

Booked at the end of September for a night in December. We were passing through Hawaii on our honeymoon to Australia. When we got there, the reservation was mysteriously canceled. No explanation. So we looked online and found a room for 30 bucks less than what we had originally booked, so we asked if we could just get that rate. By that time, our reservation had suddenly become "reinstated" and they refused to honor the rate we found online. It took nearly an hour to get checked in. Surly girl at the front desk didn't help. Once we did check in, the room was filthy and in serious need of repair. Don't stay here.
user_name:
sarahufl
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed here late Oct with a friend. She arrived the night before I did & moved rooms several times due to cockroaches. Staff were very accommodating about this.We booked a room with a double bed & sofa bed which was really uncomfortable. The rooms were very light, both day & night & the street noise & noise from nearby apartments were quiet disturbing at all hours of the day.Breakfast was typical of a hostel & overall, that's how I would rate this hotel.The lication is great, just a couple of blocks from the beach, restraunts, supermarket & buses.If you are in Waikiki to party & want cheap accommodation, then this hotel is perfect. But if you want to sleep, I suggest paying extra & maybe a little further away from the beach.

If you want to sleep at night, DO NOT 'STAY' HERE. Good location but was woken by the departing guests from karaoke bar every single night and heard them on the street for ages. Louvered windows do not help this!Trucks, forklifts, skip bin filling and construction were just some of the beautiful sounds we heard at wee hours of the morning (I am on holiday for a reason!)Very basic, sugar-loaded breakfast but free wifi.

Great place to stay. Cute decor, friendly staff, great place all around. Very happy with everything. The lighting and the ambiance was perfect for a romantic getaway. Good shower, clean everywhere and decent free breakfast and beach towels. Thank you!!!

Terrible!!!! The web site is very deceiving. The rooms don't have enough room to open a suitcase let alone two! Balconies are not even large enough to sit on. Beds almost sit on the ground and are not sleep friendly!

Had a great stay here. This hotel is close to everything, beach 3 min. walk. Bus tour p/u 2 min. ABC store 1 min. The rooms were clean and cool. Free breakfast every day along with a free paper. I would stay here again here in a heart beat

Stayed for 7 days to attend a convention with 2 elderly companions , nov 13-20. An excellent location for my companions as there are a lot of places to go to by foot. Hotel is decent, staffs are friendly, breakfast included that will fill you up ,towels are changed daily and room cleaned. Will definitely recommend to travellers that are not seeking luxury.

Great location, just 1 minute walk to the beach. The staff were nice and helpful. Clean rooms. A bit noisy but that didn't bother us. We stayed here first four nights and then went to the other islands and when we got back to Oahu we stayed there again!

Great place to stay. Tanya that works at night very helpful. Would stay here again. Close to everything. Clean establishment. Lots of great places to eat nearby. Farmers market beach was down the street. Comfortable room was what we needed!

Highly recommended by my son and his wife. If you're looking for a budget friendly decent place to sleep , change clothes and take a shower which for me are the basics in this trip then stay with this staff friendly hotel. But if you're looking for a luxurious , sleep like a baby type of hotel, then this is not for you. Book in those expensive high rise hotel and expect pay triple their price.The hotel is cleaned and towel changed everyday. Staff are courteous and will assist you the best they can as long as they are reasonable. Don't expect them to lessen the noise for you so you can sleep well because the hotel is located where buses are picking up those tour groups. Don't expect the lobby as spotless clean because a lot of young surfers , beachcombers and sun tanners goes in and out of this hotel. My wifi connection was excellent, I did FaceTime with my grandkids each night and upload pictures and chat with friends. If you want to save on phone bills esp. If you're from other countries, call them using the fb messenger . Connection is good and clear.

We had a quick stay over with family for the weekend in your 2-bedroom suite, the room was spacious and very accommodating for our party of 4. Your staff is amazingly friendly, everyone we came in contact with from the Front Desk staff (Phyllis, Staci, Tanya, Geri, Giovani are all jewels of Stay Hotel you should be so proud). Our Housekeeper was always so prompt every morning they should be commended, it's obviously not a popular brand obviously but if you're going to spend all your time in the room then be ready to spend more than $200+, we were very content and happy with our room(s). The breakfast was filling but the wifi very spotty. Other than that everything else went extremely well-Thank you we'll be back!!!

Stay Waikiki Hotel is an affordable Hotel just one block from the beach. The staff were very accommodating. They granted all our requests, including additional pillows, an electric fan, etc. The breakfast could have been perfect if there was more tables and chairs to eat on. The breakfast was distributed in the hallway lobby which did not have enough chairs to sit on. If they had moved the breakfast to the bar lounge room, then it would have been more comfy. The WiFi in the rooms was strong. The best feature in the hotel room we had, ( deluxe queen with sofa bed) was the big closet for luggage and clothes. We were able to store our luggage and hang our wet swim wear inside the closet. The sofa bed is a disappointment. It's uncomfortable to sit in, let alone to lay on.

All the rooms have louvre windows so the noise comes straight into all the rooms. Truck reversing beepers start at about 5am and go all day. Also the rubbish trucks start crashing around the bins at about 5am. The rooms are all low budget. Air conditioning u its are loud so we turned them of so we could sleep. There's a Karaoke bar on the ground floor and rooms above this are really loud. Doof doof doof and bad singing until the wee hours of the morning. On the positive side the staff are very friendly and helpful. They apologised for the noise and advised windows are 'apparently' being replaced next month. The breakfast is nice. Free towels provided for the beach as well as masks and snorkels and boogie boards. Location is excellent. Less than 100m to Waikiki beach. I spoke to several people also staying at the Hotel and they all said they would not go back. I even saw two separate people using the Internet in the foyer researching other hotels. The only way I would stay there again is if the windows were replaced with double glazing, the air conditioning is replaced with updated quiet model and only then I'd stay on a high level (level 5 upwards). My brothers were in room 205 and they both said the noise and Karaoke bar was so loud. I was in a room on the road end of level 5 and the truck reversing beepers were crazy loud so changed to room 707 which was more in the middle and quiter but still just so loud!

As everyone has mentioned the location is fantastic and yes it is; however, the hotel was a dump. There was suppose to be free Wi-Fi and we were unable to establish an adequate connection. I have never stayed at such a noisy hotel. There were two slat windows that don't close and single pained windows; we heard every noise up till 11 pm and garbage trucks starting at 5 am. It was horrible. The room itself was clean but quite run down which does not matter if you are not intending on spending much time in the room. The continental breakfast was pretty disappointing and there isn't a table to eat at in the lobby. I would not stay there again unless it was a last resort. Lastly, one of the people in our group asked to use the phone so she could call a taxi and the receptionist was quite aggressive about which taxi to call since they get a commission, meanwhile we already had out own.

Accommodation in Hawaii is quite pricey and we found this place. 5 minute walk to the beach and right in Waikiki. Rooms are budget, but they have cleverly dressed this place with nice linen. I believe it was an ex back packers but again they have dressed it up nicely. Price is very cheap and you can request a bar fridge if your room doesn't come with one. I will be coming here next time I come to Hawaii. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Also a very nice bar down the bottom which has nice beer and wine.

I stayed here last year and was totally satisfied with the accommodations. The room is bright and clean. Comfortable beds and very nice linens. A very nice continental breakfast every morning so you can be on your way with your activities and not have to wait on lines at restaurants. No need to book at any other hotel. This is centrally located 1 block from Waikiki beach in the center of the "strip". You can easily access all the major shops, hotels, restaurants & beach activities in a few minutes walk. The staff is super friendly, caring and go out of their way to make you feel like family. A very big thank you again to Jasmine who was the reason why we returned this year. Thank you Phyllis at the front desk for assisting us with our check-in and giving us some tips on great places to eat during our stay. Everyone on the staff (front desk and housekeeping) are wonderful.

The breakfast was ok, better than we expected. The location is really good, close to the beach, the shopping streets and the bars. We used the sofa bed, and that bed was terrible... Small for two persons and not good to sleep in, but the Queen bed was great! There was much noise outside in the morning because of building construction, so difficult to sleep after 8 am!

The pictures are not accurate. Not clean at all but staff are very friendly. I Would not stay here again just based on cleanliness. We had to ask for brooms to sweep our own room. The location was very good, within walking distance to restaurants and shopping.

Stay Waikiki.This hotel was not what I expected. In spite of other reviewers comments I took a chance and stayed at this hotel. The location is great. Walking distance to everything you need in Waikiki. However I didn't plan on visitors. (see picture) Anyway I understand its an island. But this was UNacceptable. You've been warned.
user_name:
Photogenic1
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: Hotel clean, rates excellent and staff very friendly and helpful. Close to beach and restaurants and while the rooms are old and limited in layout it was great value for money. Would definitely stay again.

The location is great right in the middle of everything, but I've stayed in hotel 6s better than this. Floors are nasty. The bathroom had hair on the walls and it's right next to some delivery dock so there were trucks and loud noise from heavy machinery and unloading pallets all night. The windows are just shutters so there's really no way to even make it quiet. Booked through expedia and for the same price you can find a much nicer hotel that's even closer to the beach. This was our first trip to Hawaii and it would've been nice to actually sleep.

We stayed at the Stay Waikiki October 23-27, 2014 which was recommended to us by Expedia. I have never been so disappointed with a hotel as we were at this hotel. The rooms were not renovated, they are just old with a new coat of paint. We originally requested 2 queen beds but found out too late that we only had one queen bed with a sofa bed. The sofa bed was a folded out futon type with a very hard crease in the middle and totally impossible to sleep on. The vent in the bathroom would not close all the way so hot air was coming in the bathroom so we had to keep the bathroom door shut to keep the hot air out. The rest of the room didn't even have a chair to sit on and the air conditioner was totally inadequate to get or keep the room cool. I complained to the desk clerk and nothing really changed.
