It would have taken a lot of paperwork and extra time to change hotels so we didn't change. The picture on the internet does not adequate portray how old the hotel really is. The reason why I booked the hotel is because of the location and the price but it is definitely not worth the sacrifice. If you want to stay at a hotel that is something you want to remember with fond memories, then don't t stay here. I also blame Expedia for recommending such a hotel to us when they apparently really didn't know what they were talking about. I will never use Expedia again either. There were numerous problems with Expedia and I plan on voicing my opinion on their website too. Pay a few dollars more and stay and a descent hotel. You won't be sorry you did.

We stayed here for our Honeymoon. It's located close to the beach. The rooms are old but well kept. The price just can't be beat for the location. The floor is hard, which means the sand from the beach is easy to clean, as opposed to getting ground into carpet. The staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurant/bar onsite is great.We would definitely stay here again.

I often travel to Oahu for business and try to find the best deals on rooms, being that there are so many places to stay and everyone wants to have you stay with them. This place is very reasonable priced for the money!! I is right smack dab in the the heart of Waikiki and is only about 10 min away from the Royal Hawaiian Center where there are many shops and restaurants. They even have a center stage where entertainment is free for your enjoyment! No you could pay a higher priced hotel to see the same thing but let's face it... if your on a business trip like me, and you need to take your clients out to dinner or meet some friends, then the best place to stay in Waikiki is the STAY WAIKIKI HOTEL!! The rooms are clean and comfortable and the location is perfect!! They even have a bar in the lobby with Karaoke so you and your friends can hang out and relax!! Make your reservations today!! I 'll be back and booking my next trip already!!!

My friend and I stayed here for four days last week and it was amazing. The location of the hotel is literally a block away from the beach and some amazing restaurants. Everything was within walking distance. The ladies at the front desk were super nice and helpful, giving us numerous tips on places to go and eat. The room was nice too! Small, but exactly what we paid for. For the price we paid, this place was perfect. I would definitely stay here for my next Hawaiian trip. However, no review is complete without some of the negatives. Apparently, this hotel brought in a karaoke bar a few months before we got there. We never went in, since karaoke isn't my thing, but at night it gets really loud. I sleep like a bear, so I wasn't bothered. But my friend said every morning how loud it was and that is was difficult for him to sleep. I even talked to a girl that lived in the apartments next door and she said she could hear them! Also, it didn't bug me much, but we had a couple cockroaches in the hotel. The hotel tried to come in and spray the room, but we had just gotten back from a hike and weren't planning on leaving, so they said they would do it another day. Overall, the location, price, and service beats out the noise and bug problems.

Stayed here for one night. The place was clean, however the rooms are old and basic. Location could not be better and the price was reasonable. Good staff and an excellent bar on the ground floor. Recommended if you are on a budget. Not many places around in this location at affordable prices.

I really enjoy this hotel. It is my typical choice when visiting Oahu. Very reasonably priced and within walking distance of most of Waikiki. The wireless internet continues to be slow and lags, watching videos or Netflix is impossible. The addition of Wang Chungs karaoke bar changes the dynamics of the hotel. It got a little loud Friday night when patrons were leaving the bar. Also fyi to any one thinking about making this their location, realize it is on more of an alley than a street and you will likely hear many buses and dumpsters. However, for the price and location it can't be beat.

Only stayed here for two days and found it to be a pleasant stay. Very close to the main St and restaraunts so great to be able to walk everywhere. We stayed during hurricane ana and our roof started to leak a little, but reception soon had someone up to check and fix. Not fancy but we didn't pay fancy price as we wanted basic accommodation and this was great

The hotel I usually stay is a block away, they are doing construction around there, so I decided to stay here. This is now my go to hotel. Its a small hotel, about 8 floors with 10 rooms each. Staff is friendly, not sure if they have a self laundry service but they a public one off of Kuhio. I will definately stay here again, ooo ya bring ear plugs, I had the end room, island windows, can be pretty noisy.

Booked this hotel (more like a motel) for two nights and regretted it so much!Hotel is cheap looking, rooms are dirty, curtains in room had a huge yellow stain, bathroom was disgusting and tiny. Pillows were flat and cheap. Furniture in room looks like it's from Ikea, very old and rusty. Stay away from this place and pay a little more to stay at a better place. The only thing good about the hotel is that is about two blocks from the beach. If you are looking for a nice getaway from your busy city life, I do not recommend Waikiki beach (super crowded, run down looking and no island feel what's so ever) Go to one of the smaller less developed islands of Hawaii. Good luck!
user_name:
vancutie
New York City, New York

review_body: Staff: great, helpfullRoom: I was expecting a really funky room, the photos looked great and bought a boutique room for our last nigth in waikiki. it was very basic small and nothing like the pictures. felt very ripped off as we stayed at a few other hotels at a similar price bracket and they all felt nice to come back to after a big day exploring. bathroom was tiny. smallest I have seen.Will advise not to book here unless you get it very cheap.

Dears,It was a 2 nights experience...its really for the ones who r going who wants to have fun in hawaii and not for those who r going to stay all day in the hotel.Everything is near...waikiki beach..bus stops..tour pick up.U will have wifi and a really low budget breakfast...no view at all.Reception staff are great...stacy is the best.U will hear noise at 6 am.truck unloading!!!Who cares if u r leaving for a tour at 7 am.Ill recommend if u r willing to put money on you on fun hours and on shopping not on high budget rooms.

We recently stayed here for one night before we headed to the outer islands. The receptionists were lovely and helpful throughout our stay. The room was very clean (something I was nervous about judging some previous reviews) and perfect for us. location is fantastic, right by the beach and shops but one block back so quiet. Great if you are planning to be out and about for most of your holiday.

We chose this hotel as it was close to everything (only 1 block from the beach) & was reasonably priced. We had a suite which consisted of 2 rooms so we had enough room for all the suitcases.The Hotel is clean & staff are friendly the only complaint is the noise, you have trucks doing deliveries all night & the noise from the street with people partying is very loud.

We stayed here on the 30th of September 2014. The room was a gift from my kids for my trip. The staff was polite and helpful. The place is small. The show was really small but it worked. Everything was pretty clean. The breakfast was great but get up early and enjoy it. They even were willing to allow me to leave the car parked a few extra hours so I could go walk the shops before my departure. READ THE WEBSITE. THE EXTRA FEES ARE LISTED!!! There wasn't many surprises other then all the help. One of my bags was lost in transit and when it arrived at the hotel they called my room immediately to let me know it was present and safe. ( thank you again!!!) Yes, I would stay here again.
user_name:
JP W
Anchorage, Alaska, United States

review_body: I am not writing a Negative review because this hotel is good value for money. The hotel is in a fantastic location, clean and all the staff are friendly and helpful. You get free beach toys. When you arrive there is a 10 dollar per day charge which they don't tell you about, and you can opt out of. This covers breakfast and wifi. The breakfast is sufficient , could do with a bit more choice. The wifi is sufficient and has good coverage. The room is clean and of a good size. The shower is fantastically powerful, however our shower constantly was dripping and the noise was seriously annoying. The room would have benefitted from a fridge. The other thing the front of the hotel doesn't have proper windows. It was hinged glass that didn't make a complete seal. This meant for. Very noisy night. The small air con vent couldn't cope with the demand needed to cool the room. Having said all that the hotel is what it is, it's clean, the staff are all very friendly and the bed was comfortable. I would recommend staying here If you are looking somewhere cheap to stop over for a few nights. We chose to stay else where on our return to waiki

I stayed here for 4 nights and would definitely stay here again if I ever get the chance to return to this wonderful island! The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and you can easily regulate the temperature by opening the windows or turning on the AC. Free Wi-Fi in the room and free computers in the lobby. There's simple, but good continental breakfast with coffee and juice included. The beach is just a block away! There's ABC stores on almost every block/corner in Waikiki and one really close to the hotel, where you can get whatever you need. There's alot of shops and restautrants on Kalakaua ave. The bus stop is just a block away with several buses to Ala Moana (Beach, park and shopping). This is a good hotel for both couples and families or if you're travelling alone or with your friends. If you're going to Waikiki and want good value for your money, clean rooms, good service and want to stay close to the beach, shopping and restaurants then stay at Stay :)

We have stayed at the Stay Hotel on Koa Ave. 2 different times. It's not fancy or upscale. It is very clean and cute. The location is great, it sits behind the Hyatt where all the tour buses pick up and drop off. The beach is one block up, and from this Hotel you can see a small piece of the ocean from the balcony. Next door is an ABC store where you can get anything you need. We will stay here again cause all we really need is a clean bed, hot shower, and the beach. This place has it. Hope this helps and ALOA!

Great value. Rooms are not as nice as they look in photos but still have the basics. The shower is tiny so a large or tall person would have trouble getting in. Service and staff are all very good. Floors, baseboards and bathroom walls could be cleaner. Loved our stay here and would stay again if we came bavk to hawaii.

Not agreeing with the other reviews on this site. We found the hotel good for the price. The sites make you aware of the service fee- which is $10/day. Although it is not a flashy hotel the rooms are clean, front desk staff are very friendly and helpful and THE LOCATION IS AWESOME!!!

I felt misled by the pictures online to tell you the truth. It looks cleaner, brighter, more stylish and contemporary than what it actually is.When I arrived about 11:45pm I didn't feel safe at all. The foyer is run down, there was a security guard sitting there just 'hanging around' and when I went to check in, the guy checking me in seemed like he would rather be somewhere else. To add to that I then find out there was a mix up with room bookings. Eventually got to my room, however it was completely dark on the landing outside my door, the light-switch inside the room didn't work and it wasn't at all something welcoming or inviting for guests who had travelled a long way.To add to that - I booked and paid in advance so I won't have any extra 'hidden' surprises and then I find out there is an extra $10 per night (which they take out of my bond, no choice) for the breakfast (which I didn't eat and the wifi - which was advertised as free). Given I'm not a breakfast person and I could lived without the wifi, it would have been nice to not have to pay for something that I didn't use.The lady on the front desk the next couple of days was friendly which was a bonus - but overall as a solo female traveller, I wouldn't recommend it. It just didn't feel safe.Also - there was no instructions in the room on how to use anything and I missed an activity on my last day as there was a message left on my room phone changing the time but I didn't know how to retrieve it, therefore missed the connection. Wasn't amused.All in all I wouldn't recommend it as a place to stay. Next time I will be heading across the road and paying a mere few dollars more to stay at the Hyatt Regency or somewhere else. The manager will probably say I should have told them at the time, but to be honest, I didn't feel they were approachable enough to want to hear the feedback, considering when I checked in and questioned the extra charges the guy was pretty uptight and defensive.

We stayed here for two nights, which we are glad it was only this long. We got put in this small room. It had other peoples hair on the floor, as the floor is tiled is not hard to see. There was a couple of cockroaches . The bathroom was so so with the bath not so clean. They had no fridge in the room unlike the description on the website. Our bed was under the slat windows, which faced the walk way. The door was flimsy. We did not feel safe in this hotel. There was suppose to be a safety deposit box for valubles but there was no room, so we had to lock what we couldn't carry in our bags and hope it was safe. I like to see the positive in all hotels and comment about them but in the case I can't. I will not stay here again or recommend this hotel.

When we arrived, the desk lady told us that the room price was NOT the one advertised on booking.com, but there was an extra MANDATORY 20$ for breakfast and wireless. This is always SO disappointing. The breakfast was TERRIBLE and since they deduce the breakfast price from the 100$ security deposit they force you into paying the extra fee. This is not only very dishonest, it is a true insult to the people booking online who compare prices to make a good choice, and show how Stay Hotel considers tourists just like people to squeeze for money at the limit of legality.

The staff here is wonderful. So many pleasant, accommodating people.The rooms are very basic, so if you're looking for a "hotel" experience, this isn't it.Continental breakfast is good, and generous.Overall, very good value place.
user_name:
nyeastcoast
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is an old refurbished apartment building. It is only okay. There are jalousie windows that cover tye entire wall so there is no kindmof view at all. The bed was decent and it is close to the beach. It would not be good for families or senior travellers. The shower dripped loudly, and the towel rack is positioned so you have to dodge it to use the toilet, it should be mounted above the back of the toilet not on the side. Also I was trying to sleep in a bit and the hotel called me two hours ahead to remind me that the checkout time was 11 am. I already knew this and did not appreciate being disturbed.

We booked our one night stay due to an overnight layover. It was on the back end of our trip and until the hurricane/tropical storm, we originally had no plans to stay in or see Oahu. But anyway, we paid very little for our room due to an online deal. Loved the location. The staff was very friendly and also gave a great restaurant suggestion (Dukes!!!). We were only in our room for a few hours to sleep and shower before having to leave in the wee hours of the morning to catch our flight home. Bed was comfortable, shower was hot, i didn't see any bugs, didn't have trouble with outside noise. The rooms are tiny, bathroom is tiny, and it felt a little bit like the kind of place that might rent rooms by the hour.I felt misled by the pictures online but for what we paid, it's location, and the very short visit, it did the trick. I can't say I'd choose to stay here again for a lengthy vacation. Maybe if i was in a pinch.

I checked in and instantly knew that I was in for a scary experience... When I got into my room I looked in the bathroom and there were 5 roaches in there...I understand that this hotel is on the less expensive side but I paid enough not to have an infestation on my hands...

This hotel is THE BEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK! See my scathing review of White Castle or whatever it's called in Waikiki. It was a NIGHTMARE. Back to STAY. My husband and I LOVE STAY. We are going to be repeat offenders. They are so adorable they offer you beach chairs and boogie boards at the front desk. The bar/food was awesome - happy hour that could rival any luxury resort. Cute lobby with HIP and happening people. Yes the rooms are small and bare bones, but what else do you need but a decent bed to crash in and bath to bathe in? It is walking distance to Jimmy Buffett's, Cheesecake Factory, Dukes, the BEACH, and Waikiki Shell. Had a blast at Jimmy Buffett. Oh - and I forgot to mention our FAVORITE PART - the best little bar in Waikiki conveniently located RIGHT NEXT DOOR - WANG CHUNG'S!! GO SING SOME KARAOKE.

I booked this hotel, pre-paid (no refunds) for a 4-night stay during summer 2014. The "hotel rooms" looked like dorm rooms; terrible for their over ~$200/night. I found FOUR full-sized COCKROACHES in my room in 2 days. The only response I got from the front desk was "this is tropical Hawaii - it is normal to have cockroaches". The front desk would not move me to another room without wanting to charge me more. After spending a lot of money to come to beautiful Waikiki, this became such a nightmare that I abandoned the hotel after 2 days, and lost ~$500 in the process, as they were unwilling to refund my pre-paid fee. I ended up spending the last 2 nights, at additional cost to me, at a much better hotel. I will NEVER stay in this "Stay" hotel again. The photos of the rooms they show on the web are not representative of the actual rooms. I felt deceived big time.

From the moment I stepped into the lobby I knew I was about to experience one of those vacations where what I saw online was not the same as in person. They appeared to have attempted to make the hotel better with some paint but the room I stayed in looked like the guy who painted it was 5 years old. Everything was old from the a/c to the fixtures. The ONLY positive note was the location. So if you don't care...AT ALL about where you lay your head then stay here but I would never step foot in that place again!

Anybody travelling on a budget should not be having high expectations about hotel stay. But now when you advert and promise beautiful and spacious room and the guest gets there and find out everything was photoshopped, the big room was a tiny one actually, those nice colors were enhanced and photoshopped, disappointment and anger take place. Management shouldnt be surprised to receive negative comments always. This is not a 3star hotel, honestly speaking. Noone would complain if real pictures of room were advertised. People would know what to expect for what they pay. Reading a lot of comments and they are all the same, so please management instead of apologizing and promising to make it up to guests if they would come back (which I doubt it) save yourself the trouble and take down those pictures and post the real ones. Dont cheat honest people.On the bright side, Friendly and helpful staff I must say.

This is not The Ritz. You get what you pay for. Do you want luxury, choose another hotel. If you can' t sleep with noice. Bring earplugs or choose a hotel on the countryside. This is Waikiki. It' s never quiet.We stayed at Stay for 11 days i july. We are satisfied. We read on Tripadvisor and didn' expect too much. It was better than we expected. Our choice were to spend our money on things to do, not luxury hotel.2 Queensize room on 7th and 8th floor with balcony and some seaview.Comfortable beds. Clean rooms. Fridge. Friendly staff. Good continental breakfast. Very good location near Waikiki beach. Walking distanse to almost everything. I would stay here again.

We booked this hotel for one night, primarily for location. It is only a block from the beach and down town shopping. The website looked good and the room pictures are way over photo shopped so it is deceiving. Overall with exception to location and the friendly staff this hotel is by far the worst I have stayed at especially considering the rates. Our room was on the 8th floor & very small and very old. Fixtures in the bathroom were run down and the overall finish was very low end. The bed was very uncomfortable especially with the location of the needed air conditioner beside my head while I was trying to sleep. There was no room for clothing and no "SAFE" and felt very uneasy about leaving our valuables in the room. I would expect to find this type of room at a roadside motel in the middle of nowhere but not in Honolulu a block off the main strip. Had I been staying longer I would have cancelled my room once I saw it and moved to another hotel.

We chose this hotel mainly because of the price since we were on a budget. The location was great, it was a tiny block away from the beach. You could find everything around that area, and the bus stops were about a block or two away as well. If you went on tours they usually picked you up in the hotel right in front of it as well. The hotel itself wasn't very clean though, there were bugs around the room which I hated and the shower was a bit dirty. The windows were pretty old so they let a lot of noise in, and I mean A LOT. There was wi-fi available but I got pretty bad service from our room, so we mostly went downstairs to use the computers they had in the lounge area. I had been told they had a pool, so I was very disappointed finding out they did not. The staff was very friendly though. Overall we would definitely pay a bit more next time to get a more decent hotel.

The only thing positive about this hotel is the location and, for that reason alone, I would stay there again. However, I am not bothered by bugs which were everywhere in the room/bath. If bugs bother you, this is not your hotel. Our room/bath was very small and do not have any dressers for clothes so we just lived out of our suitcases (which was probably a better location to keep out the bugs out of the clothes ). The staff was delightful and very helpful.

I read the reviews before I booked and had my expectations very low...I was extremely satisfied! The room was clean and spacious III. We spent 4nights there. We were smack dab in the middle of EVERYTHING. No car was needed. The staff was friendly and did not bother us. They are in the process of renovating a bar in the lobby, so once that opens it's really going to give this boutique hotel a nice add on. We had a partial ocean view on the balcony on one side and then mountain view on the other side. Would stay here again!!

The rooms are clean and spacious and cannot complain about the location. There is a shoppe less than 50 ft. from the front door and restaurants all over the area. Also it is far away enough from the Mall that it is not too crowded for Waikiki. The employees are courteous and helpful. The only thing wrong with this place is that the bar and restaurant is under renovation but that is not permanent. All in all a great place.

We stayed here for one night and was disappointed. First, we arrived a little early, about 140 and check in was not till 4. Our room wasn't ready and it would be a bit till it was. We were attending a wedding and needed to freshen up a bit before. I asked to be called when my room was ready and I would come over and get situated. THE CALL NEVER CAME. Service, zero points. We had to get ready in another hotel. The location was good, one block from the beach, no ocean view though. While the street the hotel is on is close to mainstream Waikiki, it did seem to be in a seedier area with a hostel next door and those hanger around types just hanging around. We finally came back close to 11 at night and found there would be an additional 11 per night as a "RESORT FEE". Now, I use the term RESORT in its loosest sense. This was to pay for the "breakfast" which was served in the lobby area from 7 til 930 am. Thawed pastries, toast, cold cereal and yogurt. Eat to your heart's content.The lobby looked as though they tried to polish a turd. But, it's still a TURD. There was a single elevator and we waited for a long while for it to come. I think someone pressed all of the buttons and got off. That's the kind of element we found to be staying here. The room was "polished" as well. Initially we thought there wasn't a shower in the room. We eventually found it when we closed the bathroom door. The water pressure was great though. The bed was platform style and the room air conditioner was running when we entered which took away from the crazy heat and humidity of the exposed corridors. I hope people are listening to the reviews that are on here. I am usually optimistic and take the good ones into consideration, but in this case I should have read the negative ones as well. This place is NOT 3 STARS. THIS HOTEL IS A 1 STAR LOCATION DISGUISED AS A 3 STAR. The restaurant is under renovation, the service is substandard and the accommodations are basically a dump. Here's the scoop: if you want a place to sleep, don't care about service or amenities, and don't plan on being in the room at all, this place would be enough. But, if you want comfort and service, do not stay here.

Don't be put off by the naysayers. Stay is great and really good value for money. Stayed at Stay Waikiki as a couple for three nights at the end of June. Was a tad apprehensive before we arrived as I'd read the mixed reviews. However I was pleasantly surprised. We stayed in room 706 which is a a queen standard room. Our flight landed very early in the morning and we went to the hotel to drop our bags, already aware that we were way too early to check in. We returned about midday expecting to just hang out I the lounge area till 4pm but we're told our room was ready. I must mention Jasmine who works on the front desk, as she was incredibly helpful and friendly throughout our stay. Room itself was simple (this clearly isn't the Ritz) but had everything it needed. We had a balcony with partial sea views. Bed was comfortable, bathroom a good size with a full size bath. All of it was clean on arrival and the daily maid service was great. Flat screen TV, iPod Dock and excellent air con, which I didn't find particularly noisy despite other reviewers saying so. I had no trouble sleeping there at all due to noise, but should mention that the Sway Restaurant/bar was closed for renovation whilst we were there, so this may contribute to night time noise at other times.The location of Stay is amazing. Just a hop skip and a jump to Waikiki beach front.The breakfast was average and that's the best I can say about it. Not bad but not good. The free wifi and media centre were really great, and we had no problems connecting to the wifi even up on the 7th floorAll in all it's great value for the money you pay. If you want luxury then go to the Royal Hawaiian and stay there. And look at you room. A lot. Because you probably won't have the money to do anything else!

I was not prepared for how small this room was however it had a nice size lanai. It was like 1/2 a hotel room. The front desk staff was very nice. In the first 20 minutes of being in the room I killed over 20 cockroaches. They were on the floor, on the curtains, on the walls, in the shower, on and in the dresser, in the closet. I live in Hawaii and am used to these pests at my own house however the sheer number of them out in the open in this small room was creepy. We had trouble sleeping because we had cockroaches even on the bed.

Don't let the poor reviews deter/scare you. You will not find a more cost-efficient hotel in Waikiki. The bed was comfy, the staff was amazing, the breakfast is decent, and you are ONE BLOCK from the beach. I had friends staying in hotels on the beach, paying $400 a night for a tiny room. With my Hotwire discount, I paid 1/4 of that, including the amenity fee, for a large queen room with a small balcony. And it comes with really delicious mini croissants in the morning (are those from Costco, or what?).Let me address some of the complaints from other reviews:--Room size: Mine was great, but anyone complaining about a small room: go outside, you're in Hawaii. --Cockroaches: Apparently my boyfriend did see one cockroach in the bathroom. That being said, I saw one at a Starbucks, a couple on the beach, and one in the driveway of a very swanky hotel. It is what it is.--Noise: I didn't notice any noise, but I live in a very busy part of a large city most of the year. And there is noise everywhere in Waikiki anyway.--A/C: It doesn't matter where you stay, the A/C is "inadequate." It's comfortable for sleeping and lounging, but you're going to need to let your hair air dry (though, they have GREAT hair dryers for a hotel). The swanky hotels' rooms feel just as hot when you're getting ready. If you want cooler, go to a different part of Hawaii.--Breakfast: As you know, I really enjoyed the mini croissants. And the yogurt was good. If it's not enough, take some of that money you saved and go to the ABC store.

The hotel looks NOTHING like the pictures. The rooms are not safe. There is no lockable windows, their is no lighting, parking $25 a day!, elevator is crap that shuts with no warning and very fast! Dangerous!The bathroom is TINY! The shower is the size of a shoe box!There is no sound proofing so you will expect a very early morning wake up call from the tour buses!There is loud noises ALL night long from the hostels surrounding the building. The apartments are very dated and quiet dirty!The cleaners don't actually clean and the aircon will keep you awake all night long with how old and noisy it is! 4 people also checked out early due to not what they booked online! The rooms are very similar to prison cells!

A lot of our experience during our single overnight was excellent: brilliant location, friendly/helpful staff, good wifi, seemingly good price/value for the area. There was a $10 "amenity fee" that covered beach towels and mats and wifi and perhaps some things we didn't use which increased our good rate by 10% plus, but for all I know other hotels in Waikiki charge as well, and certainly of the places we checked, this was the best room price in the area we found.The beds were comfy and the room was reasonably clean.On the other hand the air conditioner was quite loud. Many of the glass louver windows were "frozen." some open and none could be fully closed so outside noise and humidity came with the room. We had no fridge nor coffee pot. The single elevator chattered to a stop and the doors were aggressive and the safety baffles didn't react quickly enough to stop one from being bumped around a bit by the closing doors. After being hammered once or twice I expect a sharp learning curve would apply and this would cease to be a problem, but be prepared. We noted no breakfast facility on the premises and none came with our room, but there are convenience stores and other options all over the area. (I see now their web sight says mini-fridge available upon request.)For someone wanting simple accommodation and great access to the beach at what seems a good price in the area, I recommend it. It's 100 meters from the beach or less and in a happening part of Waikiki. If you want anything close to luxury this isn't your place.

I stayed with my mother and 2 year old son for 10 days.I was scared at first because of all the bad reviews. Our room was basic, but we had a fridge and it was just fine for us. We stayed in room 703 and we had a little ocean view! It was great. Double awesome was we did not have people sharing the wall with us so when my son had a temper tantrum I was not mortified. I suggest you get the room with the queen bed and sofa sleeper on the highest level available, or room 703 lol. It was perfect for hanging around a little and sleeping. Do not come to this place with the expectation of a luxury hotel. You are getting a great location and basic stuff. Yes, it was noisy as the tour buses line up starting at 6 and end around 9 or 10, but we were so exhausted after every day it was a non-issue. The staff was absolutely phenomenal. :) We weren't able to get a late check out because of the popularity of the room (understandable) and they allowed us to stay in another room until a certain time, same as a late check out. It was a small room, but fine for just hanging for a little bit. Saved us from hanging out in the lobby more than necessary.

OK, I have to give it to them on one thing, location. Great location. But other than that, not a very nice place. I will try to not to make this as long as it should be. But I was intended to be here for 5 nights. I landed at Honolulu airport and before getting to far, I had a heart attack. I spent 3 nights in the hospital, I had to stay the 5 nights because it was a package deal. So got released from the hospital to a few days of recovery and then the nightmare started. I got to the hotel and found that the parking garage was one story under ground. I cannot lift anything over 10 pounds, so I stop before entering the garage and let the lobby know what was going on, the kid working did take my bag, but i had a heavy briefcase also. I had to go park down in the parking lot to find out no elevator to the lobby. Stairs were not real easy, but made it to the lobby. Got my room, no ask if I needed any help getting to my room, but rolled my way to the elevator to the 8th floor. Went in to a small, old but looked ok room. I sat on the bed, and it began. A roach ran across the bed, ok expected...in Hawaii, they have roaches. As night fell upon the room, the roaches started to come out of everywhere. About 10PM I called the front dest and the girl said I'm sorry but I don't have any other room. I asked for some spray and she said they were going to have the Hotel sprayed tomorrow. OK, left it at that. Had to leave every light in the place on all night long and lay there watching the roaches circle the room. Not a nice restfull place to be after a heart attack. I made it through the night. I had one more night, not sure what to do, more hassle to move to another hotel at that point with no help. So I stayed another night. They did come to spray and I told the guy about the night before, it was like no big deal... we have roaches here is all he said. I twas a little better the next night after spraying, I only killed 7, and again had the lights on all night...no rest. Upon check out I said is it possible to waive the parking fee of 25 dollars a night since i had so many roaches in my room, plus I never moved the car the whole time I was there...remember I just had a heart attack.... She said she cannot do that. I said why, she just said she can't nut she will take $20.00 of the resort fee. WOW! $20.00...I could not get out of here soon enough. This was the worst trip to Hawaii anyone can ask for, when you are better off in the hospital, than your hotel. Very upset with this hotel. I come to Hawaii every year for work, and will never, I repeat... never stat at STAY again. The new name for this place is the Roach Motel.

I booked this through Hotwire's 'secret' deals and I was actually quite upset when I found out I got this hotel, especially after reading all the reviews on TA.However, when I actually stayed there, it wasn't too bad. I think reading all those bad reviews helped though so I went in with low expectations.When we arrived, we got room 505 I believe, and it was actually a decent size room with a "queen" bed. Their queen bed is smaller than a standard queen bed. I actually quite liked this room because it was quiet and sorta spacious (I read horror stories from other TA reviewers about the room being the size of a prison cell). Unfortunately, the toilet didn't flush so we requested to move rooms. We then moved to room 801, which had a balcony but the room was much smaller, and because it's facing Koa Avenue, it was really noisy at night with buses, garbage trucks, etc. This room was also very bright with a balcony door and a couple windows so we were woken up by the natural light at 6am every morning. Near the end of our stay, I think their pesticides were running low because I saw an ant tribe/family crawling all over the bathroom. The hotel had scheduled pesticide people to come in the day we were checking out.Now, on to the good. The location!! It's literally a 3 minute walk to the beach. And I love all the staff. They are all very friendly and nice. They also provide beach mats in every room (although we are paying for it with our $10 'resort' fee everyday). And of course, the price. I don't think you can find another hotel that's close to the beach at this price.Would I stay here again? Most likely not.But if you are like me and got stuck with this hotel from a hotwire deal, then I would suggest you request a room ending with '05', as it's the quietest and biggest room.Preferably 5th fl and up.

I agree that the photos don't really portray the hotel in its true light. However, the staff were super friendly, there was fruit offered in the breakfast, the room was clean and was pretty central. Bathroom was pretty tiny though. Was comfortable enough for our two day stay.

Nice and simple affordable place , very silent at night , excellent location thou .The staff was helpful and friendly .There were several stores near by and a avenue with almost every Haute Couture stores .Spent a week there and feel like home , nice 32 inch flat tv .

Very poor its really not nice the pics make it look good but when you get there its just a concrete room with colourful furniture and very basic bed. Must admit it was clean. But you actually have to walk along an outside corridor to get to your room, not safe for a woman travelling alone as there are no security cameras or enough external lighting. I booed on Booking.com so i couldnt change or cancel luckily and I hope he was true the reception man only charged me for the one night. I think booking.com needs to update those photos as they give a wrong impression of the place because they dont show the outside entrance corridor or tht the furnishing is a lot mroe worn. plus the cupboard has just got a bold orange curtain covering it. They should show the bathroom too.

Just got back from a 3 day stay. Yes, the room was small, but so cute. Stayed with my 16-yr-old daughter who wanted to learn to surf (Use Big Wave Daves next door for great lessons and board rentals! $5.00/hr!--get Jimmy if you can!). Perfect location 1 block from the beach. Place was clean and bright (never saw 1 bug anywhere--as others suggested). Nice flat panel TV, Ipod docking station was great for my I4s. Fridge in room. Balcony with a partial Ocean view. What more could you want? Breakfast was nice for Continental bfast. Also icy lime water out all day in the lobby. Used the free beach chairs, towels, etc. Elevator is only a problem if you are too stupid to walk into an elevator when the door opens and then push your button. Yes the door closes fairly quickly...but how hard is it to get in an elevator in a timely basis?? Can't wait to go back...will definitely book here again.

This hotel promises or did promise a free gourmet breakfast and did not deliver. The hotel is over run by drunk twenty somethings and there was booze cans littering the halls in the morning. The elevator is a death trap and the room, well, where to start. The renovations are only bare minimums and are done only to mask the poor state of this hotel. My room was a piece of crap and I was booked for five days and checked on after one night that Im sorry I paid for. There was a women in the lobby doing yoga on the floor with a can of beer by her side and no one said a word. No chair in the room, balcony door broken and would not open, bath tub plug broken, closet an old curtain hung on a string, balcony curtain tied back with a strip of frayed material, pillows are crap, bed is so so. Restaurant is closed and closed without notice a month ago with no sign of opening up again so no gourmet breakfast as promised. I don't need to go on but would rate this hotel as poor at best and will be contacting them for a refund.

We stayed at Stay Waikiki for two nights. The stay was pleasant, the staff was really nice. We were very leery because of the reviews about cockroaches. There was one little one the first night but other then that there were none. There is a big list of things this place didn't have(small rooms, the hotel restaurant was closed, terrible breakfast), but it was outweighed by the great price, the ocean view(room 707) and the great location of the hotel. If you want to surf there are two surf shops next door that you can rent a board from so that all you bring to the beach is the board--no valuables. We would stay again.

We arrived here at Stay on the 12th May,A family of 5.We here checked it very promptly by Phylliswho took care of all our allocations a very warm and friendly staff made our stay very comfortable all ways very bubbly and attending to our needs all the time.The Hotel is a stone throw away from the beach and walking distance to all the shops and foodiesI would re-command this Hotel to any one who is looking for a good budget Hotel and easy reach to all the events.

I spent a week at the Stay Hotel during a large convention. I spent a lot less than anyone else on my accommodation ($105 pn, plus the obligatory $10 amenity fee) and seemed a lot happier than most others! If you want cheap, cheerful and clean accommodation with super friendly staff, just one block from Waikiki Beach, then this is your place. If you're on a honeymoon, it's probably not the right choice (what do you expect for $105 in this location?!) My room had AC, a comfortable bunk bed, spartan but functional furnishings, large flat-screen TVs, shower, tiled floor, and wifi, the latter covered by the amenity fee along with breakfast. (The advertised Waikiki-wide internet didn't materialise but was not a major issue.) The internet was at a reasonable speed (I've experienced much slower in some Hiltons). Cockroaches are an issue, but across the whole of Waikiki - everyone at the convention was complaining about them, even in hotel rooms at more than double the price. I gather that the hotel is installing new windows that may help to an extent. The breakfast is basic but better than some reviews on here would have you believe. The coffee was actually pretty good. The hotel profiles free towels and beach accessories as you need them. The noise from adjacent hotels/service vehicles was not a problem at all, again contrary to what I had read in other reviews. Overall, it's a budget hotel and great value, and a 5 on that basis. If you want luxury, then be prepared to pay $300+ pn.

Excellent location, friendly staff, good breakfast, difficult to have such quality for the price. They have beach stuff at the lobby and you can rent surf board just next door for a very good price. Ok our room was a bit noisy but we were able to sleep without difficulty. 240 square ft room was ok for our party of three.

This place is pretty run down, dirty, and small. It is located in the back alley between 2 apartment. In the early morning, you woke up to delivery trucks and tour buses. At night, the tenant at both apartment are loud. But the front desk people are awesome and very, very friendly. Its alright if you like the location. You cross 1 block and you are at Waikiki beach.

Stayed here in early April in a room on the sixth floor. Little room, cute decor mostly Ikea furniture. Photos on their website was not the room that I stayed in. The second night I came back from a night out to find three cockroaches running around the floors and walls of my room. I informed the front desk the next morning, they said they would take care of it. Came back the next night only to find more cockroaches running around the walls of my room. I understand it is an older property, and having worked in hotel management myself before, I again kindly told the front desk to please investigate the problem. The clerk was very friendly and apologized for the problem. At the continental breakfast served downstairs I heard some other guests talking about finding bugs in their room as well. I then was offered to move to a room one floor up, to which they were painting the walkways and the smell was so strong I couldn't stand it. It was my last night and didn't want the hassle of finding a new hotel for one night, so I completed my stay. On checkout I informed the front desk of the bug problem, they waived the amenities fee which was appreciated, but they really need to get their bug problem under control.

When push came to shove, I wondered if I should be paying an extra $200 a night just to be located directly on the beach...but in the end, I decided I could walk a block to the beach, and stayed at Stay. It's FANTASTIC for the price--another couple shared the two bedroom suite with my boyfriend and me, and we found a GREAT prepaid deal that made it even cheaper.The location is great, the staff was super cool, and we even enjoyed the bar--their prices were reasonable as well. It was a block from the beach so we loved that. Loved even more that each couple had their own bathroom--we don't expect that!To me this place was hostel prices, but hotel living; the only possible exception being the floors are not carpeted, but with all the sand you're tracking in it's frankly better that way. Definitely loved this place for the price. Go go go and check out the Promo section of their website!

Not bad location for price and relatively easy to find. Excellent staff and great customer service. Close to shops and the beach. and easy to get to convention center with minimal traffic problems. Great for convention stay

Great budget hotel. Good location: minutes from the beach and the Main Street , clean: made up our room for us while we were out, friendly staff: helped us with any question we had. Don't expect large rooms, but ours did have a cute balcony with a decent view.

Besides the various bugs staying with you in your room and the really old fashioned rooms,it's in a great centralized location if you plan to spend most of your time in waikiki because everything is pretty much walking distance. This place is for solo travelers who doesn't mind sharing their room with little cockroaches of all kinds. Because I was traveling alone I decided to find the cheapest rate that includes wi-fi. This place had wi-fi in the rooms, (which did not work and took very long to even try to connect on my 4g LTE note 2 smartphone),and was the cheapest rate at around $100/nt. I had a queen bed that seemed more like a full size and about a ft of space on both sides of the bed to walk around, the bottom had around 2ft. I really liked that I could walk around to eat or shop in the area and it's a block away from waikiki beach. So,if you can handle little critters then this place is great to save money and just get some sleep. It isn't on the main strip so watch your back at night ladies if you walk alone.

Its a perfect hotel with good location, good pricing, friend staffs and delicious breakfast, $10 per day is a perfect pricing that you can get any convinience for swimmings form Stay. Thank you and I will recommond it to friend as well as book it once I come back, Thanks.Maya

Though the staff that work there are very nice, this is like a hostel not a hotel. Booked this through Hotwire as a 3 star. If you like a 125 square foot concrete room with only a bed without even night stands and a TINY bathroom then this is for you. We were out the cost of 2 nights and booked elsewhere.

I was in HNL for a day trip and all of the other hotels were way too expensive for my budget and I found this on Hotel tonight for 80 dollars. Great Location, the beach is just a block away and shopping is literally around the corner. The staff was very helpful and courteous. I walked up to Diamond Head at 6 am and it was definitely worth every step. This place may be basic and if a comfy bed and a shower is really all you're looking for then this is the place. Simply perfect for my day trip, spent 4 hours on the beach!!! My first trip to Honolulu but this place I will stay at again.

This is the 2nd time I have stayed at this hotel and we love it! It is back one block from the main strip of Kalakaua so no rooms offer an ocean view (maybe just a teeny look) but who needs it for this price? It's affordable and you are just a 30 second walk to the beach. The front staff are very friendly and accommodating. We have stayed in small rooms and also lucked out with a larger room too. If there is one bit of feedback...when we were checking out of the hotel, we were going to arrange a shuttle through one of the coupon books. We were told by the front desk that those companies aren't always reliable (and we had experienced that!) and that they recommended a shuttle company that they use that IS reliable. So a little later we called and asked the front desk to arrange this for us as they had offered to do. We called at 3pm. We were at the hotel waiting...and the shuttle never came. When the front desk called, the shuttle said they were full. It kind of seemed to us that perhaps the front desk didn't call to make the reservation (maybe they forgot)...or if this is just another example of the unreliable shuttle companies in Waikiki. The front desk employee didn't seem to care too much that the shuttle wasn't coming. That was a disappointment for us. However...it was an otherwise wonderful stay! This has become a favorite place of ours when doing Waikiki on a budget. We will be back!

We LOVE the hotel!!! Service was excellent!! Customer service was welcoming, helpful, and couteous!!! the location was great!! literally 1 block from beach!! will only stay here while visting the island!!!

So keep in mind this review is quite late.I travelled to Honolulu March 4 - 9, 2013. Upon arrival to Honolulu & getting to the hotel was a write off. The shuttle that we took to our hotel took about an hour because of the parade that was happening on the main street of Honolulu, keep in mind that we DID NOT make it to our hotel. The driver advised us when he dropped off a few other people at another hotel that it would probably take another hour for us to even get to our hotel. So we decided to get off the shuttle and walk to our hotel.It was a LONG walk. It was hot, I was hungry and I had a headache. These were definitely not a good combination. A word of advice, it is probably better to catch a taxi at the airport rather than take a shuttle as they have many stops depending on the amount of people they have in the shuttle.As we got to the hotel (finally) to check in, there did not seem to be any issue UNTIL we got to our room. I was NOT pleased with the room we received. It was not a room I had paid for! The room I had paid for had a lanai with a queen size bed. The room was extremely small, bathroom was tiny (could not even fit two people in at the same time) and the closet was not even a closet. The room walls were brick slabs that were painted over with barely any wifi signal because of this. The phone in the room did not even work AND there was not even a lanai. We went with another couple and after seeing their room, I was honestly mortified. Even though their room had two double beds, their room was bigger with a lanai! I was hesitant to book with this hotel because of all the reviews I had read previously. I was honestly worried that the same thing that had happened to another person when I read their review would happen to me... and it did...Since our phone in our room did not work, I went back down to front desk and complained. I told them it was not a room that I had booked for and requested to change rooms. They told me that they were overbooked and did not have any rooms available for me. I requested to speak with the manager but the manager wasn't available so they advised me to speak with the another person in charge the next day. Unfortunately we were stuck with that room for the night. The next morning, I went downstairs and spoke with the person that was in charge at the front desk. I had explained my situation and advised that I was not happy. I told her that I was hesitant to book with them at first because of the reviews I had read but decided that I would give it a try despite the reviews. The girl at the front desk told me that have no rooms available but hopefully should have a room available by the afternoon for me but couldn't say for sure. I had to basically wait until the afternoon to find out. After being out for a few hours, I came back and spoke with the front desk again, except this time, I spoke with the manager. They FINALLY had a room for me and told me that it should be ready in a couple of hours once the person in that room checked out and had the room cleaned. Once the room was ready, we moved our belongings to the room they switched us to and wow! what a difference it was!The room we were placed in had a flat screen TV (not that the other one didn't), a sofa bed, queen size bed, a lanai, a table with two chairs and the room was honestly 2 1/2 times the size of the other room with a bigger bathroom! They even brought up a fridge for us to use. I did not expect them to upgrade us to a room with a sofa bed. At this point I was extremely pleased! I was very happy that the staff was accommodating and understanding. They really went above and beyond to ensure that I was happy. Once again, another trip to Honolulu is booked for this year for Aug/Sept at the SAME HOTEL. This time I ensured to book a deluxe room with a sofa bed and lanai. Despite what had happened in the beginning of my March 2013 trip, my reason for booking the same hotel is because the manager, Earl and the front desk girl, Jasmine were extremely helpful, friendly and accommodating with my dissatisfaction in the beginning. As I said, I felt like they really went above and beyond to make me happy. They also gave us suggestions on things to do and where to go etc. The customer service they provided was very good. The location of the hotel is good, within great walking distance to the beach, the zoo and many shops on Waikiki! I will definitely write another review once I am back from my trip this year!

Beware the beautified pictures of this hotel! It's not a hip and modern as it may seem. The staff were friendly and the location was quite perfect for a couple of days of wandering Waikiki. However, our room seemed rundown and the bathroom was ridiculously small. I would call this an "upscale hostel", rather than a hotel. It was fine for a couple of nights, but situated between two apartment buildings, with people who party until 4am every night, it was difficult to get some sleep. Walls are thin and at times we a little unsure about our safety. It wasn't awful, but I wouldn't stay here again. The $10/day amenity fee is a joke - we never once saw the breakfast we were paying for, and the beach toys were for children.

The hotel is in excellent position, straight in the middle of Waikiki.. It is clean, the floor and bathroom cleaned every day,the staff is so nice and friendly... Only negative I can find.. They make you pay 10$ a day for breakfast and Internet plus newspaper, all 3 do not worth it... Internet does not work always in the room... The breakfast is pretty bad.. And the local news paper cost probably 1$ ... Just do not offer this extra if it cost so much .. The hotel would gain in value!!

Stay Hotel has the location card going on for it as waikiki is a few blocks away.. Not a lot after that.. The windows that they have are like big blinds so the rooms are not insulated from the noise outside... and there is a lot of noise.. mainly from all the other AC units working and the traffic on the road outside.. The shower space is so small it was ridiculous.. on the plus side, they did try to spruce up the room a little with the chair that looks like a giant hand and some nice lights.. also "continental" breakfast is included plus they have a bar in the building that they really sell to you as a place to hangout and eat dinner, etc.. the parking will be $25 and is a tiny space in their basement garage. The elevators shut so quickly that we got hit by the doors multiple times.. For us, the cons way outweigh the pros and for that reason we will never again stay there.. However, if you are on a tight budget, this might work for you.. that said, be ready to shell out about $150 a day including fees, etc.

For the price the hotel was very good. It was just me and my husband it was great. We came out with my sister and there husband, there hotel was bigger with a pool and stuff but not much nicer than ours

The hotel needs updated. needs night stands, and stand in bathroom for toiletries. Liked being block from the beach and alot of places within walking distance. Not complaining about the price, was very reasonable.

For the price that was payed we expected more. After our first night the A/C was making so much racket, teamed with the street noise we were about ready to check out days early. We were moved to the 5th floor and the street noise was still apparent, but bearable - The A/C must have been broken in the previous room. Bed uncomfortable and pillows showing visible wear and tear. Internet frustratingly slow - If you are looking for something other than backpacker style accommodation this is not the "hotel" for you.On a positive note the gentleman on reception was very nice and checked us in early which was appreciated. Location close to beach.

I needed a place for 24 hours on my way to Auckland. Stay Waikiki was clean, well priced and close to everything. Friendly staff as well! Only a block away from Waikiki beach allowed me to make the most of a quick visit

This hotel faces one of the noisiest streets in Waikiki. Bring high quality earplugs if you want any sleep. Also, if you're looking for a hotel with wi-fi, this is not the one. The wi-fi is too slow and spotty. The hotel is close to the beach and the staff are nice. But I recommend staying somewhere else for this price.

If you're a traveler visiting Hawaii for the beaches and the water then this is a great spot for an adult atmosphere similar to the swanky retro Jupiter hotel in Portland, Oregon. This reasonably priced hotel has all of the important amenities for a couple on the go. If you are needing a family friendly hotel with lazy river, arcade and overpriced buffet, you should continue on down the beach. The hotel provides beach mats, beach towels, water toys and a great evening happy hour. The only negative is an ice machine located on the main floor down a sketch, dimly lit hallway. The location is very convenient, close to the zoo, a couple of blocks from the beach, and near the Dukes statue, a popular pick up point for island tours.Bonus: Awesome Musubi and bento made daily just a few feet away. Grab some to go for your adventure. IYASUME

Clean and tidy hotel, lovely staff, also let us check in 3 hours early at no extra charge which was a god send after 2 long haul flights and very little staff. Great location, 1 block back from the beach, beach equipment available for use in the lobby. Great, friendly, affordable hotel with a good, hot shower - lots of water pressure!

Loved the location.The lounge, Sway, was awesome for happy hour with delicious Pupu's and a super friendly staff. The hotel felt like it was a friends place, Upon entering, a big happy, not cheesy, hello was there to greet you and you felt genuinely appreciated.

For an affordable friendly hotel just a block from Waikiki beach, this place can be beat. Yes it used to be a hostel but it isn’t anymore, the rooms are small but clean and comfortable. While not a modern hotel, renovations are ongoing so how it looks now will improve over the coming months, lobby is great place to handout and check you emails or read book, watch the widescreen till SWAY Bar/Restaurant opens.The SWAY Bar is great, friendly staff, great service and I loved the menu, honestly there wasn’t a single thing I ordered over the week that I wouldn’t order again...personal favourite is the Beercan Chicken (although on the last day they halfed the portion size to my disappointment).The only problem, if it is a problem, is that not many people seem to know about this place, so your driver may take some time finding it.Next time I stay in Honolulu I will be defiantly going back to stay here, when I was looking a single rooms in Hostels in Waikiki all a got was reviews of bead bugs and loud parties/drunks, so nice to fine a good affordable boutique hotel available for under $150 a night.

I traveled with a group of 6 female student friends on Jan. 27th. When we arrived at the hotel, a great smile on Daren's, one of the front desk staff, face welcomed us and he was very friendly and patient to ask questions whenever we had. That was a very good start of our trip in Honolulu. The first breakfast was a high-spirited one because of Georgia's heartwarming greeting in the morning at the cafe. The location was perfect too. The sofa bed was a bit "challenging" :) in one of the rooms we booked for two people to share. So if you'd like to share a room, I think 3 might be the best with one extra sofa bed added. Sometimes, it could be a bit noisy on the street but if you're a heavy sleeper like me, you wont be bothered at all. It is actually a good choice if you are on a budget tour with few friends or alone. BTW, if you need a fridge, make sure you make a reservation when you book the hotel. But if not, as I said, the front desk staff are very helpful and friendly, they would love to accommodate you as well as they can.

We stayed for 6 days and 5 nights. We checked in early due to our early bird flight and they were able to check us in before the afternoon check in time. Then after 2nd day, we found small critters in the bathroom and closet. Earl and Phyllis were very accommodating and ensured we had another room and since had no problems with those critters. Then they were able to accommodate our luggage in their store room until we left late night on our 6th day. We were able to stay around and walk around Waikiki and then retrieve our luggage later. Although there was only one elevator and we stayed on the 6th then then 7th floor, we kept an open mind and there was never more than 1 minute wait for the elevator. Staff were awesome and very patient with customers despite their aging facilities. Great location and reasonable prices with our package deal and flight. Thank you Stay Hotel.Vernon

Me and my boyfriend stayed here two times on our way in and out of the US. We were very happy with the hotel. The staff were always lovely and friendly. Rooms were a bit bare, but clean. They could use a bit more light. Location was great, close walk to everything. Loved the free use of beach equipment and printing facilities! Price was alsio very reasonable. The rooms at the front of the hotel can get a little noisy so if you are a light sleeper this could be a problem.Thank you to all the staff for a great stay :)

Dirty sheets upon check in, no soap or shampoo in the shower, I got a room with queen bed, in reality its double bed. How can they charge 146$ per night and have this lousy quality? This hotel is PATHETIC
user_name:
Alexei P
Palos Verdes Estates, California

review_body: Our trip here was good. My husband and I came early for our family vacation and decided to stay here for the two extra days before we went to the Vacation Rental. We had a little problem with hair on the bed and we asked front desk for new sheets. They were great and wonderful to work with they upgraded our room and our stay was Amazing after that. The only thing I would change would be the floors, to me a rug would be nice cause the tile just looks and feels a litle dirty, so we just kept our flip flops on and it was good.

The staff was very helpful and nice. Nicest people in the world. You can't find a better location than stay hotel. Walking distance to attractions in Waikiki. They have free beach stuffs like surfboard for you for free. The only drawback, they have rooms with bunk bed. So if you are on your honeymoon, you might want to reconsider.

I was a solo female traveller and found this hotel for a great price even compared to the hostels in Waikiki. I felt safe and the staff were very helpful with booking my airport transfers. The room was clean, had A/C and was a block away from Waikiki Beach and the main strip. I really liked the location since it was tucked away on a quieter street away from all the busy tourist areas, but still steps away from great restaurants and the famous beach.My only (small) complaint was the Wi-Fi connection, which was dodgy inside my room. My business is online so this is important to me, but the connection was fine in the lobby and in the restaurant where I got most of my work done. The complimentary breakfast was pretty mediocre, but you'll find healthy and delicious options almost anywhere near the hotel. For the price and location, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't need all the fancy amenities of the big expensive hotels and just needs a place to sleep after enjoying the outdoors and sunshine of Hawaii all day. I wouldn't stay here longer than 3 nights though.

Sad to say, but you can't expect much for $250 per night in Waikiki. The people working at Stay Hotel were very friendly and accommodating... but the facilities are just awful. We're talking about tiny, outdated rooms with very poorly equipped bathrooms, no amenities to speak of, and beds that are somehow smaller than a single. Add to this that the place is located next to some type of warehouse that fires up at 4:00 am - let's just say that the sound of backup alarms is a bit hard on sleep quality. Oh, and to top it off, the hotel charges a $10 per guest "amenity fee". That's a new one by me... but it doesn't seem to buy many amenities.

My boyfriend and I booked this hotel for our 10 day vacation. All of the pictures made the hotel seem like somewhere we'd like to call home for a week-and-a-half. I would not have minded staying 1 or 2 nights, but it is definitely not a hotel to stay in for more than that. Also, It wouldn't have been bad if it was just myself (I would have stayed the entire time if that was the case). The two of us together needed much more room to spread out than the rooms could accommodate for. The bathroom was tiny and I didn't feel like I had much privacy. The bed wasn't very comfortable and the tiny little air conditioning unit in the wall did not do a good job at cooling the room. The continental breakfast left much to be desired and we just ended up grabbing breakfast at McDonald's. Everyone there was super helpful and friendly. They didn't give us any problems when we decided to leave the next day. The location was great and the restaurant near the lobby was phenomenal. I think this is a great location for someone who is traveling solo or for a group of friends who are trying to save some money. It just didn't fit our needs and they do not deserve a completely bad review because of that.

Stay Waikiki is a charming little hotel with a perfect location. Rooms were larger than I expected and very clean and quiet. The hotel is half a block away from the main beach and steps away from shopping and activities. The area seemed quite safe at night, I had no issues walking around at night. Only downsides- no microwave or fridge, and the continental breakfast was only served until 930am. Staff were friendly, and free wifi is always a plus. I will definitely be returning on my next visit to Honolulu

Coming back to the US after being deployed, found this hotel online. Didn't expect much as it was just a place to sleep. Cheap, convenient location and cool staff. Darrin at the front desk gave us suggestions on clubs to check out. Friends and I was looking for a country kind of bar and he suggested Nashvilles. He gave other suggestions and they was also awesome. I wanted to stay an extra day so the morning of check-out I went to the front desk. Darrin was working and was able to extend me. This time my friends and I hit the beach. Just a 3 minute walk and they have beach towels and body boards to use for free. In all stay was good, no complaints. I've slept in tougher areas while being deployed.

The staff were friendly and always helpful.I enjoyed my stay and my run in the Honolulu marathonThanks for everything i will be back again.I was very thankful for the use of the beach mats and towelsThanks again Tom K

DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL! I am not a picky traveller and do not need to stay in fancy places but I found this hotel just horrible. First of all, the pictures DO NOT look like they are on the website - they have been doctored or a very talented professional photographer took them. In my opinion, this is false advertising. Our room resembled a prison cell. It was on the second floor, very, very small, very, very dark and very, very noisy. There were no real windows - they were frosted panes of glass. The room contained one sad looking orange chair and no table, a double bed and a pull out sofa. No fridge, no coffee maker, no safes (safes are downstairs). The bathroom is so small you couldn't even move around in it. I found the room also lacked cleanliness. There was a cheap curtain covering the closet. I went downstairs and asked for a different room and they said at first they had one and then magically they didn't. I then asked if I were to check out early if I would be charged for the last night there and they said no. So I rebooked my flights to leave a day early because I couldn't imagine staying the four nights we were orginally booked. One of the reasons I had booked this room is because it said that there was a Playstation in every room (my son is a gamer). When we get there, no playstations. I had asked where they were and they said they were in the process of 'switching companies', whatever that means. They might want to post that information on their website in order to bring it to one's attention. I was surprised when I found out there was a $10 convenience fee which they said was on their website. I looked through the whole website and did not find any mention of paying an extra $10 a day - very deceptive business practices. The parking was posted as $20 and imagine my surprise when it was actually $25 AND oh, they didn't have parking onsite and that I would have to park half a block away in a public parking area. Really??? If you don't have ample parking onsite then maybe you can offer a discount! The continental 'buffet' was lacking and there was only milk for coffee and not cream. My mom and I had come in from the beach and twice there was no water in water jug in the lobby. The elevator was TERRIBLE (slow, closed on you after two seconds of opening) and I ended up just taking the stairs. When we first arrived there a bunch of drunk people, mostly locals, tumbled out of the the restaurant and were hanging out on the stairs to the lobby and smoking. One guy was so drunk he couldn't walk. If I were the front staff I would try to shoo these people away while new people are checking in. There is also no fitness centre and no pool. What hotel in Hawaii does not have a pool?? The only, and I mean the ONLY good thing about this hotel is that it is half a block from the beach. Next time I am paying extra to stay in a real hotel.

My daughter and i went for 6 days everyone was so pleasant and helpful. We were able to do our sightseeing by local bus systems. Everyone local was friendly and ready to help. Our hotel room was always clean when we came back. The bar and restaurant had great food and drinks. Almost too good.
user_name:
Becky D
Portland, Oregon, United States

review_body: Checking in with Phyllis was awesome we arrived half an hour early and was able to check into our room .The ALOHA SPIRIT was definately here at STAY WAIKIKI. Our room was very clean and I love the location right in the heart of Waikiki,just steps away from everything.The best part of it all was the Continental Breakfast in the morning It was awesome. can't wait to return again.

This is my 9th trip to Oahu and I've been to many different hotels in Wakiki. I would say that Stay is an older, lightly renovated, no frills hotel. The pros: The staff is pleasant and helpful, they offer free use of boogie boards and straw mats for the beach, only 1 block from the beach, close to the bus lines, they offer a continental breakfast each day, they have a laundry onsite and the rooms have the basics of bed, bathroom and TV. The cons: the wi-fi system is not working/ non-existant, the hotel faces the street where all the tour buses park (lots of street noise), they have no in-room safes (you have to use the safe in the lobby) and the main elevator is possessed. If you are seeking an average hotel, in a central location, then the Stay hotel fits the bill for your travel needs.

Right in the middle of waikiki, perfect location. Just a short walk from the beach. If you stay at the 6.th floor or heigher you can see the beach. Great value for money. Friendly staff. Lots shops close by.

This was the worst stay we've had in Waikiki and we've been here many times. We always stay at lower-priced hotels, usually further from the beach than this. We were attracted here by the location, the website photos, and the pricing which was shown as about 50% off the list of $ 220 or so. Having now stayed there we are reminded "if it sounds too good to be true it probably is" The room was extremely small, maybe 120 square feet as shown on the website but had a small dresser, no table or chair, so the suitcases went on the dresser and we sat on the bed, which was a mattress on particle board and sagged badly to the center. The room floor was sticky from something and generally dirty. There was a light right outside the bathroom window and with no curtains on bath and half of bedroom it was like daylight or worse all night. In addition the windows were both very high and frosted so there was no view, city or otherwise. The breakfast was fair, watery juice and only milk for the coffee, but some decent pastries. Breakfast and Wi-Fi, along with a Honolulu paper are included in the $10 amenity fee.. Although the location is good the neighborhood isn't, especially at night, with questionable noisy neighbors and also busses running most of the time. We did find the staff pleasant and friendly.

We stayed here our first night. Room was aweful. Air conditioning didnt work; it sits right next to a hostel. No walls really; just frosted glass shutters; felt like I was sleeping outside. Buses, motorcycles, people talking. You could hear everything. They offer a continental breakfast but had nothing there during the time posted. They said they're driver was late. They ran out of beach towels and barely gave us enough shower towels. The bathroom was aweful and small. Would not ever return.

I had a nice room,but when you take into consideration the price, it was a great room. The location was 1/2 block from the beach. The room was clean and bright. The only negative was that the bathroom was a bit small but functional. The other pleasant surprise was the bar and restaurant. They had a good happy hour and when I was there they were changing the menu and they offered me some samples ......nice choices and reasonable prices. When I return for more business trips, it will definitely be my place to stay.

This was one of the worst hotels i have ever stayed at. The buses pick up outside all day and night . Very noisy and exhaust. They took our towels and had none to give us back until the end of the day. The pictures of the hotel are very deceiving. Then they charged me for my room after I has prepaid

I was extremely pleased with the hotel staff, they accomodated our room with a cot and bar fridge. The continental breakfast was fresh and varied each and every day. The hotel is located one block from Waikiki Beach, would definitely recommend for another holiday whether one week or two

This hotel was a budget location choice. It turned out to be a real surprise. Rooms are Spartan. Clean and comfortable. Staff is very nice. Restaurant/Bar on premise is a great place to get out of the humidity and heat. Happy hour hs great prices. The deserts served are amazing. Location is fantastic. o a side street but close to everything in Waikiki.

My partner and I stayed at the Stay hotel for 5 nights on Oahu and 1 additional night on our return trip to the mainland from island hopping. The hotel was a very nice surprise. Clean, friendly and convenient to beach, shopping, food, activities. You can expect some low city noise but nothing that would spoil your stay. It is, after all, the city. Room was spacious enough to not feel cramped, with room for storage. Furnishing were modern with a clean "minimalist" approach. No clutter. The bed was comfortable with what felt like luxury sheets. Definitely a great value for the money. The staff is great. Jasmine, at the front desk, is awesome. She made us feel like family. All the front desk people are attentive, friendly and very accommodating. The restaurant in the hotel is a hidden treasure. Great happy hour and a menu that will take you by storm. Lots of wonderful meals to chose from, good size portions, fresh, delicious food with great presentation. You are really getting a great value. . The lounge/lobby area is comfortable as well. I would recommend this hotel and will most definitely be back again! Mahalo! Small items that would use help:The lobby printer for guests was out-of-order.The continental breakfast was scaled back on our last morning. Please bring back the eggs, waffles, sausage, microwaves, etc. It is welcomed by travelers like me who don't expect to spent $25 for breakfast and have to wait for service. It was a treat to have the eggs, etc that you can eat and get on with your day quickly.

My wife and I stayed at the Stay hotel for a week. Overall our stay was pretty comfortable besides the occasional noise from outside which was tolerable. It is, after all, the city. The location of the hotel was convenient in terms that it is walking distance from food/drinks, stores, the beach, etc. I liked that how every morning I can walk outside for exercise with a good walking scenery. The rooms are a good size for the purpose of storing your belongings and getting some R&R. If you care about a fancy room, I suggest you pay extra for that. This hotel is economical so you do get a good bang for your buck in regards to their services. Wifi is free and so is their daily breakfast. The staff is great.
