Housekeeping is very kind and friendly. Charleigh at the front desk is wonderful (all the other front desk staff were nice too). The restaurant in the hotel is open late with good food and drinks. The lounge/lobby area is pretty comfortable as well. I would recommend this hotel and will most definitely be back again! Mahalo!

The staff and hotel was sufficient and clean enough, the room was very decent and a nice partial ocean view. A bit noisy attimes, but hey...it is in the bustling city of Waikiki! The bed was comfortable and the bathroom, clean. We had nice upper floor balcony and the decor was very contemporary. The continental breakfast was decent for a budget hotel and all in all this hotel is a good place to stay for the budget minded traveller who mostly needs a place to stay, a clean bathroom and within walking distance to everything Waikiki has to offer! Great experience overall. The only con: the printer for guests was out-of-order! :( but that's mostly it. Have a great stay and I'm definitely recommeding this place if & when I come back here to Honolulu. Mahalo!!! :)

The rooms were clean and service was friendly. ALOHA Ms Jasmine(front desk agent) even helped me check the sunrise time! Anyway I was afraid to stay here after reading all the comments, however what do people expect paying less than $100 for a hotel Waikiki. The location is excellent for my $80 a night room walk right across to the beach. The only thing I will advise is the resort fee and deposit for 2nights was $50 credit card only $10 A DAY FEE refund the rest NOT INCLUDING IN HOTEL PRICE.
user_name:
Seshat A
Atlanta, Georgia, United States

review_body: Only stayed for one night, but was a really nice room in a great location. Definitely will stay here again when I come back. Staff were lovely and nice. Reading the other reviews - I think other people just like to complain - very good for the price.

The rooms are nice and basic. Nothing too exciting but then again why hang out in your room when you can do so much activities here. The local is what makes this better. Everything is walking distance away. The beach is only one block away from the hotel, you can't go wrong with that at all.

staff and residents really lovely, rooms are nice food and drink are excellent. close to beach and all shops and transport. i would reccomment this hotel and i will definately come back and stay again

My room was on 3rd FloorIt's an old building transformed in a hotel. Really noisy-buses, delivery trucks, etc.-Room really small with no windows. No coffee/tea maker in the room, no cartoons for the kids after 5pm, only adult content cartoon channel. The closet was small and smelly. The bathroom small and no brush for the toilet. So leave you girlfriend home or buy some gloves. Same frozen food for breakfast. Also available internet that is not working. Please consider paying $20 extra anywhere else and enjoy you escape. All they have are some good photoshopped pics.

We stayed here for 3 nights. Most of the time, we only stay in a hotel top sleep. The room service was great as well, they change the linens and towels everyday, change garbage bags as well. They have fridge where you can store your drimks/food, a small veranda to just chill. This hotel also offered breakfast, although cold but hey it's free, there' always a microwave where you can reheat it. Sway restaurant has great tasting food too! great location, free wifi. I will surely recommend this to friends.The only bad thing is, well according to the concierge they can't accept guest per policy but he's my husband. He arrived from different country tired and dirty but attendant didn't even bother to accept him to check-in early. Otherwise, 80% were friendly and accommodating.

First I will list the good things about this hotel: Great Location and wonderful maid service. The rooms were spotless and they even brought us a mini-fridge because they noticed we needed one. Now for the not so great things! Rooms were very small, bathrooms are outdated, no fitness center, no pool, very loud location (tour buses, trolleys, and garbage trucks all hours of the day and night!), rooms not sound proof, air conditioner couldn't keep up, elevator very, very slow (we could take the stairs faster from the 8th floor!), continental breakfast was a joke (frozen eggs and toaster waffles you heat up yourself!), and no coffee maker in the rooms. Also the customer service (excluding the maids) was horrible. We asked for a possible different room off the street. We were told they would check into it and call us right away. Never happened! Also we asked if they had an extra cable for our dvd player. Also said they would check into and call right away. Never happened. BUT they sure were on the ball in calling us about our check-out time!!!!!!!!!!!

do not book a hotel room here, i came in at 12, and my room wasnt available until 4 in the afternoon....... great location, that is about the only good thing this place has going for it. employees are nice but i think its kind of ridiculous they cant have one roomsvailable for me, makes no sense at all. room was dirty and not clean, i was very dissapointed, should have asked for my money back. i would speand the extra money and get a room at the holiday inn or the hilton rather than spend another night at this place, most of the reviews are negative and now i know why.
user_name:
Dr Allen M
San Francisco, California

review_body: The hotel is in a great location. However, the room must have been renovated, yet you can tell it is still very old. The bathroom is small and the water leaks. There is no space to place your belongings in the bathroom or in the room. We woke up every morning at 6:15 and again at 7:15 from a trash truck outside banging the dumpsters around. The staff was very friendly and the room was inexpensive, so you get what you pay for I suppose. The best thing about this hotel was that they had cold lemon water available in the lobby every day (mostly all day long) and the walk to the beach was less than a block!! If you are only in the room to sleep and shower then this is great! If you are looking to spend some time in your room, I would probably go for another hotel

I am giving this place 4 stars instead of 5 for the following reasons:1-only one elevator for 8 floors, and a very slow elevator at that.2- the rooms are of nice size, and seem to have been renovated, until you go in the bathroom. The faucets are drippy, and probably original to the building.3- with large rooms like this, a kitchenette would really add to the value of this hotel, and would be really nice to have at least a mini fridge and microwave.The staff are friendly, and it is a clean hotel, conveniently located near many popular attractions in Waikiki. I would stay here again!

I fell for the "top secret" room, guaranteed by Travelocity to be "at least a 3 star hotel". This was NOT a 3 star hotel. Our first room was filthy with dirt, hair, lint, and other various grime along all of the walls and in the bathroom. I requested a new room and they gave my husband and I a room which was cleaner, but the shower faucet didn't shut off completely. The noise from the street was obnoxious at all hours, day and night. The elevator is outright dangerous, not to mention the slowest elevator I've ever seen. The elevator door shuts on several people a day. There is an additional "resort fee" of $10/day plus tax which is required. It includes a basic continental breakfast of cold cereal, pastries (some with SPAM), coffee, milk, and pineapple juice. Their business center consisted of two computers in the lobby with a broken printer. We requested extra towels each day, which we never received. Their beach towels are shower towels and "complementary beach equipment" (including snorkeling) is piled in a bin by the front door each day without being sanitized. Needless to say, we were less than impressed and will not be returning.

First let just say that I used to work in a hotel for many years so I am definitely empathetic to the hospitality industry however, let's start with the positive first:The hotel is located in a great location right in the heart of Waikiki, close to the beach and just off the main strip, Kalakaua Ave. Everything you could possibly need is within a short walking distance from the hotel.Our check-in was rather quick given I had a prepaid reservation through Hotels.com. The room itself was small with a queen size bed, adequate but cozy. Our room had no overhead lights whatsoever. I thought this was a little odd. Instead we had only a floor lamp and a small desk lamp on the dresser as our main source of light during the evening. A bit of an inconvenience as light (overhead) in the hotel room should really be a standard at any hotel establishment. Aside from this, I had requested for a mini refrigerator and was told that they would bring it up the next day. Fair enough, it was in the evening when I requested it although it would seem a rather simple request. Maybe the houseman on duty was on break? Maybe there was limited staff? Who knows. Well the refrigerator doesn't come at all. After speaking with the front desk all they could do was apologize.I should also mention the remote for the TV in our room was broken. It was incredibly difficult to operate just switching the channels. The buttons weren't registering when trying to change channels. As we were checking out it was explained that my deposit will be released within 3-5 business days. Typical practice of any hotel however this was not the case here.I called after the 10th business day, spoke with the hotel staff in regards my deposit and was recited the hotels deposit policy again. I was assured that my deposit would be released within the next few days. It was clear that nobody knew of my situation or really cared for that matter. So I called and attempted to speak with the MOD (Manager on Duty) and was told that he was not available. Sadly, as expected this was the case every time I would call. After leaving several messages I still haven't been refunded my deposit. You would expect at the very least a return phone call. Shameful. This has been an awful experience so far. The main reason I am writing this review is because I believe future guests should be aware of such practices (and possibly what to expect) before booking a reservation at this hotel.

This hotel has a fantastic location! It is one very short block to the beach. The breakfast is great, coffee, danish, toast, cereal, juice and coffee. There is a convienence store on two doors down that has food, wine, liquor etc. The staff was great. Yes the rooms could use a little rereshing, but they were clean, and safe. The is only one elevator and it can be a short wait, but hey, you are on vacation, relax a bit. Over all, a great stay!

the stay was ok the hotel is cute. but they make you pay an extra $20 a day for parking plus $10 a day for something else which sucks big time... but other than that the people are nice the hotel is quiet and the ladies that rent rooms here are freaking gorgeous!

I booked this through a hotel website and it was one of the cheaper places near Waikiki. You are about a block from the beach so for the price it couldn't be beat. It however feels like a converted apartment block, so the foyer is like the pictures but then once you get into the elevator (which is small) and go down the outdoor hallway to your room, it feels like you're in a grungy apartment complex. The lock on the door seemed flimsy and even though we were on the 4 floor I felt very exposed. The room is tiny and although the decor is as pictured, it's like putting lipstick on a pig - the mattress is thin and uncomfortable, the walls are thin and the bathroom is small and dirty. I don't think it's because they haven't cleaned it, it's just dirty the way old apartment bathrooms get dirty. We stayed 2 nights and had no major issues so if price is your limit, then by all means okay, but if you have the money, I would go elsewhere.

When we booked a room at this hotel it was the first time that we hadn't read the tripadvisor reviews. And when we got there we really wished we had! As most of the reviews say, the pictures that they have on their website and on other websites, have nothing to do with reality. We booked it based on these beautiful - deceiving - photos of a bright, spacious, modern, clean room and what we got was a tiny, dirty, dark hole. Not where you expect to stay in Hawaii, a dream-of-a-lifetime place. At first sight seems renovated, with modern furniture, but in reality is abandoned and sleazy. It's dirty and not at all great value for money. When we saw the room, we ran down immediately and asked if they could move us to another room. We were told that we had to wait for the next day, because at that time they were fully booked. With no other choice we had to sleep in that room for the night.... The soundproofing? Non existent! Zero! Worst sleep ever. Anyway, the following morning, went down for breakfast. The breakfast buffet was a joke!!! It was a small corner, with some weird looking muffins and a couple of other things. OMG! It was the most pathetic breakfast EVER! Better remove it folks, take it out of your hotel's services! After that went straight to the front desk and requested another room. The lady said we had to wait till 12.00 to see the only other room available, which was sliiiiiiightly bigger but overall similar to ours. We then asked if we could get a refund in case we'd like to move out and she said yes. That was it. We found a decent hotel a block away with less money! Terryfing experience, honestly. Just don' t bother, don't waste you time or money here.The two stars review is only for the great location and for the very helpful staff. Especially for Phyllis, on the front desk, who was very kind and polite.

The first day we got in, the shower head was leaking water and the toilet was clogged. The water sprayed over the shower curtain and flooded the bathroom floor. I must say the staff is very nice and they were able to get maintenance to fix the leak and unclog the toilet that night. The room does not have the typical sealed windows so it gets very noisy at night. You will hear buses and garbage trucks, as well as any construction that is going on in the area. I suggest you bring ear plugs if you are staying here. Housekeeping did not clean our room very well on a daily basis. They basically just tidied up the room like make your bed and change the towels. You can tell they do not vacuum, scrub the bathroom, or wipe any tabletops down because I see the same stains and hair on the floor. I also saw a huge roach one day right outside of our room. Some of their sheets/towels/blankets are stained. Breakfast does not consist of any hot food, there is tea/coffee, cereal, toast, or some pastries. There is also no fridge, microwave, or water boiler included in your room, but they do have a hair dryer. They say that they have beach gear available, but their beach gear is 3 beach mats, 2 floaties, and 1 beach chair. They do not have any towels available until 2pm, so I suggest you grab whatever beach gear you need the night before. They also charge you a $10 per day fee for wifi, but their wifi is sooooo slow. There were times when I could not go onto anything on my iPhone. In conclusion, I would not stay here again and do not recommend it, but if you are just looking for a low budget place to sleep for 6 hours that's close to the beach and shopping then it might be ok for you.

This hotel is fantastic for young travelers who are not expecting a serene resort. I have a little news for all of the travelers complaining about the noise - Waikiki is probably the noisiest place on Oahu. That's not the hotel's fault. If you want a quieter tropical Hawaiian vacation, go to a neighbor island like Maui or Kauai. It's going to cost you, but you'll get some peace and quiet. This hotel room was clean, small but cozy, and my room had an adorable little balcony. I don't mind the amenities fee because it's small, and it's Hawaii, everything is expensive. I will definitely stay here again next time I come back to Hawaii to visit friends. The staff were helpful and friendly, the place is about one block from the beach, and during my stay, it was actually very quiet and calm. Very pleasantly surprised and glad to have such a great place to stay for cheap in Honolulu!
user_name:
LilTundah
Charlotte, North Carolina, United States

review_body: The pictures online are not accurate. Crunchy sheets, cockroaches, and a disgusting shower. Top it off with hidden "amenities fee" for water and a picked over breakfast. Parking is a $ 20 additional fee. It is located in the middle of the city and the noise is CRAZY.

Room is clean, comfortable and the staff is exceptional. Free continental breakfast, beach gear to share, free wifi... all a very nice touch. We have stayed elsewhere in Waikiki for more and got much, much less. Convenient location, close to everything.

This is a great place to stay if you dont want to pay out for a really expensive hotel on the beach. The staff are exceedingly friendly and helpful, it is a minutes walk from the beach and it is close to the main area with restaurants and shops. We organised to visit Pearl Harbor ourselves and reception booked us a shuttle that picked us up from the hotel ($16 return - organised tours are much more expensive!). The hotel also booked us a shuttle to take us to the airport which was $12. There is a $10 resort fee which we knew abut before travelling - however we had stayed in other hotels across America and had been charged up to $28 a night resort fee so it is good value compared to other places (and the wifi does work well in the hotel. You are also given a code when you check in to access wifi on the beach although that was a bit hit and miss). The rooms were definitely adequate in size for two people and cases and we had a balcony. (if you are floor 5 and up you get a balcony) We would definitely stay here again

For the money we paid - this is excellent value for money. The hotel is located right in the middle of everything - the beach is only a two minute walk away, there is an ATM across the road and an ABC store next door. The hustle of Waikiki's restaurants and shops are only a stroll away. Beach towels are provided by the very friendly staff each day and there are chairs/lilos/beach balls available too. We spent a day and a half at Pearl Harbour and the staff booked a shuttle bus for us ($16 round trip) and advised us of the best time to get there (as early as possible as there are limited tickets per day to go and see the USS Arizona memorial). The staff also arranged a shuttle back to the airport ($12 per person).The room is very clean and the AC is efficient. We were on the fifth floor and got a small balcony also. There is plenty of storage space for luggage (we were here for five days) and the rooms are cleaned daily.There is a $10 'resort fee' which is for the WiFi and breakfast (toast, cereal, coffee, pastries, tea). The hotel staff were upfront about this at check in and is considerably less than the resort fee at the Sheraton ($29 per day!).This is not the Sheraton or the Royal Hawaiian but we would highly recommend here. There is a relaxed feel about the place.

I am giving this hotel an "barely average" rating, based on my view that this is actually a two-star hotel, like the Ambassador Hotel of Waikiki, Castle Hokele Suites, Maile Sky Court, etc. For some reason, both Travelocity and Expedia put this hotel in the category of three-star hotels, but if I compared it to other three-star hotels, I would have to give it a "poor" rating. This hotel is very basic, but has been painted, redecorated and given new, more modern furniture. It is, however, an older building with a very, very slow elevator and old-fashioned jalousie windows which are not sound-proof. The bed linens looked clean enough, but the floor looked dirty around the edges, there is still mold or mildew in the grout/caulking of the tub, and no counter-space or cabinet-space in the bathroom, no doors on the closet (just cheap-looking curtains), and the dresser top was dented up. This is a fine room if you get it at the right price, as I did: I bought it as a Travelocity "mystery hotel". If you have a car, this might not be a good choice, as the hotel has minimal parking available. It is in a very convenient location, though, for walking or taking the bus. There was a mini-fridge in my room, too. I didn't try the restaurant/bar, but received a $5 off coupon each day to use there. If you don't expect much, and and can get this hotel for a good price, it might be just the place for you.

It was a good place to stay.love the location.Service and staff are great.The extra $10. was worth it.The staff was very helpful..love the security there.What question I had ,they answer with a smile.

We stayed 4 days in 2 different rooms during august. If you are looking for a hotel next to the beach and close to nearby services in Honolulu, this is the place.On the good side, location is the most positive point and some of the staff are very helpful. Breakfast acceptable.On the not so good side we have to say that rooms are quite tiny an depending on the area quite noisy. We couldnt rest some of the days because that annoying noise...but no problem because the breakfast is served at 7 am so you can set off really early.... :> On top of that, we have to notice that when making a reservation with the parking lot, and having confirmed it 3 times, when we arrived at the hotel they just simply had released it. When problems arisen, part of the staff was not attentive and service was quite dissapointing. In our opinion some of the skills and competences of staff attending customers should be reviewed, attitude is basic when helping others... this will probably be an exception, but good management has to be aware about all these cases...

I booked the Stay Hotel for our recent trip to Oahu because the location was great and the price was right. Other reviewers are completely correct in noting that the rooms are TINY (and the bathroom is even smaller), but since we spent most of our time out and about it was exactly what we needed: A comfortable bed, air conditioning and a shower :). it was actually quite cozy, really.The only thing that I really felt Stay Hotel was missing was a mini-fridge in the room. This is the one thing that kept me from rating this property "Very Good" and that might keep me from staying there again. So that's my one piece of feedback -- I hope they take it into consideration!

I must say, in all fairness, that the staff at Stay Hotel are absolutely wonderful and helpful. However, for future guests, please note of the following: You will be charged an extra $10 PER DAY for a so called "amenities fee," which is not mentioned on their website at all--very sneaky, made me feel taken advantage of! They don't mention this to you until you arrive at the hotel, what's up with that?! The charge is for a purported "amenities fee," which is basically for internet access and breakfast--bland toast and coffee that is on display just so the hotel can say they serve "continental breakfast." Also, please note that if you go to Stay Hotel's website, it is listed that they have "complimentary WiFi internet access" which is not the case at all, as they charge you for this without having it mentioned to you until you arrive at the hotel. "Complimentary" eh? ... Overall, staff are nice but it is a misleading hotel; very sneaky indeed. Oh, and also, my room was far from the pictures posted on their website: we were given bunk beds--no joke. A hotel with bunk beds (and I was with a girl I was trying to impress)--she slept above me and I under her; just awful.

I am pretty torn about the Stay. The good: Great location right by the beach, many shops, restaurants, int'l market etc, and it's right across the street from the Hyatt which is a pick up location for most tour buses and luau transportation so that's good. The staff was really friendly and gave good directions and tips (add sugar to the poi). They have complimentary beach toys in lobby which is always nice. The bad: the breakfast was very dissapointing, these use to be UH dorms and are set-up up like so, NO REFRIGERATOR, very loud, we asked for additional blankets on the first night and they were out, I mean really a hotel out of blankets? Wi-fi was terrible but they do have computers and printing in the lobby.

I stayed here for 5 x nights and took on board the reviews. It is one block back from the beach, clean and comfortable. Daily breakfast was toast, pastries and very strong coffee. I took my own coffee bags and just had toast. You can get extra fruit from ABC next door and stuff for lunch. I took ear plugs and a night mask. I felt safe. The staff are friendly and accommodating. In fact my stay was so positive, I have changed my accommodation nod coming back for the rest if my stay. Tips: walk to the DFS store and get the 1 day green red and pink trolley pass, then get the blue pass for $10.00 extra. That is your sight seeing taken care for three days. Dinner at Blazing Steaks 2x was cheap and really tasty.

Got a fantastic secret deal through late rooms type website, arrived at 7am and was going to be leaving at 3am next day, offered to pay extra if I could get a room right away. Nice guy on the desk swapped me out of the room I was meant to be in (8th floor) to fourth floor and I was able to have shower after my long flights and sleep straight away. I wasn't charged any extra either - just one day amenity fee. The drawback was the room was lower - just above the entrance to the hotel, and faced the road .Basic Room looks good, clean and bright (had two single beds in mine), but have to agree with others about the poorly fitted louvre windows being the wrong choice for a hotel, they let in all the noise of the people partying and frequent buses that use the road outside. Shower pressure was good for me. Location is pretty good with all of Waikiki needs in walking distance. elevator is quite a physical beast trying to bite you as others have said. Fire alarm also went off (when I was lathered in the shower of course),

great staff very friendly! let us use a bottle of sunblock each day we were there great location. box full of beach accessories in lobby that you can use.continental bfast in morning.bad that check in is not till 4 but they will take your bags and lock them up for you then call you if your room is ready early

The bright side:- Fairly clean.- Amenities: internet, computers and printer in the lobby, free movie rental.- Breakfast. Don’t expect much of it but enough to start the day. Coffee lovers will have to look for the closest coffee shop though, I’m afraid.- Friendly staff.- Location.The dark side:- Upon arrival, and saying that mine wasn’t ready yet, they tried to give me a shoebox of a room. When I came back to reception asking when the room I had booked was going to be ready they gave me another one, this time of normal size.- Where those windows? Why on earth would anyone use slatted glass windows? It’s the least energy efficient and soundproof thing ever, which leads to the following point.- Incredibly noisy. Proper windows would have helped a lot.- The room key stopped working twice and I had to go back to reception to have it reset.- I already knew about the resort fee ($10 +tax per night, per guest), but still I find it annoying that you have to pay for it once you check out. If they are going to charge that fee anyway, why not do it at the time of the reservation and be done with it.- When checking out I was asked whether I had a scooter, which I had not. Apparently, someone had used my room number to park their scooter. Parking is $20+tax a day, not precisely cheap. The manager quickly took that out of my bill, but it didn’t feel very reassuring, so I’ll be checking my bank account just in case.

Very misleading. Showed up and was told we couldn't check in until 4 pm. Came in with my wife and 2 year old son. We had a total of 6 bags because we were staying for about a week. Not a single staff member offered to help with anything. Then was told we had to pay $20/night for parking which was never said before and wasn't on their website. And they had no parking available for us. So we had to park at a public garage 2 blocks away. We finally made it to our room and it was less than mediocre. It didnt have any modern amenities that you would find in any average hotel even though they charge a $10/day amenity fee which covered a less than satisfactory continental "breakfast". There was no mini fridge, microwave or even a blow dryer. The balcony was a joke. Elevators were sketchy. If you weren't in the elevator within about 3-5 seconds of it opening the doors closed on you. About the only thing this hotel did right was making it look good on its website. Just an overall poor excuse of a hotel as well as staff

convienent and affordable. Great location in Waikiki. Does not look like website pics but if a place to stay at a cheap price is all you're looking for then this place is it. Parking is a nightmare if lot is full. Nearest parking is 2 blocks away and cost $20 for 24 hours.

This place is not as advertised... On the website it looks like a cool modern boutique hotel but in reality it is a third rate hotel with ikea finishes. The only saving grace is the staff is very friendly. I would not recommend this place and don't let the website fool you.

people here are amazing. the restraunt staff here is tops in waikiki.. The little Gina bartender is one of the most hospitable people if ever run into. Great prices great info from the staff about the area. awsome infusments. They have amazing food here and great prices compaired to some of the place here in waikiki. I really enjoied the selections of draft beers. They ribs here are amazing. I hope to return soon here. Mahalo to all the staff that made my stay here memorible. Cant wait to come back and see all the smiling faces here.

I stayed here for a long week in the end of March 2013. This place is not too bad, the room was tight which I was not expecting. It was me and my boyfriend and our suitcases, which took up most of the room. This beach is right around the corner from the hotel, plenty of food everywhere. The staff where friendly especially the cleaning lady. Would I stay here again? Sure why not, I did not have any real problems with this hotel plus the location is nice.

Modest little place compared to some of the gaudy hotels on the beach but a perfect place for the price. It has everything you need - wireless, beach towels, beach chairs, continental breakfast, free DVDs - and is just a minute walk to the beach. For the price we were very happy. Our only complaint was that there wasn't a "hand" chair in the room like there was in the picture. Other than that, wonderful place.

This place is awful. It looks so cool in the pictures but when I walked in, it was basically a large prison cell. Totally false advertising. They screwed up my bill, and when I was trying to fix it the staff was no help. It is less than a block to the beach, so that's nice... But that was it. Just don't bother.

We were lucky enough to find this place on the Internet looking for a cheap clean room in Waikiki . After arriving at stay we we very pleased with the hotel .Rooms were clean and serviced daily nothing was a problem for the staff they were alway's happy to help fresh pastries and breakfast was great. Free wifi great ,free DVD also great I would recomend this place to any one . As for the charges people are talking about ($100 bond and $10 daily fee ) theses fees are normal and are just life .

Hi the hotel room fit my bill. It was basic and clean, conviently located near the beach and that is what I wanted. I did not want to pay for Spas, or ocean views, etc, all I wanted was a bed and a bathroom. I was in Hawaii to see the sites, not spend time in my room, so it was a block from the Waikiki beach and lots of shopping and restaurants.

Ok, the hotel is very basic, if u are a traveler in a tight budget, this is a perfect place for u!! Hotel is clean and just one block away from the beach, restaurants, bars and shops!!!!! Staff is very friendly and courteous, they found a shuttle for us to the airport that charges $8 per person, cant beat that....the breakfast is not really a breakfast, just get the coffee and juice (no matter what they still charge u $10) I think they should reconsider charging that for such a poor breakfast.... if u can afford more and looking for luxury, look elsewhere....

Austere doesn't begin to describe this place-the stark, white room has no in-room phone, kitchenette, coffee, nothing, but the location is fantastic- it's right where you want to be in Waikiki, three minutes from the best part of the beach, near the Int'l Market, the zoo, everything you could want to do in Waikiki.The continental breakfast features all the usual suspects and is okay. The front desk folk are nice for the most part and helpful with one or two exceptions.Frig avail. for room on request.Probably not the best choice for a long-term stay like we're having due to the lack of amenities. And the cb isn't really free since you're hit with a $10 per day amenities fee.It looks like this was an apt. building that was converted to a "hotel."

I stayed at STAY WAIKIKI for 3 nights starting the 25th of May. I checked in quite late and got a bit surprised with the additional $100.00 deposit(not mentioned in the hotel policy) and another $10.00 per day for the breakfast.However, the front desk staff was friendly enough to explain about the charges.There is a lift in this building.The room is at its minimum set up. It does have a flat screen t.v, a dock station and a fiber glass(?)looking lamp. The room is clean and the bed are well made. Enough towels and soaps,shampoos are provided. I didn`t expect a single bed,because I thought it was a dorm style for two.So I`m quite impressed when I got the room for myself.The not so good part about this room is that there is not much of a nice view to look at if you`ll be able to open the windows. It needs a little bit of renovation also.Otherwise,breakfast is ok,there is an internet service and close to shops and the beach.Just behind Hyatt Regency.They are also providing beach mats,balls,etc. for free of use.I will certainly recommend it and will come back even just for the sleep.

The most misleading place. The pictures are not even close. Please stay away from this hotel. My room was bit up and dirty. The curtains were black...nasty dirty. Bathroom's toilet sit was dirty and they only give you one pillow per person.The continental breakfast was ok. Good coffee and pastries.Phyllis was nice. It is a shame to have a hotel so close to the beach in such a poor condition. They could make it much better if it was at least clean.

The location is perfect. If you want a fairly inexpensive room without the frills then it is perfect for you. It is a little dated with a modern twist if that explains anything. The room is realy small and so are the beds but I felt really safe. It is a bit noisy but it is a tourist area so it is busy with a lot of traffic. However, the running of the air conditioner drowned everything out for me so I didn't hear anything. The staff is really nice, pleasant and personable. Everything is in walking distance so you don't need a car. I enjoyed my experience.
user_name:
Katherine B
Atlanta, Georgia, United States

review_body: On the 25th of May 2013, we arrived at our booked and fully paid hotel at the Stay Hotel Waikiki. We were supposed to stay there from the 25th until 30th of May. The room was NOT what we had expected at all. The floor was dirty and sticky and grimy and in the main part of the room, there was no light except for a dull feature light. The room was tiny, messy, and not what was shown on the website. The window in the bathroom was very unsafe as it was a simple loover and the panes could have easily been removed. We felt unsafe. The reception looks somewhat beautiful, however the rooms are a totally different story. We checked out immediately. The staff was friendly, but I would never stay there again. I wouldn't even let my dog stay in that room to be honest.

While the location to Wikiki Beach is good, the hotel is gross. It is SO noisy we were up all night, the rooms are bare, minimal and only fairly clean. Hotwire rated this as a 3 star hotel, it is NOT. We were a couple and they kept saying the had booked a bunk bed room. Most of the staff were very unfriendly and not happy to accomodate you at all. The extra $10 Ammenities fee you have to pay regardless of is you use any of the "ammenities" available. The hotwire description and their own website does not accurately portray the "hotel"

My husband & I were here for 7 days. Price wasnt so bad. The room was small, no fridge or tables. But opverall perfect for the two of us. Sway had amazing Poke & Fish Tacos. The next time I ordered the Beef Tacos, they weren't as good. They are new & in training. My favorite drink was "The Daisy" Mmmmm! :) The "contintenal" breakfast was not free!!!!! It's 10$ a day! I never used wifi since I have an iPhone. One time, the front desk was left alone. The lady ran to McDonalds and me & another customer were standing there wondering for a few minutes. If you cannot get a break with coverage, bring a meal or snacks!Overall, not bad. Would come again so we could be close to the beach and those Dasies! ;)

it was the most terrible experience of my life, such a bad customer, and room service was horrible, they didn't change our bed sheets 3 days, until we went and complained, they were so cheap that they wouldn't change your small little shampoo bottle if it wasn't completely empty, showers were so dirty and old..no central AC unit, no Iron, not even a coffee maker, and also the 2 computers that they had was out of service the 4 days that I was there.... and did I mentioned Bad customer service

I booked Stay Hotel for a 2 night stay in Honolulu for our honeymoon on Hotwire. On Hotwire, I purchased the trip based on the 3 star rating. Had I known it was going to be what we experienced, I would've never made the transaction. The pictures on their site do not represent the actual room. This is more like a 1.5 or 2 stars hotel.The location is the only thing that's good with this hotel. It is situated in the same area as the high-end hotels such as Surfrider, Sheraton, Aston, etc. Very close to Waikiki beach.Now onto the real review. As soon as we walked into the room, we were hit by how tiny it is. It really does feel like a prison cell. We were given a room with a bunk bed, which we were not happy with, and couldn't even make use of the top bunk since the stairs to the top bunk were wobbly and my husband felt like the bed was going to collapse with his weight (he is not a heavy man!). So we both squeezed into the tiny bottom bunk. Thank goodness we're both slim. Needless to say, for two nights we did not sleep well.The rug on the floor was tacky and dirty. I was really hesitant to put anything on the floor (including our luggage).The bathroom was TINY. If you're a big person, you may have to keep the door open to do your business or to use the vanity mirror/sink.When we first checked in, it was late afternoon so all their housekeeping staff had left. I asked whether there is a hairdryer in the unit and was told there should be one. However, there wasn't one in our room, so I went downstairs and asked if they can provide one. The guy at the front desk told me he'd have one ready for me when I returned. Of course, at night, when I got back to the hotel, he was not there, and did not leave a note for the girl at the front desk on where the hairdryer is for the customer. So... I had to suffer a night without washing my hair. This just added another level of frustration to the day. Thank goodness, the next day I was finally able to obtain a hairdryer.There's an amenity fee of $10 that includes wifi, breakfast, the use of beach towels and some beach stuff.the amenity fee does not include parking. There is no parking at the hotel. If you have a car, you have to park at the Waikiki Banyan lot that's a 7-minute walk away for $12 a day. We couldn't wait to leave as soon as the 2 days were up and move to Moana Surfrider. The resort fee there is $30, but includes parking right across the street with in and out privileges, use of their big pool, internet, and a photo per day by a professional photographer. Thank goodness we only stayed here for 2 days and were able to enjoy the rest of our vacation at a nicer place.I guess I'm more pissed at Hotwire for marking this place up to 3 stars when it really is not.

We had a great time at the Stay Hotel. We had bunk beds which made the most of the small room. It was decorated cool and there was plenty of room for our luggage. The amenities were nice, including the free DVDs and continental breakfast. It was all carbs but tasty enough for a quick bite to tide one over. The bathroom was the only issue to speak of. It is REALLY tiny. It's hard to wash your face because the sink is so small and there is a shelf right above it hitting you in the face if you bend over and there was barely enough room for one person in front of the mirror, much less two. There was another mirror in the hallway though. It's kind of claustrophobic trying to get dressed in there after taking a shower but otherwise the hotel is great and the location can't be beat, especially for the price. It might not be good for two people that both require a lot of primping but for the budget minded traveler on the go, it's a bargain. I'd definitely stay there again.

This hotel is in a great location. However, our room was gross. There were stains (and a hair) on our bedsheets and the shower had not been cleaned after the prior tenants. The evidence was their used soap, shampoo and conditioner were still in place! The rug appeared clean but dingy. We had windows which weren't able to be opened and an air conditioning unit which was noisy and worked poorly. It was a terrible night sleep-hot & stuffy. We attempted to talk to the manager 3x both in person and afterwards by phone. We were told that they were 'off premises' but were assured that we would be called shortly. Still no call 2 weeks later. Other reviews said that above the 4th floor the rooms were nicer. We were on a lower level, which could account for the stuffiness, but is no excuse for the poor hygiene. Mommas, don't let your babies grow up to stay at Stay Waikiki!!

This hotel was booked through Hotwire (which I DO NOT recommend) -- they ended up putting me and my partner in a twin bunk bed -- our stay was only 1 night, and the hotel itself is more of a motel -- unwilling to budge front-desk staff, even though they had a queen bed available, only wanted to upgrade for an unreasonable price. This is not the way a business should be run -- I also found the hotel to be sub-par (and I'm NOT a hotel snob) -- I used to travel via hostels just a few years ago and this hotel has the vibe of a hostel -- not worth the $130 I spent for a crummy room.

Great location, i.e, walking distance to beach, right downtown, near all shopping; Room was OK but needs mirror for wife; Breakfast OK - could have used small tables in lounge area; Parking unsat, i.e, not available first 2 nights due to repairs, then, not available at all due to limited space - $20/night if available.
user_name:
NJBoricua
Passaic, New Jersey, United States

review_body: My partner and myself stayed 2 nights at stays at the end of our Hawaii trip.. It is obviously a budget hotel and you get what you pay for, that said we didnt find it nearly as bad as some of the reviews on here, we had a queen room on the 10th floor, you could see the ocean, it was clean, our bed was made every day for us, the staff were friendly, there was cable T.V and movies and it's in a great location.. You get what you pay for, Stays wasnt terrible, it was just budget.. The only critisizm would be that it is noisy at night, but we had ear plugs, so no big deal.If your traveling on a budget or have a super early flight to catch Stay Waikiki isnt a bad choise at all, you may not want to spend 2 weeks there but it was enjoyable for a few nights..Tim and Courtney

We enjoyed our stay at STAY!! The staff is very friendly. The location is great and the price was right. The hotel rooms had very cute decor. I only wish that there were luggage stands, in room safes & irons. That would have made things better. Especially if you travel with expensive jewelry, electonic devices and passports that need to be protected. Otherwise, we really had a nice vacation and would refer this hotel to friends and family :-)) Aloha!!!

I didnt know what to expect upon arrival from reading the reviews but am very happy with my stay. The hotel is nice and well kept and the staff is so nice, friendly and helpful. I found Stay Waikiki a quiet place and felt very safe. The hotel is quaint and low key yet in a great location to everything. Will definetely vacation he. So very happy I took a chance on Stay Waikiki.

This is the worst hotel experience I EVER had, anywhere. I am a regular visitor to Hawaii and I booked this hotel because I had to come on short notice and this is one of the few hotels available at a reasonable price. However, I would NOT recommend this hotel. Some of the problems I encountered: TWO straight days of no maid service, despite a "maid service request sign" being displayed on the door; no fridge and no microwave; very sparse furnishings; no free local phone calls; no room service; and to add insult to injury, an amenity surcharge is applied for each day of stay. VERY loud at night - I can hear people talking on the streets late in the night; the sound of crushing glass directly outside; and police sirens can be heard.

Lovely few days stay here on my own after friends left. After reading reviews after booking i was worried - however the staff made me feel very safe and i thoroughly enjoyed my time here. Great location for everything in Waikiki. added extras such as dvd rental and wifi in building and outside was brilliant. Lovely bright airy rooms. Wasnt expecting $10 a day fee but have since found out all hotels charge this. Tips and added tax are usual in Hawaii!

From the moment my husband and I set foot in this hotel, I wanted to cry. First, the staff said the only parking spot they had left was the moped spot. It took us 20 times backing up and forward to get the car to fit, and I couldn't get out of the car once it was parked so I had to get out first. Then, after finally getting up to the room, this is when I really became upset. One other reviewer described the rooms in this hotel as a "prison cell with Ikea furniture". I couldn't explain it better myself. The room was clean, I'll give them that, but there was a horrible fluorescent light shining through the window. We woke up in the middle of the night thinking it was daylight already, and it was only 3am! I had to take one of the blankets and attach it to the air conditioning unit. I am not typically not a picky person, but this hotel is horrible. My husband had to convince me to stay, as I wanted to find another hotel. I lived in Hawaii for 6 years and as a tourist, you will not appreciate Hawaii for what it is if you stay in this hotel.

Aloha fellow travellers....I spent 2 nights at this place and was not impressed at all...false advertising and misleading websites lead me here and if I knew the facilites here were dodgy, I would've spent my money elsewhere. The $10 fee at the end of stay was dodgy, but I knew that when I booked, what I didn't know was the BUNK beds that I had in the room. I was expecting twin share, but recieved BUNK BEDS for $100 a night, NOT cool at all....I would've gladly paid this price for the HOSTEL or backpackers, at least you knew what you're in for...Location was great, once I got my bearings, but still not worth the price that was paid. Also, a chair and small table wouldve been handy, just to sit and watch tv or eat on.....not happening with this place....The travel agent I booked this place through, also said airport transfers were included, yeah nah, that wasn't true, and when I went to arrange transfer back to the airport after my stay the receptionist was giving me the most expensive form of transport - a taxi - for like $45...hmmm...I asked for cheaper options and the speedishuttle was only $13, thank u speedishuttle. WIFi was a waste of time, I spent a fair amount of time on the main computers, only cause they worked better. Customer service was ok, I bothered them a fair bit, just looking for the shower in the room, and eventually found it hiding behind the toilet door...hmmmmm....wasn't too keen on using many of the facilities, (even the lift) they looked like they were going to break....and the VEIW of the other apartments...hmmmm....closed curtains worked for me....UNIMPRESSED with the HOTEL....would I stay here again...Definitely NOT....

This is not high end and you should not expect "plush" based on the price. But the bed was comfy and the staff very pleasant. Location directly behind Hyatt was great. A lot of tours have their pick up at Hyatt back side. Noisy though....bring ear plugs. Lots of traffic noise, construction, and the birds are loud at day-break! (but they are cute too). Check out Side Street Inn on Da Strip for good food. Avoid strip restaurants if possible. crappy food and service. California Kitchen automatically added in an 18% tip...no wonder the service was lousy, no need for the servers to work for their tips. I would recommend Stay Hotel for a great location at a budget price. Mahalo! (re amenity fee...I am OK with that...it was disclosed to me by Travelocity when i booked that the fee would be charged. many places in Europe charge a lot more per day for wi fi)

We stayed here for one night between flying back from the Big Island and flying to Los Angeles. It's fine - no complaints about the room or the cleanliness - but let down by a couple of things. Firstly there's a compulsory $10 'amenity fee', which you are ambushed with on checking in. It's dishonest to add costs, even if it's a small amount, because guests may have chosen the hotel largely because of the price.There was heavy building work going on on the site which we weren't warned about, and the noise made it impossible to spend any time there during the day.Lastly the front of house staff were completely inept and unhelpful. We asked them to book us a taxi for 3am. We asked how much it would cost and the answer was "I don't know, sorry." Later we enquired whether the taxi had been booked yet and they confirmed it had. At 3am we came down and the night staff said the taxi hadn't been booked. I was amazed, but luckily the night staff acted quickly and got us to the airport in time.Again, not a bad word to say about the room itself, but would still advise a bit of caution when considering staying here.

this place does not get the right to call itself a boutique because their general rooms look like a cross between a dorm room/hostel/jail cell.no parking avail, no valet options, irritated front desk rep, a lobby full of white sofas no one would sit on, janky elevator and ghetto ammenities-internet doesnt work and info about general logistics printed on 1x2 cutouts.oh, the rooms are creepy, like a cement cell with a wanna be makeover. we got bunk beds, what a joke. the ladder is so uncomfortable to get on and beds are for kids. bathroom is smaller than a new york city studio. the sink is for a child.broken curtains and gross carpeting to top it off. it makes me wanna run away. only good thing, location.

Mainly great helpful staff they do their best to help you, amazing location 2 minutes walk from the sands! Waikiki beach is cool although VERY crowded and busy. Good cheap cheerful hotel, found the room clean and modern but very noisy (2nd floor).Negative: You think you are paying one price but when you arrive you get charged more?! And you have to pay an amenity fee for extra things that don't work/can't use... the internet DOES NOT work it is ridiculous, I booked this hotel thinking I was getting this included yet I have spent over $45 on roaming fee's as this is just easier than trying to connect to the wifi! Also breakfast is just bread/pastry stuff basically only good if you wanna be obese by the end of your stay. Only thing I wanted in the morning was a cup of coffee but they don't provide milk (seriously, half the world drink coffee with milk you should think about providing this!) Starbucks down the road came in useful. The other benefit your compulsory 'amenity fee' covers is free dvd hire - well this did not work either, we tried 3 different dvds which wouldn't play so don't know if the problem was the dvd player or the dvd's... so gave up. The TV in the room is at the edge of the room and cannot be moved/twisted. We had a twin room so bed one could see the tv by leaning to one side but bed 2 may as well forget it. Bad design. The 'amenity fee' also covered free beach stuff to hire... good things always picked up early only broken deck chairs and falling to pieces beach mats left by the time we got there.Although frustrating - the location, friendly staff and reasonable price made up for all the bad points, with a few improvements this hotel would really be on to a good thing. We had a great time in Hawaii :-)

GOOD POINTS- Hotel staff were very helpful & friendly- Very close location to beach & bars- Cheap! (Or it was when I paid for it!!)BAD POINTS- Every towel was stained either with yellow/brown marks or pink - which was very off putting after showering!!- The room was never swept, mopped or hoovered whilst we stayed there, the same dirty marks, sand and fluff/hair were left on the floor.- The wifi booted you out every 5 minutes & it was very frustrating!!- It was very noisy both during the day & night as the hotel is opposite the service entrance of the Hyatt hotel & close to stores and restaurants that have frequent deliveries.All in all the Stay is a good hotel if you want somewhere to shower and rest your head.. If you're looking for a luxurious experience or want to spend time in your room this isn't the hotel for you!!

Front desk personnel was not really helpful and/or friendly and did not look presentable. Elevator was broke twice during our stay. TV channel line-up poor. Did not receive fresh towels on all days. Never received fresh bathroom amenities. Hotel advertised black-out curtains but light came in from all sides. Window was rusted in place and good not be opened.Bed quality poor. Never received an email receipt as promised upon check-out (could not be presented upon check-out as the computer system was down?)

Stayed 5 nights on a prepaid vacation. No question that the location is great; close to beach, shops and restaurants. That's the good part.Our room , as other reviewers have commented, was small, poorly lighted, and dirty. Floors were ceramic tile with a small throw rug, neither of which showed evidence of recent cleaning, (The maid's cart had a vacuum cleaner but it is doubtful it had been used for awhile.) Certainly a mop had not met the tile floor for quite some time. The bathroom fixtures were old, some faucets turned backwards, previously chrome items such as sink drain. paper holder etc. are now rusted. One day the maid removed the dirty towels but didn't replace them with fresh ones.The bed caved in toward the middle so 2 people have no choice but to roll against each other. The air conditioner did work but was located within a foot of the head of the bed so the person sleeping on that side had cold air blowing directly on his head & neck. The advertised parking garage has less spaces than there are rooms so look forward to using a public facility and walking 2 blocks to and from your car. The "free" continental breakfast isn't exactly free and the selection of items is sparse with no variation from day to day. I must say that the coffee is good!I can only say that those reviewers who have given praise and laudatory comments are either very inexperienced travelers or were not at the same hotel we stayed at.

The location is walking distance to the beach. Hotel is situated between two other apartment buildings, one being a hostel so a balcony isn't necessary if you are looking for a view. The decor is contemporary minimalist. The room is small but there was room to add shelving or other small pieces of furniture such as a chair, full size mirror, or small fridge - none of which was included. The bathroom has a nice round mirror with a small shelf but again there is enough wall space to add shelves. Bed comfort was basically ok - I did not experience discomfort. Definitely a noisy location due to trash and delivery trucks early in the morning. We were lucky to get an assigned parking space because they are limited. The garage is convenient and secure with a remote to go in and out. Spaces are extremely tight and although you are assigned a stall, people park wherever so you could get stuck with a space you have to work a 10 point parking routine. Can't complain about the free continental breakfast. Didn't like the coffee but some of the pastries were ok. We walked next door to Burger King for coffee. The staff was nice. Overall I would stay here again, only for less than $150/night. I would just be very leery in the event parking is not available. There is no way to tell until you check in.

I stayed here because I can't spend over $160 per night for a hotel room (per my company's policy). I agree with some of the other travelers about the noise level. It is pretty loud. No parking. I will not stay here again as I need my sleep, parking, fitness center. I honestly didn't feel safe as a woman staying by herself.

We booked "The Stay" hotel with hotwire and in restropect will not do that again. While the morning staff was friendly and helpful, we found the hotel to be disappointing and mediocre to say the least. The website and pictures were very misleading and do not compare to what you actually find in person at the hotel. The continental breakfast is inadequate and the flow for customer traffic is inefficient to say the least. While the rooms are fairly clean, they are minimal at best in what they offer and comfort. There is no refrigerator, iron or ironing board. There was not bathmat in the shower or place to put any toiletry items. We did not want to stay any other nights here, but were locked in with hotwire and no refund was possible. We found a better hotel with all the amenities and more hotel or travel arrangements. We do not recommend this hotel and encourage you to look further for more suitable accomodations.

Stay Waikiki is located just one small block back from Waikiki beach. It's basic hotel accommodation. The lobby is quite modern and is where breakfast is served. Breakfast consisted of pastries, toast, and tea and coffee. Wifi was included in the room rate which was fantastic. I had to wear earplugs at night due to street noise. The curtains were insufficient to block out light at night and the light right outside the window didn't help. The beach was a very short walk away. I could find very few places to hang wet towels and swimming costumes from in the room. I thought a row of hooks on the concrete block wall would have been great given the location. The room had a TV and playstation, which we didn't use. The bathroom could have done with a good scrub down of all surfaces, and a re-paint, but was clean enough. For the price and location it was a good place to stay. Being in Waikiki you're unlikely to spend a lot of time in your room!So yes I would recommend Stay Waikiki. Just don't expect a luxury experience, which you shouldn't anyway as they don't market themselves as such. I would happily stay there again.

I have stayed in several hotels from budget to beach front. The Stay is the definitely the barest bones place I have ever stayed in Waikiki. The pros- Location, behind The Hyatt. Very helpful and kind staff. Thank you. Super nice breakfast spread that is well tended. Always fresh lemon water in lobby. Bright and sunny room.The cons from according to this high maintenance gal. Bunk beds, seriously? Requested different room but they were booked. No counter space in bathroom. Used back of toilet for girl things. No full length mirror. How is a gal to make sure she is rocking her beach look. I am glad I requested a room on a higher floor, I always do this. The 5th, thru 8th floors have balconies. My room faced east and I loved the sun shining in early. I would stay here again. I got a smoking deal on Orbitz that's why I booked The Stay.I Love Waikiki and I will be back next year.

From the moment we checked in; the staff was very friendly. They changed our room due to it did not have the futon, very accommadating. Breakfast was good, heavy pastries yummy coffee and fresh juice. The hotel also has a container in the lobby that you can take beach chairs, mats, snorkle gear, flippers boogie board to borrow and return, also movies to rent for free. We stayed for 7 days, the beds are very comfortable, showers hot and clean place. close to everything in Waikiki, farmers market down the block, everyone is very nice Excellent customer service, Phyliss was awesome and so was everyone that worked that week. Housekeepers were awesome and worked very hard. We will definately be back. :)

The staff is probably some of the friendliest people I have ever met and eager to help with tourist information, etc. The rooms are clean, the internet works well. The breakfast consist of pineapple juice, rolls, bread and coffee. This is the type of place I would be happy to recommend to anyone and would gladly stay hear again. Convenient to transportation, beach, restaurants, shopping, etc.

Stayed here for 7 days, during Pro Bowl week 2013. Went through local travel agent, and everything in Waikiki was booked solid. He was however was able to find availability at the Stay. He told us its clean and since we were gonna be out and about mostly, thought it would be a great bargain. I was very satisfied with the pricing, but that kinda sacared me to. I was afraid something this inexpensive in downtown Waikiki, had to be a dump. Our travel agent advised that wasnt so and we would not be disappointed. Once we arrived we went immediately to hotel, after picking up rental car. The staff was very warm and kind. They accomodated every request we had, from a iron/ironing board, to small refridge in the hotel, at no additional costs. They do have a $10 /day amentinty fee, but that fee was included in our travel package.The staff gave us directions 4 blocks away for unlimited 24/7 access parking for $72 for 7 days, due to there lot being full. It worked out perfect and was actually cheaper than the Stay Hotel lot which was $20 a day for parking. They accomodated our request to be 5th floor or higher and put us on the 8th (top) floor. The rooms are somewhat small and the bathrooms are small, but very clean. Bed was comfortable and A/C in the room.Overall, this is probably the best deal for its location. We were extremely satisfied, with not one complaint and are planning our next trip this summer in Hawaii and the Stay Waikiki.   : )

This small hotel is a great for those people that have overlays and of course is also great for your regular stay. Very clean and comfortalbe beds. Rooms a bit small but it really doesntvmatter since you dont spend most of the time in the room. It is close to Waikiki Beach literally a block and a half away. Access to many restaurants and shops. As you check in you need to pay an additional $10.00 for internet access, continental breakfast, access to use the computers and printer in the lobby for boarding passes or what not, rent movies from the lobby box and a code for outside the hotel wi-fi access. All that for $10.00 ! The lobby is very chic and clean. Super comfy to watch tv while you eat your breakfast. Another important thing to mention is that you can use the boogie boards, laying matts for the beach and other gadgets that they have in the lobby for guests to use.

Location is great. 1 minute from Waikiki Beach, even though we didn't go there often because it was crowded and basically it's swimming for little kids. You can find better places for swimming around. It's budget friendly and they treated us pretty ok. We hadn't pay amenity fees after unfortunate insect incident in our room.Room was to spartan with no chairs (have to use ones from a balcony), floor should be cleaned regularly (I know it's beach location and you can therefore expect some sand) but it seemed that it wasn't cleaned for many days. On 2nd night we found a cockroach in our bed. Photos looks much better than reality but this is often a problem.

Great location if you prefer Waikiki; friendly and accommodating staff, comfortable environment, and across the street from the beach and withing walking distance of all dining and shopping.Staff is helpful and friendly...thank you!

Just spent two very enjoyable weeks at Stay Waikiki. Hotel location can't be beat - on a small street one block from the beach. Rooms are good-sized with small balcony and nice views on upper floors. Amenities are many - free dvd's in lobby (like Red Box), in-room dvd player, Ipod docking alarm clock, cable TV with excellent reception and very effective in-room wi-fi, with possibility to connect from almost anywhere in Waikiki. Acceptable continental breakfast each morning. Daily newspapers included. All this at very affordable prices.However, best thing about the hotel is the staff - they can't do enough to make you happy. Especially helpful is supervisor Jasmine and front desk Darren.Very much recommend this small hotel.

This is the worst hotel in the world. They decieve you. they charge a $20 a day "Amenity fee" for nothing!! They said its for "breakfast" but "breakfast" is bread only. Do not stay at this hotel.It will be your biggest mistake. also, the bathroom is the size of a shoebox and the Stay hotel is a renovated old apartment building. I hated my stay in this horrible place.When I got to the place they told me there is a $20 "amenity fee". I booked on Travelocity so I could not cancel. Thats all I wanted to do was cancel.It was a nightmare.Do not stay here you will regret it

I physically checked out this property, on a previous vacation, prior to booking it. I had too, had read the many reviews that spoke of the bad & good, regarding this property. All that to say, we really were not in for too many surprises.Other than, we purposely reserved a room that had the futon & a queen bed. I didn't realized there was more than one layout for this type of bedroom. Needless to say, though I called ahead & asked for a room above the 4th floor, one was not available for the first few nights of our (9 night) stay. By day 3, we were indeed, up higher, in a much better (roomier) layout.The good: GREAT value (at the time I booked (Jan 12) for our Aug 12 vacation, I got one of those big rooms for $109. Smoking deal)!!! The staff. Cleanliness. DVD's to "borrow". Location (just one block from beach, and RIGHT next to surfboard rental shop).The not so good: elevator was inoperable more than once (which normally wouldn't be a problem, but I was just getting over knee surgery). The pastries & "tang" were really not even worth bothering with. The windows are louvered glass - - makes it soooo darn easy for all kinds of noise to come in. No pool. No restaurant (these last 2 omissions didn't matter to us in the least).If I was able to get that price again, I would book again in a heartbeat. But I do know that prices have gone up. I may still book again, but not quite as readily as I would have a the lower rate.

I knew coming in it was going to be noisy staying there. It was the location and close proximity to the beach that I liked. I asked for a higher floor away from the street which they did provided but I still had a hard time sleeping.The front desk clerk was friendly when I checked in. The problem was the room. There was no luggage cot to put my luggage on. The walls and sheets are stained. Room was very small. Bathroom is tiny. It's not the Four Seasons but you get what you pay for.I think it's still pricey for what I paid for. But that's Hawaii. Hawaii is expensive period.No fridge or microwave. No coffee maker or kettle. Just TV, hairdryer, phone and alarm clock.If you want ice, you have to go to the lobby and ask the front desk clerk. One employee there looked annoyed when I asked for ice the one day.

This place is brilliant. Perfect location being less than 2 minutes from the notorious Waikiki beach. The room I was in was small and a bit dimly lit, but had a flat screen, iPod docking station and a play station 2 (with a free DVD/games rental system downstairs!). What more could you ask for!? The people on reception are lovely and friendly. The breakfast was ok and the Internet was good for the most part. They even have a bucket of beach things you can take stuff from to use for the day e.g. Snorkel, half boards, lilos etc. Overall great stay at a great price in a great location. Thank you.

This was my first international trip with my boyfriend and so we decided that the best option was to book an affordable accommodation and save the rest of our spending money for shopping and attractions. In saying that, we found this hotel conveniently located in Waikiki. To be honest, the photos were more appealing in comparison to the real room BUT I also have to say that regardless of the noise and very simplistic setup of our room, my boyfriend and I had a really wonderful stay here as mentioned in the title. The staff were super friendly, welcoming and warm, the room provided everything we needed and transportation was just around the corner. I also took advantage of the daily breakfast and I was happy with it. As mentioned by other guests, we were also lucky enough not to experience the sight of cockroaches roaming around. For a budget accommodation, it is definitely one to consider. HOWEVER, my boyfriend and I, although we appreciate the fancier hotels, we are not fussy about staying at less modern places such as this. It all depends on the type of traveller you are and I suggest that if you are looking for a more luxurious experience, that you stay elsewhere. Overall, it was great staying here and we thank you the staff at Stay for being so accommodating!PROS: Affordable, friendly and helpful staff, convenient location.CONS: Not as modern, breakfast was all pastry, amenity fees at check out.
user_name:
Mary Grace M
Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

review_body: We booked 2 tween beds room, 311. It is for travelers on budget, with 2 minutes from Waikiki beach, food store, restaurants, car rentals, but not the most comfortable. It was more noisier that we expected. We have earplugs always when traveling, but an orientation of this room towards the most busiest street, and back of Hayat AC and receiving made it harder to sleep. My only complaint was cockroaches..yes they have them. We killed 2 first night, and decided no food of any shape or form in the room, and that did the trick.We talked to a locals and the story is that they do have roaches problem on the island. All windows have these horizontal strips of glass, and since it was windy we opened those "strips" and had nice breeze, no need for AC which we do not like to use. We paid extra fee $10 per day to the hotel, for breakfast, internet...but really never used any, and didn't eat their breakfast. Hotel is next door to the International Hostel, that is the same way designed, so you can get the idea of the room sizes. I would say it is not kids friendly, since it is not as clean, especially the floors. So, if you are on the budget, and can ignore some of the inconveniences, this is a good place to stay. If you like the comfort of a big chain hotels, this is not a place for you. The service and all workers were really friendly.

We had booked this hotel serveral months in advance due to the late November time of travel. I guess the best way to handle this is by lows and highs. First lets talk about the hotel. The building its self is the typical low rise unit of the late50's early 60's build that flooded Waikiki at that time. Location is good as it is directly behind the Hyatt towers and central to the Waikiki strip. It looks like it has had had several updates, namely the lobby and the rooms. The elevator and car park leave lots to be dsired. If you expect to park at the hotel be preared to be told there is no stalls availible. When you do get one it will cost you 20/night. This is a little high for Waikiki but not overly bad either. Parking is tight so if your not a fabulous driver be ware. We paid 84/night for the room but remeber they have a "resort charge" that you also have to pay which is 10.00 per day. This resort charge is a farse. It includes there continental breakfast, coffee in the lobby tell 2pm, beach goodies, movie rentals and internet service. Forget you are getting a breakfast as it is not worth it, they goodies for the beach are left overs rom previous patrons that left there goodies behind. The wifi works sometimes but is netorious for booting you out. The movies rentals does work but subject to availibility. Room wise its a Ikea special not bad and I must say the materess was very comfortable. The tub in the bathroom had big black streaks in it and looked discusting but they didn't come off. Staff is fair unless you have a complaint then they get off standish. So just accept it for what it is and remember its going to not be as cheep as advertised. For us it worked this way 84/night for room 20/night for parking and 10/night for resort fee. It adds up. Would I stay again no, there is better for the 120/night that it worked out to with tax.

Its practical, well priced , well designed and has a cool unusual foreign sounding name, Ikea? Stay.  If you're not really concerned with high-end amenities, if you're not bothered by basic, casual accommodations and If you're not hung up on having the floor numbers in the solitary elevator be in the same font ,... then you're in luck. this place is steps from everything in Waikiki. People mere yards from you are paying three to four times what you are, literally. The furniture is pure Ikea. Even has the Ikea tags on. The rooms, while by no means luxurious, are functional and convenient. The staff is very cool. Local hospitality at its best. And they are well aware of the limitations of the place. Definitely stay on floors 5 through 8. Room numbers ending in 03 or 10 are the largest and have the best lanais. Secure one. Skip the "amenities" - the coffee is served in stryofoam cups and the pastries are from some frozen locker in some Costco somewhere. The Wi Fi crawls. Go out for breakfast. You're close to everything. In fact, go out to breakfast in that hotel 30 steps from the front door where guests are paying $400/ night. It goes a long way to make you feel akamai that you Stay waikiki.

We bought a groupon for one night at this hotel. For $75 we weren't expecting much but as we had a very late arrival it suited us. We didn't have high expectations as we arrived at midnight and we were going to check out and to the Hyatt in the morning. Parking: no parking. You need to go down the street and pay $25 to park your car in a public parking lot. Room: dirty and small. Very rough around the edges. I can tell they tried to modernize it by adding a few ikea items. Very dingy and the toilet wobbled when you sat on it. Sheets did not smell clean and the mattress was lumpy. Think the worst was seeing a cockroach, we were very careful to keep our luggage zipped up while we slept and made sure we shook out anything that wasn't zipped up.This hotel is inexpensive but when on holidays why would anybody want to sleep in a dilapidated slummish room? My suggestion, pay a little more and stay elsewhere.

Our room was supposed to sleep 4. There was one bed and the fold out couch was too small for anything other than one small child. Our other kid had to sleep on the floor. "Free" wireless, breakfast, etc is not free as you have to pay an extra "amenity fee" in addition to the price they quote you. Also the "free" Internet didn't work and the breakfast was terrible! Do not waste your money here.

We enjoyed our time at the Stay Waikiki Hotel and reserved a room for two nights. It was through a Groupon deal where we paid $145 for the two nights. Keep in mind though that the hotel has other fees such as local taxes, parking, and the notorious “convenience” fee. The $10 a day convenience fee supposedly covers things like wifi, breakfast, and DVD rentals. Parking was $20 per night and you get a remote which opens the gate to the garage. I guess this guarantees you a parking spot. I would recommend parking down the street at the King’s Village lot which costs about $10 per day. It’s just a couple buildings away from the hotel and is a very short walk. As for the rooms, they were small, but they were clean and modernly styled (think along the lines of an Ikea). I didn’t have a problem how small the rooms were, especially considering the price we paid and the distance we were to the beach. Let’s face it, if you spend all your time in a hotel room while you’re in Waikiki, you are there for the wrong reason. In the mornings they have a continental breakfast laid out with your typical pastries and coffee. If you are going to the beach, you can borrow lounge chairs, mats, or boogie boards from reception, but they are on a first come first serve basis. There’s also a kiosk where you can borrow DVD’s to watch in your room. The people at the front desk are very friendly and glad to give you directions along with suggestions. The greatest perk for staying here is the price and location. You are conveniently located near the beach, International Market, King’s Village Farmer’s Market, along with shopping and restaurants. Everything is within a short walking distance. Overall, for the price and location, I’d stay here again.

for the price i paid i should have gotten better but nope it was small and dark, only good thing about place was friendly checkin people. They also charge a $10 "amenity" fee! What a joke! The breakfast is a few bread is all, come on, does it really cost that much for eggs, cereal and milk? For the $10 fee they charge it should have been better! The rooms are really small even for Honolulu standard! Smallest rooms in 4 hotel jump around in Honolulu. The rooms need an update really bad. Internet worked really well in the rooms.

I value trip advisor and really rely on others who travel and take it the ratings into consideration so I had to make this review. First of all GREAT GREAT service, everyone was so friendly and nice. Secondly, it was clean, however it's just an average hotel. Great price for the location, it's in the heart of Waikiki and you can walk to everywhere, but if you're used to staying in a 4+ star, don't get your hopes up. The rooms are soooo small, no great place to but your luggage and although I said it was clean, it wasn't a floor that I wanted to keep my luggage.
