If you're looking for something affordable and economical, this is the place to go, but if you're looking for something a bit nicer you're going to have to pay more. Hope this review helps.

I booked this hotel based on price and location, both of which were excellent. However, there was a mistake in my reservation. We were supposed to have two beds and we only had one. Their solution was a roll in cot, not a new room with two beds. That was disappointing but not the end of the world. The room was mostly clean and VERY tiny. I have to admit the photos online are misleading. Road noise was a bit of an issue but was mostly solved by turning the A/C full blast. I was disappointed to see an extra $10 fee for my room to cover 'complimentary amenities'. It included DVD rentals, continental breakfast and wifi. We literally just needed a place to sleep so we only used the wifi, which in the end was not complimentary, it was $10. The staff was friendly but not very accommodating. I really wish my reservation was sorted out properly. I would still recommend this place if you aren't going to spend much time in your room and want to be in a decent spot in Waikiki.

Hotel has lost our reservation when we came in. By the time they found it. We wanted a redund cuz of the atmosphere the place had. It's dirty smells like smoke. Sand everywhere. Very noisy just over all a horrible location besides the part where it's a block away from the beach. But other than that nothing. The pictures are so miss leading. Does not look anything like that in real life. If your planing on staying at stay Waikiki. I recommend you pay they extra 100 200 bucks and stay somewhere nice like the Marriott where we ended up staying at. Not worth your money

We booked this hotel through Groupon for 2 nights during our 5 in Waikiki. First glace, the building was small (we expected that based on reviews) and the lobby had modern chairs, computers and a TV. There were several people hanging out down there. Oddly enough, we kept seeing the public computer logged onto TripAdvisor rating the hotel with 5 stars. The front desk staff was friendly. We got into our room and we were shocked by how small it was. Being that we were on a 2 week honeymoon, there was not enough room for our luggage and us.The window was slated and frosted so not being able to see outside made the room feel very claustrophobic. We asked to be moved to a different room. They understood and moved us to a room with a sliding glass door and small balcony, same size but felt more open. That night after walking around the room, we found the floor to be very dirty, if we didn't wear flip flops to walk the few steps to the bathroom, our feet were too dirty to get in bed. We also found a small cockroach. We checked out the next day. Pros:Cheap, TV, PS2, free DVDs, friendly staff, good location, good ACCons:Small, tiny bathrooms, dirty (floors at least)

If you want a budget hotel to stay, STAY here. You don't spend your time on a vacation in your room....it's just a place to sleep. Staff are awesome. The amenities had a fee, but paying for the fee included free wifi, dvd rental, continental break. You would pay for those fees separate at other places and it would cost more than the $10 daily fee they charge. We will definitely STAY here again!!! CHEAP/CONVINIENT LOCATION/AWESOME STAFF

I was surprised at the low price of the hotel when I booked it, but it was not a brand name and the picures looked a little to retro for my taste, but knowing the proximity to the beach, I was okay with it. It was one of those grow on me experiences. When we arrived, we were surprised with a $10 fee per day, but I soon found out that it was well worth it. Once we bought a simple meal at a dive resteraunt nearby and paid $30.00, we appreciated the continental breakfast. They had many choices of pastries and were quick to replentish. The lobby area was relaxing to eat in. We also liked the ability to connect to WiFi while we were there. The most surprising thing though (and the thing that really made $10 a day worth it) was the courtesy of the staff and the ability to just grab whatever beach item we wanted from a box in the lobby. We could get snorkle gear, boogie boards, beach towels, beach chairs and bamboo mats. Just grab and go one block to the beach when your done just return them to the box.I will return and will tell everyone I know who is looking for value in Waikiki about the STAY HOTEL!Ohh - one other thing. We thought we did not have a referigator in our room, but a staff member named Sam was taking one out of someones room near us and he offered it to us - no extra charge. Again - great value!!!I have stayed at four other hotels in the area. The Stay has earned a repeat customer from me.
user_name:
Steve B
Pomona, California, United States

review_body: Our stay at this hotel was horrible! Our room looked nothing like the pictures. There was hair every where, and the sheets were dirty. The bathroom was not clean, and we couldn't even walk barefoot on the floor. Upon our first night, we had no pillows in our room. We had to ask for them at the front desk, then wait an hour to receive them. We were told we would be comped one night for the amenity fee because of the inconvenience, but that didn't happen. We had to pay for all. We complained every day to the staff about our room, and everything else that became wrong, and no one would do anything. They would just shrug and say "Sorry" and go back to whatever they were doing. We talked to multiple staff at the front desk and kept getting the same response every time. We had to sleep on old dirty sheets the entire stay! We were very disappointed to find that the restaurant/nightclub was not open like we were originally told. Upon arriving there, we find it's still under construction. That was the main reason for booking this hotel! After inquiring about this, we find the main website for this hotel has changed it's date when it had specifically stated early 2012 before. Now it says 2013. We were unable to access any of the amenities that we were having to pay for. We couldn't access the Wi-Fi, we were unable to eat their "food" since it's against our dietary needs, and there was not any beverages. The "movie box" didn't have a single movie in it the entire time we we there! Not right to pay an extra fee when we are unable to access them. The only thing we got out of that was the use of their towels to take to the beach, which were also dirty. This was a terrible stay, and we will NOT be going back. Most of the staff was unhelpful, and one even steered us in the wrong direction as to where to catch the bus. We had to wait 45 minutes at the wrong bus stop! We felt very deceived, and we were unable to get our money back to leave the hotel and stay somewhere else.

We came to Hawaii on a budget Honeymoon! We love this location and the staff! They took care of us. They were very clear on all the amenities available. And when the city sirens went off during the Tsunami warning they were in total control and directed us where we would be safest! It's not fancy and does not have a pool. But really if you are coming to Hawaii WHY do you need a pool? You are on the BEACH! If we had the choice to stay at one of the other more costly hotels we would still choose to stay her with Stay Waikiki!

Although it might not have the glamour of many hotels in Waikiki, Stay hotel had exactly what we wanted it for the right price. We had a ocean view from our balcony and a good size room for two (#806). The bed was comfortable and was better than many I have slept on. Housekeepers to a great job changing sheets and keeping the room clean. I'd say the best thing about the hotel was the location, we could walk to everything to wanted and the beach was only a block away. Down side would be that the restaurant on the bottom floor isn't finished and their breakfast consists of bread, jam and juice. Overall we would stay here again.

travelercare@How we came upon this hotel….We did a search online for hotels for October 6th, and 7thThe search brought up the Hyatt Regency having rooms available for $119, knowing the Hyatt had clean rooms and a good reputation, as we have stayed at the Hyatt before and liked the service we received and knew they had nice clean rooms.We clicked on the Hyatt Regency, it sent us to Orbitz, and we made our reservation. On the receipt, Orbitz gave us a receipt for this hotel below… Having almost the same identical address, as the Hyatt back entrance. We did not realize the word Stay was the name of a hotel.We just thought it was a fluke and that maybe the Hyatt had more than entrance and more than one address. This picture they have posted onlineTotally Misrepresented: (see our actual room pictures below)1. The pictures posted on the net were not taken from anything we saw. Actual room was tiny, dark, dirty, unsafe, and probably infested. Room # 404 that we were given was not anything like the pictures on line.2. Hotel staff told us they did not feel comfortable putting us in the room above that we saw online and instead gave us a double bed that they said was a better bigger room.3. Hotel staff would not let us enter or see our room or any room until after 4:00 pm. We asked if they could hold our luggage until the room was ready so we did not have to cart it around the island. Waiting for the room to become available, we decided to go sightseeing, the local beach, stores and the area around Waikiki, just to kill time.4. Hotel staff allowed us to leave our luggage in a cluttered dirty back room on the 1st floor. They did not give us a receipt for our storage luggage and did not have a separate secure place for it.5. Giving the hotel staff an extra hour, we waited until 5 pm to return to the hotel. However, after seeing our room, we were appalled; we immediately went to the desk and tried to cancel our reservation. The hotel staff would not let us cancel our room reservation, stating the reservation was thru Orbitz and we had to cancel thru Orbitz! Hotel staff stated there was a 24-hour minimum cancellation in effect. If we were to leave, they would charge us for a full night whether we stayed or not! We had no other place to go.6. The elevator doors were very mean to everyone and kept closing on guests. Even after the door hit you, it kept hitting you! 7. Upon entering, the back room on the 1st floor to get our luggage there was a huge cockroach lying dead next to our suitcases. We informed the hotel staff that the cockroach was there, hotel staff pretended not to hear our comment about the bugs lying dead on the floor! 8. Our room door to the outside had no threshold under the door and the door had a gap of an inch or more from the door to the concrete floor and anything could crawl in or out during the night.9. The hot water faucet in the tub worked backwards and was dangerous – turns counterclockwise to turn down or off, cold is opposite clockwise for off (the way it should be).10. The bed was a single mattress lying on thin sheets of sagging chipboard. The mattress was held in place on 3 sides with additional molding attached to the chipboard, the front of the mattress was held in place with drywall screws that were sticking out of the chipboard approximately 1 inch.11. The light switch when we finally found it was on the floor, in a cord behind the dresser cabinet.12. Windows are the older tiny louvered, drafty, type. We were unable to see out. Even if the windows had been clean, they were too high up in the room, and over the bed, so no windows to look out of at all, and very little light in, sort of like a dungeon. 13. The carpet - more like an area throw rug was filthy.14. Behind the bed and the TV dresser was filthy and dirty, (had not, been vacuumed in quite some time).15. The elevator doors were very mean to everyone and kept closing on guests. Even after the door hit you, it kept hitting you! Trying to get out was a repeat fight with the elevator doors.16. The dog next to the room kept barking constantly we are talking approximately 10 feet away just on the other side of the concrete balcony and walkway.17. The room was so bad we did not feel comfortable or safe disrobing, opening any of our luggage for fear bugs would get into our luggage or even our bed. We left all the lights on when attempting to sleep to keep the critters away. Sleeping on the beach probably would have been cleaner, quieter and or healthier.18. My wife put the supposedly clean towels on the floor from the bathroom to the bed for us to walk on so our clean feet would not get dirty going to the bathroom.19. The towels/rags had black hair stuck in them from the last guests who had long, black, course hair.20. The throw pillow that was on the bed also had stains on it from some previous guest.21. The outside sheet was not clean.22. Behind the bed and dresser was more hair, dust and dirt that was obviously from the staff or previous customers that had worked or played in room 404.23. Trying to get out was a repeat fight with the elevator doors, repeatedly hitting our luggage and us.24. We did not get our Complimentary Breakfast – after seeing the big cockroach, and the other filth, we did not deem it safe to eat the food. Nor was the breakfast ready when we hurriedly exited the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. 25. Hotel staff would not give us a check out receipt, stating that we had to get if from Orbitz, so we still do not know what we were charged, for that night in hell.The night hotel staff stated, they would only charge us for one night – although we could not get them to give us any documentation to that effect. Refund or not we could not subject ourselves to another night in that hotel with these conditions.We went down the street to the “Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel” (right on the beach) where we received superior service. We got an excellent, large, clean, quiet room, two queen beds, continental breakfast, beach picnic with free complimentary picnic cooler, proper plumbing, free entertainment, pool, iron, ironing board, hair dryer, numerous complimentary soaps and lotions, free beach chairs to take to the beach from the hotel which was just out the front door, all with no night critters. We had excellent beach view, much better location actually on the beach street. The best investment and the best $24 we have ever spent. I was sick the next day, but my wife and I did make it out of that room alive. We may or may not get our money back, but we are doing everything possible to reduce the number of unsuspecting suckers like us.LDW – Seattle, extremely disappointed

The location of the Stay Waikiki is a convenient location and the bed is comfortable. Housekeeping could have done a better job with cleaning. Breakfast is mediocre, Doors are flimsy and anyone could have kicked the door in. Front desk is friendly. There were no hooks or towelbar in the bathroom. On my last day, I had an evening flight and had left my bag to be stored for the last day, while I was sightseeing. I returned and wanted to use the restroom before I went to the airport. Front desk directed me to the restroom. Restroom, was occupied. After waiting a few minutes I knocked on bathroom door again and a woman(not a hotel guest), opened the door and explained she had been changing her clothes . That bathroom is accessable through the garage of the hotel, which is not secured. I read the reviews on Trip Advisor and cannot believe the positive reviews and question if those review writers even stayed at this hotel. Also on the last day, front desk, gave me a "courtesy call" 15 minutes before checkout about checkout time. 10 minutes before checkout time housekeeping knocked on my door and to see if I had left, so they start cleaning my room. Find another hotel in Waikiki. The $10 "resort fee" was a rip off.
user_name:
Carol B
New York City, New York

review_body: I really enjoy the hotel & the friendly employees. I just think that if they can put a chair and a bigger mirror in the room, I will even lover this hotel.The room keeper didn't put the towel and shampoo in our room, but she was working hard.Nice and clean place, and really sooo close to the beach. I like it!
user_name:
Ting C
Richmond, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: Room was a bargain,could hear delivery trucks but I am deaf anyway so it did not bother me much. The staff more than make up for it they were excellent always ready to help, My 12 yr old grandson really liked it computer room and wireless is great.Grat location for waikiki in middle of everything and a block from beach.rooms are clean no cucarachas.

Great location. The lobby was appealing but the room that we stayed in was terrible. The carpet was filthy and there was pubic hair on the shelf where our towels were and on the toilet. I couldn't walk around without my shoes on. I was disgusted. The bed was not very comfortable and outside our room was extremely loud at night. I will never visit this place again

The best thing about Stay was the staff. Always friendly and helpfull, oh yeah and the free wirless internet was good too.The rest not so.Rooms:It's a good thing we left our cat at home because there was no way would have been able to swing it. Once the bed was in there was less than 20cm each side before you hit the wall, so we had to climb in from the foot of the bed.The A/C was good and it was needed as the building is an old 1950's/60's Besser Block structure that really holds the heat. The unit was located at floor level at the head end on one side of the bed. Fine for cooling when you weren't sleeping, but one person ends up with a very cold head at night! The bed however was quite comfy, and the room was clean.The bathroom was small but functional, the only issues were the towel rail hanging over the toilet (you would't want to hang it in a hurry and miss), and Kramer and Jerry would be as satisfied with the low-flow shower as we were.Ammenties:When we checked in we found out we were being charged an extra $10 per day ammenity fee. The only ammenity that I could find was the free wireless internet, but having said that if you had to pay for wireless $10 a day is a pretty goog deal.Breakfast:Nothing to get excited about. Toast, croissant, muffins and coffee we gave it a miss.Overall:For our short 2 night stop over Stay was perfectly adequate, but if your in Honolulu for an extended period look elsewhere for more creature comforts.

The staff were awesome and very friendly. I asked, they provided. The breakfast could have been better by simply adding yogurt or fresh fruit, but otherwise it was fine. Our room was just enough for two, but we brought our 6 year old along and luckily the bed was large enough for us all. Lastly, the place is one block from a very good location at the beach and thats a plus for sure.
user_name:
Paul G
Henderson, Nevada, United States

review_body: One of the benefits of this hotel is its location. It is located right beside the Waikiki Beach where you can go surfing and swimming just a block away!The other benefit is the free breakfast which although is a bit dull but at least can get you well prepared for a whole day of activities in Oahu.The major down side is the noise which I guess depending on your room you'll hear the various noise coming off from the back of Hyatt Regency. My suggestion to overcome that is bring a few pairs of ear plugs so that you can have a sound sleep at night.Make sure you also bring your own toiletries because the ones they provided is only good for washing cloth and hands.

All I can say is that we had a very happy experience in this hotel. We originally only booked into here for two nights, but loved it so much that we cancelled all our other accommodation and Earl, the general manager was kind enough to give us a great rate for the remainder of our stay. A shout out to Rob T, and the girls behind the desk too, as they could have not been more friendly and helpful. If you are looking for a well priced place to stay, this is definitely the place to come...good rooms,very clean,and a great location! I loved Oahu, and if I come back I will most certainly book to stay here again.

The Stay Waikiki has all the benefits of a resort close to the beach, but none of the fluff, or extra costs. Friendly staff, good minimalistic desgin in the rooms. perfect for us as we take care of ourselves and didnt need a pool/concierge etc.

If you'd rather not stay at a hostel because you're no longer in your 20's, don't really want to party all night, but don't quite have enough to splurge on one of those $400 plus/night Waikiki beach hotels, Stay Waikiki is probably your best bet, especially if you're planning to surf Waikiki. The staff (shout out to Liane!) are pleasant and make every effort to ensure you're comfortable, but are never right in your face. The hotel itself, though an older property, is really cute (mostly white, modernist decor) and clean, next to the best surf shop in town (Koa Board Sports) and only a block from the main surf break at Canoes (just around the corner from the Hyatt)!My only gripe is the room (I had the cheapest room, with a bunk bed) was maybe a bit TOO spartan. Very very clean, but could have been improved with a chair and maybe a bigger side table. Also, there was no real place to put your suitcase to unpack so i had to do it from the floor. HOWEVER, at just about $101/night (including all taxes) I can, and did, live with it. Other than the savings, the location of the hotel really can't be beat - true, you're not right on the beach, but it's just a block away, shopping and great food (Me's BBQ, Hula Dog, Furusato Sushi Bar and the Loco Moco at Hula Grill were standouts for me), convenience stores, bus stop, etc. all within close walking distance. Me's BBQ became my absolute favorite place to eat in Waikiki (see my separate review forthcoming) - located right next to the "other pink hotel", the Royal Grove (another great budget option - was actually going to stay there but it was booked). Me's is a casual eatery with amazing island-style korean food and tasty, cheapo breakfasts. Their bibimbap and mac salad were the best I've ever had.The hotel served a continental breakfast (including these yummy sausage rolls) with coffee and Tang (yes, that's right TANG - I grew up on that, so I didn't mind;)).Definitely book at Stay if you're planning a more active vacation (surfing/hiking, etc.) where you're not spending a lot of time in your room. why would you do that anyway?? you're in HAWAII, for crying out loud....

So close waikiki beach. perfect location.Parking lot are limited, first come first serve $15 per day.Nearest parking lot (1block away) $20 per day, another one (3 blocks away) $12 per daySurfing equipmemt rental lacate half block away.Value more than you pay. Resonable price 5 stars hotel location.

Nice experience we had with Stay Waikiki. The air conditioner was the only prob, it was so close to the top of our bed, made lots of noise. we couldn't find the right temp for us cause at one point it would be really cold and others it was so hot without turning it on after getting frozen. No microwave, breakfast was just some sorts of muffins, breads, juice and coffee.They let you borrow the beach accessories which was really cool ( save you fews bucks from the stores around.) Beach was only 1 block away.Generally, it was a good-budget and nice hotel to spend about 1 week of vacation. We will come back and recommend it for everyone and hope it still maintain the same standard that we've been through.

Great experience here at Stay Waikiki, No Fridge, doesn't matter you go to a hotel to sleep anyway. Also be ready for some noise coming from buses picking up people and dropping them off all night... I would definitely recommend this hotel for the price compared the the high prices all around here.

We came to Oahu on a whim. We booked through Expedia with a flight & hotel package and was very pleased with our whole experience. We stayed at Stay Waikiki in a bunk bed room for 5 nights and have nothing but good comments. Now they weren't lying when they called it a boutique hotel, for it is very small, in fact our room was similar to a large walk-in closet but it was decorated nicely and had a small balcony that overlooked the city and a small part of the beach.Pros:- The price!- The comfortable lobby, including the best swinging chairs I have ever sat on!- The free amenities, including: inflatable floatation tubes, boogie boards, free DVD & PS2 games rental (PS2 comes with every room & flatscreen), wifi, pastries & coffee in the morning, etc.- The GREAT location. I'm talking a block away from everything! Waikiki Beach, the main restaurants, rental services, and since you are right behind the Hyatt all shuttles to Luaus, tours , etc pick you up basically from the Stay lobby!- The extremely helpful staff! Cons:- The room was tiny, but the decor made up for it and I mean, you're in Hawaii, why are you staying indoors?!- The large Hyatt blocking your beachfront view.*Some people complain about the noise, but it was not that bad. And the windows can be fully shut, but once again, it's Hawaii, let the ocean breeze flow in!!! Even at night.Seriously, so happy we STAYed here!

Hi all. As the title says, it is what it is. It seemed to be an apartment block turned into a low price hotel / motel, think of it like business class for a backpacker. Dont expect luxury, its not what your paying for. The rooms are big enough (queen bed on 7th floor) although the bathroom is small but even at 6'6" it wasnt a big deal for me. If you want ocean views from your room dont bother, just walk 100m to the beach. PROS: The location is excellent and only a street back from Waikiki Beach, not even 100m away. Theres air con, a balcony, a bed, a tv, a playstation, wifi, a shower and a toilet. Staff were pleasant and helpful. The lobby is welcoming. The self service laundromat downstairs was very handy and something the bigger hotels could benefit from. CONS: Street noise that other reviews mention was noticeable, but i felt it was drowned out by the air con. Without refitting the entire hotel with new windows the noise will always be a problem for some. The curtains could be better and are about 60-70% efficient, but on the flip side Hawaii is a beautiful place so worthwhile getting up early anyway to take a stroll. No fridge in the room for cold drinks and snacks. TV placement would be a problem for some but a room for me on holiday is a place to sleep. Room wasnt ready for check in until 4pm, but we were able to sleep in the lobby on the comfy couches anyway and guzzle a couple beers purchased from the local ABC store, not so bad. OVERALL: Great value for money. Would happily stay again, you get what you pay for. If you want 4-5 star and all the fancy hotel jazz then load your credit card up and stay elsewhere.

We stayed because of the good price for the area, good reviews and the ok pictures. The stay was average.Not great because:- the noise starting at ca 5 a.m from the deliveries to the surrounding hotels, the windows are zero noise isolating so do take a good pair or air plugs unless you want to go up at five. (this is not a subject to floor, we stayed on floor 2 and 4 and both were equally noisy)-blackout drapes/curtains - there were curtains but far from black out... -the cleaning was so so. had to wipe the glass panel at the bead since some fat residue from the heads of the previous inhabitans still was there.. -beds not comfy at all-breakfast is symbolic.. we bought our own (but then again we are a bit picky eaters, so check with the other reviewers)-a bit unsafe feelind due to the very open nature of the entry lobby..Not poor because:-location-price-friendly staff-no other hygienic incidents other than mentioned aboveReading the positive reviews from the others it seems that the room standard might vary somewhat. If the only alternative option is staying at one of the nerby hotels for double or tripe the price then this hotel is ok since all what you really want to experience in the waikiki area is very near.

My husband and I spent a week here last month (July) and we were pleased with the hotel. It was supper close to the beach clean, and we received maid service daily. The elevators were down for a few hours and we had to take the stairs but it wasnt bad. Next years vacation will be at the Stay Hotel.

I had a very pleasant 2 night stay here and will definitely come back again! I was a single traveller and ended up with a room with bunkbeds - which were fine and surprisingly comfy! The property was clean and fairly modern. The other guests were all very similar to me - young, adventurous, and personable. There were a few families there as well. Especially considering the price I paid (in reward points), this place was an awesome fine.ps- Air condition worked and it was close to everything

This is a good hotel for people that don't care about amenities. The location is perfect as far as being close to things (beach/Diamond head/shops/restaurants) but BEWARE - Koa is a busy street. Tour buses & other traffic come through there early & late, which makes it very loud. Room was cute but small & you can tell the building is old. The bathroom only had one small shelf (two girls w/makeup etc did not work!) & the only mirror was in the bathroom (so 2 people could not get ready at the same time). Continental breakfast was not good - only had little pastries & toast. Housekeeping was average (didn't empty garbage once or give us the correct amount of towels). Staff was nice and helpful. Free internet. Biggest complaint is the "resort fee" they charge. THIS IS NOT A RESORT. No pool, gym, bar, or free parking...what am I paying extra for???

Had a great stay at Stay Waikiki. Staff was extremely nice! Some other customers on the lower floors complained of the noise (Waikiki is inherently noisy). We we're perfectly fine in the back of the 2nd floor with the AC on all night anyway. Great location steps from the beach. Fair continental breakfast. Excellent value for the money!

Rooms are modern, clean and just the right size. Bed is very comfortable. Restrooms are clean. There were no stains so that's really good. Shower heads' design was like pouring rain. Staff were excellent. They were always greeting us and smiling. They were very helpful and accommodating as well. Free internet access, printer, DVDs, beach mats, umbrellas, chairs and floaters. You can request for a mini-fridge. Very comfortable couches in the lobby. Continental breakfast was good. They have breads w/ sausages inside and some breads have ham & cheese. Sometimes, they also have mini bread w/ spam & egg which was my favorite. Oh! You can bring breakfast up to your room. Plus, all other danish & coffee. We have balcony w/ partial ocean view (Room 608). We're heavy sleeper so we didn't have problem w/ outside noise. The only cons we have was when we requested for our rooms to be cleaned the floor wasn't swept one time, there was a little problem w/ the DVD player and the elevator door closes really fast. That's it!Other than that we would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

What this hotel lacks in amenities it makes up for in their staff. The rooms are pretty basic but clean. Location is an easy walk to the zoo and Waikiki beaches. Chris at the front desk was amazing. He provided maps, useful tips and very good recommendations on places to go and restaurants. The atmosphere was friendly and fun. I will stay at this hotel again.

I was making a quick visit to Honolulu and didn't want to spend a lot on a place to stay in the Waikiki area. The Stay Hotel was reasonably priced, the rooms were very clean, and the staff was incredibly nice and helpful. If you need to park a car at the hotel make sure you arrange for that ahead of time because space is limited. Also, it is on a noisy street with a lot of delivery trucks, tourist buses, etc. But, the rooms have A/C which you can turn on at night to drown out the street noise. Beds are comfortable and the area felt safe. The hotel is in a great area for shopping, eating, and close to the beach. I am giving the hotel a "Very Good" because of the price, cleanliness, staff, and location. You can always pay more for more frills in that same area.

The Stay is perfectly located near the beach. It is clean and the staff is very helpful. Includes a continental breakfast and is also located near several other breakfast options. Beach towels and chairs are available.

The staff is hands down the most down to earth & pleasant people that I have ever dealt with in a hotel!, (this includes $500+ a night New York hotel room where you would expect awesome service for the amount of moolah!!) the price was pretty darn decent especially for its great location! the continental breakfast was good for being free! the room had a ps2 in it and you could rent movies and games thru thier version of redbox all complementary! and the movies were up to date, there was free wifi that was provided, the hotel looks like it was a apartment building turned into a hotel, the only downside was that the floor was a bit sandy when we got arrived but hey there is a beach a hop skip and jump away so it wasnt uncommon, and the parking was tough! but we managed! and the AC unit was really low to the floor so the dresser enjoyed the cool air. But all in all I would definately stay here again if the price was right!

We have all done it, passing through a city so we think, I'll just get a low cost room for the one night, it should be OK, Well, the Stay Hotel is OK, but you get what you pay for so be careful! The best thing was the excellant help provided by a young woman working at the front desk (sorry I do not have her name) but she went to extra efforts to help us, even printing a map for us to help us find where we were having dinner. She was a big help, friendly and made the difference! The hotel itself is very simple and plain. Somewhat intimidating if you don't like looking at surfers in the next door buildings. But reeally no problems with them. So don't expect alot, except good service and a clean room and you'll be heppy. Warning, the downtown area around the hotel is a traffic mess! Road construction, streets closed, I'll never stay in that area agian. But again must give the front desk woman and night time desk workers pats on the back and say "Great Job" !Finding something to eat no problem.

Recently my daughter and I stayed here. It was perfect for us. We could walk right to the beach and was close to everything we wanted to do. Jasmine and Chris were so incredibly helpful. They helped us make the arrangements for our excursions and answered all of our questions. They were absolutely wonderful and they treated us like family!!! Our room was simple and met exactly what we needed. The breakfast was well stocked and the staff there was friendly also. If your looking for a clean, inexpensive place, right around the corner from the beach (close enough to walk barefoot) this is the place to stay. The staff alone will make you want to come back again and again.

Stay Hotel is situated at a prime location off the Waikiki Strip. Main bus routes run through Kuhio Ave right behind the hotel while the beach is steps away from the front door. Front desk staff is extremely helpful. My flight was delayed and I was set back one day to arrive in Honolulu during my trip. I notified the hotel before my arrival of the delay and the hotel staff modified my booking right way for one less night of stay and also reminded me to contact Expedia to refund the pre-paid room charges. However, I must say there is room for improvement in terms of their house keeping services. The cleanliness of the bathroom is truly substandard, and towels are stained (coffee stain is very obvious, I can understand if it's just a tiny spot and you don't bother taking this one out of the rotation). The hotel staff waived room surcharges and late checkout fee after I expressed my dissatisfaction. For the price I am paying, next time I would trade location for cleanliness. Hopefully the house keeping improves because the service and location are exceptional.

Stay Waikiki is located in a perfect spot and close to everything - beach, hotels, shops. The staff are very helpful and the service includes internet and breakfast - unlike most top end hotels. The room was clean and fresh - dvd's available too. Just a bit noisy. I would stay here again for sure.

So close to the best part of Waikiki Beach (Diamond Head side) with every conceivable amenity right outside your door. Watch amazing boogie boarding near the pier. Stay Hotel Waikiki is clean and modern for a reasonable price. Intimate, laid back with no fuss and everything you need. We found all of the staff to be friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast, daily newspaper, flat screen tv, internet access and WiFi were all nice amenities, but there is a daily amenity fee associated with these. Parking available. Just stayed with my 18 year old son who will be attending UH Manoa in the Fall, so this was an excellent location for us to quickly zip up to campus for appointments. Much more traffic congestion and heavier foot traffic going toward the Ala Moana side of Waikiki which makes Stay Waikiki's location very convenient if you have a car.

Prime location, extremely friendly and helpful staff(Chris was especially good with advice), clean. Just what we needed for a few nights. construction going on in the alley made for noise early, but that should be done soon.

Stay hotel is a perfect location on Waikiki. It is only 1/2 a block from the beach. The hotel rate is very reasonable compare to other hotels in Waikiki. The housekeeper cleans the room daily and replaces your towel and bathroom needs. The hotel staff at the reception desk are friendly, helpful and they are willing to answer your questions. This is a newly renovated hotel so the rooms are clean and the furnitures are new. They even have a flat screen tv, playstation and an ipod dock . The hotel has washer and dryer which is so convenient. They provide beach towels, and beach accessories for the hotel guests to use for free. Overall, the hotel is a great value for your money on an excellent location in Waikiki.

This hotel was perfect for what I needed. I was in town for only a couple of days. I picked this hotel based on the reviews stating that the staff was great. My experience with the staff was the best I have ever experienced. They were friendly and truly interested in me as a person. I had an unusual circumstance with my flight departure and the staff was helpful in figuring out a plan that would make my stay as easy as possible. The room was comfortable and I enjoyed the brightness of it. I will be returning to the hotel the next time I am in town and would recommend this hotel to my friends as well.

I love this hotel:+the service is excellent +rooms are tidy +staff is super friendly. +overall state of the hotel is quite nice+i was able to change the reservation so that i left a couple of days early with just one day notice and they didn't charge me any extra.-breakfast served in the lobby from paper plates and cups and It was basically just toast and some pastries. -quite noisy: the walls are thin and the windows basically let all the noise thru. You don't here much noise from the other rooms, but if you have a room with the window on the corridor side you'll hear the people going pass so well.Only thing that bothered me was the noise, but i'm a heavy sleeper so it didn't bother me that much.

The bad...*Since we had a rental car we had to purchase a space within the tiny garage for a $15 per night fee, as there was no other parking option. Luckily we got the last spot. That fee was on top of the **Our room had a balcony overlooking the apartment building directly next door. We had a running joke that there wasn't just 1 morning each week the garbage was picked up, it was every morning, as even though we were on the 5th floor, we could still hear everything from the street through the jalousie windows!***The elevator needs to be replaced. It broke down twice while we were there. It's not cool when you have to climb the stairs twice in 1 morning & then attempt to surf. Admittedly the staff acknowledges this problem, but seems resigned that nothing will change any time soon.****A duplicated $10 a night amenity fee that, even though it was included with our original pre-paid purchase price, was still tacked on at the end of our stay. Essentially making it $20 per day.The good...*This hotel is basic, clean, reasonably priced option about 2 blocks from the ocean. We stayed here for part of our stay on Oahu and choose this hotel as we knew we would not be spending much time in our room & more time exploring the island.**Free beach accessories to "steal" for a day: mats, inflatables and boogie boards.***Newer Ikea furnishings within cosmetically freshened rooms. iHome docs for alarm clocks.
user_name:
Babsiepoodles
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We booked the “Deluxe Queen with Sofa bed” for 4 nights. We arrived 5 mins after the check-in time to make sure that we were there early in case we had a “chance” to request for a room with lanai. Unfortunately, we didn’t have that “chance”. I was greeted by “Char”. After I told her my last name, she told me that my room had a problem about electricity (didn’t call us beforehand at all?!?). She relocated us to Aston Waikiki Beachside Hotel and booked “Partial Ocean View” room (with “breakfast”) for us. We were so tired from the flight and my husband was standing by in our rental car since the hotel parking was full, so I said “okay”. We found out when we arrived in the new hotel that we had a “Moderate Hotel Room” with balcony but no ocean-view at all, and there is no breakfast!!!!!! I called “Char ”and she said that the “Moderate Hotel Room” that she booked for us was “Bigger” than the “Deluxe Queen with Sofabed” room at Say Hotel Waikiki!?!?!?!?! She also said all the rooms at Stay Hotel didn’t have ocean-view neither. No mention anything about breakfast!!! I was so upset about this unprofessional big liar. But again, we were so tired and not in the situation that we were ready to fight for our right. We hate the fact that Stay Hotel didn’t try to contact us before we arrived. The hotel staff intentionally gave me the incorrect information and just wanted us to go away! So “STAY-AWAY” from STAY (AWAY) Hotel Waikiki, if you don’t want to have a bad experience like us!
The hotel is close to the beach and the room has funky decor. Definately will come back.

Went for a quick budget getaway to Hawaii with a friend and found this gem of a hotel. It is a newly renovated building, not fancy, but done nicely. Everything is new and modern, great decor. You can tell the building is old here and there, but this is what is to be expected with budget and the area.The location is absolutely perfect. Short walk to everywhere in the area and close to bus stops for getting to further areas. A little over a block to Waikiki Beach, right across from the Hyatt.The staff was amazing and always helpful! They were so personable and always willing to help! Even the cleaning staff was sure to always smile and help in any way.The lobby of the hotel is a nice area to relax between outings or in the morning. This is where breakfast is served (assortment of pastries, breads, juices). Plenty of plush, new sofas, canopy chairs and TV. They also have a business area for guest use, a collection of beach accessories (chairs, mats, floaties) and free DVD/video game rentals! All of this and wi-fi is included in the $10/day additional fee.The room was great, everything we needed. Very clean, awesome new decor and a balcony with table and chairs. There was a flat-screen TV and iPod docking station. We had bunk beds and they were very comfortable. The bathroom was quite small, and there wasn't much light in the shower. However, it was clean and served its purpose. We never had the noise issues others have described, but we were on a high floor. Keep in mind, this is a budget-oriented place. There is no restaurant (although they are in the process of adding one) and no pool. You are not going to get luxury, but you are also paying an amazing price for being right in Waikiki. I would definitely come back.

Stayed for four nights here. The location is fantastic, literally one block back from Waikiki Beach. The room was decent and clean, however, with a nearby Motor Enthusiasts club and the Tour Bus pickup point for the Hyatt Regency over the road, it is indeed noisy! The noise was just manageable for me, but do bring earplugs. The staff were friendly and helpful. Finally, the internet access and morning breakfast comes with the $10/night ‘hotel fee’ – the internet access was good, the breakfast was limited in range. Overall, it's this hotel location that is the biggest draw card.

I am a flight attendant who just got based in Honolulu and couldn't find a place that was reasonable priced, clean, and with a friendly staff until I came to Stay Waikiki. I original only planned to stay here for a couple of nights however, after I got here I immediately extended my stay until the end of the month. The rooms are super clean, the beds are comfortable, it's close to the beach and easy to get to the bus station. I loved the staff. They are so kind and helpful. And the manager was so accommodating. By far the best place to stay in Waikiki.

Okay, is this place great? Not, not really. But for our purposes of having a place to crash after a day of hiking and exploring Oahu, this place was perfect. Similar to what some people have said, the rooms can be a bit small but we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a larger room for our two nights there. Score! I will also verify some of the other comments people have said: it is indeed next to a budget hostel which could be noisy. We were there just after Spring Break so the place was empty and not really an issue for us. The early morning garbage trucks are real and will show up 6 am or so like clockwork. The windows are glass slat types that will keep water out but not much noise. Depending on your expectations of a hotel, these things may bother you but for the two of us, they were non issues. We both slept with earplugs, making all of these things a non factor during our stay. One other thing of note is that the bathroom was on the interior of the building so all the steam from your shower would have to escape out into the room once you opened the door. I am always puzzled by places that don't have a fan or put the bathroom with small window to the outside to let fresh air in. All of that stuff said, it was an absolute steal for what we paid (we did a bundle with a car from a main travel site that was wayyy cheaper than booking both separately). We did have a car rental as well, which we parked about 3 blocks away at Hotel Banyan for $10 per 24 hrs with in/out privileges. There was a sign up that this was increasing to $12 effective June 1st 2012. The 3 block walk didn't bother us but if you have limited mobility or kids, walking back to hotel may bother you. Breakfast is white bread, unfrozen muffins/pastries, jam, juice and coffee. You don't want to fill up on the stuff but it will let you eat something before you begin your day, which is convenient. Service was great, with each staff member being super nice. There is an ABC store about 3 doors down for late night drinks and munchies, a Mexican restaurant that has happy hour about 5 doors down and the beach is about a 2 minute walk from the place. Can't really complain about the location as it was pretty much perfect. I can see how if you're here at the wrong time of year, this place would be brutal. But for us, I'll chalk it up to a bit of luck and knowing what we were getting ourselves into. T'was perfect!

Staff is not at all professional.Aircondition was not working. Parking is very limited and make sure 15$/day parking fees.They never tell you that. Breakfast was nice from faraway but while eating we noticed bread was all stale, butter was some local company not at all eatable. Room was all sticky and weared although when called for cleaning nothing done abt it still they are saying it was already taken care of. Bathroom doesnt have light in shower area. When ever I dial 0 i.e. guest service number it ringing and message will be call can not be completed as dial.Moreover on last day elavator was not working we ask for help to get luggage down. Answer is nobody is available I have to get my 50 lb 2 bags all the way down from 7th floor.I dont have word to say about other than foolish people will book this hotel.
user_name:
patwa4u
New York City, New York

review_body: Things in Hawaii are overpriced, period. It is hard to get a good bargain on certain things, especially in Waikiki, where everything caters to tourists. However, Stay Waikiki is a great little gem that disproves the idea that a deal can't be had. My husband and I had been staying at the Hilton (paid for in part by his work, in part by our Hilton rewards), but when we ran out of free nights, we needed somewhere cheap to stay for the last few nights. Really, we weren't looking for a regular "hotel" - we just needed a place to lay our heads at night (who spends a lot of time in their hotel rooms anyway when you are in the most beautiful place in the world?!). Stay Waikiki fit all of our criteria: helpful staff, modest yet clean rooms, great location, and a fantastic rate. No suites were available when we booked, but we got a double room for $89/night, plus a $10/night resort fee, which includes free newspapers, free breakfast (pastries and coffee and juice), free wi-fi internet and use of printer, and free DVD rentals. Also, the hotel has plenty of beach toys you can borrow, ranging from straw beach mats to boogie boards. People of all ages - traveling singles, young families, and older couples - stayed here during our 2 nights, so this breaks the mold of being a "budget" or even "dorm" lodging. The room: bed was comfortable for two, we had a mini-fridge, plenty of storage room, a breakfast table and sofa bed, and a small (clean, but badly in need of an upgrade) bathroom. The wi-fi works great in the room. We only got 2 towels total, but there is maid service daily which will replenish your supplies. Downsides: we could hear entire conversations coming in from the vent in our room from some other room (I think from right above us, it was difficult to tell) and there was a huge gap in between our door and the floor (as in, 2-3 inches space). No bugs or anything got in, but still, a bit off-putting. I wouldn't stay here for a long period of time, but for a couple of nights, Stay Waikiki really fits the bill.

Pros: 1 block from Waikiki beach and shopping. Staff friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast.Cons: Bare bones accommodations. Room furnishings are austere at best but all necessary items are present. No chair/table in room but plastic chair on balcony can be brought in. Housekeeping consists of bathroom cleanup, clean towels each day but no clean linens. Hotel is on a street which is the loading zone for the neighboring Hyatt Regency Hotel and even tho I was on the 5th floor there was significant loading noise 24/7 primarily from tour buses loading/unloading. Hotel has parking for only 10 cars. Arrived with auto and had to search for a garage in vicinity since the Hotel garage was full. I was able to get a spot in the hotel garage for $15/day on the 2nd day of my stay.

I just got here today and got a room at the 3rd floor. The room's window was not sealed and it was really really really noisy all day and night. I couldn't sleep in this room. And I go to front desk to change another room, they always tell me the hotel was full. But I don't think so, I think they just don't wanna give me the new room. I think the stuff just want to save the "trouble". And every room has to pay 10 dollar for every night you stay. This is not charged until the final day. And I can't feel any privacy when I stay in the room because the window close to the walkway is not sealed and I really think it is not safe enough. Anyway, if let me choose again, I will not choose this hotel again. I will rather pay more to stay at other hotel. Don't be cheated by the pictures from the website.

I absolutely loved this place! It is so close to the beach and near everything close to Waikiki Beach. Had a decent continental breakfast and it has DVDs and games at the desk that you can play in your room. The best part of this place is the staff who go out of their way to help you and to be friendly. I ask a lot of questions and they were very patient with me for our entire stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Even though when we arrived they had no record of our booking, the staff were very friendly and our room was quickly organised. The rooms are clean and basic. Great location, close to all Waikiki has to offer. No frills and can be a little noisy but great for value.

Breakfast needs improvement, it would be nice to have a variety or something different everyday . Nothing fancy ,simple would be ok. If you stay there for more than 3 days, you will keep on eating the same thing every morning. Since you are charging 10 bucks per day anyways, might as well improve. Room also needs a small fridge for leftovers .Staff was superb, friendly and accomodating. It is hard to sleep in the morning from 4-6 am since it is very noisy outside...but it is walking distance to waikiki beach.

I did a last minute trip to Waikiki and I needed something inexpensive but up to date. I seriously lucked out. I love this place! The hotel is clean, simple, and cute! I enjoy the simple things and love that this place has that for me. The balcony is cute also! I love that they have free wifi and free movie rentals!

We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting the island of Oahu. We choose this hotel because it looked like a cool, trendy, contemporary place! Plus it describes itself as a "boutique hotel". But it seems that every hotel which has contemporary & trendy furniture (Ikea) and less than 50 bedrooms can call itself a "boutique hotel". However if you find a dirty and filthy carpet in your bedroom, a not up to standard cleaned bathroom, floor and furniture’s you WILL question the description named above. The room and the hotel itself felt more like a hostel, rather than a hotel! The staff at the front desk were friendly, however not very well trained or confident. Also it felt that they did not want to go the extra mile to make their guests feel 100% comfortable. This is why after listening to a conversation the receptionist had with another guest while waiting to be served we decided not to bother with "feedback" about the room and our "discomfort" as we thought that there wasn't much they can or want to do about it anyway. I guess because this hotel does not have a lot of returning leisure guests as most of them are tourists visiting from all over the world, and "Stay Hotel Waikiki" doesn't strike me as the place to hold functions, conferences or to be attractive for business people, the interest in keeping every customer happy didn't seemed to be top priority. We paid $10.00 per night amenities fee, which includes breakfast, wireless internet, use of the guest computer, comp. newspapers available in the lobby and coffee served (help yourself service) throughout the day. Ok, it is what it is and even if we didn't want to make use of any of this we still had to pay it. The breakfast was "served" on plastic plates and cutlery in the lobby on two tables next to the elevator and included toast, jam, butter, Danish & tea/coffee, with seats available (or not) in the lobby.We couldn't find the restaurant/bar. However two blocked of doors where we were able to store our luggage and looked like a building site is probably where it will be eventually once it's finished. The good thing about this hotel is its location, just one block away from Waikiki Beach and close to bus routes going into every direction. The bad thing is the noise...but we were well aware that if you book a city center hotel, you will not get a lot of sleep, so NOT really the hotels fault. (We brought our earplugs beforehand)Would we stay here again? Only for one night maybe and if I didn't had to pay the full rack rate, so watch out for special offers or lower your expectations.

I stayed in the hotel with my 21 years old son and his best friend. I have booked a deluxe queen room with balcony. However, when we checked it, we were given a room with no balcony and lower level ( which you could hear lots of noises ). Have asked to change, but the answer was full hotel!The stuff, specially the front desk, was the nicest people. You do feel welcomed by them.The room was clean when we checked in. However, on the five nights that we stayed there, housekeeping did a really lousy job. The floor was half cleaned, there was sand and dust on all corners. The bathtub was never cleaned ( tub got dirtier and darker). The toilet seat was never cleaned either, I have to clean it with clorox wipes. The extra pillow that I have requested has blood stain. It was really disgusting.My expectaction was low when I read all the reviews. I have even brought a lock with me since there is no in room safe. However, I did not expect the room to be so untidy!!!Hope they will improve on that aspect to make it more desirable hotel. The location of the hotel is really close to the beach, and the stuff is super super nice. It would have been a nice inexpensive hotel to stay if only they have much cleaner rooms.

THE GOOD: - Free wifi- Free movie rentals- Free beach mats and boogie boards- Refrigerators (upon request, if your lucky enough to get one)- Balcony rooms on the top floors are very nice- Very clean- Friendly hotel employeesTHE BAD: - The breakfast (Don't count on it)- Ancient elevator that almost smashes you in half every time you walk through the doors.- None of the windows seal shut (very loud all day & night)- $10 per night surprise fee when you leave- Lower level rooms are extremely small motel rooms with very little light (kinda like a small dungeon cell)Your stay at this hotel will either be excellent, or you'll hate it completely. The first room we got was on the 2nd floor, and it was equivalent to a super small motel room. We hated it. I'd rate that room as a one-star MOTEL room (not the 3 star hotel rating they currently have). After asking for a possible upgrade, they said no other rooms were available. We also asked for a refrigerator, and they stated they had none available. On the third day of asking, they finally upgraded us to a bigger room with a balcony and a refrigerator on the 5th floor and BOY WAS IT A DIFFERENCE! The new room was much larger and had an amazing view from the balcony! The room on the fifth floor would be rated as a 3 star hotel. We loved it! As far as the breakfast goes, don't expect anything of it. The breakfast is nothing more than just coffee, tea, some small pastries, and slices of bread with a toaster. Nothing more, and usually they run out of pastries unless you're the first one there. The elevator they have is the oldest elevator that I've ever been in in my entire life. The doors close on their own and slam you from the sides. It also almost broke our stroller and gave us some bruises. They also charge an additional $10 per night surprise fee on top of your hotel price (for the breakfast and wifi internet). Note to hotel manager: - Replace the elevator.- Make the breakfast a little better. (add some potato wedges and french toast at least)- Make customers aware of the horrible rooms on the lower floors and have a choice when booking (with different pricing). - Remove the surprise $10 a night fee by including with the original booking rate. - Replace windows that actually seal

We got a room here last minute for a surf getaway. The hotel is like a block from the waikiki surf and it was excellent. we would definitely recommend it. Spartan room, but worked perfect for our needs. Very clean!

A little background - the purpose of my trip was a 2-day stop on Oahu to see a house that I wanted to buy. Since I didn't have the wife and kid and would be busy all day, I opted for the cheapest hotel I could find in Waikiki that had decent reviews on TripAdvisor. Stay Waikiki had an Expedia deal for a $90 a night room with bunk beds, so I went with them. A couple issues I had:1) parking - there is VERY limited parking available at the hotel, and the staff said that there was $8/night parking available at the adjacent building. The actual price for parking had changed to $20/night unbeknownst to the staff, so I had to correct them.2) room - I've stayed in some cramped rooms before, but this was one of the smallest I had ever seen. The bunk bed was also very cheap, like used dorm furniture.3) fees - there is some kind of $10/night fee for. . . I don't know what. I noticed a warning for it after I booked the Expedia deal, so I think Stay should just put it in the base price of the room4) loud - the walls aren't well insulated and this is one of the noisiest parts of Waikiki due to buses and service trucks pulling in behind the Waikiki Hyatt Regency, so it was pretty noisy all nightOtherwise the hotel was fine and served its purpose of giving me a place to crash. The room was very clean its VERY close to EVERYTHING in Waikiki, so you won't be at a loss for places to eat or things to do. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling with friends on a budget and relying on public transportation. I would not recommend this to anyone travelling with a family or looking for a romantic getaway.

I was a bit skeptical when I was first looking at this hotel because of the small rooms and the no pool aspect. But I was really happy with the experience. The hotel is cheap, which is great, the location is great (1 block from the beach and right in the middle of all the awesomeness that Waikiki has to offer). My hubs and I figured what did the hotel we stay at matter since we didn't plan on being in the hotel anyways. We actually ended up staying in more than we thought! The windows are these frosted glass panes that you can control to open or close. It gave the room a feel like we were in Thailand or Indonesia or something. The room was small, sure, but totally livable and I like the modern colors. And best of all were the people at the front desk. They were sooooo nice and helpful and trust me we were a pain. They were always smiling and friendly and they are what made this place a place where I would stay again. Aloha!

Stay hotel is a great alternative for people traveling to Waikiki, the rooms are recently renovated and are quite large. All necessities are available friendly reception, wifi in the rooms and Stay is situated only 3 minutes from the main beach and shopping street. On top of that Stays room rates are quite low and incl. breakfast :) All in all I highly recommend Stay hotel (especially for younger travelers - 35)

This place is a great value in often-overpriced Waikiki. The pros outweigh the few cons about this property and I will likely return again.Pros:Value - My partner and I like to travel on a budget but we don't want to stay in a dump! After a prior poor experience staying at an older resort-style hotel during our last trip to Honolulu, we were looking for a more positive experience and better value for our money this time around. This place fit the bill - affordable, fresh, clean, and comfortable. Concept - I am a little tired of resorts in Honolulu. They're nice if well executed but often fall short. What I love about Stay Waikiki is that it doesn't try to be a full-featured resort, and this is definitely refreshing. The location is great - just a block to the beach! Brand-new, ice-cold A/C units.New, comfortable furniture - It's obviously from Ikea but I love that.Friendly, accomodating staff.$10/day "resort" fee - Many reviewers have mentioned this as a negative aspect of their stay here but I found it to be a good value. The fee covers a lot: it includes a newspaper each day, unlimited use of the hotel's wifi connection and business center, AND as many rental movies as you want (though you may find that newly-released films may already be checked out!). I would suggest, however, that the fee be included in the cost of the room and not as an additional charge tacked on at check-in.There are a few cons that I have to mention:Lack of mini-fridge units - In order to get a mini-fridge in your room, you must request one, and there are a limited number of units. I requested a fridge for several days and did not receive one. The hotel should invest in installing mini-fridges in each room.Noise - This hotel's walls and windows are thin. If you are assigned a room on a lower floor and/or facing Koa Avenue, you will hear nighttime revelers, tour buses, early morning garbage trucks, and more. If you are a light sleeper, try to request a room on a higher floor towards the back of the hotel and plan to bring earphones.This problem could be mitigated somewhat if the hotel installed modern, double-pane windows in the rooms. Continental Breakfast - The continental breakfast includes just a few types of pastry, wheat toast, fruit punch, and coffee (with powdered creamer). I would have loved to see fresh fruit, a variety of types of juice (rather than just fruit punch), and half and half for the coffee included, especially since we couldn't get a fridge to keep these things in our room ourselves. My partner and I come to Honolulu once per year and I hope to stay at this property again, especially if the cons I mentioned are sorted out.

Overall this was a quality hotel. I visited Oahu with my wife and we had a great time. The room was tidy and comfortable. We had our own balcony and the hotel was located near Waikiki beach. We only had bunk beds to sleep in, but we also looked for the least expensive option during our stay. We had our own bathroom, the staff was friendly and I would absolutely suggest this place to anyone looking for a great vacation on a smaller budget.
Don't expect too much from this hotel, its a cheaply renovated concrete block apartment. basic double bed, no fridge. Room access via outside balcony. Staff are very nice

The location is good, but the room is small. The bathroom is very cramped with little space to spread out. The balcony is nice, but some may not like the bunk bed arrangement. WiFi is fast. One negative is that the hotel adds a mandatory $10 per day amenity fee which is extra on top of the Internet room rate. Breakfast consists of toast, rolls, pineapple juice and coffee. They do provide an iHome and game system, and daily paper.
Although it's an economical hotel, it's very recomendable. Great location, very clean, very nice the people who works at the front desk. I'll be back!

This was my first ever visit to Hawaii on the last leg of a long vacation. Restricted to a tight budget, I found accommodations to the Stay Waikiki Hotel through travelocity. 3 nights bundled with 3 days of car rental, my total was $337. EXCELLENT value. The location was great with the beach, shopping, and restaurants all in the immediate vicinity. The rooms very simple with no frills, but do a fine job when you are looking for a great value. I stayed on the 7th floor, the walls are quite thin and I could hear what my neighbor was watching on TV. However, they do offer computer/printer in the business center, Free wifi and clean rooms. I'm very pleased with my choice!

I visit Honolulu with my friends during the last week of February. We have been doing this trip for 20 years with a 4 or 5 years missed here and there. The point is that we have stayed in many different hotels, condos, and beachfront properties. The Stay, for us, provided a good location for our activities. The parking provided was convenient as well. The staff is working diligently to create an atmosphere of aloha hospitality and it was appreciated. Every little request was well received and accommodated, such as an extra pillow. The computer availability and the wi-fi were welcome benefits. I enjoyed the clean room, the high-end linens, and retro tiled showers (thank your for not tearing out the tile - good greenies!)My suggestions would be to add fruit to the morning menu, a small refrigerator in the room, and free massages. OK, the last one is a stretch, but the first two would be a great addition!Thank you to the Staff and my apologies for posting this three weeks after our visit!
Stay Waikiki, within easy walking distance to the Waikiki beach and seaside pavillions, is also reasonably priced. Rooms are clean and staff, friendly.

I love the concept of this hotel, but they need to continue to work on it. Stayed 1 night - the staff could not have been friendlier and the location was great. But the room looked like they simply painted the old college dorm room, added a new bed and that was it. All the bath fixtures were original equipment. There was no nightstand, and I brought in the little patio table to use as a luggage rack. I paid their internet rate of $109/night and should have gone through one of the discounters - with the parking ($15) and the "amenities fee" ($10 - was at a loss as to what that was for, but apparently it was for the continental breakfast and the free wi-fi) and taxes the room ended up costing over $150! I wish them well but won't stay there again until some upgrades are made.

We were a bit skeptical of this hotel, since it used to be a college dormitory. But we like to take a chance on hotels that have been recently remodeled. Some other recently remodeled hotels we've stayed at: Waikiki Pearl and Queen Kapiolani.Whether we stay at a hotel like the Four Seasons or an economy hotel, we still want clean rooms. This hotel passes the "clean room" test. For the location and cleanliness, you get good value. Consider it like a well-runned Hampton Inn... except in Waikiki. Please note that I'm basing the experience on the upgraded room.++++Staff is very attentive and personable. Way better than staying at a 1,000 room resort, where nobody knows you.Responded to clogged tub drain issue immediately.$10 resort/ day fee is fair and gives you internet (works about 80% of the time), dvd rentals, and use of beach mats, chairs, floats; daily newspaper; (typical) continental breakfast of juice, coffee, toast, and pastries; a business area, so you can print boarding passes, use the internet.Very close to the Beach. You're smack right in the middle of the Waikiki strip. 10 minute walk to the zoo, one way and 10 minute walk to Beachwalk (Lewers) the other way. Restaurants are plentiful nearby. I prefer that small hotel buildings don't have restaurants, because I may be stuck in the room right above the restaurant (you can hear the noise and smell the kitchen.)Very convenient to the bus stops. We take the bus everywhere when we stay in Waikiki.Laundry facilities available - wash is only $1 and 45-minute dry is 75 cents.- - - - If you're a large-sized person, the bathroom may be an issue. It is tiny... like 15 SF. (You can wash your sandy feet while you're sitting on the toilet.) We're not large, so it worked out okay. And who hangs out in the bathroom?Couldn't quite figure out if hotel is being "green" or staff just forgot to make it to our rooms and get us new towels. We usually fix our own bed, and re-use our towels (because that's what we do at home), but it was stretching it a bit, when all towels got used up (because we went to the beach) and trash bin was overflowing. For those who complain about noise... you're in the middle of Waikiki, which is a very popular area. You can stay at the Royal Hawaiian for $350 - $400 per night if you want quiet.Recommendation to hotel:1) get wifi to work fulltime2) include the fairly priced resort fee in the nightly room rate; we like to prepay our vacations beforehand, so the resort fee was a bit of surprise.3) Fix the elevator's door sensor. The elevator door's closing too quickly will maim somebody one of these days.

The Stay Waikiki has many pros and cons.On the positive side:nice staffexcellent location (one block from beach)clean, all IKEA furnishingsinexpensive (best price for location)On the negative side:Breakfast was a bustThere is no in hotel restaurant- a bummer on the many rainy days we encounteredcleaning was SLOW- upon request it took hours for service, there was one day only one cleaner showed up, service was all over the boardPillows- the room came with two, we requested more and they were never able to accomodate us in the week we were thereTowels- it was hit or miss, sometimes we got hand towels, we didn't get a washcloth until the last day and we got oneThere appears to be no standard for service at the hotel.With a little attention to detail, the Stay Waikiki could be the best hidden gem by the beach. There is room for improvement with several small changes.

Great value and location, just make sure you bring ear plugs if you're a light sleeper. Tour buses for the Hyatt are across the street and are quite loud in the mornings. Staff is very friendly and accomodating.

Stay is a boutique hotel for people who are looking for something comfortable but nothing really fancy. The location is the biggest plus factor to this hotel and the staff as well. Most of the other hotels in the area are large chain hotels and therefore much more expensive. Our room was mostly used just for sleeping as we were out exploring Waikiki but we also enjoyed some drinks on our small balcony.The downside to this hotel is that the bathroom is VERY small. It might not work well for a family. The breakfast consisted of juice, coffee, tea and some pastries. Nothing really special but it was free! Also, the elevators are in need of an update. I was painfully caught in between the doors!The staff were very courteous and helpful at this hotel. They were always willing to offer information especially for local transit and they were quick to get us ice whenever we needed it. They also let us use their computers and phone when we were trying to find tickets for a New Years Eve Party.This is a great option if you're only planning on spending a few nights in Waikiki. If this is your main destination in Hawaii you may want to consider more of a resort style hotel with restaurant options and a pool. However, there are many restaurants within walking distance as well as the beach which is just 2 blocks away!Just a tip: local calls are NOT free!
excellent staff and the rooms are clean. simple, small but all the value. excellent location. a little noisy in the early morning because its behind the bigger hotels but nonetheless a great find!!

Flew in for a short trip & was looking or a good budget hotel in Waikiki. Did some web surfing & came upon Stay Waikiki. Location looked great for the price so we took a chance & booked it. We were more than pleasantly surprised & extremely happy with our stay. The hotel sits behind the Hyatt next to Kings Row. It appears to once have been an apartment, converted to be a small boutique hotel circa 1950's. They did a complete remodel, is tastefully appointed & is squeaky clean (our pet peeve). They even had an Ipod docking/charging unit & flatscreen TV & new remote control AC unit. The only thing I see they should have done was to change the bathroom fixtures. Our room was small but for the price & location, who can complain. We walked to all the Waikiki restaurants, shopping & beach with ease. They have an excellent continental breakfast every morning. The staff was excellent & friendly.Parking is limited for $15 but there is also public parking at Kings Row down the street for $8 a day- no in & out privliges. You don't really need a car if you do most of your activities in Waikiki.I highly recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget & want to be a block to the beach amongst the high end hotels. I will be back!
We stayed the STAY WAIKIKI for 5 nights, and like this hotel very much, and we would like pick STAY WAIKIKI again for our next visit.

I stayed here for two nights, Feb, 2012. Had a very nice room, super clean, comfortable beds- twin room. OK breakfast of juice, tea, coffee, toast, muffins etc., very basic, but replenished frequently, and out early. Parking is very limited and far better with an economy car. It is easy walking distance to many attractions, food options, beach. It is a noisy location, so if of any issue, this won't be a good hotel choice. My priority was price, of which this hotel delivered. :)

This hotel was simple. No fridge in room (unless advised before visiting, and only if they havent run out), no kettle, coffee, tea or water in room or available after 10.00am in lobby. Also, may of the rooms features were broken or needed repair (bathroom window, dvd player, ceiling light). Extra $10.00 amenity fee charged evey day of your stay which is not advised anywhere when booking (charge is for wireless internet, dvd rental and daily breakfast of a toast or mini pasteries and coffee). Coffee and water was not provided (after 10:00am).Parking costs $15.00 a day (and only if they havent run out of spaces). Good news; Internet is accessible all day via computers in lobby as well as a printer (which you do not have to pay any extra for) and an ATM machine... Customer Service was good, staff are polite and somewhat helpful.

Does not have regular windows,they are glass blinds you can hear everything from the street. There is very limited parking. I had to park 2 blocks away. They also charge a 10couple Dlls amenity fee. Will never go back again.

We recently stayed nine nights at the Stay Hotel on Waikiki Beach Hawaii and it was a great experience. The price is very reasonable, the rooms are simple but adequate, the location is good and the staff is VERY friendly. The only aspect that could use improvement is the continental breakfast which is sub par but otherwise we have no faults with this hotel. The place is a gem!
good hotel to stay.The rooms are very clean.Close to anything you want to do.

Preface: While I stayed in a nearby condominium, my friends stayed at Stay for a week and had a wonderful time. My return flight was overbooked, so I called Stay and they made a room for me for 3 days.Service: Front desk staff is mostly outstanding. Warm, friendly, accommodating and helpful--they are the personification of the Aloha Spirit. Daily housekeeping is quietly efficient and respectful.Location: Premium. In the shadow of The Hyatt, in the middle of Waikiki, 1 block to the beach, and walking distance to all things local.Rooms: Clean and small. My top/8th floor unit was a quiet room with single bunk beds. Linens and beds are fresh and comfortable. I believe all units have balconies. I would not want to stay a week in a room this small, especially if I was traveling with someone, but for others it might be ok. My only suggested improvements: Coffee maker and mini fridge in room.Amenities: Not much. But there is free morning coffee in the lobby, ice, parking on a first-come fee basis, and beach gear available. Free Wi-Fi was jankey and unreliable.Summary: Clean rooms and an outstanding staff, at a reasonable price, makes this hotel a good value and a recommended place to stay.As always; I travel to Waikiki several times a year, I can advise that Waikiki is a nice tropical urban adventure.
