The city comes with the negatives of a big city, along with the overwhelming benefits of a beautiful beachfront resort. Generally, everything in Waikiki is “a little tired” although there have been continuous improvements in the last few years. If you are traveling solo, take Roberts Hawaii from the airport (no rsvr rqd). Two or more people, take a taxi from the airport to the hotel (should be under $40). In Waikiki, nearly everything is walking distance or a short shuttle/bus away. If you need a car for the day, you can rent one in Waikiki.

This hotel is a simple hotel, in the heart of Waikiki in the best location possible; however it is no frills at the Stay Hotel. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable enough, the highlight is the amazing staff - Jazmine made our trip in so many ways, with great tips on island hot spots and absolutely outstanding customer service!We were so pleased with the value and the location, plus the staff, enough to return to this hotel in the future. There are rooms that have "slat windows" in the bathrooms only, some have them in the bedroom as well - the rooms that do not have the slat windows in the bedrooms are quieter... You are in the heart of Waikiki and next to the busiest tour pickup (at the Hyatt) so be prepared for a lot of noise starting at 7am, but it is probably one of the best locations on the strip with one of the nicer beaches 1/2 block from the hotel.

We stayed for 10 days. The rooms were very clean and fresh. All the staff were absolutely great especailly Jazmine. She was always there to help. We stayed on the 8th floor. Continental breakfast was included each day. A good way to start your day. You can't ask for a better location close to everything. Price was the best you could find anywhere in the surrounding area. Would stay there any time I was staying in Waikiki. Only one problem if you are a late riser it gets quite noisy after 7 am. Otherwise was geat.
I will return good value. freee rafts to take to beach Very nice
user_name:
Marci M
San Diego, California, United States

review_body: The location is amazing! The front staff were fantastic (especially Jasmine & Leanne!). They helped us with anything and everything we needed.

Recently stayed 10 nights at Stay Waikiki. I was a little bit hesitant prior to booking as there were limited reviews about the hotel. Stay Waikiki is a small hotel with an awesome location (right behind the Hyatt, between the two towers on Koa Avenue). The beach and the main strip Kalakaua Ave are both 1 block away and there are ABC stores on both ends of the block (and around every corner of every block) for water, beer, snacks, snorkeling gear and Hawaii souvenirs.We had a standard queen bedroom, which included a lanai with a sliver of an oceanview. Room had AC, flatscreen TV, adequate closet space with drawers, and a very dated, small bathroom. The bathroom was probably my least favourite part of the hotel but not significant enough to ruin my stay. It was quite noisy especially early in the morning, as tour buses start loading and unloading right on Koa Avenue, in the back of the Hyatt. They also have service trucks on the other end of the hotel, which are just as loud. This is not the hotel's fault but just to keep in mind if you are a light sleeper.The hotel offers free complimentary breakfast daily, free wi-fi (connection was spotty at times) and has limited self-parking available at a first-come, first-serve basis for $15/day. We chose to park at the Waikiki Banyan (on Ohua and Kuhio) instead for $60/week with unlimited in-and-out privileges. They also have washer/dryer machines available for use at a cost. You can purchase single dose packets of laundry detergent and dryer sheets at the ABC store.Housekeeping staff were very hardworking and front desk staff could not be nicer. They were always happy to see you and offered very helpful insight about all things Oahu.Some constructive feedback for the hotel would be to better display the various extras that are available to the hotel guests, for example, washer/dryer usage, parking, fridge, iron, ice, DVD rental, printing services, etc. Almost all of our "extra" requests were met; we just had to ask for them as we didn't know if they were offered. It would be helpful for the guests to know that they have all of these extra services and amenities available - maybe via a pamphlet or sign.I would recommend this hotel on the condition that you don't expect more than what you are paying for; it is a clean, no frills hotel with all the basic necessities (and some extras).

If you want plan on spending a lot of time in your room, this is the perfect hotel! The service is excellant and willing to help you find all the hidden local treasures along with the touristy stuff. Located one block behind the strip, one block from the beach, its perfect; comfort quality and price!

Checking in to the hotel was a pleasant experience. I think Jasmine did an excellent job assisting us and was very knowledgeable with giving information within the Waikiki area. We unknowingly made reservations for a room with 2 bunkbeds and she immediately upgraded us to a room with a queen bed. No questions asked. The room was clean and cozy but there was no refrigerator, no coffee maker, and no microwave. But there are so many places to eat within close walking distance to soothe any appetite. The beach is a block away, lots of places for shopping, and bars/clubs for night life. Hotel parking is $15/day on a first come, first served basis. No reserved parking or assigned stalls. But there are other hotels or parking structures with in walking distance for fee. I would recommend to all. Mahalo to all at Stay Waikiki.

Warm welcome by a very busy one person front desk clerk JASMINE. Assisting others before us & welcoming us assisting our check-in, also helping another couple with parking issues all @ one time giving us her total attention. Made reservations online unknowingly we selected BUNK BED but were able to get a queen size bed. No fridge or coffee pot. Good stay tthouggg.

The Staff here is soooooo friendly and accommodating. They ALWAYS (morning, noon or night) greet you with a smile and a warm greeting. The hotel is situated mere steps from the beach, just a bout a block, has it's own parking a garage and other parking garages on the same street if you decide to rent a car. Walk or drive, it is easy to get to any where you want to go. Also in the hote's media/business center there is free use of computers with internet access, where you can also print for free, whether it be yout travel itenerary, driving directions or boarding passes for your flight back home, you can print it for free. they also rent DVD's for free for those nights you want stay in and take it easy. The rooms are minimalist, but modernly decorated. There are nice views from the lanai in each room (balcony) and did I say the staff here is AWESOME! they really are! you almsot feel like family.

I stayed here Dec 24-28 and it was a very good stay! I upgraded to a queen room + sitting area and was pleasantly surprised! Extra space was REALLY nice, wifi access was good, and the wall of windows allowed for a good breeze! Add to it that I was 1 block off the Waikiki strip, and it was a bargain! This hotel works great for 1-2 travelers on a budget!Drawbacks were few, but the bathroom was small & dated and the cross breeze was best w/ door open.

Know before you go. I would give 2.5 points but rounded down because I was given the runaround. We were hesitant to book anything besides our "regular", well known hotel where we always stay. The STAY WAIKIKI had good deals, was newly renovated, had only few but good reviews, so we gave it a shot. Here's what you need to know before you book, and if you decide to go with it, what to look for when you arrive. 1) The hotel is newly renovated and has a clean feel overall with modern styling elements and contrasty colors. The rooms have wood laminate floors. The baths are tiny. The fixtures are not updated, but are acceptable. In my room when sitting on the bowl, I could rest my chin on the sink. One could see that as a plus, or minus. Showers were completely tiled, which I prefer over silicone sealed plastic tubs. I was wary about the little brown crawling insects after some of the reviews, but did not see ANY in the 9 days I was there. 2) ONLY FLOORS 5 THROUGH 8 have balconies aka Lanais. So if you check in and expect a room with a balcony, make sure it's on floor 5 or higher and explicitely ask for a DELUXE (if that's what you booked). I'd also say from floor 6 and up you get a good view. The hotel is so narrow that it's only one room wide, meaning every entrance is on one side, every window or balcony is on the other (towards Diamond Head). 3) The tricky part is to catch a DELUXE room WITH a lanai. The supply here is limited. We booked a deluxe with lanai explicitly and they gave us a standard with lanai. After pointing this out, they moved us to a deluxe without lanai on floor 4, which we declined - terrible view and no lanai. We eat take-out on our lanai and rely on it. The "booking system did also not allow for predicting when the next deluxe WITH lanai gets available" - really, guys? Really? Well if you can't predict how long a room is taken, then I understand that the reservation system also does not allow for you to RESERVE me a deluxe with lanai, which is what I had booked in the first place. Ok, how stupid do you think I am. It's the age of computers. And luckily, also the age of tripadvisor reviews. 4) The DELUXE rooms are MUCH bigger than the standard. The standard is a shoe box. In the Deluxe you have room to breath. I saw both rooms, and believe me. You want the DELUXE SIZE, WITH lanai.5) The parking garage is tiny and holds about 8-10 cars with only 2 spots allowing for full size cars or bigger. I'd say one or 2 spots can hold mini vans. I took the small spots with my Chevy Cobalt rental leaving the bigger ones for the minivans and had to maneuver multiple times to get in and out. NO KIDDING. Oh, btw, parking was "full" when we arrived and we were immediately advised that we have to park off site. $8 without in-and-out privileges. They used this as a bargaining chip later though (AHA!) and suddenly parking was available (and complimentary which was very nice, so thanks for this plus).6) The staff is friendly, absolutely. But they are advised by their management to give you the runaround when it comes to giving you what you booked. I feel for them, but if you don't get your reservation system fixed it will be a returning problem. Again, we did book the DELUXE WITH LANAI and WE DID NOT GET IT. We're still on the phone daily with Expedia to get a refund. What a hassle. Had we known that, we would have gone with our "old" hotel where we know what we get into (which floor, which room, parking, staff etc). Again, friendly staff at the STAY, but the underlying theme was still visible which is giving you the runaround until you give up. If I have a week off, do I want to have a hassle with the front desk FOR TWO THIRDS of my vacation only so that I can get what I booked AND PAID FOR, only two days before I leave? No. And management knows that. Listen, management. Customers have a pretty good antenna for when they are given the runaround. No, I will not recommend this hotel to my friends, because of that.7) Location is awesome. We saw whales from our lanai and you're right in the middle of things. I do prefer Hawaii in summer though. It's lush, greener, warmer, and smells better with the ginger and plumeria in bloom and the hala fruit falling. Less guava though in summer. It also seems like there are a little less tourists in summer.8) IT IS LOUD even with closed windows and sliding doors. I had to use ear plugs every night, which was expected and is normal in the middle of the city. If you have been to Waikiki, you know that. If it will be your first time, be advised that you can't escape the sounds of the streets, nighlife, reversing buses, barking. Anywhere except in a high rise building on floors 15 and up (be advised, there you might have helicopter sounds).

Very nice hotel. Clean and near everything in waikiki (including beach and crowdy shops and restaurants). A little noisy, but it's not that bad (I'm a really light sleepper and I sleep with earplug). For now, best hotel in waikiki for the price. (but don't know when the price will be higher). Front desk workers are nice and helpful (the ones we have talked to). Highly recommended.

I booked 2 rooms with BALCONIES for 2 nights at Stay Hotel, I was given 2 rooms without balconies. When I addressed this issue at the front desk they claimed not to have any available rooms with balconies - hello it's called a RESERVATION! The hotel staff was clueless about how to resolve this issue and said I would have to check with the manager. I came to the front desk 5 times in the course of 2 days to seek out the ever elusive manager - he never showed up! If you book here, it's a good location, but it's so bare bones that the bathroom's don't even have a mirror! Also hotel website claims to have complimentary breakfast - that's false too! So basically if you're looking for an uncomfortable motel with non-existent customer service in a great location, this is the place for you!

I chose this hotel because it was a good deal. It is located in a great spot. Just 400+ feet away from the beach and down the street from King's Crossing and other shops and restaurants.The room we booked was not the same room they showed in the picture. We stayed in a standard queen. The photo shown has a lanai. Our room was small and barely had a window. Little to no storage space, poor lighting in the room and no chair or desk.The room and bathroom was updated and clean but very small.The area is loud. We constantly heard hotel doors slamming, people talking, dogs barking, sirens driving by, busses and trucks parking and the constant beep, beep, beep sound of these trucks backing up. We had to leave the ac on all night and the tv on to help block out some noise.They have parking available for $15 a day. But be warned. The parking garage is very tight and it is difficult to get your car into some of the spots.Overall I liked the hotel (my husband did not). The staff was very friendly and helpful. If you can handle the street noise, do not need a pool, workout room or restaurant then this is the place to stay. I would pay a little more and get the deluxe room with the sofabed and lanai.

First I just have to say a big thank you to Jasmine at the front desk. Thanks to APEC being in town when we were there it was a challenge to get to the hotel. She stayed on the phone until we got within sight of hotel. So on that note the hotel staff could not have been any more friendly then they were, we just loved them. The location is one block from waikiki beach!!! The room decor is done in Ikea which I love!! The hotel itself is definately older but they have updated the furniture and such so its really hip and fun. The bathroom fixtures are old but the room was very clean. They had a blow dryer, ironing board in the room as well as an Ipod dock. We had small deck but we could see the water from it even though it was only a sliver. The only downside to this place is the fact its behind the Hyatt and that happens to be the bus pick up for all the tours that go out in the area. Now depending where you are from the noise may be an issue for you. We are use to noise when we sleep plus we had the ac running in the early am so it really wasnt an issue. The windows are very old in the hotel they are the slat style and some of those wouldnt shut so you could hear the buses for sure.However that noise on the street did not make a difference to us. We would so stay there again. Waikiki was great loved seeing sunset everynight and being that close to shops, restaurants and the beach was just the best!!! This hotel is fantastic for the money if you are looking for an infinity pool on the beach this place is not for you.(they also have free wifi)I hope this helps you pick your hotel next time you are in waikiki!! We cant wait to go back!!

It felt a bit like I was sleeping in a tiny dorm. Basically everyone who books within an "unknown" amount of time can get a room for 80$/night. My advice to you is to go on Priceline and bid for a proper 3 star hotel where for 5$ more I got TWO beds, coffee/tea, fridge, a washroom I could comfortably fit into, unlimited calls from my hotel, enough lighting to see things in the dark, and a pool to swim in. Most of their rooms are really small, but some of the rooms are slightly larger. A lot of people review this place and say it's "affordable" because they haven't shopped around and didn't end up staying in a nearby hotel that gives you MUCH better bang for your buck. I wish the rest of my family had the chance to write this review.

I really did want to like this place--the descriptions of the quirky decor, great location, and the fact that it was newly renovated all were good selling points. And there were some things to like: very friendly staff, the location immediately across from the Hyatt's transportation center, the proximity to Waikiki beach and attractions, and the fact that many aspects of the room had been redone: new floors, paint, grout, molding, furniture, and a comfortable bed. Unfortunately there were also things not to like: extremely poor room lighting, no chair or desk in room, a bathroom faucet that was very difficult to turn on, noise coming through louvered glass windows (especially the end next to Koa Avenue), deadbolts that did not work (and in fact trapped us in the room for several minutes), lanai/balcony door locks that didn't work, and finally cockroaches (a big one in the tub and a small one running across the desk right in reception). We experienced three rooms over 2 stays, separated by a week. We coincidentally got one of the same rooms from our first visit on our second stay, and none of the defects we reported at the end of the first visit had been fixed--especially the non-functioning deadbolt lock. If the management will improve room lighting and fix all the door locks I would at least be able to recommend this hotel.

I was just looking for a place to sleep for a night while on business. At starting rates at $79/nite, this newly renovated hotel was perfect. This clean, cute, boutique-like hotel has friendly and helpful service. It's located a short walk to the beach and surrounding shopping and restaurants. My overall rating would be higher if the renovation was complete. I'll be sure to return.
very cute boutique hotel. very affordable with prices starting at $79/nt. good location being right next to kings village.
